review: Warning for Integrated Graphics users DO NOT BUY THIS GAMEYou will only hurt your nerves and your wallet.I've fought with many problems to get this game to work on normal settings. I nearly wrecked my Laptop trying to fix this brown nugget of a game and what do I get?A game that looks like on the only settings I managed to get it to work on.Spawning in multiplayer I apparently didn't have the rank to do the first tutorial mission so that does not work.In singleplayer my keyboard inputs lag because of the Integrated Graphics don't ask me no idea how they are connected but a short internet research revealed that they are linked so that does not work either.(I know you can fix the keyboard problem but I really don't want to change my settings everytime just to play the game same as I don't want to deactivate my graphics card every time.)In total I've wasted about 20 hours of my life trying to get this to work. Not worth a single one every time you fix a problem they throw another one at you. I see this game in my steam list I wish I'd never bought it.If the game works for you be glad take a minute and thank whatever god you believe in for giving you the chance to play this unoptimized turd. I personally hate Rockstar for what they sold me.

review: Hi guys. I'm Zalvager aka iBryan. This is my review on behalf of the Original Traders Group. From Me. Honestly this game was amazing on any console. It is a beautifully made game and if you don't enjoy it something is wrong with you! To start I thought the PC version's driving controls would be terrible. I was all but right! Driving and Shooting is absolutely beautiful and easier to do. I understand the game had it's bugs and is bad at times ( Not Really ). But when people actually complain that the game is depending when it comes to specs but honestly. The video card and space on it is all you need to worry about. Most PC's are built to play the game. If your having lag spikes then try messing around with the settings to check what your shadow quality grass quality etc. This will effect your gaming depending on how your computer/ laptop works. I honestly love the controls and gameplay in it. I love the game and I think it is a better option then the consoles if you have a good PC. The OTP review 9.5

review: Amazing it outshines Gta 4 by a landsllde. you can do about everything in this game and more.just beat the story and it was the best put together video game story in years where it has you pretty much cheering for the characters like they are real people but still give a feeling like its a real world adaption of a movie.Graphics look amazing and im and the minimal settings too i believe ( my compute ris only 1 2 years old ) so that just screams how amazing and life like everything looks especially since all cutscenes are acted by the Voice actors themselves so they really nail how the character would react with motion behind it.Oh yeah and the voice work is amazing main characters sound believable and entertaining while the minor Npc's all sound like they are having real conversations and react like real people....to most things at least since cant directly talk to them.the Ai is fantastic......at times at least. what i mean is that they hit the head on how people would walk and do stuff so all the Npc's feel natural its just.....sometimes the game does glitch out with Ai but thats on rare cases more of a physics thing anyway. biggest complaint is that when driving if your driving in wrong lane people tend to swerve toward you instead of trying to swerve away.The big feature though is Heists basically fun main quest robberies that earn you big bucks but requires big team and careful planning and prep. basically you will be introduced to a heist idea and will study up on the place sometimes then you will go to a planning board screen that will explain the two paths you could take to achieving a successful heist with both options being completely different sometimes and resulting in its own events that will make the heist smoother or pay more. after you choose you get to make the choice on the crew basically you have a list of people who you can choose to do certain roles usually being hackers gunmen and drivers. the big thing here is it is important that you choose correctly who you take with you because they can die from not being skilled enough or make bad mistakes but you dont want to hire to good of a team because they require big cuts in the loot. as you find potiental crew members and level up existing ones in heist ( which make them better without raising the Cut percentage ) its all your decision though.Gameplay is amazing a literal wall filled with different guns though they are broke into 8 classes that game takes time to introduce before you can buy sadly but hey some are so expensive you wouldnt be able to buy them tll the point they unlocked them anyway because of the amount of money they give you in start.which brings me to my only two complaints....in the begining unlike Gta 4 which would pay you for nearly every job but with low amounts Gta 5 doesnt pay you for alot of jobs but makes up for it with when they do pay you its usually big AND the fact that business exist for you to purchase and earn money as well as other ways to earn money. also the biggest complaint i have that in Single player ( because multiplayeri s a different beast and i only liek talking about single player in reviews like this ) they give you so few heists theyre about 4 5 in the game after say 40 hours of gameplay i just wish they threw in more and really explored the aspect of multi pathed heists with some routes that just are failure routes if you cant be efficent and have a great team.other than that i still say its a great game and will always recommend till hopefully GTA 6 blows it out of the water ( just hopefully not in the next couple years like some companies do ) very much in the top ranks of my favorite games.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: "You spoke and we listened! We are proud to have such a dedicated fanbase that cares about our game. Modding will be returning to GTA V in Q3 you are now able to use your bullshark cash cards to purchase an impressive array of mods in game making the process easier than ever!"
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: (Update) Apparently you could possibly get banned for using discord and overlay it on gta but i havent ran into problems so.....You see this game is debatable. Overall I would recommend it because of the story mode and (some) parts of the online mode. Sorry for the bad spelling im not used to this keyboard LONG REVIEWAlright so as for the story I love it. I absoloutly love it. It has a funny and great story with awesome gameplay. I love the 3 main protagonists I love their different personalites and they absolutly get me hooked. The ending was a difficult choice. If you plan on mostly buying this game for the story BUY IT NOW!Online Alright so there are very mixed feelings on this one. First of all as for the false bans. Personally me or nobody I know has not recieved one yet and we all use basic talking programs like Skype and Discord so I can guarantee if you dont use anything other than those 2 you will be fine. For the actual Online however it is fun. See the key to Online is to have the most money which results in more gear and armored cars and weapons and etc.. To not spend a fortune on this game buying Shark Cards (Cards you buy with real money to give you in game money) you have to be good at the actual game or play with good friends. Fortunatly I play with good friends and I am sorta good at the game. Therefore its more of a skill based game to get money which is appropriate. The actual Online sometimes can be glitchy which is acceptable considering the game is constantly updated and is adding new stuff. Now the part that people hate about online is the community. You could get annoyed which is very nerve riding. People could continuosly kill you or they could mess up the heist on purpose for you and you just buying the game have no idea how to kick them. Also heists. They don't usually give you a lot of money unless you do all of them in order in which that would be great as you would get bonus money for doing so. Again thats where Shark Cards come in but unless you actually spend additional money on games you wouldnt want that. Also unless you have a decent gaming rig and want graphics that look okay then don't buy this game. All in all for Online play with good friends try to be decent at the game and do all the heists in order. Also if you have any additional money that you dont want to keep in your steam wallet for whatever reason (Maybe someones coming over and they will check your steam account and if they find money beg you to gift them something) or just wanna spend it on something that you might enjoy spend a few bucks on a shark card as it might boost your game and allow you to buy a decent gun. Also for the story its amazing buy it now. Hope to see you in game if you decide to buy!

review: The GTA V story was great.Dividing the gameplay up into 3 different characters helped the story stay fresh throughout.Gameplay hasn't changed much same tight mechanics.The driving in this game is awesome.I would recommend a FOV mod if you're going to be driving in first person. Guns can be a bit too accurate but thats a minor peeve.Overall 9/10 on singleplayer.GTA V online...not so great.I like to ride around in fast cars and light kids up with an UZI while I'm on call for a job.It breaks the monotony of the grindfest.Most of my murder sprees will end in being royally screwed by a hacker. *******(EVERY LOBBY HAS A HACKER!)*******"Ohh well sammy maybe you should just play in invite only sessions""ohh well...maybe you should go f*** yourself"I dont like to ruthlessly murder my friends and i don't have 20 i can play with?But i also dont liketo be ruthlessly murdered by a script kiddies with god mode. That s*** has got to stop.So yeah the hackers manage to ruin any fun in the game...Like how is it even fun for those kids anymore? IDFK.Rockstar does absolutely nothing about it. The the scripts are capable of is ridiculous. How hard is it to ban anyone with a vehicle whose god moded and chrome when they dont even have that rank? Seems pretty simple if free to play games can catch you using a crosshair overlay...So rockstar being useless and hackers being...well hackers. 1/10 Online experienceAverage that up...a lovely 5/10 Sadly. 10/10 if it had some actual anti cheat

review: This game is in full color. I'm not even kidding not just the base colors but every combination of color you would expect. We're talking everything from Dark Slate Gray to Hot Pink folks.As if color wasn't enough these geniuses found a way to include sound like a LOT of sounds. Ever wanted to hear a footstep? The sound of glass bottle nudged by someone walking by? Now you can hear it all!Color and sound this would be enough to make any game a winner but they didn't stop there. This game uses the alphabet AND numbers. That's right every letter your used to seeing in upper and lower case numbers and even punctuation. The amount of type in this game is stunning and you'll spend all day reading to your hearts content.I think its pretty clear that we have the building blocks for an amazing game here so expect to be blown away by the experience.

review: GTA Online can be quite fun with its incredible customization options and solid shooting mechanics. It's just a bonus that the game still looks gorgeous in 2018 with its support for 4K and incredible textures.However Rockstar has evolved into another greedy EA corporation and it's this that spoils much of the game's fun. Please stop buying their Shark cards guys you've ruined the company. Many missions require you to spend millions of dollars on things such as Bunkers and Nightclubs and it's honestly quite lackluster. And even when you buy these things there are several more things you are required to buy in order to enjoy the missions. Characters like Gay Tony Lester and Agent 14 will bombard you with phone calls EVERY LOGIN and it's this incessant whining from them that makes you want to buy what Rockstar is offering. DON'T DO IT.This is a disgusting business practice worse than what I've seen in several MMOs and the developers should be quite ashamed of themselves. Don't support shady business practices like this.On top of all this GTA has a griefing community of online modders that they refuse to remove after receiving complaints AND their missions are hidden by a horrendous paywall. Everything about the online experience is now TOXIC.Ultimately the groundwork for a great game is here if you just want to enjoy the campaign and/or coop missions with a couple of friends. But the introduction of Shark cards turned this game into a cesspool of horrendous capitalist garbage. Rockstar has fallen. Don't support this broken product.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is breath taking. I've never seen any other game with insane graphics. Putting the looks aside the gameplay is amazing. Though I mostly bought this game to drive cars and breathe in the virtual surrounding and environment. The sun setting low beneath the clouds slowly sinking into the waves of the ocean and the apex of the mountains the downtown bustling with individuals interstates full of vehicles driving to their own direction for a specific need... It's like living a real life but in a virtual world. I do not really care about the violence sexuality or any sort of thing that's inappropriate in this game. In fact I usually try to avoid it. I just love driving around a realistic city full of unbelievable detail lifting off planes drifting along the shoreline with a jet ski etc. Overall I recommend this game.

review: gfx_d3d_initAn error caused by instability between gpu voltage and clockrate. The default graphics card settings on most computers cause this. Because it is a user end problem rockstar can not fix it.A user should not be forced to underclock or increase the voltage of his/her gpu in order to play specific titles that have this issue. A user who does not know what he's doing might burn his graphics card by changing these settings blindly.Do yourself a favor and buy this on console. This is a bad port for reasons that in all honestly could not have been avoided by rockstar. They were just doing there job by releasing this game on pc.

review: The single player is pretty good. The multiplayer offering though holy balls. Let's ignore the sheer hell that is free roam with hackers FFA k/d bros and people broadcasting over open mics. We can even ignore that there is no real way to lobby up with friends not one that reliably works anyway.What you cannot ignore is the fact that every new DLC that comes out is basically a reskin of the previous DLC albeit with some cosmetic changes. But hey you get new vehicles right? I mean sure if you don't mind paying for them.Let's break this down. A megalodon Card costs $100 USD for 8 million GTA bux. It's now to a point where you cannot get everything in a DLC for that amount of money.So ask yourself this. If you paid $100 for a DLC and did not get access to everything that DLC had to offer would you consider that a good purchase? this game and everything it stands for.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Solid game with varying different styles of gameplay all of course absolutely bonkers. Can find myself going from just chilling out driving around on the Freeway to shooting it up and stealing supplies for my criminal empire. This is a great sandbox with hours and hours of gameplay. Drawbacks A lot of the "Free" DLC is very heavy on cost with in game currency so microtranactions are very popular. That said you'll find that Rockstar run plenty of Double XP/RP weekends for spotlight events. So you'll always find it quite easy to grind out the cash. Most of the time it doesn't even feel like grinding because your having a blast. Community can sometimes be a little weak with you struggling to fill a lobby if running quick jobs and you'll get the occasional hacker griefing but they are getting rarer and rarer with Rockstar constantly adapting to fight cheaters.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Singleplayer is a masterpiece however there is nothing to keep you going after the main story unless you are an avid achievement hunter. Online was fun for a while but as subsequent updates have appeared it is now impossible to afford anything within them unless you have been grinding the game constantly since launch or spend real money on shark cards. No free bunkers or hideouts are given to get you into the new updates you are just expected to pay several millions of GTA$ just to be allowed to take part. And the money drain doesn't end there.And after that the result isn't even worth it. The game currently supports griefing and cheating while chastising honest and sensible players. If you want a fun online gaming experience go elsewhere lest your soul be corrupted.

review: Finally!After completing the game on PS3 AND Xbox 360 I can finally complete it on PC!I've always been a fan of the GTA games. This easly my favorite one.GTA V on PC. The graphics are just fantastic I mean the difference between PS3/X360 and PC are HUGE! You can even see big differences between the PS4/XONE and the PC. (Depending on your computer specs. ofc!)The cars the environment the streets the characters the infrastructure. I LOVE IT!!!!I also like that we have some more features on the PC than on the PS3. For example "Rockstar Editor".I haven't tried it fully yet so I can't leave a complete review but I've seen what it can accomplish and it's simply amazing.I can also feel that the cars are more realistic to steer on PC than on consoles. I like that too. Rockstar have made a great job and It's been "worth it" to wait this time!I hope that many people will buy this game including my friend because I'd love to play with you all.If you are into GTA V Online Join my Steam crew http //steamcommunity.com/groups/GTAV4L I hope that you learn something from this review Thanks for reading.

review: Grand Theft Auto V And Story Mode and mods to install for this game however a terrible online community.Story Mode 10 hours worth of Missions and Strangers and Freaks and Random events to be explored and completed. Also many Challenges to be done aswell. The 3 Main Characters Micheal Trevor Franklin there is also alot to explore in the map.The Game has cool Easter eggs and cool backstories of the characters and other cool places. If you like to play GTA V go ahead the Story mode is amazing!Online I wouldn't say the Online version of the game is the worst we got from Rockstar in all history of GTA Games but it is.The Online version has alot of Hackers and Bad Sport players wich means you can get banned or put in a cheater pool or Bad Sport pool meaning you would have to wear a hat that says Dumb or Cheater wich you can't get off or unequip it because its temp or perm. You can't make barely any cash without you having actual money to buy Shark Cards wich give you the advantage to buy from 100k to 8 Mil$. Wich you can use to buy an apartment and all the Bunkers and Hangars and Motorcycle club houses so they stop calling you and telling you to buy there The Online version however is fun to play with friends wenn there is new adversery modes and cool player created Missions or Death matches. I don't recommend the game fully cause of "Again" the lack of support and updates that needs from Rockstar. Players getting banned randomly Hackers buying accounts to mod. There is no way you will not meet a hacker i bet you my steam account you will meet one. "Sooo Good luck playing the Story mode and online mode." I would give the Story mode 10/10 and Online 6/10. 6 + because of the gameplay4 cause of the Microtransactions and stupit phone calls and loadings screen to advertise the 10 + Never Ending Story mode D

review: I will be giving this review a postive rating but there are some major issues that really need to beed looked at.Pros Amazing story line. Tons of stuff to do in online. Fun online progression system. Playing with friends is best. Tons of sweet mods for single player!Cons Hackers/Modders/Cheaters there is usually one on every server some are nice and just fly around most are s. Connecting takes a long time to online. You're not paired with players of your same ranking so some servers you will get demolished because there is a clan of level 300+ destroying you with flying vehicles and lock on missiles. Online houses/bunkers/businesses/etc cost WAY TOO MUCH money! For casual players it is almost impossible to gain that much money so quickly unless you buy Shark Card which is a huge money grab! Shark Card pay to win essentially...pay a bunch of real cash get all the best houses and vehicles instantly! Not many cons but they are huge issues. All in all its a fantastic game bought it for me and all my friends.

review: 20+ hours I played this dang game. (it's 17 hours in Steam as I played offline more)Nearly completed the story mode and online actually pretty nice for me. (but sometimes hackers still annoying af respawn death respawn death)+ Modifications. Cars guns.+ Get in a vehicle. Select unarmed. Stop in front a car on an intersection. Right click while you burning out your tires and horning the horn. Get p*ssed off and hits my hard to find muscle car. Catch the car. Shoot the tires. Hand to hand combat and wins. Two star cops and wasted because I ran out of ammo. Personal humor lol+ Love it when you press throttle too deep and it's burning out.+ Bit more better combat system. Hell pistol really hurts now.And many more that I too lazy to write.But? Bit more like the old GTA 4 handling and physics tho. I'm a guy that actually loves realism. Even I need to readapt with the car controls on here. Online prices. Like. Really? Getting few grands be like half of hour my time always wasted just because of failed setups and heists.And by the way either Rockstar or Take Two learn from your mistakes you fella did.

review: If you are worrying about the price or the downloading of the huge game i recomend reading my review.2 years ago i was thinking about buying GTA 5 but the price seemed so high. For some reeason My friend and I then bought the game and i have now played it about 600 hours. I have never opened the game when i didnt want to and yet i have now easily gotten to 600 hours of play time. I think you should think about not the price but the expected price per hour. And i think nearly everyone will play GTA more than 100 hours and at that point the cost of one hours play time is less than 1 . If you compare that to movies or other games i think you will be in the same class of around 1 per hour. So actually the price can be justified even if it is really high.I recomend buying GTA 5 on steam and not the rockstar version because i have had so much problems with the rockstar versions download servers that i actually bought the game again this time via steam. After switching to steam i have had no problems with downloading the 66GB game.

It is full of cheaters and down right hackers. It used to be you could earn enough for stuff by hard work which has now become 5x harder. All in all it is well made and you get a lot but It contains continual pushing of people to buy to play multiplayer. So I don't feel sorry for them when hackers give themselves absurd amounts of cash.If you have money at your finger tips go ahead but it can be irritating.

review: My IMO score 10/10Why?Don't have to answer Roman's calls anymore because he isn't in the game.Seriously though here are my points Story I haven't played it yet but based on my brother's gameplay it is really well crafted and very unpredictable except for some parts. There are also a lot of twists in the story.The inclusion of 3 protagonists was also done very good with each of their respective Special Abilities. Cheat codes are fun too!Online I played about 99% of my time in Online. The community as I expected is SOS or shoot on sight kind of players so you don't really have a room for making friends. The real fun comes when you are playing with your friends. The jobs are actually good and make a really stable source of money.Beware though vehicles are very pricey and it will be a while until you bought your first legitimate vehicle. It will still be longer before you bought your first apartment too! Although they are very expensive they give you a safe haven from the rampaging players that shoot you down with no remorse. They also give your owned cars a safe place where other players can't blow them up and you have to call the Insurance company to get it back. The most expensive ones looks something that only Iron Man can buy hell the Garage already looks like a house.HEISTS my favourite part of Online. They are cooperative missions that need good teamplay and effective communications. The succeeding heists after the first one are extremely hard without teamwork but it really feels good once you bring home the bacon. It gives you a darn lot of money especially if you are heist leader (I got 200k once). The problem is that most of the players who joins your heists are 1). Noobs who cant do 2.) People who don't know what to do. 3.) people who Perform their roles poorly and 4.)just incompetent s who sit around while you and possibly others are getting by the police. However when someone you know or trust gets together on one crew you can have actually fun and it doesn't even feel that you are competing. You also burn through heists quickly and you level up fast. Optimization Hell this console port doesn't even feel like it! Truly the PC Master Race has prevailed. The graphics looks very beautiful. The streets and cities are very lively. The effects are truly stunning. All this runs on my decent laptop with the following specifications GTX 860M(Single)Intel Core i7 4710HQ 2.5Ghz 3.416 GB RAM.It runs around 40 60 FPS on Very High settings with no AA and on 1920x1080!There is a little stuttering and screen tearing but it isn't really noticeable and it is just probably my eyes getting damaged from playing GTA V constitently.Well that's all I could say for this review. This review will be updated as the game also updates on PC
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: TL DR Fantastic game ruined by a terrible communityThis is a fantastic game. Whether it's the graphics gameplay or story it's all phenomenal. Just to buy this game to play the single player would be money well spent.Online is good as you try and build your own criminal empire by doing odd jobs and progressing up the criminal ladder. It's a bit of a grind fest to acquire bases vehicles etc. but that's because all the DLC is made available for free in a way.You'll read reviews telling you to stay away from the online side and you might think it's the game Devs that made it a bad experience.Online is ruined by the player base nothing else. Hackers/Modders are constantly present so all you can hope is they don't decide to mess with you. Trying to complete missions on a public server will often end with someone using a Hydra/Deluxo or any other ridiculous OP vehicle to blow you up with ease.As I'm typing this I'm about 0 40 as a guy in a hydra is spawnkilling me before I can do a thing. And as I'm on a mission I can't go into passive mode so I'll just have to wait it out as this has already been a 20 minute ordeal.

review: The game itself is great lots of content lots to do and is very fun with friends. But the people you meet in public servers are absolutely horrible. Kids in hydras blowing everything up griefers with explosive sniper rifles bombing your car from miles away and unfriendly modders that buries you under 200 planes. I understand that this is supposed to be part of the game but a lot of the game mechanics seems to be encouraging these actions. Such as having a kd ratio to your character gaining money and experience points (rp) for killing other players for no reason etc. All in all if you are fine with the griefers and toxicity this game can be really fun. Oh and did I mention the graphics are astonishing and hard to run even till this day?

review: After the disappointing PC version of GTA IV this is a welcome relief. You ll have to sacrifice some of the finer details like the gorgeous depth of field effects and ultra high res textures but it s entirely possible to play and enjoy GTA V without a super powerful PC. If you have the muscle to run it at max settings the visual fidelity is astonishing. Driving through the city at night in a storm neon signs reflecting in the puddles and on the rain slicked hood of your car it almost looks photorealistic..

So when your expensive sh*t you grinded for gets blown up by a hacker don't expect any help from the company itself.Main take away is this is a P2W microtransaction online griefing simulator. Game sucks man. Bring us the singleplayer stories like you promised Rockstar.

review: At the moment I would not recommend GTA V (Certainly don't buy for full price) I have enjoyed GTA online I can't help feel it is a bit of a grind fest at times in order to own the businesses and arsenal i'd like to. I don't have lots of time to invest into this game in order to gain the money i'd like. I understand rockstar ''needs'' to sell shark cards but please don't tell me the online DLC is free when its only available to those who get deep vein thrombosis because they've sat on their a** for too long playing GTA.. Players will seek to destroy your fun online and it can be hard to play on an open online server without someone trying to destroy you and your fun with one of the many ridiculous vehicles available. Then again they have been made available. I have had fun but mainly in closed friends only servers but then you can't interact with the MC clubs ETCThere is a lot of fun to be had I have had a lot of fun but lately it feels a grindfest and feels so much harder to get on a open server where you can complete MC missions without being trolled and feeling disappointed by the outcomes of the missions
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I don't know what this meme is of Rockstar being a company which is debatebly true and banning people and taking money from people for no reason which lowkey they probably do but the game itself isnt bad honestly. Is it my favorite GTA? No because it's not Vice City. But is it a fun game? Hell yeah it is. Single Player Stories are things that Rockstar is pretty good at doing but with GTA V? Ehhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh could be better honestly. It's not really a bad story itself it's mostly just "Oof ouch bank heist gone wrong wrong guy got shot guy gets dead man walking rob banks sucking eachother big ing d i c k s again with a new ." which sums it up completely. The thing that brings it down the most is the characters Franklin is obviously the best written one because he's an actual C H A R A C T E R and Michael is just a grumpy old man with kids and a wife who hates him cuz he's a And Trevor is just some meme character that kills people and does drugs and does the epic i hate the people that arent meeeeeeeeeeee. Missions are dope tho especially the heists solid 8/10.Online As of right now the online is considered " ing bad bad bad bad bad bad!!!!" but like it's not when you bring friends along which is like the one thing you should do when you play video games but I dunno. Yeah it's filled with modders but if you aren't gay you'd know just to leave the game or just not be gay. The "rockstar taking money from us!!!" meme is just a meme if it happens you can just like get more money in like 3 missions. The thing is tho it's still grindy as so if you DO wanna get your money back depending on what mission you do you'll have to do a on of em to get it all back. Which would be better if you just played with friends but apparently people dont know what friends are????? Overall it's not bad just grindy and filled with losers and if you have internet like me lag.Strong 7.5/10So yeah I'd def buy this if it's on sale and you have some buds to play with just don't take all these meme reviews seriously cuz it's just people getting pissy at Rockstar because they're unironically a bad company and we still need to know they are.

review: Product received for free. You can't not like GTA gaming. GTA V has to be one of my favorite games ever made so far 2016. GTA IV was also a classic but something like 5 years later and we see just what a developer can accomplish in that time span. The story was amazing. Just straight up hilarious at times and the character development is pretty solid. The story could be longer however but it was a solid story and i enjoyed it a lot. Online is a different story of course. All the shark cards and dudes flying around in jets and recently the oppresor can definitely make me angry as hell. However It is possible to get thrown in a solo lobby which i spend a lot of time on to resupply my meth and cocaine labs aswell as my gun running business. Also wish you would get more money from jobs/heists/etc. But hey still a good deal of fun to play a majority of them. I still reccomend this game 2017. You can best believe i'm playing a lot of this title

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I used to really love this game. It was the first game I bought for my pc even before it was built. The game used to be more so about gang warfare and I guess thats what i liked about it. The past several dlcs have made this game something that i don't want to participate in. The CEO/company biker gang gun running smuggler's run dlcs have been in my opinion just reskins of the same core idea. Pay millions of dollars for a crew base buy supplies go get the supplies sell them buy outrageously over powered vehicles to kill players minding their own business. I feel gun running was the final nail in the coffin for me. Anyone lucky enough to be in a lobby with a modder and not have their modded money taken away by rockstar got the upper hand. They bought apc's and other crazy death machines. They bought guns like the heavy sniper and put stuff like explosive rounds on it instead of leveling up.I will say that the heist dlc was great. It added more story to the game and to online. If there were to be a second heist dlc I would most likely reinstall the game.Obviously hackers that blow up everyone on the map suck so I'm not going to talk about that. I'm not a fan of how rockstar handled situations where people were being modded money. I played this game with two of my friends and we were all glitched money. One of us was permanently banned. I had my money taken from me. My other friend (who was modded the most money) was left untouched. Punishment became a lottery.I have logged over 300 hours in the pc version of this game. Before that I played on my PS3 for I don't know how long. Many of those hours were great. I loved the game and it makes me sad to see what its become. I can no longer recommend this game.Its been fun guys.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

They don't care if there is a fault on thier end they just say no and tell you to literally off... To me Rockstar can now go suck a bag of .. They on my account with no option to get them to even CHECK that it was valid.Honestly Steam should look at this and consider their future releases as this will be something they will keep doing no matter what anyone says.Bad business Terrible responses and quite frankly the biggest ' you' to anyone who puts time and effort in to playing the game even while all the hackers run riot online without consequence.Also when they reset my account they reset it to 0 and didn't give me back the money I paid for as part of the PRE RELEASE... them and their new releases that are coming out. Not worth the risk to get suspended and simply be told 'You violated the EULA/ToS" which is so broad that if you stop a player going into a store and they don't enjoy it then you risk being screwed.HIGHLY RECOMMEND TO AVOID ALL OF THIS COMPANY AND IT'S SUBSIDIARIES RELEASES AS THEY ARE PURE TRASH AND CAN'T EVEN CATCH _REAL_ HACKERS...I can't even sell this piece of game to anyone else to recoup some of my money and to rid myself of this crap... title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Okay so i've been playing this game ever since it got released i've been playing it on xbox360 and PS3 even PS4 it was great fun and i was happy with everything but when i started playing on PC (this is about online) i was disappointed... the amout of modders you see in lobbies is just unreal.. i mean i don't really mind modders who are cool and don't grief but most of them are griefers and they're extremely annoying but if you don't mind switching lobbies from time to time then there should be no issue.The Gameplay is great i mean online is really well made theres so much to do but it gets kind of repetitive.. you constantly have to grind jobs and get money and lets be honest most of the jobs don't pay that much you can make about 100k if you play gamemodes that have double money and RP but even if you grindded that for a week straight it would still do you no good since everything is so expensive and the prices are jacked.. although it's repetitive if you have a group of friends you could really have some fun doing hesits etc and could possibly speed up the money making proccess but thats if you have friends who play GTA all the time.. it's really difficult and very boring as a solo player you constantly get people who leave jobs right when you're about to finish people who grief jobs etc the gta community is extremly toxic full of griefers... and f*** me don't even get me started on Freemode It's basically a KOS People will constantly blow you up blow your car up kill you to the point where you're going to have to look for another lobby.. but like i said apart from all the chaos and toxicity it's extremly fun with friends. i've met people in game who became friends with me helped me do heists etc... in general online is well made theres so much stuff to do you can squeeze out a couple thousand hours in online without a problem. Now the singleplayer.. i mean it's singleplayer it's great amazing story great voice acting.. just a perfect game.. despite it being 5 years old It's still really fun especially with mods.. i think i've beat the story mode like 5 times already with mods and without mods it's really fun.. so overall it's a great game i would recommend it 100% although i would probably play on console if you want a better online experience but if you dont mind modders and all that then go for it you wont regret it..
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: DISCLAIMER I started playing this game on release day on my Xbox 360 and then pre ordered the PC version when I made the switch to PC gaming so I have a very long very diverse play history of this game.GTA V is a mixed bag to reiterate what one of my peers put into their review. The singleplayer is an incredibly memorable experience and the story is characteristic of Rockstar's blockbuster storylines. If you want a darn good singleplayer game you will feel like you have spent your money well. There's an absolute ton of things to do and it doesn't take unheard of amounts of money to do it's just darn good fun and you can't beat it. From the incredible storytelling to the improved gameplay I cannot recommend the single player enough. If you're reading a review this in depth then you know how incredibly detailed and amazing Rockstar's singleplayer worlds are and this is an absolute bar setting experience.Where this game falls short is the multiplayer. And it's the ONLY reason this game is remotely bad. Compared to the singleplayer it truly feels to me like two entirely different studios developed this game. Rockstar made the singleplayer and the scummiest most criminally minded corporate scumbags made the online version. To put it bluntly there are very few things that online did right and an unbelievable amount of things they did wrong and it's truly concerning. In the early days following release the pricing systems (in my opinion) were rather well balanced. It didn't take and overtly insane amount of time to get the good cars guns and clothing/houses. But as things developed and time moved forward the game took a directon which all games nowadays seem to be taking one we observed in countless AAA titles Fallout 4 being among them as well. What I am referring to is the seemingly constant push to make games appeal to wider audiences release large amounts of half finished content and lacking DLC just to get consumers to spend more money on things like in game currency. And that's more of a philosophical issue in gaming and gaming business that I won't delve into but when so many developers in the modern era are constantly pushing in game currency and half finished DLC doesn't anyone question what they're doing to the game itself as far as content or integrity to justify those types of additions?Regardless of this the online portion itself is a grindy frustrating experience for many players just read the various reviews from my peers on steam and reddit and you'll find a few common themes. Grindy gameplay unbalanced gameplay (in terms of level gaps and economic gaps) and an overabundance of just really unfriendly players. That brings me to another issue and it's not something R* can control directly but have an influence on. The playerbase itself is a very very toxic community because R* does nothing to control it and doesn't give players the option to do so either so it runs rampant. There's no way to flag problem users there's no way for the community to police itself and Rockstar seemingly has no interest in this either and thus the toxic community. As for support from Rockstar that's an entirely different issue that normally isn't related to the game but in this case it is. I have no experience with any sort of unfair banning and neither do my friends so I won't speak on a topic I have no experience with. But in past dealings with R* support when I had issues migrating my account from XB360 to PC their service generally places any issues or blame on the customer and doesn't seem to be interested in accomodating or helping the customer. Which being a business owner myself I can tell you that despite popular belief the customer is always 100% completely right and nearly the only way to have a successful support/service department is to do whatever is feasibly possible to help the customer even at a loss to yourself. It breeds a positive customer base and that's not something we see with this game as I have previously mentioned.To conclude I don't really have any advice as far as te al aspects of the game go since I have no background in any form of programming whatsoever. However I can give support and business advice. The more money you take from a customer without them feeling satisfied justified and cared about in their purchase/experience the more you'll develop bad publicity and poor unruly customer bases. Business is about a relationship between a corporation or company and an individual and while a company's primary goal or directive is to make money you simply cannot treat customers poorly or take advantage of them through unethical practices or "overly corporate relations". You have to be a human first businessman second. You have to make money while also ensuring that you don't lose sight of what you originally set out as a company (or studio) to do and that's to make games that people want to play. Not make money. These practices might work in the short term but as we have all seen before consumers NEVER EVER forget and it's even less likely that they forgive. And Rockstar well you've lost sight of your goal and you allowed your highly prestigious studio to be controlled by the never ending pursuit of money. Tl dr I am unable to in good conscience recommend this game even with the incredible single player. I cannot recommend it.

review: Man oh man. I've played this game on PS3 PS4 and finally PC. Rockstar have created their Magnum Opus in this (and now Red Dead 2). Plot 8/10 Characters 10/10 Content 11/10 (Online) Map 9/10. My only gripe is the non enforcement of ages. We have 12 year old K/D warriors all over the Online servers who frankly ruin the experience of the ENTIRE online aspect of the game (80% of it). From a person who has played GTA 2 3 Vice City San Andreas Chinatown Wars IV and now V the non online portion of the game is 1000% worth it. In recent years the Online portion is getting more and more expenisve to play however. Its' understandable that they charge a lot for shark cards since all DLC is released for free (lots of it). But its' not cool that they make all the in game items more and more expensive every update. Just be prepared to drop cash if you don't want to spend DAYS grinding to get a single car.

review: Don't get me wrong. The main characters are great. The alternating characters mechanic is interesting and is perfectly exploited.But I think that the gameplay of GTA V is mostly for GTA players not for anyone.There is no quick travel. "But you can call a taxy" In the middle of a freaking mountain? "But the realism..." REALISM? WHEN YOU DIE YOU SPAWN IN A HOSPITAL!!! REALISM MY !! "Ok but you can simply log out and..." And after 4 hours of loading maybe I will be able to play again.The AIs are terrible and the spawn of enemies is wild and unpredictable (police during chasing during races and so on) but I guess that the latter tries to compensate the former.Oh and basically your body is just a punchball when it interacts with any surface. If you jump just a centimeter earlier instead of climbing you will jump and hit the obstacle and lay down forever.And remembering all the commands it's a nightmare. I would have prefered a game more intuitive with less non important features (like the damn cell phone) but with more effective core mechanics.Oh and the objectives for the gold medal are shown only after the mission instead of during it so you probably have to play them again. So more than one hour of time wasted just in loading screens!Once again probably for people who love GTAs with all their quirkness this game is perfect and they will not give any importance to these flaws. But to me these are big flaws that should not be present in a AAA game.Also...the damn unlocked achievements are of the same color of the damner locked achievements...damn!

review: Was GTA V worth this long wait? It is a fantastic done port much better optimized than GTA IV ever was. Don t bother with the first person view as it cuts off about 40% of your screen. Rockstar has provided a lot of graphical customizations to let you get those 60FPS depending on your PC Hardware. It s always good to check your settings with the provided benchmark. The grass and vegetation options on PC put the console peasants to shame! The PC port is highly detailed compared to last gen and current gen consoles. The Radio Station is mediocre at best GTA IV and San Andreas Radio was better I suggest using your own MP3 s and making your own playlist. Addition of new weapons vehicles and Easter Eggs throughout the game make a very nice and exciting gameplay. You can customize your weapons and vehicles to your liking there are a lot of options. Nothing like driving a sweet ride and listening to some tunes. I consider it to be one the best looking Open World games which will continue to get better with modding community on PC.

review: Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V). This is by far one of my favorite games ever. The graphics are great. The gameplay is simple and satisfying. The characters are loveable. There is Franklin a gangster who wants to be a little bit more. Michelle a retired criminal who is basically dying from boredom and my favorite Trevor... just plain crazy Canadian. He is not sorry. Anyway the reason I like this game so much is because there are tons to do even taking away the online mode which I will get to shortly. There is the main story that is interesting and fun where you get to plan your own heist to an extent hire crew members (using the same people in your team makes them get better the more you use them) The fun thing is unlike other GTA games to date (as far as I know) GTA V gives you the option of playing as 3 different characters instead of just one. Each one has a special skill which is pretty cool. There are tons of side characters that are either very annoying (Michelle's family) or very awesome there are even stranger missions that you can do where you meet someone and they ask you to do something for them like a mini story something I really appreciated. All in all I really think this has been one of the best GTA games.Now for the online version. GTA Online aka loading simulator. Don't get me wrong it is worth the wait it is just very annoying. GTAO is very fun especially when played with friends. There are more things to do then I care to mention my favorite are the stunt races. You can get a few friends together and do a heist which is a lot of fun unless you get a random and that person doesn't want to follow the rest of the team. The thing that really makes GTAO feel real for me is you start with nothing just the clothes on your back and by doing stuff like events or heists or even missions you get money which you use to buy houses businesses cars whatever you want. There are even some of the mini games you can play from the single player mode. The community are about what you could expect from GTA in other words most times it is just a bunch of people killing each other. Still fun but can get annoying if you want to do like a car drop where the more damage the car takes the less money you get.Basically if you liked the previous GTA titles you will most likely like this one too. It improved a lot on the GTA formula. Heck there is even a first person mode that seems better then most FPS games out there so well done Rockstar. There is literally something for everyone in this game. Race CTF team death match. There are tons of stuff to do. I recommend picking it up on a sale since it is a little pricey but even at full price it is totally worth the money
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I Waste of money in 2018? HECK YEAII Grind? HECK YEAIII Pay to advance? F YEAIV Decent storymode? MEHV Mods? HECK YEAVI Hackers? MEH... SOMETIMESShort DONT GET THE GAME!!!Save your money get this game off some website where you can get a key for cheap if you really want to. online grind. Long Dont get this game in 2018... if you are even reading this... just don't do it... this game is only fun for a very small amount of time after so you would want to take long breaks from the endless grind this game requires (authors note I am not a very good with money so take it with a grain of salt... nor am I patient enough for most grinding) However the game does give you a great time if you aren't into the freemode stuff. I do recommend the races especially the user made stunt ones. Races are great with freinds... not that I have any that play them with me... BUT ANYWAYS... it's still not worth the purchase unless you get this game from somewhere cheap. 60 dollars or even the 50% off 30 dollars isn't worth your hard earned cash. However... this game does serve a niche in the market as there aren't many other open world games I could recomend over this... unless you include GTAIV (which I have never played) and The original red dead redemption (which I also have never played). From a person who has played many F2P games I know when I smell Pay 2 Win or Pay 2 Progress and this game stinks of the latter. However I understand the business side of this game and although I do not support the extent it has gone to try to dry our pockets they have at least added some new content to the game. Simply put it is most likely that liscensing for the music in the game does not come cheap for Rockstar. (from experience researching music liscensing for youtube)Conclusion if I only look at this game in 2018 I would barely suggest getting the game when it is on sale. I am honestly still enjoying this game from time to time but that does not mean that I would support this game. As of now me and my 689 hours played is firmly seated against YOU buying this game and especially the "Shark cards". It doesn't get as boiled down as that my friends.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: first off this is a Great game a bench mark for the series technically. I'm still amazed how good it looks.Yet the game seems to lack the special something of earlier titles the "wacky" is muted replaced with a more somber realistic toneyet the classic absurd nature of the games physics of how tough you and your vehicle still exist.it creates an odd dynamic you get drawn into the reality of the game you find yourself not having to suspend disbelieve as much then every once and a while that is shattered by evil kenival type stunts and unreal bullet damage.its like it can't make up its mind if it wants to be GTA The simulator or GTA the game. as for the game the main story is great good pacing actually interesting characters are better fleshed out and with 3 main storylines to follow it keeps thing fresh but there are fewer side missions/alter goals in singleplayer and sadly this seems to have affected the logevity of the game as once the main story is completed the world feels kinda bland/empty the cheats avalible are "meh" could be that after 4 iterations of this game I may just be an tired old man but it dosent seem to have the same replayability of the older games.Online is great! if you can find a group of like minded players.watch out for hackers and con artists tho it makes for an interesting side of the game people have developed systems to rob people after hiest etc I must admit adds a bit of tension to the gameif your looking For straight up TDM DM etc like GTA 4 you really need to get a friends/player list as a pick up game of that type hardly ever happens.online jobs/heist/gangs missions etc are fun can be a bit convoluted if played with randoms as i said get a group of regular players and you'll have a blast.*update The new heists are Awsome
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: If I'd be able to rate GTA 5 vs GTA 5 Online I'd give GTA 5 a thumbs up but because Online sucks so much I'm going to give this a thumbs down.Playing for the first time in Online is a total and complete frustrating experience. You have no idea what to do no idea what a lot of stuff means no idea how to get cash and the list can go on.Plus Rockstar seems to think that sticking a bunch of players who are level 200+ with a total beginner is a great idea. Can't tell you how many times I've been bombed from a helicopter while I can barely afford a 2 car garage and a few guns. And that Passive Mode is a joke. You can't do anything while in passive mode. Once you enter a mission it's disabled and people can start killing you again.There's no tutorials nobody to show you the ropes. They just throw you out there and wishing you good luck.

review: Only focusing on the online gameplay 1. every other session (if u manage to connect) has hackers who either kill u non stop or do some other things. Hackers are very frustrating especially when they spawn kill u for 30 50+++ times in a row.2. customer support does absolutely NOTHING about hackers. I exchanged numerous emails. All they say is report in game and "no further information required from you at this time" which doesnt work well too many active hackers and hacker can crash ur game so u cant report him. the only way to protect against hackers spawn killing u is to become hacker and enable god mode yourself.3. hackers like dropping millions of dollars on u (once u get money u dont need to work hard to earn them and u skip a lot of content in game). I had rains of money dropping on me way to often.4. problems with joining/leaving sessions. might take u a while watching loading/white/black screen to join session. u might get kicked out of a session. This game require u to tune ur router with DNAT/DMZ/port forwarding like no other game on a market does. The fact that sessions are publicly hosted also makes is EXTREMELY easy to hack/cheat in game.the online gameplay is an unfair unmoderated disaster and heaven for hackers/cheaters. I have 2 accounts and i had to bag this game.

review: This review comes after I have totally given up on Rockstar support and have deleted it from my Steam Account (I'm not sure why I'm still allowed to review this but whatever I'll take it).Overall GTA V wasn't a bad game it had a good and fun singleplayer mode which I enjoyed and multiplayer *WAS* fun until hackers and whatnot would spawn items money etc. everywhere and being a game in which you auto pickup everything you recieve all this "free" money. Once you recieve a certain amount within a small amount of time the game lets you know that you have been "logged" to Rockstar. This has happened twice and I had a 3 day then 3 month ban rather than risk getting a perma ban for nothing and knowing that after hours spent trying to resolve the issue with Rockstar they kept blaming me which isn't how a business is supposed to work. I had my Steam account unlinked from the Social Club bullcrap and will never buy another Rockstar product again.When a company's Customer Support blames the customer for hackers spawning lots of money on top them and that it was my fault I decided Rockstar doesn't deserve anymore business from me and I had the game removed from my Steam Account as well (at a loss but I didn't care).Overall though before hackers and Rockstar's "Support" blamed me for something I didn't do the game *WAS* fun sadly this is no longer the case and singlplayer was boring after beating it and whatnot...Game (Overall) 3/5 Not Bad was fun but can't play a game with hackers and no effective anti cheat or customer support.Rockstar Customer Support 0/5 I've never given anything a 0 but they are terrible. Maybe I just got unlucky when I called but they were rude and completely unhelpful the most help they provided was when I wanted my Steam account unlinked from the Social Club Account which they did.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V is a better port than GTA IV. It runs smoother despite the fact it uses newer tech. I've never played the console versions so I can't compare it to those though it's pretty obvious that the PC version runs and looks much much better however it's one of the better AAA releases of late. I recommend using a beefy cpu and gpu to fully enjoy the PC version. I'm running it on an i7 4470K Haswell and a 770 GTX which allows me to run everything on "Very High" except for Textures that are set to "High" with a stable 60 fps (higher w/ V Sync disabled). You can squeeze by with an older card but you'll be missing out on the full scope of graphical improvements in this release.I'm still playing the Story Mode and haven't bothered with GTA Online yet so I cannot comment on its functionality but Story Mode is running fine. No crashes or stutters or any other game breaking issues. My only gripes seem to be in game design and it's a little petty of me I'll admit.I don't like the cops in this game they're too invasive and it feels like a lot of the chases are more tiresome than exciting. Losing the cops in this isn't as fun as in previous titles. Also it feels like they pick up on every little crime you commit and that's a bit of a change from the other games. Unrelated but just as annoying the phone in this one is absolute trash unlike the one in GTA IV. GTA IV's phone was quick and intuitive. Whereas in GTA V I'm annoyed with how much time I spend trying to find different things in my phone when I'm busy driving or doing a mission. It seems like they're just too busy satirizing Apple's iPhone when they should have made a functional phone for us to use. Perhaps I shall adjust.So that's all. Concluding I'd like to just say that Rockstar has improved so much in this latest release. It seems like they have learned from GTA IV and listened to their fans quite a lot when it comes to developing a port for PC. Aside from that the gameplay &amp story remains pretty flawless and loyal to the GTA feel that we're accustomed to with the exception of annoyingly clairvoyant police and a couple of petty gripes of my own. Still it's definitely a better port and worth giving a go.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The long wait has been worth it. If you re a PC gamer who s spent the last eighteen months envying the console crowd while they all got stuck into the latest greatest GTA then rest assured that you can now play the definitive version. Sure the Xbox One and PS4 versions were amazing delivering GTA 5 at higher resolutions with more detailed textures smoother surfaces better lighting and cool depth of field effects (see our full review below) but the PC version offers even more enhancements plus a couple of additional features that play to the PC s strengths. In doing so it adds a few more metres to one of gaming s towering achievements.

review: Now don't get me wrong. Despite the negative rating I honestly do enjoy GTA V or at least the singleplayer part. It's a fun and charming game with a lot to do great writing and a lot of hours to spend. The multiplayer however not as much. With rampant hackers a play to win model and microtransactions everywhere it leaves a lot to be desired.In the years since GTA V's PC release Rockstar and Take Two have constantly been making decisions which have been incredibly consumer unfriendly. Whether it's the neglect of the singleplayer mode in favor of the broken online which just happens to make them more money (seriously where is the singleplayer DLC? No let's just keep having more MP microtransactions instead) or the time where they manipulated Steam sales by adding one of their virtual currency cards in a bundle to avoid actually going on sale or most recently the debacle where Take Two has gone against the modding community by sending a C&amp D to the OpenIV team.Mods have been an important part of PC gaming for a long time and the Grand Theft Auto series is no exception. In the singleplayer campaigns people have the right to do whatever the hell they like with a game that they have purchased as long as it has no bearing on other players. But no apparently that's bad now according to Take Two. Never mind the epidemics of hackers on MP it's the singleplayer modding community which is the problem.But as long as these issues still stand there is a definite problem and it needs to be addressed.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've played at least 2000 hours in this game over my ps3 and pc and I highly recommend this to anyone who loves the GTA franchise or are just looking for a game to invest some fun and time in. Easily one of the best games I've ever played. Also currently ALL dlc is free in the game.

review: UPDATE 29/08/17 Just like they did before GR hit R*s been nicking peoples cash again. I personally made about 5 mil from the I/E double money event and a couple days later R* took 1.2 mil away. Though I should count myself lucky there are people who got Criminal Mastermind money taken and even Shark Card money! If you browse the Discussions keep an eye out for the R* defense squad if you make a post about lost money they'll spam links and cheating accusations all over. Game's decent.. Plays good looks good sounds (mostly) good. Online mode can be a bit hit and miss sometimes you get good sessions with no greifers or cheaters other times its a cluster of chaos. Discussion boards are nothing but a huge garbage fire stay away if you dislike salt and poop (because my god does it get thrown around a lot).R* doesn't seem to know exactly what they're doing with the game as of late giving rediculously OP vehicles and weapons to the richest of players while leaving the ones at the bottom to seek glitches for empty sessions just to play the game. Of course if you bring this up the vocal minority of braindead psychopaths that lurk in and around the games playerbase will say that they're 'just playing the game as it was intended' but don't bother listening to that lot. Over time you may find some decent people to play with (I've made friends with quite a large group of people over the past few months) but at the end of the day GTA Online in some ways is like Rust. You start at the bottom and either get killed on sight by some or you grind up to the top and eventually become the who kills on sight. Though there will be some exeptions that's essentially how it plays out.UPDATE 24/03/2018 The banocalypse is here god save us all (Exept for iD and FIREFLY they can go hump a cactus naked).

No mods either so when mods do come out....good bye life.Going out to upgrade my PC soon because I finally realize after playing GTA on Xbox360 and XboxOne then PC...that 60+fps really does make a difference. review: Grand Theft Auto V in my opinion is an important milestone in the evolution of video games. It's also important to point out that this game is centered around having fun. Fun things to do in real life is fun to do in this game. The mechanics are deep and varied allowing you to do things I'd doubt the devs even thought of. The aesthetic of the game is consistent and polished. You always get the 'Los Santos' vibe from the parodical nature of the game's media to the nostalgic hollywood esque music scores that play in important/exciting events. The game forces you into immersion in ways I haven't seen other dev's than Rockstar do for example in Online To buy stuff like cars you have to browse the in game web using your in game phone. Things like these really help you get deeper into the world.

review: If you are thinking about buying this read this review I will try to give you all the information shortened.This is not like old days GTA. It is another game a more commercial one. You are in a city Los Santos and... Why don't you watch some videos? There are thousands of them. Pros 1.Singleplayer is not bad2.Multiplayer exists3.A lot of content4.Good graphics5.A lot of voice acting6.Good voice acting7.A lot of different cars faces people buildings locations and many more8.Some interesting heistsCons 1.Important! The game does not make the feeling when you are on a heist I mean even if you have a stealth mission it ALWAYS comes to the point when you gotta shoot. And not just shoot but kill 200 policemen trying to stop you even if you do everything right you will get somewhere with a lot of space and the melee will begin.2.Boring multiplayer3.A lot of killers on multiplayer4.A lot of hackers on mp5.A few things you can do with a car or any vehicle forward backward left or right no slowing speed not even lowering your side glasses!6.Pay to winIf you are like me and buy this game here is what is going to happen. You go to Singleplayer you buy a lot of guns and you start destroying everything and soon realise that policemen waves are infinity and you can not blow any structures and finally get killed. After that there is not many exciting things to do.The price is not tha good for a game like this If you are too eager to buy and play this wait for a sale. I did not write as much as it was needed but that was going to make the review boring. I hope I helped.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game itself is fantastic. My only issue is the PC port. Only way this game is playable is to turn down all graphics to 50% and turn off all AA. You're probably thinking I have a weak system? Two Sapphire R9 290x Tri OC Vapor X's in crossfire on a Z97 with a devils canyon. Crossfire issue then? Definetly I pulled one card and it became more playable but still not able to put the graphics settings up to decent level without major frame rate issues. For as long as it took to get this game ported to PC I have to say I'm really not impressed.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V (also known as Grand Theft Auto Five GTA 5 or GTA V) is a video game developed by Rockstar North. It is the fifteenth installment in the Grand Theft Auto series and the successor of Grand Theft Auto IV. The original edition was released on September 17th 2013 for the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3. The Xbox One and PlayStation 4 versions were released on November 18th 2014 and was later released on April 14th 2015 for the PC.Grand Theft Auto V (kısaca GTA V veya GTA 5) Rockstar North tarafından geliştirilen ve Rockstar Games tarafından yayımlanan açık uçlu aksiyon macera tarzı video oyunu. Grand Theft Auto serisinin on beşinci oyunudur. 17 Eylül 2013 tarihinde PlayStation 3 ve Xbox 360 için piyasaya çıkmıştır. Oyunun grafikleri güncellenmiş yeni nesil sürümünün PlayStation 4 ve Xbox One için 18 Kasım 2014 tarihinde Windows için 14 Nisan 2015 tarihinde piyasaya çıkmıştır...

review: So here is Rockstars latest introduction to the GTA franchise. I myself cannot say it s perfect and yes the ban system is WAY out of whack but there is a silver lining to this game. Pros It is in my opinion an AMAZING way to get together with friends and just absolutly wreck the town/each other. I think that there is no better way than to get together and just goof around. It s an amazing experience to play this game with other people who want to try out the same whacky s*** that you want to try! It s a great experience from the other versions of GTA online that we have been able to try. GTA 4 was awesome as hell but this adds so much onto it in such a tremendous way. The constant but limited in time DLC keeps you busy. Want to be a CEO or run a your own chapter in a bike gang? Do you want to spin loops and run like a cracked out bunny while possibly breaking speed records? You can! Even though the DLC isn t what everyone wants (cough cough zombies) It s still entertaining to see what they throw out at us. The full ability to customize/transfer your character. I m really glad this was an option.Cons The banning system that Rockstar has put on this game does more than just damper the experience. It leaves good and fair players in fear at the risk of getting temporarily or even permanatly banned. If you re like me and you have invested WAY to much time and money into your character getting banned is like having a chunk of you ripped from you and lit on fire. Over the course of the life of GTA V s life the system has gotten more and more strict on what players can and cannot do. This turns players off immensly. There are players who just want to watch the world burn literally. I was always paranoid on getting on public servers even before the ban switch was flipped. People are such a** munches when it comes to this game. yes I understand that It is a public lobby and that it does happen but there is a time when enough is enough. Shark Cards....The only way to get your bonus money is to actually buy it from the Rockstar site itself....Overalll GTA V is a stunningly beautiful game that has entertained me for hours. Yes it has its issues and no I m not neccissarily defending Rockstars ban system but if you have the right people this could be one of the most amazing games for you. Let this game bring you as much entertainment and joy as it has for me. Also remember not everyone out there in that world is out to get you. Some of us are actually good people.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Oh GTA what is there to say about you? Such fun.On top of it the graphics are stunning particularly in the PC version. LA doesn't look this good in real life!

review: tl'dr Story 9/10Online 8/10Pros +++ Story/General+ Long Story to follow (got about 70 hours for 100%)+ large open world+ smooth switch from controller to mouse+keyboard even both at the same time possible+ large pool of mods+ Director Mode for producing your own clips (even some long movies have popped up)+ Graphics really good for such an open world title+ Steam integration (you can join/invite without needing to use the ingame stuff)Cons Story/General you can only have up to 7 cars per character (1 main 2 in the house garage and 4 in another garage) owned cars that get destroyed are gone forever except the main carPros +++ Online+ really funny in coop with friends+ heists nice change of pace+ many coop missions+ many free roam events+ physics glitches (think of the "swing of death" in GTA IV)+ npc AI is hilarious sometimes (ever seen a dump truck going rampage?)Cons Online at the date of writing this review ONLY 50 cars saveable (50 per character) (if you play as long as I do you just need more) (this recently got changed to 60!) No good system to separate controller from mouse+keyboard (both have their advantages+disadvantages) &gt Most matches with random players feel unfair most of the times in my opinion Hackers/Griefers Late Game only offers reeeeeaaaaaaaally expensive stuff most cars are useless in races / every car class has its own "superior" car (personally would like to see truck races)

review: NEW GTA V SINGLEPLAYER ___________________The story follows three people Michael Franklin and Trevor.These three have their own seperate stories that converge into one where they all perform various jobs like heists in order to live the good life start buisnesses and get out of debts.The singleplayer story has a loads of enjoyable missions and a good plot though id say the GTA IV plot is better though that is my opinion. The story isn't as serious as GTA IV's story but it isn't wacky like what they did to Saints Row 3 and 4.GTA ONLINE ___________________It's quite obvious now that this game is filled with terrible paywalls and good GTAV youtubers like GTAMen and GypsyYT have videos that explain this in much more detail than I can.GTA Online has become Rockstar's and TakeTwo's cash cow because of shark cards.It is possible to grind for money in Online though it is time consuming and in the end probably not worth the time spent.GTA Online at first was very enjoyable having a world that you can explore with friends and such and nothing was really forced upon the players but in order to really enjoy the game now you'll either have to put in tons of hours grinding or pay Rockstar tons of money.BASICALLY___________________If you want a proper GTA experience any game before this one will suffice.Alternatively you could avoid GTA Online use FiveM (If you're into that sorta thing) or Singleplayer Modding. You could hack money into GTA Online but you'll probably end up banned.mfw i bought this game three seperate times and i couldve bought something else

review: GTA V is without a doubt the most draconian and anti consumer product to have ever been released to any market since the invention of currency. Let me explain why From the ground up every feature of the game is designed with the primary purpose of limiting the amount of in game revenue you can earn. Buildings designed to keep vehicles stuck are placed under hills to ensure that if you're selling something and your car goes over the hill you lose all your product and thus you make less money. Extremely long cooldowns are placed on CEO businesses to ensure you can't make too much money. Modders are never banned until they start dropping money for people to take. Heists which are one of the only things designed before the game ruining microtransactions were implemented pay extremely well compared to the low quality businesses and cost a fifteenth as much to do. Every tiny feature is modified to ensure it hinders one's ability to earn money as much as possible. I could name dozens of other examples but I won't for the sake of time.The game is a non stop grind to earn enough money to buy the next ridiculously expensive toy only for updates to retroactively nerf it and introduce a new more overpowered and more expensive item. This has resulted in a level of power creep rarely seen in video games where you now have APCs which can ignore 10 direct RPG hits and flying motorcycles with homing rockets on them.Don't forget how terrible rockstar's support is. It often takes weeks to deal with basic issues if they even try at all. Bugs which have existed since 2013 are still unfixed. There are constant non ending loading screens that force you to exit GTA via task manager and restart it as well as a myriad of other glitches R* knows about but doesn't bother to fix.The singleplayer isn't remarkable enough to pay full price or even the 50% off price for.Is the game fun? Sort of. I've had enough of a head start to afford most of the toys (largely due to the few times the ever benevolent star graced us with x2 rewards for the most lucrative heist that brought in millions for me) However new players will be easily squashed by the nigh unkillable warstock vehicles and forced to grind heists and missions for hundreds of hours before they can even come close to competing.Never have I been able to recommend people to avoid a game more thoroughly. GTA V is a garbage fire propped up by microtransactions corporate greed and pure utter hatred for the consumer. There is no circumstance in which it is logical for anyone to recommend it. Avoid it and any future titles from Rockstar everyone knows damn well they'll be microtransaction riddled hellpits. Never in the history of my entire life have I so utterly loathed a "product".

review: The single player side of this game is phenomenal. I'm very engaged into it and still haven't finished even half of it.The online side of this game is... Well have you ever been to a circus? It's the complete opposite. Modders overrun 50% of lobbies you get put into pulling every shenanigan in the book from increasing their in game level with cheats and making it impossible for you to kill them (or to survive them) to setting off mapwide perpetual explosions stealing your money just for being in the lobby with them attaching gigantic objects like f*cking forklifts to your player's head making it impossible for you to see where you're going and persisting with you to new lobbies.Most of the few remaining decent lobbies however fall victim to an extremely toxic player base seemingly overrun by people whose self image and confidence depend entirely on their ability to kill you and call you every profane word in the dictionary.As for actual content yeah the heists were cool at first but unless you've kept up with new releases (which by the way didn't happen for a few years) you'll find them impossible to get into because nobody does the older ones anymore. You either buy R*'s shark cards or suffer through incomplete lobbies or complete lobbies filled with people akin to what you'd find in a World of Warcraft raid finder group.Overall these days (unless R* cracks down heavily on modders which given how long they've been a problem probably either won't or can't happen) if you enjoyed the GTA series before and don't mind completely ignoring the online portion you will probably have a very enjoyable time playing the single player mode.I rate this game "not recommended" though because one of its most appealing features was the online play. Which I'll admit can still be fun at times. My real recommendation though is either (a) play with your friends and try to limit your exposure to complete strangers as much as possible or (b) join or start a crew and play only with them.
