review: Firstly I have been waiting for this game since console release and swore to only play it on PC as I'm not a console fan. I pre ordered the game in January with much anticipation and excitement. Although the game was pushed back a couple times due to technical issues I didn't mind as I wanted GTA V to run correctly on my system I mean who wants a broken game? Secondly as soon as I launched the game when it became live I fell in love with it it is all I had hoped for and I'm incredibly impressed with the way it has been optimized. Unfortunately nothing is ever perfect and neither is this game. Day 2 after release and I can no longer continue with the game as it crashes with every mission I begin now as disappointing as this is I'm not angry like a lot of people are you need to allow the game a couple of weeks to allow Rockstar to iron out the game breaking bugs. Even though I haven't played as much storyline as I had hoped at this point I highly recommend it to any Rockstar Fanboy/Fangirl as it is one of the best games I have played in a very long time visually and performance wise.Well done Rockstar on an amazing game!

review: GTAV is a great game. It is really. The visuals are stunning. Everything about the story/single player is fantastic. I previously had a long review about how the Online was kinda ed up but I got tired of even seeing it in my reviews list. Soooo I edited this review with a writing chainsaw.GTAV is beautiful complex interesting thrilling and funny. Since I'm also weak and attached to material possessions I'd just give it a 10/10 because it allows me to buy stupidly expensive supercars and to drive them slowly in the suburbs with dope music sending bass all around.The story is great and there are of course tons of easter eggs and things to discover. The game is also moddable which is nice.Now GTA Online is a great experience. Well it's true that there are... Hum... Well some loading times. And yeah it's true that apparently it's also moddable leading to lobbys being sometimes clean and sometimes full of hackers. But with the latest updates it's feels even more alive.And of course since I can also drive around town in my stupidly expensive cars and this time not only for my pleasure but for the pleasure of showing off like hell I still recommend playing it.1) Stay away2) Only recommended when on sale3) Recommended4) Highly recommended5) This is a must play
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Mixed opinion on this game I love it but also hate it in their very own aspects. Story Mode should probably be a side purchase in my opinion not too many people play the game for that just GTA Online from what I've seen. But despite that the storyline seems to rush right into the bank robberies and explosions and bullet stuff. It could've done better but even to this day it can't compete with GTA San Andreas. Let alone GTA IV's story line. Grand Theft Auto Online on the other hand pretty much an economic nightmare is one way to say it. Want a car that can shoot missiles? Give Rockstar your money. Want to shoot anything pretty rad? Spend an overwhelming amount of time grinding for that level up or give Rockstar your money. Want to not give Rockstar your money? Get banned for trying to negotiate with that one dude you talked to earlier claiming his money drops are untracable. Want to drive around the block in that new convertible you bought on San Andreas Autos? Oops some modder popped into the lobby and decided to blow everyone up for who knows how many times. Overall opinion? I recommend the game if you have 2+ friends preferrably 4 to enjoy all of the content in GTA O. Story mode is pretty nice if you're looking to toy with some mods but my overall take on the game is to just be sure that you have friends. Otherwise you're looking at a really stale grind for hours on end that can leave you to be the overpowered social outcast of the server or just the outcast in the server in general. The game's fun though if you have enough friends to do a 4 man heist or if more a race can do just as well! The only downside with 4+ friends is you'll have to abandon a few if you really want to get to making money which can usually be achieved via Heists. Races or events tend to forget about the money and consider it a way to play with more than 4 friends with no money made whatsoever.

This for me was the last chance for this game but when i downloaded it (22 hours btw) i couldn't activate it. I searched the internet for solutions but it seems like people have been having this problem for 2 years now and there is still no easy solution. I understand not wanting people to pirate the game but when it gets to the point that not even an honest user can play it that's a little to far. So what if 1% of players pirate it. Better than 20% of buyers asking for a refund. IMO Rockstar are too big for their boots. Support sucks so do the games these days. hope RDR 2 isn't rubbish as well.

review: The single player in GTAV is OK. I mean ok it's very short with very limited features if you never plan on going online and the post endgame is as in all GTA games boring with practically nothing to do.GTA Online on the other hand is a bigger cr*p than single player. Why? Lots of reasons The loading times you will spend the majority of your GTA Online experience watching the loading screen and if you're lucky like me and most of my crewmates you will lag out.. a lot.. and will need to re connect.. which means more waiting.. yay! Repetition (I mean sure heists are fun TDM and DM modes are fun racing is fun and the freemode events are fun... to some extent. But when you've done it about 5 6 times it gets repetitive and the loading times make it so much worse. Sessions why oh why god all mighty couldn't they make it possible to invite people from multiple sessions?? The game features so called sessions the map which is reserved for a set number of people (32 max I think?). If you want to start a heist and need people you may only invite the people from your current session or your crewmates. If no one from the session wishes to join you need to go into another session which means you guessed it! MORE DUCKING LOAD SCREENS!!!!! Lag FPS issues graphic glitches even on high end PCs you may experience graphic glitches and stuttering which you will not fix unless you join another session and pray to god / allah / buddha the glitches will disappear. If they won't just join yet another session and enjoy watching the same loading screens you have been watching for the past 10 hours.All in all do I recommend this game? No. Definitely not. The game has way too many bugs and way too many nuissances to have a fun time. If you wish to play only single player ask a friend to lend it to you or something but don't spend 60 EUR on it because I guarantee you will only be disappointed. And until they fix the basic problems with GTA Online trust me on this one YOU ARE NOT MISSING A DAMN THING! It is NOT fun it is NOT entertaining it is NOT all that great it's boring repetitive and as I said for an hour of gameplay you will only play like 10 minutes and wait the other 50 minutes reading loading screens.You have been warned.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is probably the game that has been the hardest to decide whether or not to recommend. It has a lot of good and it has a lot of bad. On one hand it has a huge open world with a lot to do ranging from races many creative and fun pvp modes coop heists and everything you'd expect to be able to do in a vast open world game except hunt wtf? Hunting and being hunted by animals with friends in Red Dead Redemption was an absolute blast and it's available in solo play why not online? Anyways the Singleplayer is enjoyable and long. Some of the stupidest tiest fun you'll ever have will probably be in this game whether it's flying off a mountain and catapulting your friend out of your technicals mounted gun and having the two trucks your escorting follow to trying to pick up your friend riding a dirtbike with a helicopters hook hooking him by the head and sending him flying a hundred feet into the air. GTA Online supports custom maps as well with a wide variety of BMX tracks Snipers vs Cars Impossible BMX tracks Money hacks that don't actually work but are always popular for some reason horribly made BMX tracks and something fun every once in awhile in between the hundreds of the previously mentioned.GTA V also has some of the stupidest t in gaming ranging from $100 Shark Cards that give you in game $6M which can't afford some of the more expensive purchases ($100 of your cash in addition to $60 can't buy you a yacht) to hackers removing all of your weapons trapping you in a box and teleporting you underwater a mile off the coast. For reference the most expensive car is $2M not including another at least $500k worth of upgrades and customization. Yachts can reach near $8M the new offices and warehouses can combined reach over $6M and Aircraft ranging to over $6M and averaging around $3M. The real issue here comes down to heists. The best heist the Pacific Standard Job can earn up to $1.2M usually unequally split among 4 people with whoever hosted the heist earning more since he had to pay to start it. This heist almost sets you up to fail attempting to make you drive nearly across the map on motorbikes with 5 stars. Here's where it gets even more fun every time you take damage you lose money and lost money does NOT reset if you die and restart at the latest checkpoint. Between the setups and the heist it usually takes about and hour and a half on a good day to sometimes make UP TO 500k for youself. OH YEAH and that $1.2M is only on the hardest difficulty. Otherwise it's 500k or 1M. Missions and minigames aren't worth earning about 200 300k over the course of a few hours depending on what you play. You can always rob stores for $1252 out of the register all day. The UI is also the worst ever. You can't start a public private invite only or closed session while in multiplayer. Instead you must exit multiplayer into singleplayer which with a good computer is at least 3 minutes of loading go to the Online options and spend another 3 8 minutes (my friend with a good laptop actually takes 8 minutes tested) to load back into online and have a half decent chance to get kicked back to singleplayer due to connection issues. Then you do it all over again cause you really want to play with your friends without getting killed by some bag with a jet only to have everyone end up disconnecting 10 minutes later. If you want to race pvp anything regarding the missions with your friends expect everybody to be split into random lobbies and having to start the entire ing process from the start. The UI is also really unresponsive and is unecessarily confusing and frustraing to navigate which really adds to the whole experience. Now this doesn't happen most of the time but it happens enough to be irritating as hell and worth mentioning.I want to say don't support Rockstar and this half broken unbalanced extra DRM cash cow hackfest that is GTA Online but at the same time some of the most fun I've had in gaming as existed because of this game. To be fair though a good amount of that fun was had while using mods to spawn in (in a private game i might add) invincible clowns with tazers that would follow you ing everywhere and show up randomly one hour later out of nowhere and taze your friend for 10 minutes straight while you laugh uncontrollably because there's not a whole lot you can do to stop an invincible tazer clown. That ended quick when we got banned though. Speaking of bans many people who don't mod also get banned. Regardless what you do with mods whether you have fun in private lobbies use it to exploit money hacks so you don't have to grind for hundreds of hours to get the cool use it to be a total dickhole to everybody or simply happen to be in the same session with someone who does any of that you might get banned. ConclusionIt basically comes down to you can have a lot of stupid and enjoyable fun doing ridiculous things in a vast open world with a lot of options ranging from flying helicopters and planes to exploring the depths of the ocean with submersibles that can reach hundreds of hours but it comes at a pretty big price between $60 WAY overprice Shark Cards hitting up to $100 A lot of the fun and progression revolving around owning money modders getting banned from said modders free mode holes restarting a heist 10 times a day because either someone sucks can't communicate can't pull their weight or leaves mid heist or grinding for literal hundreds of hours to reach a high enough level and earn enough money to reach end game unlocks etc.

review: RAY'S REVIEW. Factor Rating Gameplay 9 Story 7 Graphics 8 Content 8 Mechanics 9 Challenge 7 Diversity 8 Mapping 10 Soundtrack 7 Interface 9 Pricing 8 Performance 9 Replayability 8 Online/DLC ( 3 for server issues and waiting time) 6 Personal 7 SCORE 8.0/10Factors are in descending order of importance. Ratings are separate to each factor despite the overall opinion regarding the game. However they are given equal importance while calculating the average. 2 Cents Grand Theft Auto always has been a bar on how open world third person shooter games have been perceived. And V doesn't disappoint in that regard. If you have been a fan of the previous games go with this one without an afterthought. You get a huge pleasant open world to rip in. You get to do bizarre in a set of compelling missions in the campaign. And if that's not enough you can team up with your friends in multiplayer to do similar missions in co op including better heists than most of the single player missions. But the game does come with a couple of issues. The story though stronger than most GTAs is nowhere close to the bar that games have set these days. Side missions has never been a high point for the GTA games and that proves true in this one as well. While the game is filled with a lot of things you won't do it lacks things that you'd love to do that are not part of the main narrative. The game follows a linear format through the whole campaign up until the very end where you get the binary choice of the kind of ending you want. I went for the ending where Michael dies because he was my favorite character. This ending gave the story the kind of serious tone that the whole narrative needed. Where the whole thing comes full circle. Michael betrays the people who trusted him and ends up with the same fate just before everything was about to be alright. The other two were too superficial to be true.Getting to GTA Online. While the missions have been well made and the system is a fantastic attempt. It lacks 2 very things that are the backbone of any online experience Seamless matchmaking and people to play. I'm in no way stating that the online is barren and no one is available to play with anymore. But even with all those people who want to play it is still not very smooth to get 4 people to do a heist. The most absurd thing is the minimum requirement of 4 people even in set up missions which can be done by a 1 3 people as well. You need 3 more players with you to play online. And if you're lucky you'd be able to get a mission started in the first 15 minutes. Never happened with me though. The game becomes really cheap during sales and is very well optimized for even medium end PCs. Even the campaign is worth the money and I feel GTA V is a must have.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V is an open world action adventure video game developed by Rockstar North and published by Rockstar Games. Set within the fictional state of San Andreas (based around Southern California) the single player story follows three criminals and their efforts to commit heists while under pressure from the government agency. The open world design lets players freely roam San Andreas which includes open countryside and the fictional city of Los Santos (based on Los Angeles). The game is played from either third person or first person view and its world is navigated on foot or by vehicle. You control the three lead protagonists throughout the single player mode switching between them both during and outside of missions. The story is centred on the heist sequences many of the missions involve shooting and driving gameplay. Outside of missions you can freely roam the big open world. Mostly composed of the San Andreas open countryside area and fictional city of Los Santos the world of Grand Theft Auto V is much larger in area than earlier entries in the series. The single player mode lets players control three characters Michael De Santa Trevor Philips and Franklin Clinton criminals whose stories interconnect as they complete missions. You can use melee attacks firearms and explosives to fight enemies and may run jump swim or use vehicles to navigate the world. Throughout single player you may switch between the protagonists at will by using directional compass on the HUD. The game may switch between the characters automatically in single player missions to complete the objectives. A character's compass avatar will flash red if is in danger and needs help and flash white if he has a advantage. Overall I give GTA V a 9/10 stars it is a huge improvement to it's predecessor. I absolutely recommend you get this game because I am just absolutely without single doubt sure that Grand Theft Auto V will not disappoint you in anyway at all!.

review: With over 2.5k hours on the game I must say the game is great. I like both singleplayer and multiplayer modes but the modders/hackers make life a living hell on multiplayer. I had most fun playing the game with a group of friends who helped each other in heists and stock sales. Making money can be a labour intensive but the patience does ultimately pay off. But then again the whole idea is to force players to buy Shark Cards. The load time on this game is ridiculously long and I am surprised the game isn't officially called "Loading Simulator." Overall it is a very good game and probably should play it and suggest it to your friends. Highly Recommended.

review: A fantastic single player experience. If you've played a GTA game before then you know what to expect. A massive open world with a huge amount of detail lots of action and comedy. This time around you get to play as three different main characters which all have their charms and unique qualities. The story will keep you busy for a long time and there is a heap of side missions to work on too. Sadly the multiplayer aspect falls far short in comparison. Ridiculously long load times which will happen too often just to be thrown into a match with cheaters. Yes cheaters. Rockstar have done nothing to stop the cheaters and they just keep increasing as time goes on. At one point people were being banned for receiving money from cheaters which just make people run around throwing money at everyone to get them banned. The cheaters themselves have had nothing happen to them. Online could and should have been so much better implemented which is really disappointing.I highly recommend the game for single player. If you only want to play online then keep an eye on the forums and when/if they start cleaning the game up and banning cheats then think about picking it up.

review: Some issues joining online public sessions now and then but that could just be due to port / router issues on my side. I am able to join but will be thrown into my own public session after some time. Which i dont complain about as its easier to grind cash in your own public session (there arent any high level players flying around in jets hunting ground targets for daily objectives). Invite only lobbies work great with friends.Overall a really great game. I would recommend it to any of the GTA series fans out there. Follows the GTA V story perfectly and is extremely immersive. Id recommend getting it on sale as they come around quite often but if you have some extra wallet and are looking to get started by all means dive right in. My rating 9.5 / 10

The heists are the only good part but they are far too few and to short. Planes and helicopters are annoying as hell. And most anoying of all rockstar club or whatever its called. review: Overall the singleplayer gameplay is an enjoyable experience from start to finish especially if you throw a couple of your favourite mods in the mix. 9/10 would replay again! (No singleplayer DLC tho ever... F*ck you.)The multiplayer ONLINE mode is a myth and a scam developed by Rockstar's hungriest moneygrabs during the third reich. Grinding is extremely slow and paying huge amounts of real money for a couple of in game big ones is somewhere between burning money and raising a child it's just disappointing and a waste. And what about cheat prevention? Do not spend 8 hours grinding for that sweet sweet cheddar 'cause you run the risk of getting all that money removed by Rockstar because 'that money might be cheated'.! (I wouldn't know since I don't grind for money or xp. I just hear tales about it.) If you only want to play Grand Theft Auto V for it's official multiplayer mode instead you should buy some pizza and use the remaining money on hookers and cocaine.But there's a mod for the game that allows hosting your own servers independent of the sh*tty ONLINE mode so that's nice. It's called FiveM you'll find it actually has more features than Rockstar's big spender imagination of a multiplayer mode.

review: GTA 5 is the greatest game in the series so far. The story mode is pretty good and you'll miss Trevor once it's over.GTAO is without a doubt one of the most addicting online experiences i've enjoyed. There are unfortunately many cheaters who will try to ruin your fun but they are easily evaded when encountered by simply changing to another lobby or hosting your own. More cars and lethal road/air weaponized vehicles than you could ever possibly need. You can easily switch to a peaceful solo lobby to run missions and sell any product without worry.Constant flow of DLC this online mode has grown much since it's initial release helping it to maintain one of the largest playerbases on all of Steam.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Of course a great game. And if it would not have all these annoying restrictions cooldowns and the ability to go straight into a private friend only session it would have been the perfect game. When driving around in los santos you get cursed at at least twice every second. But trying to make a number plate with the same language is forbidden. That's just stupid and hypocritical. For a game that is called "Grand theft auto" you can only do a "grand theft auto" once a gameday because of restriction. God forbid you could make money easy with stealing cars cus after earning billions we need more of your money so buy shark cards kid! You can't do this or that because there's a cooldown for 5 10 15 30 minutes. For most things in online mode you will have a cooldown timer which gets pretty annoying. When alt tabbing to google something you get kicked within 2 minutes from a friends only session where you are playing alone and put into a public zone. Stupid. First of all why kick me in the first place what is the reason for that and why can't it remember i was in a friends only session? When switching online characters you get put in a public session have to go back to story mode then you can goto a friend only session. Which amounts to 3 to 4 minutes of useless loading the same again and again. The interface is a pita i'm aware that it's made for consoles but couldn't they dedicate some time in the already long time it took to release it on the PC to make the interface a bit better for us PC players? For instance when you want to use a snack you gotta go through 3 or 4 layers of this bloody menu where it could have been tied to just one key. The heist should have been do able with only two players and the other 1 or 2 optionally replaced with Ai. That way you are not forced to play with idiots that leave after joining dying or generally messing up the missions. Now with the latest update you are forced to play in a public session which most of us are trying to avoid because it's just a deathmatch filled with hackers and griefing idiots. It's just irritating.Even with all the irritations the game is of course good. But to be honest a game should not annoy or irritate you. After all the sole reason we play games is to have fun.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Despite coming out in 2013 orignally on the consoles this game still holds up on its own now in 2017. The PC version as always is the best version to get. There has been a lot of negatvity surrounding this game (but which GTA isn t controversial) most notably the GTA Online component (read microtransactions) as well as the single player modding tools. I cannot say much about the modding as i personally enjoy the vanilla game as is.Microtransactions have plagued the industry and this is no different here. I just don't buy or spend any money on that so problem solved.That being said the game itself is very enjoyable with a memorable cast narrative and a well lived in open world.The game is still hugely popular which is why it's still full price. It does go on sale frequently so you could wait for that. Now if only Rockstar could bring Red Dead Redemption to PC.

review: With almost 400 hours of pure online on PC I can tell you without a doubt this game is amazing. It's incredible. It's one of the best multiplayer games I have ever played it basically reinvented what a mutliplayer game could actually be.I've met amazing people made friendships and broken them over this game.It became my life for a few months.I've not experienced 100% of GTAO but I will give you my honest review over everything I have experienced good and bad and sum up why I don't recommend this game to anybody.PROS 1. It's the most fun you will ever have with your friends.THE most fun.It's the most fun you will ever have with people you don't even know.THE most fun.It's the most fun you will ever have with people that you ing hate.THE most fun.2. Beautiful. I can't believe a game that launched on PS3/360 wound up climbing to the top to become the most beautiful gameI have ever played and enjoyed to run at a pristine framerate at that.3. The foundation of this game should be how every game strives to be. Completely open. No bars. But GTA has always been that way I'm sure I don't need to tell that to you. CONS 1. The community is insecure and I don't blame them.The way interaction functions is to be expected in a GTA game you can do whatever you want Especially to other players. You are rewarded both for helping others and for completely destroying them.However you are rewarded more for hindering others completely.You barely get anything from helping others be it heists or CEO work there's no point in joining someone else's job or corporation unless you are just doing a friend a favor. So what you wind up doing is waiting.Waiting.Waiting.Waiting. Someone joined my corporation.Why?Because they just bought the game have no money and don't know what to do.Great. That's exactly who I want working for me.Waiting.Waiting.Waiting.Someone joined my corporation.Why?They are bored of doing the same waiting that I am doing.Awesome I really want someone who isn't taking this seriously.Now it's time to work.Start job.Waiting.Waiting.Get to crate.Action. Shooting cops.Now to drive to warehouse.Waiting.Waiting.Player who went off radar was waiting to shoot crate with rocket launcher.Mission failed. Money wasted.Players leave corporation.Waiting.Waiting.Apartment. Start up heist.Waiting.Waiting.Waiting.Waiting.Waiting.Waiting.Someone joins.They leave.Waiting.Waiting.Three random players appear.Let's start the heist.Waiting.Waiting.Waiting.Heist started. Let's go take pictures of the va Player left heist.Waiting.Waiting.Waiting.Apartment. Start up heist.Waiting.Waiting.Waiting.Waiting.Waiting.Players joined. For your sake we'll just pretend I wrote 'waiting' between each individual player joining and also leaving and waiting for others to join .Let's play the heist.Alright let's get that van. It's a real chore. Grinding. Grinding on time. Gets van. Mission over.Waiting.Waiting.Waiting.Alright let's inv players to next setup.Waiting.Waiting.Waiting.Now let's get some dude on an island. Nobody can do it without dying? Can you please just stay off the island I will do it.No please don't go to the island. No you don't 'got this' just like you didn't 'got this' the last five times you tried to 'got this'. Please just w Player left.Waiting.Waiting.Waiting.Alright let's go back to the setup board then.Waiting.Waiting.Waiti I'll skip ahead about 6 hours Eventually you get about 400 600k as a reward for the tumor you now have in your head.Enjoy spending it on something fun ) 2. Every NPC calling your phone every 5 minutes Another settlement needs our help.3. Do you like cheating?Do you like going over the rules?Do you like bending the entire system of fairness over your lap and spanking it until every other child in the room criesover what a twisted mangled vision their version of reality has become due to your need to get ahead?No?Well now you can anyways!Because all it takes to do all of the above is sit on a mountain and chat with your friends for a couple of minutes before the sky gods bestow their healthy bounty of modder cash upon you!NO NEED TO FEAR ROCKSTAR SUPPORT IS HERE."No longer do you have to live in fear of anyone giving a mother ing god damn about you you piece of ing little " Rockstar SupportFrom the creative people that brought you "Make fun of American government and corporate organizations and all legal entities for being corrupt" just unwrapped a big box of 'oops are we hypocrites?'.That's right folks you'll get banned for others cheating.Easily.Very very very easily.And rockstar will do absolutely nothing about it not care not even break a sweat looking into your ban.You won't even be informed of what you supposedly did to get the hammer.The auto hammer.That's right the one they brought into the game to make sure nobody can get around buying their shark cards!You know. That thing they sell which makes them beyond rich.So. Yeah.Can't not be gettin' rich.Who cares about the people investing time and love into our game though.Definitely expendable if we can stall those modders just a little bit longer.Sounds a lot like the people their entire GTA stories revolve around poking fun at.Shady.Greedy.Careless for others.Willing to do anything to make that extra buck.Never saw that coming did you? So the next time M or T spit one out about the proletariat cogs getting scraps for their dedication to a grander machine of governing power just remember who wrote up all that diologue.Really.It's hilarious. Aaaaand I mean I guess I could keep writing but it's late as and I really need to go to bed.Loved this game though.If you can get past the BS buy it. Really.Do.But I'ma tell you right now dog it's like taking that first hit of something you know in the future is going to be very bad for your health.And it is.Even though you and your friends have a blast on it.It's killing you man.It will kill you.

review: Full disclosure I've played GTA V since 2013 on console and PC.This game is an absolute triumph the overworld is beautifully detailed. The campaign is great. The amount of cars you can own legally is also astounding. Credit needs to be given to Rockstar for really going all in on the social commentary as well. On PC the game is even better. It is astonishingly well optimised.Recently Take Two Interactive filed a cease and desist against OIpen IV a modding tool for the Single Player campaign. Rockstar very recently convinced Take Two to retract this cease and desist (source https //support.rockstargames.com/hc/en us/articles/115009494848). I am really glad this is the case. I am not much of a modder but I will always endorse the freedom consumers have to mess with game code for their own personal use.As a result I'm giving this a positive review.GTA Online on the other hand is still loaded with cheaters and is skewed very heavily toward users who buy Shark Cards. Can't blame Rockstar either as they made like $700 million USD last year. Very cool.But yeah buy this game. It's absolutely worth the money for the single player alone.

review: The long wait has been worth it. If you re a PC gamer who s spent the last eighteen months envying the console crowd while they all got stuck into the latest greatest GTA then rest assured that you can now play the definitive version. Sure the Xbox One and PS4 versions were amazing delivering GTA 5 at higher resolutions with more detailed textures smoother surfaces better lighting and cool depth of field effects (see our full review below) but the PC version offers even more enhancements plus a couple of additional features that play to the PC s strengths. In doing so it adds a few more metres to one of gaming s towering achievements.Having covered the game twice already we won t go too far into the detail of what makes GTA 5 so good. Partly it s a question of experience. With four previous 3D GTAs under its belt plus Red Dead Redemption Bully and assorted DLC packs Rockstar has had time to refine its vision for open world gameplay and its systems and GTA 5 has the best driving the best shooting and some of the best mission design of the series.It s also a question of structure. Dividing the action amongst three protagonists with three interlocking storylines and three distinctive flavours means you nearly always have the option to flick from Michael s ageing career criminal saga to Franklin s ambitious hoodlum story to Trevor s crazed amoral brand of mayhem where the dumb cathartic slapstick violence we all deep down love GTA for finds its natural home. With repeated play it only becomes clearer how well all three tales mesh thematically with Rockstar s savage satirical take on the Californian dream.

review: Talking before the update that made everyone hate it which is when I quit the game it seemed pretty good.It ran 40+ frames on my craptop so it was well optimised for an open world game of the detail level that it had. The controls seemed a tiny bit clunky but still gave a realistic feel as the pay off. The storylines seemed for a video game fairly realistic compared to other competitors in this genre (Saints row for example).The downside is the waiting. Like Saints Row 2 you have to do things before you could start the next mission.But it wouldn't tell you what you needed to do. It just expected you to do them.I never completed this game because the waiting and dumb chores were terrible. They were increasingly more annoying to complete as the game went on and practically forced me to give up not even mid way through the game. Saints Row 2's infamy system or whatever it was was bearable to me. I enjoyed it it made me do all these extra little things that I wouldn't have done other wise. GTA V's system makes me go to the middle of no where just to complete a task that I don't wish to do just to drive the story forward in a completely different section of the game.If you're okay with this or you're here SOLELY for the multiplayer then I can highly recommend the game to you. If you disliked Saints Row 2 SPECIFICALLY for the system they had in place then do NOT get this game for the single player experience. I never made it far enough in multiplayer or "online" to truly comment on how well that plays out with heists and such. I've heard good things but I recommend staying away from random players from the rumours I've heard.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game is amazing story mode felt a bit short in terms of gameplay hours but definitely enjoyable. GTA online needs some improvement though. And the number of players in a session should be increased to more than 50. Currently I am not able to join the session with more than 15 players. Its a must have if you love open world adventure.Gameplay 10/10Graphics 10/10Multiplayer 9/10

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V is an odd game to review. The singleplayer was enjoyable in my opinion definitely what I'd expect from a Grand Theft Auto game. Then there's the online mode. There are a lot of different opinions on the online and personally I found it really fun. It's great to play with your friends and I spent most of my hours in the online mode just messing about. I do however find the monetisation of the online mode very predatory if you don't decide to waste money on the micro transaction it will become a very long and boring grind to purchase the best items. I still think this is a good game I just wish there was less emphasis on micro transactions however with the amount of money they've made from this game it's likely that future Rockstar games will only focus more on micro transactions. Let's just hope they don't ruin any games with micro transactions in the future. 7.5/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Product received for free. My friend gifted this game to me since he knew how much I loved GTA but now I m not so sure. GTA V is a great game (I ve played it ever since it first came out) the storyline is amazing and you will feel a kinda connection with anyone of the three characters in the game. Soundtrack is amazing as well for anyone but the only thing that makes GTA V bad is Multiplayer. GTA Online is great but it does have flaws like the Shark Cards and the new DLC s that cost a lot of in game and if you do buy a Shark card Real life money. GTA Online does bring players together to pull off great missions and amazing heists but the new Heist that came in seems more like a cash grab is anything. The past few DLC have seemed like this but The Doomsday Heist is one main culprits in the game. For a game more about trying to make money and getting to the top the game is taking away your actual money just for a few things in your in game bases. GTA V is a great game but don t be foolish and fall into the trap of Shark Cards for GTA Online.

review: This game was gifted to me by a friend who bought it for full price....If i would know this had so little gameplay hours for 60 bucks i would refund it immediatly and give the money back to my friend.Sit down and grab a drink or a snack folks as this is gonna be quite a lengthy review.Whoever wants a good game with a good story you may wanna go check other games (such as Metal Gear Solid V The Phantom Pain even its lacking story for a Metal Gear game is better than this one and the gameplay is astounding)The missions are extremely repetitive which comes down to "go here shoot them while spamming your gun behind this cover/spam your gun at them" "take this after you killed them" maybe "drive after this guy to this location and shoot the people there" or shoot the driver thats it.Gun mechanics are extremely noob friendly in the manner that they are near laser accurate and have no recoil (some of them have very slight recoil) unless you are in first person view mode which gives you abit more of a challange to use guns but its really not worth it considering just how choppy the first person mode is no way to explain it its just BAD.Online is a more dull version with a few more dull additions to it and luckily a few non dull ones.The standard missions may be a good quick fix but they get extremely boring after the 3rd go also coming down (and this time literally) to "go there shoot then take this drug/get back this veichle".The online missions are just one of many gamemodes the game has to offer ranging from them car races survival and PvP.PvP is just plain awful lets begin with that when everyone are quite slow have stable and near laser accurate guns and jumping being utterly useless for dodging the attacks its like the wild west whoever pulls the trigger first wins. (unless the enemy has a one shot sniper rifle which in that case you are ed unless you also have it)Survival is probably my most hated one you and possibly a few more of you friend are up to 10 waves of AI that increase in their numbers and firepower as the game progresses sounds good right? until you realize that even after the early waves the only way to pass it is to find a cover spot where the AI cant shoot you from at all and spam your guns from behind cover but no worries to makes this harder you dont have your crosshair out while you are spamming your guns!(not a problem to people who played other crosshairless games such as Killing Floor PAYDAY 2 and even Battlefield hardcore mode which i happened to play all of them and i find the lack of crosshair meaningless)The car races are actually good driving is very solid you got some bonuses here and there on the road to help you out you gotta know how to dodge the incoming cars without losing speed or needless to say bump into them and there can be wonderful racing courses made by other players and of course do stunts!This game also has flying!Actually this part was also made quite nicely probably the hardest out of shooting/driving/flying and again even this gets boring after a while UNLESS you decide to pull off some amazing stunts but im gonna save that for laterAnd then we have the feature that was praised by most people ive met that played GTA V the heists as a PAYDAY 2 player with well over 1000+ hours i couldnt wait myself to see how the heists in this so far incredibly dull 60 bucks game would play out but 60 bucks is 60 bucks i guess.It was awful.These so called "heists" are basically a bunch of standard missions put down to one... how should i call it.... "campagin"coming down to the same things ive already mentioned with the only difficult part about them being the driving (which again greatly done).Besides all of these gamemodes you can do alot more you can buy yourself a fancy house (which isnt as cool as it sounds you basically got a building and you buy an apartment in it and you can't customize it) buy yourself a car modify your car to be better get yourself a gun from the decent amount of guns this game as to offer (most guns of the same cathegory function the same at least that's how they feel to me) modify your guns! (only difference it makes is scope as far as it comes to noticeable gun performance)and buy stuff for your lovely character.The open world is very lacking the only things you can do is 1)shoot innocent civilians to get the cops attention.2) fight off the cops you've just called upon yourself.3)rob a gas station and call cops by doing so.4)repeat 2.5)randomally pick on other players who don't wanna have any trouble with anyone and just wanna relax and enjoy the game.6)Probably the best one pull off some actually amazing stunts with cars airplanes bikes or a combination of all of them!In the short time i played in the multiplayer i only encountered assh*les you either get uncooperative people in your missions or be harassed by someone in free roaming for 15 minutes like a guy who said i was mediocre in life for not being as good as him in GTA V *cries in the corner*.You CAN improve the lacking gameplay with tons of mods that people have made (such as shooting cars out of your minigun and airplanes all around the sky shooting at your and crashing at you in an attempt to kill you) but knowing there have been mods that were created with viruses as well i decided to avoid them altogether.Overall? 2/10 this game is too dull for a 60 bucks one.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So this is less of a game problem but more of a technical problem i bought this game on the Chinese new year sale as a bundle with the megalodon shark card and criminal starter pack for online together for 26. i download the game game launches but would never load past the social club box that is very small (around 680x820 i think). this box will be infinitely black where it should be loading the game but isnt and nothing ever happens trust me when i say this i left my computer to go out came back 2 hours later and it was still on the same screen. i cant refund it now either because i have 5/6 hours on the game where none of it is play time and its just me trying to fix the game so i can play what i rightfully payed for. However there is one thing that works if i go into my device management and disable my graphics card (NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060) and then launch the game the game sometimes loads but on god awful settings and even on these settings it's still unplayable because of how unresponsive it is for example i would try to move and it will continuously move without stopping at all and i can never change weapon or do any actions in the game. so basically it either never loads up or it works but to the point of it being unplayable and not being able to do anything at all almost. IF ANYONE KNOWS WHAT THIS IS AND CAN HELP ME OUT PLEASE LET ME KNOW. Oh and also (if this helps at all) im using an Alienware laptop thats fairly new and can run loads of other games such as the witcher 3 rainbow 6 siege for honor and warframe all on the highest settings possible. NON OF THESE GAMES HAVE PROBLEMS IN ANY WAY AT ALL SO I DONT KNOW WHAT IT IS THAT ISNT WORKING. please help me if you can or know what this is (no youtube videos i've seen have helped me either)

review: I don't want to talk about single player simply because it's ALMOST issueless.Alot of people complain about loading screens and hackers and I agree with them...partially.Loading screens. Yes they are taking forever. Especially when you are joining online after launching the game jesus christ that thing takes forever. I could find myself wondering if the loading screen was bugged or if it was just taking forever. Rockstar should improve this. Hackers are a big issue especially when they like to destroy your game. (Deleting your guns trapping you). But hey R* is making those banwaves coming faster than ever. Toxic community? I'd say I've met more normal people than on any other game. There are some people that are randomly killing you swallowing their mic while holding the voice chat button or purposely ruining missions or heists but let's be honest you will meet those kids everywhere these days.Sharkcards and expensive DLCs? Yeah f*ck them.Overall I think this game has alot to offer but also has alot to improve. I personally really enjoy this game and would recommend it to all of my friends.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game's terrible and not worth your hard earned money. Online is the main thing I'm gonna talk about since story mode isn't really that fun. Story mode is pretty boring the missions don't feel worthwhile and once you're done there's not anything else for you to do except get a mod menu and even though it's fun to see what you can do with it it gets pretty monotonous. So basically when you've completed all of the missions you're never going back to story mode ever again. The story is actually quite confusing trying to combine 3 characters into one main plot isn't a good way to go. They should've stuck with one main character. The things you can do in story mode are what make it better you're rich after completing the last heist so you can pretty much do anything you want after that UNLIKE what I am going to be talking about below.The only other option left for you after story mode would be GTA Onlne. I'm only rank 20 so there are VERY MANY limitations and options for you to do. Online is mostly a grind really because the only thing you're going to be doing is jobs and you're going to be paid 20k for each half an hour job when a car you really want costs 2 million. It's pretty much a pay to play game shark cards are the only way you can get everything you want. The problem is they keep releasing update after update in an annoying way where they release a new car or event every week and there's no way possible to actually get all of it without paying! And if you don't buy the new things coming out Ron or Agent 14 will keep pestering you about it every time you log on to Online!! **** THEM! Maybe some people just don't want to pay 100 bucks for 8 million in game cash that will probably be used to buy ONE FREAKING CAR!!! And the player base is absolutely terrible! If somebody that has friends with them doesn't want you in their session they can just kick you out even if you're not even bothering them! If you and your friend just want to have fun delivering an import/export car to a dealer there will not be any more fun when they BOMB YOU WITH A TULA AND DESTROY ALL THAT HARD WORK THAT YOU PUT SO MUCH EFFORT INTO TO GET!!! This is the only thing those types of players want to do in this game just ruin other people's time. OH BUT JUST YOU WAIT!!! I'M NOT FINISHED YET!!! REMEMBER THE MODDERS?!?!? YEAH I THOUGHT YOU WOULD!!! THEY ARE THE IEST THING I HAVE EVER HAD TO DEAL WITH!!! They teleport you all over the place so you can never get anything done they display FAKE BAN MESSAGES ON MY SCREEN THEY MAKE MY CAR DISAPPEAR AND THEY can make it say that you killed everybody in the session to MAKE IT LOOK LIKE YOU ARE THE MODDER!!! WHAT THE ROCKSTAR?!?!? I THOUGHT YOU WERE BETTER THAN THIS!!! Oh and the LOADING TIMES!!! IT's like I'm playing Loading Screen Simulator V instead of the actual game. Yes you heard me. You will be spending more time looking at a loading screen than actually playing the damn game. To get onto GTA Online you will spend 15 minutes looking at a screen that displays 4 different messages about new things coming out. If you want to do a heist or an adversary mode there's always that one player that you can't kick who is stuck on a loading screen and you can't start the game.Please for the love of everything that you love and care about just DON'T BUY THIS GAME!!! PLEASE!!!!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I got GTA V during the Summer Sale and I got sucked into it as my playtime has shown. It's an amazing game with so many vehicles and now planes and just a game I can play with friends and just have a generally good time.Though I can't recommend it.It sucks you in and you still hate it but you can't just stop playing it it's a daily grind where you just have to spend countless hours just to buy a plane you'll never fly again.The fact that R* has taken legitimate money from honest players is baffling yet they don't remove my friend's money after he got 30 mil the day before the new update. Absolutely ridiculous.They ban modders because they "make the game unfair" and "break the system". However don't your shark cards (that cost an insane amount of money) do the same thing? Put the player at a disadvantage from other people who can afford to throw away thousands of dollars? No wonder there's a modder community people have to earn money some way.I love this game but I can't recommend the Online.If you're getting it for the Story Mode be my guest every mission (except the Strangers and Freaks they get old way too fast) are action packed and different and very enjoyable.

review: When is Rockstar going to figure out that GTA V Online is nearly unplayable?I guess the thing that frustrates me the most is that it's a really great game. It has so many cool features and game modes the graphics are amazing the racing is nuts and it runs so darn well on my computer in every way except the user interface. Anyway I just picked it back up the last couple of days and now I remember why I stopped playing it. It has by far the worst menu system and server queuing system of any game I have played ever. Ghost Bear's Legacy on my 56k modem was a dream to get going compared to this nonsense. It makes it so you aren't even playing most of the time but waiting for load times and extremely slow turnover on racing and challenges. It's like this for 5 years and my computer today is about 4 times as fast as the computer I was using when I first purchased GTA V with no appreciable decrease in load time.To even start the game with friends one would logically click GTA V Online which takes about 2 5 minutes to get going. Then it takes you to some random open world server regardless of what your friends are doing or anything. So you have to then join on your friends which could be anywhere from 30 seconds to 5 minutes. Finally we're all in a server together after at least 2 30 and up to 10 minutes. ANY other game in my catalog is no more than 1 minute but whatever it's only 5 years old.Now once you've waded up 12K miles of clogged Internet there's FOUR completely disparate menu systems to make sense of. Hit escape that's a menu. Hit home that's a menu. Hit the up arrow you better believe that's another menu. And just when you thought surely no he was exaggerating like the maniac he obviously is you guessed it! Just try that M key over there. ANOTHER MENU!Once we get that sorted we can actually look for the actual game we're going to play. Can we pull up a server list? Nope! Use your cell phone and its still frequently disfunctional auto matchmaking system leaving some friend dropped so your friend isn't going to be put in the same server as you so you want to cancel the search but there's no cancel anywhere to be seen so you and three friends wind up in a full server and we all have to quit back to the open world to start all over which takes another 30 seconds to 5 minutes.Did you get dropped because you were waiting for your friends to get loaded for 10 straight minutes? No problem! Let's just rejoin a completely random server instead of the server you were in with your friends 10 seconds ago.There's plenty of other examples but the point being that all of this results in only getting to play the game like 60% of the time you're spending in front of the screen. 70% if things are going really well and 20% if things just keep glitching over and over.I get it the cell phone seemed like a cool idea but having to join an open world twice before even getting to pick a game mode is silly. I should be able to click GTA Online and within 2 minutes be playing with my friends. I would play so darn much GTA V if that were so but I'm going to have to give up on it to play games like Counter Strike and Rocket League both of which are loaded with all four buddies in a fraction of the time and we're actually playing like 95% of the time.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Can't believe i'm saying this but Rockstar for whatever reason has gone completely incompetent. They port GTA 5 to pc years later and admittedly it's a pretty good port. But they hardly even support single player modding and instead allow online to be completely overrun. The single player is great looks great etc.Now for the updates. Updates have caused the game to go from running perfectly to stuttering frame drops out of nowhere and countless other problems. GTA Online for PC is a complete craphole. Modders/cheaters in every other free roam lobby. They can boot you from vehicles force you to kill yourself and everyone else on the server ruining your reputation and potentially getting you moved away from other players. They can spawn virtually anything they want and teleport anywhere they want. The last update not only destroyed FPS but it was nothing but overpriced vehicles so they can sell more cash cards. I will reconsider buying games from Rockstar again. They finally cracked. They were one of the last few developers who stuck to their guns but this game has proven to me that they're slipping.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Solid single player but GTA O is inexcusably broken and Rockstar has been actively hotile twoard the modding community.If the only thing you care about is a solid unmodified single player experience that only runs on Windows this game is fine. title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Beyond the questionable business practices during the Steam Summer Sale the game is very very good.The single player is your usual fare with a unique mechanic of being able to transfer between three different characters. Going through some of the story it's checking off some of the same beats as the previous incarnations of the series. Someone pisses off some kind of cartel and the next ten hours of gameplay is cleaning that mess up before doing it all over again. Not that this is a bad thing it's just... expected.The game shines ever so slightly for GTA Online which is basically a modern day sandbox MMO that I've always wanted. People talk about hackers auto murdering entire lobbies and making millions of dollars litter the streets but I have yet to encounter any of this. So either people are exaggerating the "plague" of hackers or they've cleaned up the servers before the two days I've owned the game.The game sort of forces you into a couple of races and deathmatches before it unlocks the full array of activities and there simply wasn't a hack to be seen and I won most of those entry level matches.Beyond that there's an ocassional trigger happy player that kills me but it's more of a temporary inconvenience than a rage inducing event. And if they are the type to continously hunt you down I'm two buttons away from a different server so even that wasn't an issue.GTA O however remains to be a lot of fun. After gaining a few levels you're a few button presses away from countless activities you can play from competative or otherwise. I like doing a spree of cooperative missions followed by a freeroam around town to buy some clothing steal and save a new car followed by a heist.If I had a request heists need to be redone a bit. I've only succeeded in one (And only because the main guy really knew what he was doing). The rest are just conga lines of failure and it would be nice if heist hosts could reassign jobs if someone was... less than stellar. I can't drive planes to save my life so that's just a failing notion if I ever end up being assigned such.GTA O is sort of a granted wish I didn't know I had. I look forward to working my way up the levels.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Tried playing the game on pc. Wouldn't let me play because it couldn't connect to rockstar services. Won't even let me play in offline mode. I guarantee you if I went out and bought a ps4 or xbox one put the disk in installled it I could play instantly but on pc it's a big deal???? What's the issue. From the moment of purchase and installed it said that??? Why??? Any idea how frustrating that is to buy a game and not be able to play it then troubleshoot for hours because even though you can love the game all you want buy it you can't play it? Steam support will refer you to rockstar support on this issue...and rockstar support doesn't respond?? Yes there's a support telephone number but no one talks to you...it refers you to the support page where there again once submitting your ticket there's no response. What's the deal?

review: Single Player? Sure its a great game with a great story and gameplay. Online? Utter crap. Not only do they actively encourage you to grief and troll other players the amount of grinding you have to do to make any reasonable amount of money is attrocious. And to top it all off I almost want to say some mechanics are deliberately left broken. Was delivering special cargo just now 9/10 deliveries complete plane's wing clips a tree and forces me down. Plane still intact both my partner and I were still alive "ALL CARGO DESTROYED". $100k and several hours of work(had to do half twice because of aformenioned greifing) instantly down the drain. And that sealed it im done. I've loved the gta series for more than ten years now but litterally a week of playing GTAO calls all that into question. GTA V was the only game ive ever preordered and now im considering pirating future games out of spite. Thanks R*

review: Great game even though the software is incredibly terrible at times (mainly GTA Online). Online lobbies aren't servers they're peer to peer connections. As a result cheating is an issue and is harder to address. You're connecting to players a player in Asia will have a terrible connection to you causing their character (and NPC assets that have/could interact with them) to glitch around and lag to you. On occaison you will disconnect from the other players in the session kicking you into your own lobby. Yes this can happen while playing with friends. Alt + F4 does not hard crash the game (like it should). It puts you into a pause menu asking you to confirm you want to quit. If you get shot at in an online lobby and you are in the pause menu it kicks you out of the pause menu which can be irritating when trying to change settings/leave a lobby in which you are being spawnkilled. "Free" DLC It's blocked by a paywall of ingame money. Rockstar has made over $500 million off of the in game microtransactions. The newer cars they've added with pricetags of $2.5m ingame cost an equivalent of $40 USD. The Finance and Felony content update requires you to have a CEO office (min price of $1m ingame) and a warehouse ( $200k iirc). Most of the future content updates are gta online only. New supercars lowriders only exist in online. With that being said the singleplayer game is worth the $60 on its own.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Firstly I'm a GTA fan. Been playing non stop since GTA 3 easily my favourite franchise of all time and Grand Theft Auto V didn't disappoint me in anything. The world is huge everything feels right the physics the animations the graphics the detail the sounds. The characters are quite unique and have their own story that the game tells you in a great way the transiction between every character is flawless and innovative. The story is probably the best in the franchise with a decent ammount of choices and lot of explanation given so you don't miss any detail. The guns feel good the world feels alive the cars feel real the NPC's feel alive and not for one second this game felt nothing less than a true masterpiece. One of the best games of all time.

So maybe rockstar sees that as suspicious activity for whatever reason. Buy at your own risk since you may get banned for no reason. Its a great game its just to bad bans are given with no real reasons. I have never even used cheat codes in single player so to be banned from online blows my mind. Had I would of read the comments before hand I would have saved myself $35 bucks.. Edit On another note since rockstar wants to be and banning for no reason if your in this same situation. Look into GTAV private servers. YOU ROCKSTAR I will never pay for a game from you again.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: UPDATE TWO I love this game in singleplayer and the fundemental ideas of GTA O however the economy makes me want to run far away from it. In the beginning we had reasonable prices and shark cards that while they were microtransactions in a premium game were fairly balanced and you got a respectable amount of money for them. That has since changed drastically.First they never go back and fix anything they just pile on top making everything below it redundant. This applies to game mechanics and the economy/microtransactions themselves. It seems with every passing update the items in game get more and more expensive. A borderline usless yacht for as much money as it would cost me to buy a whole new game? Sure! Why not? 60 million in new content added in the smugglers run DLC that would take me (at a generous estimate) at least 60 HOURS of grinding to buy all the content (that's assuming you have everything set up to maximize profits and don't waste any time or *gasp* actually want to do something enjoyable like the stunt races or what have you.) If I were to by shark cards it would cost nearly $700 for all of the smuggler's run content ALONE ingoring any of the prevously price gouged DLCs. Yes it's free if I want to grind tedious cargo sell missions and import/export jobs but as the YouTuber Nerdcubed did the math for you would be better off getting a minimum wage job to make money in GTA Online it would be less time and just as fun. Yet I keep playing it because goddamn it I want that flying bike. I will say this though Take Two Interactive will never see another cent of my money in shark cards. I know I'm just a drop in the bucket but if we all put our foot down we can put it right where it hurt a swift kick in the wallet.

review: UPDATE FOR 2017/2018So I haven't played much partly due to not having a system that could run the game but really ignore the people talking about how online is bad. Every lobby I've logged into for the past half month since I've been able to get on properly has been peaceful and as long as you don't with someone then you get left alone. If you are doing CEO stuff where things are tracked and your in a full lobby yes expect to get attacked it's part of the game since it gives cash and RP to players. I've stolen loads from people and they just try and take it back part of the game get over it.Grand Theft Auto V So this first part of the review is for the single player aspect of GTA 5 the online aspect will be put below this part of the review.So single player. One thing for money I have to say is the stock market buy low sell high and you can make a ton of money. This is mainly how I make upwards of 100K per time I use it by watching the values of the market snuff investments supposedly don't work in some peoples eyes but they take in effect a longer term investment in my eyes than normal if you do the snuff killing and etc...The campaign since I've played through the game a few times and I've enjoyed the campaign thoroughly. Franklin isn't your typical black man coming from the neighbourhood he's in as you can see by the surroundings there are lots of dealers gang bangers and people that are just getting by. Franklin though has bigger dreams of owning a nice house having nice cars and being able to live rather than sit around at home.Michael married man with a ruined life by his past and a cheating of a wife...well at least for now. Kids? Two stuck up runts one who loves to try and sell his dad's stuff and the other who likes sleeping with porn stars. Michael just wants peace and happiness.Trevor? Insane psychotic Canadian with a tad bit of a meth issue. I relate with Trevor being Canadian and crazy.GTA 5 offline mode is great there's a lot of things to do but you eventually will run out of things to do unless you make movies in game with the editor then you will have plenty of to do.GTA Online review. s all of you ing s.At least that's what I thought in my first few weeks of playing online.Now though I'm at level 49 done a few heists and done some of Lamars missions as well. I own a high end apartment with 10 cars... marjority stolen and then refit at LS customs.I will say it is more enjoyable now that I've unlocked stuff and been able to actually do stuff around the game. One of the best features of online play is the ability to do private sessions with your friends this has helped me enjoy the game more in running around causing mayhem with my buddies and then doing heists and going into a online lobby and using homing missiles to shoot people down.If you love the series I'd advise getting it if you don't like being blown up randomly or getting shot full of holes by the cops for taunting them in offline and standing near them in online then don't get it.

review: Great game to play with friends but it has it's issues.Rockstar constantly adding little ways to stop you from grinding the same missions for the best payouts.E.gRemoving things like the replay options after the mission is completed.Changing the way a mission works to make it longer for you to complete.Adding different amounts of rewards triggered by timers E.g If you complete the mission in under 15 minutes you only get 60% of the reward from it.Which this just seems like a way of making you give up on the money grind and buy one of their overpriced micro transactions for money.New finance and felony DLC offices and warehouses are way too overpriced considering that your deliveries are almost guaranteed to be destroyed by some guy in a buzzard or jet unless you get lucky enough to find an empty lobby and even then they don't pay well at all.Loading times are still shocking.Online is still infested with hackers and Rockstar couldn't care less.E.gI was attacked by a hacker and sent screenshot and recorded evidence of him.Godmode I recorded myself attempting to blow him up with the RPG multiple times whilst he was in a banshee. (Then he'd just gun me down from inside the car)Also attempting to headshot him with a sniper whilst he's stood still (He took no damage)Hitting him with my car and bouncing off.Minigun point blank whilst He was AFK Returned and sent me 200 feet in the air.Jedi powers Video showed him forcing me to ragdoll away from him (Much like the effect from flying on the superman mod for GTA SA)Spawning vehicles Pretty basic video just shows him spawning anything from jets to tanks.Player model swapping Video shows him changing to NPC characters from the story.However after I gave all this evidence to Rockstar as well as his name they sent me a reply a week later telling me that not enough evidence was provided of this scumbag to prove that he's using hacks. All in all it's a great game to play online with friends if you stay away from public lobbies If you've got no friends I'd pick it up for the story but stay away from the online.Unfortunately I can't give it a recommended since Rockstar can't be bothered to support the community and are attempting every possible way to try and sell you the shark cards. (Micro Transaction for online currency)

review: I never reviewed this as I really had to no reason to given review's pretty much covered what the game was like.Now I find out about Open IV has gotten a cease and desis order I feel compelled to share what I think...The game itself has a decent single player story and can be fun online with friends though cheaters tend to ruin a lot of public session events.So R* repsonse to how we can make the game more boring for those who enjoy modding while doing ltitle to impact the actual cheats was this.What are they losing by modding GTA V?It has been going on since shortly after release with this program now all of sudden they care?So now thanks to GTA V and R* greedy bottom line we can not mod IV good thing it will still be easy to find said program.This just shows the true colors of the greed and now makes me wonder why I pre ordered RDR 2.I get they have the right but why do it?I mean clearly these resources could have been put to use to actually make a decent anti cheat for V or could have used Denuvo which would have prevented use of trainers ect.Yeah so much for there "we are for modding and willl not ban for single player mods" So now we can not mod single player anymore then what is the point of mods at all.This really does little to deter modding from a cheating stand point as people can still use the current program to mod files just no new features or updates so bravo R* your idiot lawyers did nothing to stop the real issue of actual cheaters with trainer's.You should have sued them and served them and threatend them with jail for hacking the game not Open IVTwo reason I bought this game for the promise of future single player content and modding not being an issue and both statements turned out to be BS.

LIBBY'S 100% Pure Pumpkin1 can (12 fl. oz.) NESTLÉ CARNATION Evaporated Milk1 unbaked 9 inch (4 cup volume) deep dish pie shellWhipped cream (optional)Directions MIX sugar cinnamon salt ginger and cloves in small bowl. Beat eggs in large bowl. review: Grand Theft Auto V is a phenomenal game and it sucked having to rip into it but modding of PC games is a freedom owed to all and if a company attempts to destroy the vibrant community and enhancements that sprung from it we had to speak up. Thankfully our voices were heard (and hopefully some closed wallets contributed) and Take Two has since reneged since Rockstar hadn't authorized them acting on their interests and have since allowed OpenIV to continue development.Now I would highly recommend the game to anyone interested in a detailed open world with plenty of opportunity for mayhem a captivating story with great characters a bangin' soundtrack with original score and solid game mechanics to keep it all flowing.As for GTA Online it's good for what it is but only play if you have a few friends to play with over Discord or something as solo it's nothing but a chaotic grindy mess. And DO NOT BUY SHARK CARDS THEY ARE AN ENABLER OF SIN.If you're looking for more out of your game experience download OpenIV here http //openiv.com/and download mods here https //www.gta5 mods.com/ORIGINAL REVIEW FOLLOWING TAKE TWO'S MOD BAN BELOWIf this was a month ago I would have given this game a favorable review plenty of new content being released through the years new vehicles weapons mission types game modes clothing it's simply marvelous.I could have proselytize the merits of PC originated features like the first person view mode Rockstar Editor and highest quality settings possible.I could have mentioned the vast community of creative types making machinima.I could have mentioned the enormous array of fantastic mods.But I won't now because according to Take Two and Rockstar modding is illegal.For those not in the know Take Two filed a cease and desist against OpenIV a file navigation and editing tool for various Rockstar games including GTA V that allow mod creators to do truly amazing things to expand the possibilities of their games. Also know that both Take Two and Rockstar are complicit Take Two claiming violation of intellectual property and Rockstar claiming it to be the cause of GTA Online's notorious hacking problem even though OpenIV was only intended for single player use and will actually crash your game if you attempt to go online with mods enabled through it.OpenIV and its creators have been operating as clean as a modding tool can be expected to and have no reason to be halted by greedy bastards who are mad more people aren't buying Shark Cards. (in game currency)If you own GTA V I urge you to sign this petition https //www.change.org/p/rockstar games save openivI urge you to email Take Two and Rockstar Games directly on their official websites.And most important I urge you to refrain from purchasing any games under Take Two's umbrella that means no buying Rockstar or 2K's games. DON'T BUY THEM NOT EVEN ON SALE NO SHARK CARDS EITHER YOU'RE BETTER THAN THAT.In fact I'd advise against playing GTA Online period simply enjoy the singleplayer with mods cuz it's your GODDAMN RIGHT. Download an offline installer of OpenIV 2.9 (the latest version) and wait for ScriptHookV and RAGE Plugin to receive compatibility updates then start modding like crazy.Then share your modded gameplay.Rub it in their faces.Show them that it's OUR SOFTWARE WE CAN DO WHAT WE LIKE WITH IT AND THAT THEY CAN'T STOP MODDING!

review: Grand Theft Auto V is an open world action adventure video game developed by Rockstar North and published by Rockstar Games. It was released on 17 September 2013 for the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 on 18 November 2014 for the PlayStation 4 and Xbox One and on 14 April 2015 for Microsoft Windows. The game is the first main entry in the Grand Theft Auto series since 2008's Grand Theft Auto IV. Set within the fictional state of San Andreas based on Southern California the single player story follows three criminals and their efforts to commit heists while under pressure from a government agency. The open world design lets players freely roam San Andreas's open countryside and fictional city of Los Santos based on Los Angeles.The game is played from either a first person or third person view and its world is navigated on foot or by vehicle. Players control the three lead protagonists throughout single player and switch between them both during and outside of missions. The story is centred on the heist sequences and many missions involve shooting and driving gameplay. A "wanted" system governs the aggression of law enforcement response to players who commit crimes. Grand Theft Auto Online the online multiplayer mode lets up to 30 players explore the open world and engage in cooperative or competitive game matches.Development began soon after Grand Theft Auto IV's release and was shared between many of Rockstar's studios worldwide. The development team drew influence from many of their previous projects such as Red Dead Redemption and Max Payne 3 and designed the game around three lead protagonists to innovate on the core structure of its predecessors. Much of the development work constituted the open world's creation and several team members conducted field research around California to capture footage for the design team. The game's soundtrack features an original score composed by a team of producers who collaborated over several years.Extensively marketed and widely anticipated the game broke industry sales records and became the fastest selling entertainment product in history earning US $800 million in its first day and US $1 billion in its first three days. It received widespread critical acclaim with praise directed at its multiple protagonist design open world presentation and gameplay. It caused controversies related to its depiction of women and a mission featuring torture during a hostage interrogation. Considered one of seventh generation console gaming's most significant titles it won year end accolades including Game of the Year awards from several gaming publications. It has shipped over 60 million copies and is one of the best selling video games of all time.My Review I in Love This Game 10 Travor's Our Of Ten

review: I can currently not recommend buying it There are heaps of problems at the moment GTA V seems like a game that has been released way to soon.Amongst others 1. Launcher issue You will need to create a Windows local admin account if you are having a useraccount name with certain characters. (This is the case for almost everyone who has windows 8/10 as you usually have the " " due to the Microsoft account).2. More launcher issues Beside this there are various problems for people with different AVs Dual graphic card settings etc. 3. Performance It is a hit and miss. Once you finally can get into it..It works... Next time it is so slow it does crash windows as it has an massive issue with memory spill. It is playable yes. Some people do get lucky and have a machine where it does work..and the game itself is as good as you have seen it on the consoles a year ago. But...Some if not most players experience problems.... And this is unacceptable.UPDATE Wow it is even getting worse. On one of my three machines the game could be loaded although with massive performance problems that occured randomly . Well. The last patch was installed yesterday after that it worked as well. Now it does not start on either of the three machines. Congratulations Rockstar After almost 18 years that I've played your games for countless hours it is the first time I am seriously disappointed. It seems this is yet another game pushed out early due to pressure from shareholders and marketing. I will wait for another 3 days before I will apply for a refund from steam.
