review: Better then the console versions in every way! THE MAIN STORY has new life brought to it with 1st person and better graphics it has never been so captivating. If you haven't played through this story yet you are in for a treat. If you never go online and just do this you will have still played one of the best games you will ever play with hours of entertainment.ONLINE now this is where the majority of my review will focus. Since I've already competed the main story on console my main focus was online and here is what to expect Online has so many rises and so many falls Teaming up from the get go you can find a way to join up friends tho make sure you both have completed the tutorial as it won't allow you till you do. If you have friends on GTA online then it will be a blast if you don't you can join a crew or just play with strangers but be warned you will have less fun doing it this way as most of the bigger crews don't help or even talk to you and strangers are sometimes worse. What you may find is you will complete a mission together then as you are transported back into a session together you will spawn near everyone else. You have strangers amongst this bunch there is a good chance while you hotwire a car they will shoot you in the head for no good reason. It can be annoying but it can be fun to spend the next 30 mins hunting them down to get sweet revenge. Alternatively you can put a bounty on their head for all the other players in that session to get your revenge for you or you can turn passive mode on and no one can hurt you. Whats more the worse you are to your fellow players the more you become a target on the map.Deathmatches can be fun but you do get these custom death matches that are made to create utter ruin for all except those that created it be warned. Then there is the skill system it doesn't matter if you are a better gamer this game punishes you for simply starting up and taking on other players without having a higher skill bar. You character will die easier have less access to guns armor cars run slower for shorter ect. To me this was stupid as it was a real handicap that new players would find disheartening and ex veterans would find unfair. You may get the drop on these higher leveled people unload an entire clip at them then all they need to do is come up pistol whip you and your dead.Races Suprisingly you will find some challanging races in this game be sure to try all of them as the 1st time you go on a track you may not expect it to be so intricate. Off road Planes Bikes Boats even parachuting is a type of race you can do online all of which are fun and well done. Playing in 1st person if you have a wheel you can switch and use it instantly without need for menus If you have a plane and a stick same thing. I personally switch between Joypad and Keyboard all the time Mouse for Shooting Range Joypad for game.Missions This is one of the best features missions can be increadibly entertaining requiring real team work to complete often pitting one team against another to complete an objective. The only downside to missions can be the waiting time in the lobby to get enough people. Often you are looking 5 minutes (on average letting anyone join) to 35 minutes (if you want to populate the lobby with people of simmilar skill).Heists This is the big one like in the game heists requre missions that set it up and missions that involve the actual heist. It is thrilling and exciting to do one and you come away with a lot of money. The only downside to heists is that it is only this exiting with friends over headphones. You can type talk to each other but with strangers there is no garuntee they will reply. If you don't have four friends that play GTA then you will have to go with strangers and even tho you can re invite them for the next mission often you will be mixing and matching which means long waiting times in the lobby and unpredictable people in your mission which you have put in game money down to host.Hackers This is by far the WORST thing about GTA online. The hackers they are everywhere. I use the term hackers loosely as all they have done is downloaded a mod and loaded it up on GTA anyone can do it. At 1st it might seem these guys are great as they shoot money out of their guns or have parties on a random spawned giant chrome plane. But the longer you play the more you see that these guys ruin the entire experience. Remember that guy who shot you in the head for no reason well lets say you get revenge and run him over. Oh he doesn't like that so you will have random missiles from the sky hit you for about 10 minutes untill you manage to turn passive mode on. Then he will come at you with a machine gun that shoots cars as that effects you even in passive mode. Worse is that he might turn god mode on and drive around in an armoured car with a machine gun this happened just yesterday it tuck a tank to eventually blow up the vehicle after several shots the guy came out 20 headshots later he was still standing there it wasn't till we all said how much of a wuss he was for not being able to fight properly that he left. They will randomly spawn dancing jokers around you take all your guns away for that session or even take controll of your character! These guys ruin the entire experience. Rocksteady said they will be banned if cought but no one is catching them I don't even know where to report them? And if I do am I reporting the right guy or just someone they have taken controll over? Often you see text saying "that wasn't me!" even tho you are dying due to sky missiles from that person. You then leave session wait 5 minutes to be loaded into a new one and hope another hacker isn't in it.Overall This game for single player alone is a thumbs up 10/10 for online it is mixed as on one hand it could be an experience like no other hitting peaks where you litrally think that was one of the best online experiences you've ever had and lows where you feel like there is no point to working hard in the game if hackers are going to ruin it. Because I'm an optamist I give Online 6/10 but really it would get less if done by a proffesional.If you get it and don't have many friends on the same game and want the online experience feel free to add me theoneknownasd.

review: Best California tourism simulator and tech demo I ever bought at $70 it's still cheaper than buying a ticket to go to the real place. For serious now vehicles actually feel great to drive again and not at all like the rhinoceroses that were GTA IV's. Your characters still move and handle realistically which means they can't take much punishment before dying and/or I am just bad at videogames. Bit of A bit of B. Mission variety is pretty good. The 3 leads are likeable and gasp there's 3 leads now. There's a healthy amount of things to do in the game but almost none of it is for me it all feels like busywork not because it's videogamey fluff like Ubisoft's sandboxes but because all the activities feel routine and just what you'd expect an aspiring crimelord's daily 9 5 to be. I don't need another job! To Rockstar's credit then that their simulation is so on point that I'd much rather just put in the time and effort with the same general pursuit of life liberty and happiness only in real life instead indiscriminate crime aside thanks!My PC benchmark results and also my score for this game 27fps/10.

review: I love the GTA franchise and GTA 5 was an amazing addition to the franchise. here are some pro and cons to the game Pro's The story mode is fun and has a fair amount of content for you to play throughYou feel immersed in the game and the characters livesHeists are fun in story mode and onlineThe game usually keeps a constant frame rate of 60 fps at 1080p with medium to high settings (processor i5 4th generation 8gb RAM Nvidia GTX 960 2GB). this can be different depending on the PC you have.Cars (need not say more)The online game modes are fun to play with friends they're still fun to play on your own but not as much.Online character customization.Con'sThe Rockstar servers can be complete aids so if you play with your friends they may lag around on your screen.Shark Cards are ridiculously expensive to buy and they're 100% not worth it just do some heists which will give you a couple 100 000 or some biker work which will pay you 20 000 in 5 minutes.hackers can be a pain but you can always just create a friends only session and that will deal with that problem.Social Club can sometimes need to be updated maunally which is a bit annoying but that rarely needs to be done.Overall i like this game and i recommend it to anyone who has played any of the gta games and people who are interested in buying this game.

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding lemon bars recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1) 2 cups Flour2) 1/2 cup Sugar3) 1/4 teaspoon Salt4) 2 sticks (1 Cup) Salted Butter Cut Into Small Cubes5) Filling6) 1 1/2 cup Sugar7) 1/4 cup Flour8) 4 whole Large Eggs9) Zest And Juice Of 4 Medium sized Lemons10) Powdered Sugar For SiftingDirections 1. For the crust Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9 by 13 inch pan with butter.2. Stir together the flour sugar and salt. Add the butter to the bowl and use a pastry cutter to cut it all together until the mixture resembles fine crumbs. Press into the prepared pan and bake until golden around the edges about 20 minutes.3. For the filling Stir together the sugar and flour. Crack in the eggs and whisk to combine. Add the lemon zest and juice and mix until combined. Pour over the crust and bake about 20 minutes.4. Allow to cool in the fridge for a minimum of 2 hours then sift powdered sugar over the top before cutting into squares.(Use an 8 x 10 pan if you'd like the layers to be a little thicker.)

review: Do not buy this game. Rockstar do not care about it's customers once they have milked all the cash they can.If you have any problem with the game the only answer you'll get in the official forum is to open a ticket. This ticket is going to be ignored. You're only hope will be Google but you'll soon discover that the same problems have been present since launch.And yet you'll still be unable to solve the problem you have because for each error message you can get you'll find dozens of wild guesses alleged fixes. Of course you'll never know which one will work of harm your system even more since there is never any official word from Rockstar. I know most people will think "That's not a problem if it doesn't work Steam will give me a refund"... Except that GTA can decide to stop working in a few months. You may be forced to pirate a game you own to work around its non functional launcher. Did I mention that the official minimum internet bandwidth for the launcher to login is superior to what the game needs to host a 30 players session?So spare yourself the hassle if you're still interested pirate it. Then you'll be sure it works. This is not a game it's a cash grabbing scam.

review: My journey began at the firestation. After beating a few firemen in a fist fight..(that I pulled out an smg to ensure victory) I found my true calling DRIVING A F#CK1N&amp FIRE TRUCK. Never before had I experienced such ecstasy and a feeling of I am king. Many will go crazy in GTA V while driving a tank but the real fun is in your local Fire Department. I drove around washing the streets of anyone and everyone who questioned my reign over Los Santos. And then I took the fire truck on a high speed police chase on the high way. I never thought driving a 35 000 lb vehicle at speeds of 100mph+ could be so invigorating. I was almost falling out of my chair when the cops tried to tackle me off the road in their standard sedan squad cars. I decided after the chase had gone on for about 5 minutes to take the truck on a safari. Mudding in a firetruck oh man there aren't words to describe getting air and doing doughnuts in such a beast. Unfortunatley the cops still were chasing me so I decided to implore the laws of physics and simply ram head on into each cop car. It was beautiful and the truck still kept on going!I then took it back to the city and noticed it was late at night! So I began my cruse of the streets looking to pic up some ladies in true GTA fashion.... this is my only complaint of this game I couldnt pick up these individuals of interest becausee a firetruck is "too small" for such an ordeal.Then I realized it was ok. This was the GTA gods telling me to purge the streets of these fell temptresses. So I unleashed the FULL power of the spray cannon mounted on top of my mighty ride and sent the heritics flying as they were bathed in my holy water. In the end I brought home a firetruck to my house rather than a woman. I believe this may be a wise choice for us all to do IRL.

review: This game should not have been released as it is there is a really bad lag between the keyboard input and the response in the game especially while driving. So many other popular games I own seem to play much more smoothly. I read terrific reviews online so I thought this might be something other than an afterthought port but sadly the reviews were wrong from my point of view. I tried turning down the graphics and ran a benchmark but even with about 40 50 FPS there is still really bad input lag which leads me to believe there is some fundamental bug in the game itself. The game crashed several times and even caused my antivirus to crash which is a behavior I have not observed in a game since the days of Windows 98. So many other games play fine on my system so I have to conclude that this is a bad port and is not worth it (as of April 2015). I sure hope they fix it because the graphics look terrific and the story was fun (I played it on a console before buying the PC version). Until a fix is provided I cannot bring myself to deal with the frustration of playing this game as it is life is too short.

review: If you are looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Cookies recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients1/2 cup butter softened 1/2 cup peanut butter 1 cup packed brown sugar 1/2 cup white sugar 2 eggs 2 tablespoons light corn syrup 2 tablespoons water 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 2 1/2 cups all purpose flour 1 teaspoon baking soda 1/2 teaspoon salt 2 cups chopped semisweet chocolatePreheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).In a large bowl cream together the butter peanut butter brown sugar and white sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time then stir in the corn syrup water and vanilla. Combine the flour baking soda and salt stir into the peanut butter mixture. Fold in chocolate chunks. Drop by 1/4 cupfuls 3 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets.Bake for 12 to 14 minutes in the preheated oven or until edges are golden. Allow cookies to cool for 1 minute on the cookie sheet before removing to wire racks to cool completely.And eat it!

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The most recent offering the in the Grand Theft Auto franchise has finally reached the shores of the PC. Is it worth the wait? I'd say absolutely the graphics are excellent the gameplay sublime and the new songs on the radio are a treat.First of all I want to start off by talking about story mode. I feel as if the characters are well written and they develop throughout the game in a good fashion. It helps the player connect with them emotionally which in turns offers more incentive to progress through the story.However I feel the story can get a little stale at times. Not because of the writing but because of the type of missions. Everything big is a heist mission which are fun at first but seem draining as time goes on. Variety would help with this as the previous GTA games had more variety in their missions (aside from GTA IV).Secondly the graphics are very nice. The port is decent enough and with the AMD GTA patch my 280x was easily able to power it on high settings with little to no frame drops. An issue I had frequently was that textures seemed to load slow and had not fully loaded sometimes if I drove fast ending up with me driving my expensive car into indestructible obstructs from time to time. This is nothing game breaking but it did get annoying from time to time.Next the radio stations are better than the previous game in the series GTA IV and since coming to next gen consoles and PC there has been a plethora of tracks added and a whole new radio station. Personally my favourite is Non Stop Pop and the Rock Radio but there's a radio station for everyone and if there isn't then there's always Self Radio. Self Radio is where you can add your own music to the gym so you can traverse through the world of Los Santos and it's surrounding countryside to your very own jams.The map of GTA V is very big in comparison to GTA IV. I'm very grateful for this but as I neared the end of the game I thought that it just wasn't big enough! However what it lacks in size it makes up for in quality as there's lots of little neat secrets tucked away and it's littered with races and missions to get you exploring the diverse landscape.The online portion is a neat addition to the GTA franchise and it's been demanded ever since San Andreas MP took off on the PC. Whilst this isn't as good as SA MP in my opinion I do feel as if it is sufficient. There's a nice leveling up and you can feel your character getting better as you get faster more expensive cars and the more expensive apartments and garages. I do feel as if the missions are repetitive online but there is a lot of variety as you can race do adversary mode do deathmatch and many others. One feature I didn't like infact I abhor is the character creation. I feel having to choose between two parents has stifled the creativity of the community and does a disservice to the online portion.In conclusion Grand Theft Auto V is a great game to purchase and you'll hopefully thoroughly enjoy your time on the game with the amount of stuff to do and explore and experience. It has great graphics stellar radio selection engaging story fun online portion and satisfying gameplay.

review: This game is very addictive. The game play in single player and online are excellent. BUT the online portion load times are ridiculous. The server issues will cause you to throw your hands up in frustration. Team members getting disconnected during missions will cause an instant fail. If you don't have a crew you will have to wait in the lobby forever then you have to pray the pick up guy(s) is competent at their given task. There are a million things that can go wrong during a heist and it will test your patience. All that being said IF you are lucky enough to get a good team together. IF you can bear the unbearable load times and are lucky enough not to have anyone leave or disconnect. Then during those few golden moments during a heist are the most fun you will have in any game. Those are the moments that keep me sane waiting for this game to load.10/10 bar the server and loading issues.

review: It's a very good game. You can run under the specs by tweaking the game files to get those few extra fps if you need them.Very great story was interesting in my opinion.Also very good online play quite interesting and addictive would be great if there weren't all these cheaters out there.I would have lots of more hours if it wasn't released earlier for ps3 i am certain about that as i have spent lots of horus in there too.Well that was a review that was positive but is changed to negative because i want modding to be a part of the pc version as it was for years on the gta franchise.Currently i don't recommend it and i would actually like a refund features that were there suddenly disappearing is quite bad.And the negative will stay in here forever i guess. Rockstar keeps making bad moves in other more subtle ways. I remember hearing that they undermonetize the game yet even the more simple things have gotten way more expensive than they used to. You either need to grind for countless hours in online to get the things you want (remember there was a story mode at some point? rockstar does not).The game started off as a very great game but right now i would consider it a failure. I have stopped looking forward to gta 6 not because i know they just want to keep milking this game and screwing over the players but because i feel the same situation will be a reality when gta 6 launches.I totally regret buying it again (for the PC) and i would rather just play in the PS3 until support stopped for it (because apparently paying 70 euros for the game was not enough for them to let me play for more than 3 years)Farewell rockstar. A very disappointed consumer

review: This is a really really good open world game. It might not be the best game in the series (san andrease or vice city are better) This game is still pretty good on it's own. The online for this game I cannot recommend.It's filled with loading screens microtransactions grinding and hackers.Getting back to the singleplayer the story is not enjoyable in any way it has it's moments but the story for the most part just does not have the same impact that the previous games had. This mostly stems from there being three playable characters that you can switch to on the fly while that is cool and all it resulted in there not being enough focus on the 3 characters equally. The story mostly feels like it's about michael. He is the first character you play as and he has the most amount of missions.Speaking of missions missions are the best they have been in the series. they now have a large variety in things that you do. on one mission you can be running around an office full of satirical portrayls of nerds and on another you can be blowing up a gang to shreds and killing their leaders.The gameplay is the smoothest it has been in the series though I would argue that it is the least complex.I found myself empting entire clips into enemies without consideration compared to the previous game Gta IV where I would burst my shots. Overall this is a pretty good game if a little flawed on the story and not that complex on gameplay side of things.

review: I think I've played this game enough to understand that rockstar has gone communist. GTA V is so expensive and you have to put so much time and effort just to have decent cars and places to live. You can't even sell half the you buy to buy new It's t even more than real life and cancer. If rockstar is trying to make this game like real life and all the real life t that comes with it then stop trying. Cops start shooting you if you just stand in fornt of one you don't have to obey traffic laws or gun laws for that matter. Heists aren't as rewarding as they should be if one person leaves from that heist that heist is cancelled and you have to find a whole new group to do it with which is t because trollers love to do this along with noobs because noobs always lag out or are too terrible and leave as soon as you call them out. All in all rockstar could've made this an absolute great game where you could play in a modded lobby with your friends you could get more money out of a heist allowing you to buy the large mass of stuff that you can buy in this game the physics are better and skills stayed with you not decreased over time and make everything you buy sellable. If you skipped to the bottom because you didnt want to read this whole review then I'll say it right now DO NOT BUY THIS GAME wait until GTA 6 comes out or a new game comes along to whip GTA's

review: Grand Theft Auto 5 has a great story line with a very interesting cast some missions are very fun or exciting but there are the odd view that tend to be alot slower in pace and seem to be there for padding. but overall the campaign is fun and exciting and there is lots todo and there is a large range of side missions and activitys to complete. the port on the other hand is something to be desired. its not the worse but i have a i5 4670k and a 980ti. i understand that is not the best CPU but it should work just fine. however i am met with frame drops when driving no matter what settings and no matter how high i put the AA i seemed to still be greeted with a jaggy mess. i believe the performance has seemed to get worse as patches are released so im not sure whats happening there to be honest. then the worst part of this package by far is the online. this is littered with hackers and after the handful of heists are finished in one sitting there is little left to do other than try and make your own fun and have that shot down by the previously mentioned hackers. believe it or not i have owned this game 5 times. PS3 PS4 360 XONE and now on PC. im sorry to say that this is the least fun ive had with this game im not sure if the charm has finally worn off but it simply felt more at home on the console and seemed to work better as a package.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: hmmm where to start... First off i had super high expectations being the only version I knew anything about was the PC. The graphics were well above average and game play not too shabby... Multiplayer...is where it starts to get bad... gameplay concept for this is good but the demand for graphics plus all the people plus hackers very unstable gaming but that can be over looked for the fact you can friends only play. Where the game lost me is a lack of variety in missions and limited hiests... i mean only 5 heists? Seriously?? and then when they came out with the latest addition of like 4 cars and like 3 flying vehicles and 1 new gun and celibrated it I was done...That's not how you do it rockstar... you guys made hella money off this game alone... stop being lazy new heists new guns unique cars if someone has to play 25 hours to make a few million give them a reason to. Until the effort makes it look like RS cares about entertaining the a.d.h.d. of gamers i wont reccomend this game.

review: REVIEW IS ONLY FOR GTA ONLINE! If you are I buying it for the campaign go ahead. The multiplayer though there is hackers bugs and sometimes a toxic community.If you are a low level most people just kick you from their game. Try to make sure that you have 3 other people if you buy this game. If you try to start a heist and do it most people screw around and don't even try. Then they leave. There seems to me to be quite a lot of desync online too. Sometimes it completely ruins the mission for me. Like one time I was driving and for my friend it showed we were stopped then he was killed and the mission failed. I don't know if they are doing anything to fix it.Modders/Hackers are another thing that ruins it online. I join a gang to do some bounties and VIP things but there there is billy1423 with his brand new modding tool and he starts killing everyone on the server. I really thought they would have fixed this by now but to this date they still have not.Also they decided not to let anyone have mods online in private sessions. In GTA IV you could start up your own lobby and play with some mods. Sure it would crash the game A LOT but you could still do it. On here their goal is to keep the multiplayer strictly mod free. I like that but why not add like non official servers or something? It would make the game so much more fun. In overall it's not a bad game. Story mode is great and there is lots of modding in the singleplayer. If they could work out the bugs hackers/modders it would be great. The community would have to fix itself though. 7/10*UPDATE May 2017* Still cancer*UPDATE Mar 2018* I now have cancer from playing this

review: Product received for free. Grand Theft Auto V evolves nearly every mechanic that was in the previous Grand Theft Auto games. As far as driving goes the vehicles have been greatly improved with Rockstar running more complex physics on them. The cars can even hold to the ground slightly better. The driving mechanics feel more like a racing game particularly the Midnight Club series compared to Grand Theft Auto IV's rocky boat like handling system. The shooting mechanics are better in terms of the feel of the mechanics and larger compared to the melee mechanics in the game but that doesn't mean that the melee combat won't be fun as it as been improved over the previous titles as well. Weapon selection has now also been changed. Instead of the old way of selecting through all the weapons there is now a Weapon Wheel which is similar to the one featured in Red Dead Redemption another game made by Rockstar Games. Grand Theft Auto V draws inspirations from many different Rockstar titles in the past including Max Payne 3 Midnight Club Manhunt and Red Dead Redemption.There are many unique features in the game one of those features is that when the players are playing as one of three protagonists in the game the other two are out living their independent daily lives and you will be surprised by what you find the characters doing when you switch back into them. Another unique feature is that the character swapping feature is executed in a Google Earth styled manner and was displayed during a Game Informer demo which was showed to have ran smoothly and without lag. The PC PS4 and Xbox One versions present an exclusive feature the first person mode The whole game can be played through the eyes of the protagonist. This gameplay mode presents a whole new way to play the game. Cars have detailed interiors different from one another shooting is like that of an FPS game.New activities have been added such as yoga triathlons jet skiing parachuting tennis golf and scuba diving. Random events have also been added to the game and can appear any time while the player is exploring the map. The mobile phone has returned from Grand Theft Auto IV but is now only used for calling the player's contacts surfing the web and quick saving. Giving people the middle finger is another new feature the player can use while in a vehicle (which Rockstar recommended you do in various locations around Los Santos to see the outcome of this effect depending on where the player is at they will get different reactions from pedestrians).Rockstar has also made changes to the pedestrian mechanics some pedestrians can be seen at the bus stops in East Los Santos and the same people can reappear in Rockford Hills working in the gardens of the opulent mansions. Some minor mechanics that help convey the environment and appearance of Los Santos occur at certain times of day such as a sprinkler system being turned on in the morning in wealthy areas like Morningwood.The map is larger than Grand Theft Auto San Andreas Grand Theft Auto IV and Red Dead Redemption combined. After some calculations by members of GawdAlmighty.com that would equal to around 27.5 square miles/71.2 km2 when land and sea are combined.

review: This is the first review for me and im sad to say its a bad one. The game looks amazing and seems like it would be fun as hell if i could play it. Every time i join a free roam server I get a flood of messages saying that everyone disconnected. Its really me disconnecting because of some bug. I opened a support ticket with rockstar and they have not replied. Doing some research into this I have found that many people across all platforms are experiencing this. Rockstar made a guide to fix the problem which said to forward some ports and disable your firewall among others things. Well I tried it and it did nothing. I really hope they fix this but I doubt they will. Because this has been going on for years. I think they are just not worried about the few that are getting this bug because the majority are not. Just goes to show how much of a company they are.DO NOT BUY THIS GAME UNTIL THEY COME OUT WITH A PATCH. Or risk wasting 60 ing dollars.

review: 35 minutes and so far Rockstar's Social Club BULLSH*T is preventing me from actually playing the game. After finally getting Social Club to work (it recognised no problem with my connection) the "Enter activation code" block is greyed out. It's times like this I envy pirates who deserve having to tinker a little to get their stuff working. When your anti piracy measures are preventing your paying customers from using your product you're doing it wrong. It doesn't matter how good your product is game breaking security measures will always leave your customer unhappy.After nearly 2 hours and many forums I finally got the game working and still Social Clup asks me my birthday every dam time I start the game despite entering and asking it ti remember. Graphically the game is OK frankly they seem a little "last generation". Max Payne 3 had better graphics.Story seems OK so farNo matter how I set the camera view in settings the view when driving has to manually controlled with the mouse.Not worth full price IMO

I'm running the game on high settings with a 4790k and a 760 with about 50 60fps.Anyway this is the first game I have ever pre ordered in my life and I love that I did. review: Within a month of being out I've played GTA V every single day it's been out and have 130 hours. I never played GTA V prior on any console. I was very excited for it to finally come to the PC. Like many I was curious about how it would run. Turns out it's one of the best ports there probably is. Very easy to run 1080P with 60FPS and even better it doesn't require a $500 GPU to max out. I must say I'm in love with this game. My friends don't play it as much as we did the first week but I continue to play daily. The preorder bonus of $1 500 000 was a good gesture but now that is petty cash once you get into the game you get it all figured out and know how to keep up the cash while maintaining full garages.As of October 2015 I decided to play a bit of singleplayer again where I didn't get far. As soon as I was able to play as Trevor I was hooked. Within the next 24 hours I ended up finishing the story line. Singleplayer is a great time definitely worth playing instead of just going for multiplayer like I originally did.

review: Singleplayer 10 / 10. The best characters of all the GTA games and by far (I've played them all since GTA 3).Multiplayer 7 / 10 I guess. Heists the high end money earning activity are not very well thought out and get boring soon. Other activities are fun but don't provide income or incur losses. And you'll need A LOT of money to buy nice things in this game.#1 downside CHEATERS. Lots and lots of them and they do very annoying bad things to you.#2 downside the system requirements. My AMD HD 6950 runs it well 1920x1080 but I had to turn the graphics settings down enough that my pictures doesn't look as good as the screenshots (to a large extent because of no AA but not only that).

review: Hoped in a random person's car trying to steal it and ended up in passenger seat. She drove off quick w/ me inside. Next thing I knew Some crazy black driver runs into us scratching the side up. I thought to myself "Crazy bad driver"...Then he reversed back into us. Then I thought ok now it makes sense he is trying to kill us. I got out and made a run for it only to be gunned down. I love crazy people 10/10 for me.P.S. I did crash once on launch day changing the settings to window mode is bit difficult which I play all my games in. Other than that it ran perfectly.System Specs i7 4770kGTX 97016GB LP Cosair Vengeance RAMSABERTOOTH Z87 Motherboard

review: I played for about 19hrs 30% completion. I didn't have a lot of fun. I do appreciate the world building in GTA V the characters the dialogue the story the city the blatant satire. The problem is that there is almost no fun gameplay in GTA V the playthrough is polluted by pointless side missions menial mini games and long boring drives around town. Despite the open world nature of the game the missions are very linear and usually forces the player through scripted events. I got no enjoyment from the yoga QTEs moving shipping containers or towing cars! Gun battles are few and far between and they are generally tedious with little strategy required.The game plays like an some sort of interactive animated from Adult Swim. Not my thing. Wasted $40.Edit to illustrate my points I'll summarize my last 4 hrs of gameplay.Drive. Gratuitous mini game moving shipping containers drive again.Drive. Sucker punch a dude and steal a mini sub no one else to stop me.Drive. Forced to a flying tutorial despite the fact that I've already flown on a previous mission. Drive. Sucker punch an isolated guard the whole base is immediately alerted. Rush to the heli and take off. Soldiers and the pursuing helicopter can't hit me.Heli pilots very poorly it's a pain to get it to the very specific waypoints required for the game to proceed.Drive to Chinese mission. Oops it's a pointless mission for Cletus where I have to shoot elk.Drive save the game and huff some gasoline. That's how I feel lol.Okay can I do the heist now? Nope... "Open World" they said...Drive to cutscene then drive to another cutscene.Heli sequence to another very specific waypoint. Rail shooter sequence then heli again.Drive. Torture QTEs as Trevor then snipe a defenseless dude as Michael.Drive pilot heli pilot sub pilot heli rail shooter sequence pilot heli. That was the heist.Spot the active or skillful gameplay. Yes it's funny but that's all there is.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Awesome game good quality port to the PC as well they really have made it optimised. I was worried that I would have to upgrade my graphics card from the AMD R9 280X that it is to something more substanstial as much as my settings aren't maxed to the fullest I experience the game in incredible details and a perfectly playable 40 50 fps in comparison to the 20 30 I get on GTA IV almost ten years old. I am very pleased with the port job they did on this game and after playing the game originally on the 360 to then migrate my online character through social club was also a benefit to see my character reimagined for the next generation. Do yourself justice and add this to your steam library i couldnt recommend it anymore. Especially for the director tool and replay option that you can use both online offline and in director mode exclusively.Awesome game!

review: Plays like it was meant to be a pc game. SLI works. Nvidia dropped a new driver today for this game and SLI optimizations. This is my first time playing this game and i was blown away by the performance the visuals and the level of detail in everything. Just started the story mode but i did some exploring. After i am done causing mayham i will progress through the story mode. But i think this will be one of those games i will be playing for weeks to come. Since the 1.28 patch the game stutters like crazy. Also seems rockstar is more focused on DLC than adding any real content such as mission or even 1 new heist. Most lobbies are overloaded with hackers. Rockstar support is terrible. Fix your in game seriously........So the performance issues seem to be resolved. But it doesn't seem like they are going to add any new missions or hiests so i have since moved on to other games. Adding cars guns and clothing and only what they think is going to sell shark cards is all they seem to be interested in and after doing the same missions and hiests over and over gets old after a while. You can't expect people to buy shark cards if every other lobby is full of hackers. And then there was the summer sale scam and for that reason my review will stay at thumbs down.

review: I will break my review in two parts one for the single player experience and the other for the multiplayer experience.TL DR Superb single player dysfunctional multiplayer.Single playerGrand Theft Auto games get more complex each iteration and this one confirm this trend.Map wise the level of detail is still amazing each area of the map is specifically designed with care and attention. From the busy city to a calm desert or a huge mountain area the variety of terrain is nice and well put together.The world is filled with non player characters with a plethora of actions and reactions conversations. You will often surprise cops chasing someone on car or foot people parking their cars partying in the woods... Everything comes together to make you feel part of a world that is alive(and might want to murder you if you wander on foot into the woods).On the stylistic side of things the work in lightning is unprecedented and the colorful sunsets will make every player forget the brownish tint of Liberty City and for many people a bit of Vice City memories may come back.The scenario is more hectic than ever. After the somewhat serious story of Niko Bellic in Liberty City this is a return to a more wild type of storyline involving ridiculous car chases breaking thefts destruction all around fun.The rand character mechanic of GTA IV is back in a more structured way. Strangers and freaks will ask for your help. They are not essential to the story progress (or the 100% status) but are nice way to take a break from the main story missions.The three characters seem like they are tailored to three types of GTA players. Gangbanging in the hood driving fast sports cars and wearing fancy suits wreaking havoc.... The special abilities are a little plus that is if don't forget they exist or how to trigger them.The mechanic of switching character solve a problem often encountered in large open world games I'm in the middle of nowhere no means of transportation? Let's switch characters and see what the others are up to leaving this one to get back to civilisation by himself. The missions that take advantage of the mechanic are forcing the player to use them which end up restricting the possibilities. Fortunately they are in small number.When it comes to driving the handling is a lot less ridiculous than GTA IV the feeling of driving a cardboard box on soft springs is gone and the fast cars are very satisfying to drive especially with Franklin's special ability.The deformation of the cars has been decreased too it will be more difficult but not impossible to turn your car into an unrecognizable mess.The huge variety of vehicles is amazing even though we could have used less declinaisons of modern sedans and more special vehicles (the return of the go kart or the hovercraft for example).The radio is always an important part of all Grand Theft Auto games and this game is no exception with a decent variety of genres over 16 music radios and 2 talk show stations all of that punctuated with the infamous satiric advertising. There is also a way to know at any moment the title of the track playing.MultiplayerAfter much thought given to it I find the multiplayer being the weakest part of the game. It is a shame because it all comes down to the quality of life or quality of experience. When joining the multiplayer you re put in a free roam session with up to 32 other players. The entire map is yours you can do whatever you want.After a few minutes you ll realize that the world is a bit less lively than in single player. In order to optimize the amount of network traffic the number of AI around the streets and driving is significantly decreased. The pedestrians are scarce and have less range of actions and no more wild life.This is one of the most negligible problems.The main problem is the way the multiplayer itself is structured. If you want to join a race deathmatch or other kind of gamemode you are first disconnected from the session you re in then the game checks if the gamemode party you want to join is full. This means that if the party is full you will have to face another load time while it puts you in another free roam session.Another infuriating thing is if somehow the game can t connect to a multiplayer session instead of sending you back to the main menu or asking you if you want to give it another try it puts you back into the last single player save. That s two more loading times.The whole heist system is handicapped by that. If one out of the four players disconnects everyone gets sent back to a free roam session instead of just coming back to the party screen.One other problem is the amount of cheaters. Since there is a lot of informations sent by the players on a peer to peer basis there is no server to check for malicious information sent and cheating is common. Even after Rockstar promised increased anti cheat measures people are still able to teleport themselves or everyone on the server to other players can spawn vehicles money or worse of all blow up everyone on the server while making it appear in the kill feed that it s someone else s doing.If the multiplayer was more cleverly implemented and cheater free I would recommend it without the neccesity to have solid nerves and a lot of patience.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: If you are playing for the gun play I can not recommend this game. It takes a step back from gta 4 cover system making cover really only good against an ai. Against a person that has played enough if you use the cover system they already know where your head is going to come out of cover if its not out already to kill you. In gta4 you could come out top of cover go left and right and if it was standing cover even crouch and come out left and right. So now in a gun fight you have only one spot he comes out of cover instead of the 3 5 you had to pick from in gra4 to try to get the win in a gun fight. Also no crouch was a big fail that is almost game breaking in my opinion. So any depth that was in the gun play of gta4 was lost in 5 leaving the story and other thing that were fun. But since we are playing a gun game here with that part of it lacking cant give it a thumbs up. Again everything else was better than gta4 and moving in the right direciton.

review: GTA V what can you say about this title other than GREAT!GTA V story mode allows you to play out some epic scenes good enough to make movies from ... well actually a lot of them were taken from movies lol. Now do not take that last part as in they ripped off the movies because they changed it enough to where it becomes something new and different but still full of epicness. I found myself invested in the characters and wanting to see what happens next. It wasn't all smooth sailing though when you first start playing Trevor it gets slow or did for me. I did not like his character and found it hard to play. He is nasty dirty disgusting and down right crazy and disturbing but soon he gets back in touch with the "others" and that all changes ( he doesn't change the fun level does ). I found myself playing 5hours or more easily in a sitting because i just couldn't put it down. I had to see what happened next. Everyone out there will most likely find a conection between themselves and one of the characters. It's a must play.GTA OnlineMost games of this type throw you online in little maps of deathmatch combat. GTA Online allows you to play the whole open world of GTA V and do what ever you want. The Hiests are great fun and well done the Missions are plentiful and diverse ( racing "land sea air" sky diving deathmatch PvE Survival etc etc etc. Owning your own house or condo setting up your OWN hiests or just goofing around in the map. The fun is endless it truelly is. the only drawback is from level 1 20 it was not as much fun as it got after lvl 20. Stick it out reach lvl 20 and start to REALLY enjoy the online aspect of the game. Overall GTA V is a must have in anyone library do NOT miss out on this title ( PC ) or you will be missing out on one of the best games EVER made and that is not fan boy Hype.

review: NOT FOR MULTIPLAYER. I'VE HAD MY FILL ON CONSOLE.GTA V is going to be a landmark game for the 2010s with how many copies it's sold and the game itself. Grand Theft Auto has always had an affinity for films and cinematography (note the near useless 'cinematic mode' you can use when you drive) and this is the most cinematic entry in the series. The game follows a 'Crime/drama/liar revealed' type story one that hasn't really been done in the series so far. One of the characters is more or less washed up an old veteran in the crime scene. Trevor even after being exiled is still heavily involved with serious crime even more so than Franklin. Franklin would be the most 'GTA' of the trio as he's just a gangster trying to work his way to the top. The story really kicks off when the three of them meet. To talk about the gameplay it has been improved and feels and looks better than GTA IV. The driving especially has been changed for the better going from floaty and realistic to tight and video gamey. The gun play is more or less the same except now all the guns don't sound like you're hitting a plastic bottle against the floor. The set pieces in the story are especially fun to play through my favorite being the boat mission and the shootout through the recycling plant. The music in this game is stellar icey synths over stuttering percussion on the loading screen to big band brass when you're playing through missions to even some other genres that characters will use the radio for (the mission where you blow up the O'neil brother's meth house). This game feels very very modern most of the time but will sometimes dip into the 80's or 90's. One of the most glaring flaws in the GTA franchise is still very prominent in this entry you can't meaningfully interact with the large beautiful world rockstar has built for you. People will run you over they'll attack you if you look at them for too long. This open world serves only as a hub area for missions and collectibles and any wacky stuff you want to do in your free time. These wacky killing sprees can be written off easily if you play as Trevor or even micheal where as in GTA IV it would create a sort of ludo narritive dissonance when put up against Niko's character. Dispite this I still love GTA V it's characters it's story it's gameplay and especially it's music and visuals. 9/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Even if I was desperate enough to purchase an 8mil Shark Card ( 60) I'd still be short 2mil of getting the yacht I wanted (You spend a further 60 on R* and you still can't buy the item you want in game that!). To stop players from making lots of money quickly by grinding non stop GTA have added cooldowns. Want to sell all those vehicles in one run? Tough luck it's a 40 minute cooldown between max of 3 vehicles per run. No wonder people mod the crap out of this game!

review: I would reccomend this game for playing the sp. like all of the games in the gta series the sp gives the player a vast and diverse world offering endless choices to make doing good or evil...however the online version is one of the most bugged games I've seen lately... and I've played lots of those eg ghostrecon assassinscreed... al games that where pushed to be released giving loads of bugs...in this game the online version gives problems connecting to friends and other player loading heists... you can invest dollars in a heist only to find out you HAVE to play it with four players wich if you are at the moment playing alone is a big problem but when you go online your friends can't even join... if somehow otherplayers manage to join you you get a blackscreen ( I was hoping it was just a loadingscreen but no the only thing that was working was my talk key and the others kept waiting for me to start the heist...short of if you are into sp games rpg style in a modernworld with some shoting elements then this game is something for you. if you want to get a good multiplayer experiens it looks to me you are better of playing PAYDAY2 although here in gta you get far more heists and possibillities and unfortunately also the bugssincerely Farathinel

Feels like im just sitting on connecting/loading screens all day with no human or game interaction.To be honest I may aswell be playing with a bunch of glitching bugged bots.The online could be great but there needs to be more emphasis on teamplay and community.I guess any game primarily designed for console is going to lack any online community and I shouldnt be surprised but COME ON! Its GTA! Get it together wits!

review: This was one of those games that I put off playing for the longest time. After beating it I will say that I have no idea why. The story was very well written and the characters are the best I've seen in a GTA. Michael and Trevor do seem like they got more attention than Franklin but by the end I was a fan of all of them. The driving is as fun as ever and the gunfights are very nice with the first person mode. Love the radio and song selection. The voicework is SUPERB. I had a few graphical glitches here and there but for the most part it's a beautiful looking game. Of course it retains that classic Rockstar style of humor with more hits than misses. There are some missions that drag a little but I think that's true of any GTA style game. The highs are much more common than any lows and I fully recommend the single player game. I haven't touched the multiplayer but I hear that it's a mess. Still worth buying though.

review: If you are having trouble at launch like the Rockstar client crashes and an error message occurs I had the same problem. To fix this I went into Device Manager &gt Display Adapters (I have Intel HD 4000 and an Nvidia Card) &gt Disabled the Nividia Card &gt Started up the GTA client (It then loaded without crashing) &gt Then I quickly enabled the Nvidia Card before the actual game launched. I know that the desciption isn't the best but I hope it helps anyone with the same error I had.

review: Excellent game very fun not for the light hearted or people who take things to seriously. Need to remember its just a game regardless. Yeah bad language nudity death and gore )I beat story mode and have to say I was sad when it was over. But after the missions in story mode you get a nice piece of pie to play with.Online play is ok but needs some work. Game uses P2P for connecting instead of real game servers like most online games. With that being said if you connect to a session where someone doesn't have the greatest set up you may get spammed up that everyone left leaving you all alone.The same issues with XBox/PS plague the PC version also with the empty lobby issue. Once again due to P2P and no real servers.Rockstar editor mode is loads of fun if you like making videos. Having the ability to change the camera angle in recorded clips is completely awesome. I have not yet tried the Director mode (thats next) but I already know im gonna have loads of fun playing with that mode also.Overall its a fun and addicting game and would recommend it for appropriate ages.Edit May 8 2015Love the wave of bad reviews recently.The game is even better now after last patch that cleared up some of the connection issues and banned all the people using cheat mods. Now online play has improved tremendiously. No more people running around in god mode unkillable or using money cheats and FOV Field of view cheats.Thank you Rockstar for cleaning up the garbage and making online play enjoyable again for the people who play for real without cheats and hacks!Edit June 24 2015Stopped playing online little over a month ago.Cheating/Hackers returned and have ruined online play.Game went from 300k online to 30k online. Probably 25k out of the 30k left are the cheaters.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: +The Single Player Campaign A multilayered work of art simulation and satire. Bravo +Runs smoothly and the graphics are astounding. +All of the cars feel different. The Multiplayer Online component. In Perth Australia it is basically unplayable as I am connected with non english speaking servers. The multiplayer is frustrating un fun and there is zero communication. Which makes what would be fun games like co op rally driving where the passenger has to voice command the driver where the checkpoints are impossible. Server options and server visibility is needed. Also the Loading times are historically long and don't even think about alt tabbing to surf the net while it loads. It has to be a foreground task to actually even load. It is very disappointing. The graphics are also downplayed in the online component. Overall yes but online no.

review: Let me start from the statement that this is the great game and I spend and still spending a lot of time in it with pleasure creating interesting challenges with friends. You can do countless things and this game replaces literally tons of other games like racing games shooters simulators and stuff. But I have to rate it thumbs down as I'm tired from R* politics no not about Open IV about ingame economy! It's disaster!I know that to be high on steam ratings people should play the game more but they shouldn't grind all day to buy 1 car! I'm playing GTA Online from the 1st day of the PC lunch and love all the modes and heists but after lowriders prices on cars and property got higher and higher. Yes you can say developers want to sell shark cards for the reason all DLCs are free but ok then I bought the game for the price of Megalodon card (8 000 000 gta $) and lets look what we can buy on this 4 cars? For the price of card that costs the price of the game I should be able to buy ALL the property in the game 10 times. All DLCs that came out already required less time and money to develop then original game for shure and why should I pay the price of the AAA game for opportunity to buy 5 cars??? Now we came to conclusion that there is two ways out of this situation 1. I'll do as R* want me to do will grind all day stealing cars and selling it. Do you think it's fun R*??? Seriously? If you dont be prepared to grind grind grind for cash...and along the way everyone who bought shark cards is going to be using all the high end toys to troll and grief the lobby. I would glady go back and play gta IV but gtav is dead to me as is Rockstar.

review: This game is a great way to pass the time whether online or playing the intriguing story. Now I would like to point out some flaws for people who have bought the game and are finding issues. This game requires a much stronger computer to manage it. Depending on your graphics card you may find constant crashing a large amount of visual lag and ultimately rage. I do not think that it is fair to take anger out on the game because it is mostly for strong computers and consoles. It is a fantastic game that was well designed and thought out. I personally have a medium spec computer and had to do a lot of research into getting my game to run without crashing and while I am still running into some issues online it was well worth the time that it took to research it. If anyone would like help in trying to get their GTA V to run more smoothly please contact me and I will try my best to give you some help.

review: Alright so I love GTAV. I bought it back on the PS3 back in 2013. loved it! When I heard the PC port was released I was gonna buy it at the summer sale. Rockstar bumped up the price to regular but just with a Shark Card ($1 200 000 in GTA Online). So I didn't buy it then. So during the christmas sale the price was ACTUALLY decreased. So I bought it. Note that my specs are on my profile yes I have the Alienware laptop/desktop hybrid. The game is very well optimized and may be the best looking game on the market. So I already beat the story so I went to GTA Online and imported my character. Note that I've played GTA V around 150 hours on PS3 alone. So I expect this to be great I loved GTA Online on PS3 so it should be cool to see my character in high res and do some heists really difficult. This is where it gets bad.MODDERS.Every. ing. Lobby. MODDERS.It's almost unplayable. But for every clean lobby I find I find around 5 servers with modders.I still have a great time with the game nonetheless. BUT ROCKSTAR CLEAN YOUR GOD DAMNED GAME!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Do not buy this game! The game is broken after the "Executive" update! The game won't run without stuttering every second.I have 228 game hours on this game. Despite the lack of heists the added things that cost more money then the best hiest even with the best people would take a full month's worth of grinding just to scratch it's cost and lack of a better character creation and in game character modifications. No plastic surgeons in a city that has a film industry? No way for characters to excersize for bigger muscles and better strength? This shows that Rockstar doesn't care about it's gamers and only wants you to spend money on their shark cards.No more god damn pvp freemodes! It's hard enough trying to find decent players to do hiests or even missions with. Now we have to deal with s that where already annoying just doing some free roam open missions when trying to do the "new' free roam modes. They are your game modes from CoD! Just reskinned for GTA. The rewards for the new modes don't even justify the effort. If you want to spend your money. Do not spend it on this game.

review: Not a perfect game but certainly the best of its genre. Recently this title has been suffering from what appears to be poor decisions on the part of the developers. Many have complained about poor performance after updates when they had fantastic performance previously. I myself have only had one instance where my experience dipped into the "poor quality" category. Other than that I've had a blast with this game. If your computer meets the minimum requirements I'd see about buying this game. A word of advice As soon as you're out of the tutorial focus on finding a fast car and break some laws so you become wanted by the police. A higher the wanted level is ideal for this. That way you'll see as soon as possible if your computer will struggle with framerate drops popping textures or anything of the like. Police chases are considered to be one of the most prominent areas where these issues occur. If you're able to get to this point and see for yourself if you are able to play within the first few hours of having the game running then it won't be too late to ask for a full refund if you need it.That being said I put over 200 hours into this game just on PC and still highly recommend Grand Theft Auto V/Online for its replayability open world sandbox style and engaging characters throughout the entire story.

review: I might very well expand this review and elaborate in the future but for now you get the short version.GTA V has given me many joyous moments in the single player but I have never really felt on par in the Online. This is due to it's microtransactic nature. The Online part of GTA V is balanced in a way that means that (unless you are one of those who exploited the early days of money raining) you have to play all of the very limited amount of Online story content again and again and again in order to accumulate funds to play for fun. Things like a few cars a garage to store them in and an appartment to go with it is expensive enough. When you add the desire to get an aircraft or maybe a boat it just comes down to a downright grind. Unless of course I continue to pay Rockstar through micro transactions for a full price game they have already sold me three times.The single player mode is being affected by this as well. Some interesting and fun vehicles and other assets are exclusively accessable through GTA Online to lure more players into their micro transaction swamp. The best solution to this was until very recently the use of mods. THREATS OF LEGAL ACTION WERE DIRECTED AT THE BACKBONE OF SINGLE PLAYER MODDING. The gamers enjoying single player mode is apparently not of value when compared to the watered down repetetive grind of a micro transaction heavy multiplayer and its economical potential. The threats has since been withdrawn but I can hardly recommend a purchase after the incident.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: When GTA V first released for consoles I tried to ignore it and all the hype that surrounded it as I knew it would be a long wait for a PC port to be released. However even after all of the delays I still feel as though that wait was worthwhile. Rockstar have clearly put a lot of effort into making sure this game isn't just a shonky PC port in fact it's obvious that a lot of time has been spent optimising to ensure the game runs as well as possible on high settings (I played at 4k and my 2x780Ti's were able to maintain a constant 60FPS on very high settings something a lot of less visually impressive games struggle to accomplish). I can certainly see why a lot of critics and fans have deemed the PC release the 'definitive version'.The game looks incredible at moments although not necessarily as pretty as some less open world AAA titles. It does also suffer from some quite obvious pop in at times but otherwise it's visually a very pleasing experience.As far as the actual story is concerned the dialogue is hilarious at times and the characters are well designed to match. I do think that Franklin was the weak link but otherwise the storytelling was engaging and entertaining throughout.I've only finished the story mode so it's now on to the online where I'm sure the experience will be similarly enjoyable. Highly recommended.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Nice game rubbish server GTA V is a very nice game I admit. However the price contains two parts GTA V and GTA Online. I've played online mode for 36 hours since I bought it and almost half of the time I'm in loading page. I cannot finish even one task because I always get kicked out. I entered an empty lobby without other players. It's like I'm so scary that everyone quit immediantly once I log in.(In fact it's me who disconnected). After searching on the Internet I found out a lot of players face the same problem with me. Overwatch and LOL run perfectly on my com. So it's not my own problem. We cannot play with other players cannot race with others cannot even see each other. GTA online basicaly is a single player game without story. The only thing you can do is rob some shops and then lose the cops. After losing the cop you find out you cannot do anything else. I paid for both two modes and now half of the game is totally rubbish. Then why should I buy this game? I mean I rather download it from than being cheated like this. Oh when I started to write this review my GTA Online is loading. Now I finished writing it's still loading. So rockstar you better not make next GTA cuz I'll download a pirated version without feeling bad.

Rockstar will only punish the fair playing people for some reason. That's really f*cked up.At most i can say the game is entertaining enough to keep me playing now and then and it still is a really good GTA game.8/10 Really missing the hacker free lobby's that I played in on the xbox 360.

review: This game is the best rpg I've played and my favorite gta game yet! The story is long and has good depth fun to play through a couple times and is the perfect canvas for mods. Only downside is that Rockstar has ditched any attmepts at single player DLC so dont expect anything in that department. GTA online is entirely different It's amazing playing in lobbies with 30+ people and with the new heists and CEO updates and even more to come with rockstar promissing to continually release new content to improve the online experience there is so much to do even with 264+ hours played on my Xbox 360 already and now transfering to my PC can keep that going. No major glitches in the game although online has become overrun with hackers so rockstar needs to step things up controlling this problem but all things said I would recommend!

review: I had high hopes. I had heard from every source that this game was fantastic adn they weren't entirely wrong. The single player is good though filled with entirely unlikeable but interesting people. I bought this game primarily for the multiplayer though and was sorely disappointed.GameplayI'll talk about what the single player and multiplayer have in common first gameplay. In a word meh. Driving is excellent. I love zooming through the streets at high speed. swerving around obstacles. Each car feels different and it makes them all feel fun to drive. Once I had gotten my first supercar (Coil Voltic don't judge me) the most fun I had in the whole game was driving it at high speeds through Los Santos. Flight controls well too but I recommend a controller for both.However in my opinion this is the only good part. Shooting feels extremely same y. Normally I wouldn't complain about this but in GTA 5 every gun feels EXACTLY the same except sniper rifles and rocket launchers. Magazine size is all that differs. Recoil is negligible and it auto compensates so that whenever you can shoot you always shoot in the same spot. Guns feel dull all around. I enjoyed using the marksman pistol most just because it added a little interest to shooting since it only has one bullet in the magazine.Movement is okay but just okay. At times you never even notice it which is good. But whenever you try to enter a car for instance your character automatically figures out the best path to get into the driver's seat even if that involves getting in the passenger's side so you stay nice and still for the cops shooting at you or running clear to the other side of the car and getting run over by traffic. On top of that he resists your attempts to stop and you have to continue to tell him to move another way before he listens. This can be extremely aggravating at times. In short when you don't notice it it's fine. When you do you will break your keyboard.WorldThe world of Los Santos is one of the best I've ever seen. The detail in every house every nook and cranny is staggering. It's like the developers were just waiting for you to go to the middle of nowhere and see this little piece of nothing at all. This makes it feel so immersive like a real world. Living and breathing. However if you just want to muck around in it it quickly gets boring. You'll start shooting up a strip club and hide out inside with a shotgun blasting the cops as the come in the door or start throwing grenades from the side of a train blowing up cars as you go by. THis will last you for maybe five to ten minutes before you realize that its no fun without other people to do it with and even then it's kind of pointless. But I mostly played in multiplayer with a pal or two so these were generally fun times.The police are a constant downer though. They are EXTREMELY sensitive and view the slightest bump as an act of murderous aggression. They are also infinite so you can never beat them. You run away or die.MultiplayerIn a word garbage. I expected way WAY more quality.You enter the world of Los Santos after spending two hours in characters generation and are overcome with wonder. What will I be able to do in this world? What sweet cars can I get? And what instruments of mass destruction? Then you realize that everything literally EVERYTHING is centered around obtaining the only resource in the game cash. You play heists get cash. You play Adversary Modes get cash. You rob a store get an extremely small amount of cash. So on and so on.It... is... mind numbing...You'll have fun for a few hours until you figure this out. Then it is all one giant grind.And actually getting into a game with other people? Getting into a heist or adversary mode? Nightmarish. I would spend twenty minutes just trying to START playing. And every time that you get into a game or leave a game you get a two minute long loading screen. Why?Another major issue is the amount of adversary modes that nobody ever plays. There are so many modes. Deadline is one of my favorites but no one ever plays it. I got one game going with four people then never was able to again. I turned on their system called auto invite. Near as I can tell all this does is repeatedly invite the same people who have already said no. These modes need to be discontinued then brought out again at a later time so people are excited about them. There should be ten modes or fifteen at the maximum not FIFTY.Cutthroat and trollish behavior is the norm. If a higher level or more skilled player decides to repeatedly hunt you down and kill you good luck stopping them. There is a passive mode that essentially makes you untouchable to other players and other players untouchable to you. You can't draw your weapon and they can't shoot you. This is fine until you bump a cop car or off some rednecks. Then you get to fumble around in the menus and wait ten seconds after you disable passive before you can shoot back.As a final point hackers are everywhere. I have encountered more hackers in this one game then I have in every other game I have played. One such hacker was giving out free cars and money to people. Another was driving down the street causing the entire thing to explode. Oh yeah. And he was invincible. And invisible. The last one made me stop playing entirely. A player came into the match and immediately every other person on the server was teleported to maximum world height. After maybe 60 seconds of falling to our deaths unable to use our parachutes for some reason we were all teleported again to the inside of a building. However none of us could move or draw our weapons. The hacker then proceeded to pull out a heavy machine gun and kill us all. We all left the server because there was nothing else to do.SingleplayerThis is actually alright. The story is solid from what I have seen but I have no interest in continuing it. No one and I do mean no one is likeable. They are interesting in the same way that a dead cow is interesting. I like to look at it for a second and wonder how it got that way before I plug my nose and never see it again. I do think this is the best part of the game and if you enjoy interesting characters who treat everyone else like dirt then you will enjoy Michael Franklin and Trevor.The surrounding characters are funny hilarious at times. Each one is a caricature but they have have the same qualities as the main characters they quickly dpress you and turn you off.Final VerdictIf you enjoy satire interesting and depressing characters and morbid humor then the single player is for you. I recommend the single player to no one.I hope this review helps you in your decision. I know many people really enjoy this game so do not look at one review (mine or others) in isolation. GLHF
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The summer sale is over get over it. Yes rockstar did perform some shady but they still need to make money no matter how much you don't like microtransactions Rockstar NEEDS to always make money and right now the shark cards are the best solution especially with the summer bundles since GTA Online mods are out of control THIS IS A FACT i have 60 mil in game that other players have given to me so there only solution was the bundle to get a chance to still make reasonable amounts of money a few months after the PC release. Now to the real review. Its GTA and above all ITS GTA V. So far the best in the series to me I have played as a long time fan of GTA since GTA III and these games are just plain fun. It combines the openess of GTA San Andreas the broken city feel full of crime and hijinks like in GTA IV the outrageousness of GTA Vice City and the familier gameplay of GTA III. This will be a game to remember from days to to come...

review: I've just completed this game for the second time first on console and now on PC.I've not played a great deal of the online mode.The story mode is fun and the main story is definitely interesting. The game play is great.The only let down is the controls. It definitely plays much better with a controller compared to a keyboard. Where with any decent car W sees you fly forwards like a jet and S sees you screech to a halt. Analogue is king here.The controls are generally your biggest nemesis in this game compared to the older gen combat and driving is simpler but that makes the gameplay much more smooth.Bugs oh the bugs!There are many many bugs int this game from simple ones like mission checkpoints not triggering to complex and worse ones like how my Xbox one controller suddely stopped working with this game. And heart breaking ones like that jet fighter you stole and saved vanishing if the game forces you to use one of it's planes in a mission.Still recommended!

review: I bought this game shortly after it got released because I was interested in the Online aspect. It was good while it lasted. For maybe a couple of months I had fun making my way up to organising heists and buying cars. When I finished all the heists and got myself a couple of apartments and cars I was kinda growing bored of it and just left it as it was. The game was sitting in my library for a good year or so I pretty much forgot about it. Then I read somewhere that the game has been updated with new content so I went to check it out again.Now I'm just stunned at how much there is to do ingame when playing online its awesome and my money well spent. I never modded the game to begin with so I dont really care about what happened recently. The game is awesome for it's content and if you have a good setup then the graphics an also be amazingly beautiful. 10/10

review: Return to form for GTA! Right from the start you are hit in the face with the over the top action that has made GTA the pillar of gaming that it is. From there it only gets better. First off you have to talk about the visuals they are amazing. There are moments where I forget I'm controlling the action and not watching a movie. The frame rate is buttery smooth dynamic lighting highly detailed textures and so on make GTA V feel alive and begging to be explored. So far I'm only a little ways into the story but it already is engaging and I'm excited to see how it all unfolds without feeling burdened by it. Don't pass on this GTA is the crown jewel of gaming and GTA V once again proves why.

review: Be extremely careful with who you play with online modders are known to mess with people's accounts undoing hours of progress. Rockstar also has a history of missbanning so play at your own risk.With that being said if you like racing and shooting you'll love this game.Pros Great graphicsBeautiful and colourful open worldHuge variety of vehicles (land sea and air)Lots of customization for land vehiclesPlenty of activities to do in the open worldFun driving and shootingDecent selection of radio musicFun and varied singleplayer missionsGood voice actingVery diverse selection of mods in singleplayerMultiplayer Heists can be boatloads of fun (the first few times...)Cons Bland and overused sound effects (except explosions)Frequent connectivity issuesNo classical or jazz radio stations in game (Multiplayer missions get 'grindy' very quicklyNo mods allowed in multiplayer (frequent bans are handed out to offenders)Multiplayer items (vehicles property etc.) are very expensive (probably for Rockstar to sell shark cards)Are there modders in multiplayer? Yes a lot of them. Are you still going to have fun? Almost certainly.You should probably buy this game with a few friends to create a crew but multiplayer can still be fun on your own just to a lesser degree.In summary great single player slighlty sketchy but enjoyable multiplayerSolid 9/10

It's may be a little over priced but it's worth it in the long run.
