title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Rockstar is one of the few gaming developers in todays market that is heavily worshipped by the majority of the average gamer community. Anything they release is an automatic GOTY candidate and is heralded as THE game that raises the bar for others. Meanwhile any semi intelligent gamer that is not so easily swayed by the hype generated by these marketing masters realizes that time and again rockstar has so masterfully created videogames that appeals to such a wide audience that it fails to entice those individuals that crave enthralling tales about people we grow to care about cheer for and empathize for. I have been playing rockstar games for a while now from GTA3 to Red dead redemption and I see the same formula being regurgitated over and over again in the backdrop of a game that is all shine and no substance.Correct me if I'm wrong but GTA has never created a single likeable or even realistic character in its entire history. I never rooted for Tommy Niko John/Jack Marston and not to forget the 3 stooges in GTA 5. Not ever have we played the hero and not ever have we played as a female. This is because Rockstar has figured out so well what the average gamer is like and tailors the game to them so well that the average player doesn't even realize this. I can't think of a single protagonist that Rockstat has ever had in their game that is memorable enough to stand the test of time. I don't remember anything about Tommy Niko or even John Marston. And since Rockstar knows that it can't write a coherent character they try to fool audiences by including 2 extra ones. Don't even get me started on the "story"... I'll keep it simple there is none. Nobody recognizes Rockstar for compelling writing and they never have. So how do they cover up the schlock they call "story" and "character"? They build an impressive detailed and pretty sandbox for the player to play around in. That is the whole premise for GTA. People don't buy these games for the next chapter in the GTA saga they play these games to golf watch movies kill innocent people fly planes boats play stock market etc. Basically play real life in a video game. That is something I will never understand. Why do people want to play reality in a videogame? People that play as race car drivers astronauts samurai space cops knights templar and even plumbers I understand but playing in a world based on our world to do exactly what we can do in reality? C'mon. To all you gamers out there singing this games praises on how good its golf or bowling is... get off your BUTT disconnect from your tv and go outside and play for real. You all completely miss the point of videogames... it is to escape reality and live out our fantasies in lands and as people we hope to but can never become. So the entire premise of Rockstar games are all gllitter and flare. Story is non existent. Characters are forgettable within 5 seconds of meeting them. And honestly nobody will remember these games in 10 years. Nobody will remember when you had to do the 50th "drive to point B and kill C" or "go do yoga" missions in this game. I'm still playing it and even I don't remember any of the missions I've done. Maybe the bank heist but even then its getting stale. I do not like these games and I don't like how predictable the average gamer is. Until our community starts growing half of a brain games like these will continue making 2 billion dollars. It's disgusting. It's lazy. It will never change. Mark my words GTA 6 will just be GTA 5 but in a bigger city just like how GTA 5 was GTA 4 in a bigger city. I don't recommend this lazy game not at the price they are charging for it. Wait for it to go on "sale" if that will ever happen. This game has been out for several years yet its' price is still way too high that is disgusting. Shame on you Rockstar. No wonder you cannot create likeable characters you are a relection of your work.

review: none of the following complaints apply to singleplayer if you are planning to get the game only for the singleplayer then great go for it 9.8/10 as for the singleplayer and keep in mind that gta online does have its fun moments with friends BUT...Gta online is by far one of the most aggravating games I have played lately due to the large amount of broken and unbalanced mechanics as well as that fact that the game nearly supports the griefing of other players. To start the heists in the game are extremely annoying and are agonizing to play with randoms. Randoms are often stupid idiots who don't have any idea what they're doing and really shouldn't be allowed to do heists at such an early level! Any time one of them messes up it fails the entire mission for everyone even if they merely die! Then when they leave the mission fails except this time you get SENT TO FREEMODE INSTEAD OF THE LOBBY often making you lose your entire group and forcing you to restart all checkpoints. Also you only get to suffer all of this after you actually manage to get a group because lobbies take ages to fill up unless you're doing the final where people feel that they are entitled to a higher paycut even though they got to skip ALL SETUPS!!! The part about all of this that can be most aggravating is the fact that almost all the things listed above can be fixed with very simple patches yet Rockstar completely ignores it so long as people are buying shark cards. With the exception of single player the game makes me feel that the developers are completely incompetent when it comes to basic game design. There is one thing that can happen which is ridiculous and shouldn't be a thing no matter how incompetent the developers and that is the fact that you can get kicked for being idle while you're in THE LOBBY!!!! In fact a heard from one guy that he got kicked during a cutscene at one point. This is sheer stupidity and no developer has any excuse that can ever justify this. ceo associates get paid practically nothing for their efforts helping a ceo who then has to go out of his way to do vip missions just to be able to pay them. A ceo should be able to directly pay his associates and the fact that he can't is stupid. Next is the fact that when you buy crates not only is the process sometimes excessively annoying and time consuming but there's also the fact that players can go out of their way to sabotage you for only a small amount of pay making them more motivated by their ability to troll you rather than actually gaining something out of it. Ceo work simply just does not pay enough to justify this risk. Once you're ready to sell your crates you must carefully transport them and if the vehicle is destroyed by an npc or some player all of your hard work goes down the drain and you can kiss all that money you spent good bye. Also even if you manage to do all of that successfully there's a chance your warehouse will be robbed by npcs which have insanely ridiculous accuracy making you lose your crates and even if you kill them you can't get your crates back which is RIDICULOUS!!! Whoever thought this was a good idea should have their own eyelids melted into their eyes by a hot rod. I'm not done yet! I've still got more to complain about before I finish! One other thing I hate is the spawn killing which other players can do for absolutely no reason and the fact that it's possible to force someone to pay insurance through multiple means. Also this game has no balance for example two of the worst motorcycles are the two most expensive motorcycles while one of the cheapest is the best one costing less than 1% of the price of the two worst. WHAT THE HECK!!!Also there's the armored kuruma which makes you almost invincible when fighting npcs while you can shoot them in complete safety from anything but explosives which npcs rarely have. Rockstar's greed is also ridiculous. For one thing unless you buy the game twice you can't access certain vehicles something which is absolutely ludicrus and in my eyes is absolutely UNFORGIVABLE!!! This entire game draws more frustration anger and hate than what I can handle for the amount of enjoyment I can squeeze out of it. I've had enough and I'm sick and tired of it all. This is probably only about half of my complaints and to summarize my main points I hate rockstar with a burning passion rockstar makes great singleplayer games some of the best in the world but rockstar faults when it tries to make a multiplayer experience enjoyable becasue of their refusal to fix simple things such as a glitch that has been well known and extremely overpowered and heck the developers probably use it when they play the game! I digress but I hope I didnt come across as a rambling idiot as all of these problems may not be extremly game braking but are really bad game mechanics and awful design flaws and they stack up.

review: So Im walking through a parking garage and an NPC drives their car in and parks it. I glance over as they hop out and as I start walking away I hear this quiet off beat ticking noise. What is that noise I think it's coming from the car? I walk over puzzled and I have one of those euphoric 'holy crap' moments when my brain finally comprehends that it is the car cooling off... the heatshields and everything cooling off on the car are popping and ticking just like a real car. That little detail is an example of what I love about games.If you love the wide open freedom and ridiculous sarcasm/satire of the GTA series this is a must play. It seems like they worked to distill all their previous GTA games into this one gem.

review: Today I changed my review. I've been playing for a while now and GTA Online is *great*. But you know what ruined it? Modders. Modders everywhere. Well now steps have been taken to get rid of mods period because thats really the only way to get rid of modders. Its sad but can you really blame the developers? Everytime a modder abuses other players it costs them money and they get so many complaints about this stuff. So they did what they had to do.But then everyone starts screaming "Oh no. We can't mod singleplayer anymore! '(". and gives negative reviews. Now don't get me wrong its terrible they can't. Really it is. But how many of these do you think are genuine? How many of these negative reviews after all these years still only play this game for the single player modding? Not this many thats for damn sure. I recommend this game based on the fact steps have *finally* been taken to properly address the Online modding issues. The cost is heavy but it is worth it.

review: Two words Caveat emptor. Before buying this be well aware! When you first purchase this game the first thing you will notice is inflation. Everything is tens to hundreds of thousands. Want a small $50 tattoo on your butt? $68 000 thanks. Want some shoes? $250 000! Leather motorcycle jacket? $180 000. Wait you want it black instead of pink and green stripes? That'll be $450 000 thanks! Every car you try and jack when it tells you to choose your first ride is 'premium' and locked. All the missions are dreadful. And all the buildings are fake bar like 5 in a 50 kilometer radius. Controller controls are counter intuitive you'll need to change them straight up.You can't buy a house for a long while and all houses are pretty much fluff. Can't play tennis because there's no one online. Can't play mini games. Can't be an executive running a business because there's no businesses only phoney sham fronts and mafioso fluff RP text. There's no stock market no purchasing or sale of things and no way to make money bar grinding boring deathmatch style missions. Oh also EVERYTHING has a padlock on it. You need to be level 50 100 to access 90% of the content. So don't buy anything you'll regret it later because if you can access it it's noob. Oh speaking of buying. Pay to win? Hell yeah. They named it right with the SHARK CARD. Because they're definitely shark's out for your shekels. And the drop outs omfg. I literally spent 20 hours waiting to play about 1 hour of gameplay so I've gone through the 2 hour refund region. You'll definitely need to queue up some YouTube in the background to make the huge amount of wait sufferable. Tbh I am seeking a refund from Rockstar for it. Whether I'll get it who knows. I know Steam would screw me over like they always do because it's been more than 2 hours. Mind you it took me 19 hours just to download it and 30 40 10 minute lags looking for online servers. But hey screw me for taking more than two hours to wait to see if I can actually play the game. I'm miffed I wasted $80. I knew I'd have buyers remorse when they screwed PC users over so royally taking a year and a half to port it. But I didn't realise how evident it would be.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Never played it on PC so I don't know about this version but Grand Theft Auto V is by far one of the best video games to ever come out so far. It's not just a Shooter It's not just a Racing Game it's not just an exploration game it's everything combined making it the most open Grand Theft Auto ever to be released.Pros VERY moddable. (Story Mode)Amazing Online mode unlike anything you've seen.Great music on the radio plus an amazing in game soundtrack for both Online and Story Mode.LOTS of cars that can be modified.Lots of guns that can be modified.This game doesn't have that crappy driving physics like in Watch_Dogs 1/2 or Just Cause 1/2/3.There is a lot to do in both Single Player and Multiplayer.Good story. (although maybe not as good as IV)Good Graphics. (could have been better if not released on last gen consoles)Very funny.Cons Map is too small and boring.Online Sessions need a higher player cap. (Maybe 100?)Driving physics are not realistic but still not too arcadey like WD or JCIf your were to drive a car straight into a wall at 100mph it would look like you hit it at 30mph. (Cars are pretty much made of steel)Auto aim is abused way too often Online resulting in constant deathmatches in the city.Online modders are a thing and they will either bully you ruin your game by spawning stuff or give you x amount of cash so that Rockstar bans you.Everything Online is over priced and requires you to either grind your off or buy "Shark Cards".New DLC is no longer being ported over to Single Player.Once you have done everything the game gets boring.Notice how most of the cons are for Online? Grand Theft Auto V is a great game Grand Theft Auto Online is okay. (even though there are more things to Online.)Overall I think this is an amazing game that you should at least try. It has it's ups and downs but so does every other game.

review: This game is fantastic it's an incredible game that has been made extremely well however recently Take Two (the creators of GTA Online) shut down OpenIV the base for almost every mod. This is shutting down modding for GTA Online which is good but also shutting down modding for the single player as well as other GTA games. GTA modding is dying because of Take Two and Rockstar. Not only this but Take Two have designed GTA online to get them as much money as possible. The economy of GTA online is awful the only way to get money in GTA Online is to either grind for hundreds of hours or pay large amounts of real money for not much in game money. As well as all the issues listed above everything added to GTA online is not added to the single player Take Two and Rockstar are forcing you to play GTA Online to get themselves more money. The singleplayer of GTA v is extremely good and massively improved with mods but because OpenIV has been shut down mods have been removed from the single player game Take Two are making GTA online a money farm and instead of working on the next GTA game Rockstar are just milking GTA online. As I've said the singleplayer of GTA V is amazing but Take Two have ruined the game I don't recommend anyone gets this for the online as it is a pathetic attempt to earn themselves money.

review: This will be a single player review only because my PC cant handle the online portion of the game.Grand Theft Auto V is an amazing game simply said the story charachters and the world itself will nail you to your chair and you will want to see it through ASAP this really is one of the best open world games of all times.Sadly publisher of GTA V (Take Two Interactive) decided it would be a good idea to shut down single player mods content that gratly expands the lifetime of the game and in no way affects the online portion. While you have a lot to do in this gameworld after completing the game that ammount of content cant be measured with the work modding community has done over the years.In conlusion this is a great game but the greed of the publisher is causing it troubles now a few years after its release I will recommend this game because I had a lot of fun for my money but I am hoping they will bring back mods so I can continue enjoying this masterpiece.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is a absaloutly fantastic game. The single player campaign is amazing and has its memorable moments but for me it wouldent be the same without the multiplayer mode.Rockstar did an amazing job with the multiplayer on this game with very regular "Free" DLC's which keeps the game alive. It greatly expands what the online experience has to offer everytime theres an update. Yes the free roam is a big focus of gta but without money its crap thats so there is numerous ways of making money in gta from Races to missions to multiplayer heists. The amount of content is amazing.The problem with this game is that online items can get very expensive and money in gta v is not easy to come across and takes time to get but i guess thats what keeps us going back Sure theres shark cards but the prices are ridculaous for what you can actually get. I guess this is a small price to pay we do have constent free DLC updateds close to every month.

review: The multiplayer in this game is a mess. The single player is spectacular and some of the mods make it almost infinatley replayable but the multiplayer is something else. I have many more hours on xbox but it's impossible to play without getting a modded account with millions of dollars in it. That worked for months but then all the money and items were taken from that account and i had a pistol with no ammo and no money to buy bullets. I came and bought the pc version but i got another account with money on it because online is unplyable without a ludacrious amount of money and I got IP banned on pc. Everything is a cahs grash and ever non minor dlc costs $500 to over $1000. You get a car for free and it's still expensive to upgrade the thing. You can spend up to $20 000 in game dollars destroying cars getting killed makes you lose your entire magazine which can be $4 000 if you die with the grenade launcher you get heat for doing almost anything and the missions give you poor money and repeating a mission gives you less money so you can't grind the best mission in the game. Unless you wanna spend Five THOUSAND REAL dollars there is no point to buy this game for online waste of time and money.

So my advice is check GtaV all the time to see if you can get as lucky as it seems somebody is trying to help us out. review: GTA VIt's an amazing game not only because of the storyline but what the game is itself. Seeing how far it has come since the very first launch back in 2013 you wont be disappointed in this game. Singleplayer is well thought out and very interesting. GTA Online however is a different story. Due to the amount of modders and cheaters in the recent months you may end up getting your experience ruined or if you're lucky enough get in game money which is hard to gather if you're starting in 2017 or later. Online is also very very complicated for new players. It has so many different activities and features that you'll spend your first hours just by trying to understand what you can do.+Pros Well to Good game optimization (you can run this on a watermelon with playable fps) Amazing singleplayer story You wont get bored with all the jobs and activities you can do Cons GTA Online is ran by money if you have it you can play like you're supposed to Very complicated as the game is getting updates over the years changing gameplaytl dr If you have the time to put into this game get it.this is my first "proper" review so if i missed any key information (duh) i'm sorry

review: Really horrible Q&amp A. Half a dozen missions are bugged and require ridiculous workarounds. Some missions are totally bugged and can't be worked around. At least you can skip missions now which prevents the game from being literally completely useless. Some other weird stuff. Like why do rich guys who drive porches only have a maximum of $17 in their wallet when you murder them? That doesn't make any sense. The multiplayer is horrible. Just absolute trash. Laughable MP game mechanics.... If you kill a guy and steal his car he can disable the car. Why even bother killing someone if you can't steal their car? It's fricken gta.Otherwise pretty decent single player slightly better than gta4. The characters are very memorable and the story is alright. Fun... but well over priced wait until it is deeply discounted.

review: Here is my review for GTA V (Single Player)PROS Open world with very big map which you can explore and do many many things from side quests to activities. Stunning graphics. Excellent voice acting. The music is as usual in GTA game good. Easy gameplay A live city the Ai was very well made. You can do almost anything you want from watching TV playing golf parachuting going to strip club buying various properties or even wreaking havoc in the city! The main story was although nothing extraordinary solid and good FANTASTIC main characters each one with his pros and cons in his character. Even if you finish the game you can just play it from time to time for fun doing whatever you like. You can customize your vehicles at a great extent something that i really liked.Cons You cant have a proper girlfriend like previous GTA. Although the cops are more challenging than previous GTA and thats good sometimes it becomes a nuisance to escape them. Rockstar's move before the summer sale to increase the price was HORRIBLE and it stopped 3 of my friends from buying it.Online is really enjoyable but i stopped playing because there were too many jackasses that attack you for no reason epxloding your car etc making the gameplay frustrating for me.

review: I avoided playing or watching anything about the game on the consoles and just waited for the PC release. So happy I did. They got everything about this game right. PC port is nearly perfect. This is what a PC game should be. Game of the year without question. I was annoyed when they delayed the game twice but if this is the final result then more games should be delayed. I've had it crash twice but I have overclock SLI setup so it may be my computers fault not the game. I have GTX670 SLI and get over 60FPS at 1600p with everything at high or very high (except textures at normal as 2gb vram is not enough it will run with high textures but you can see the stuttering as it constantly swaps the frame buffer from system ram). One thing I did notice is that SLI scaling is not as good as it could be. One spot I tested I got 52fps with one card but only 63fps with both. I did find that turning on MSAA 2X with one card killed my FPS but with both cards it only took 2fps hit. What I found the best in terms of visuals and performance is to run the game at 2560*1600 and use NVIDIA downsampling to 1920*1200. This gives a much sharper picture with less performance hit that using 1200p and MSAA. Different setups may have different results. Hopefully a driver update can squeeze out some more SLI performance. Can't say enough good things about this game though. Everything that I didn't like about GTAIV is fixed and improved. Some of the best writing and voice acting I've ever seen. Haven't tried online yet so I can't comment. Like I said this is what a game should be and a game like this is why we buy high end PC and not crappy consoles. As others have said thanks for the consoles for beta testing for us. Buy this game and show developers why PC is the best platform for games.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V In Depth ReviewStory Pros *3 Playable characters.*Shows the pros and cons of crime instead of making it look so good.*Alot of cars and drivable planes boats and helicopters.*Moddable (but new mods won't come out unless OpenIV does something)*Acurrate representation of Los Angles CACons *Takes alot of time.*Boats are annoying to drive.*Mods are dying for one of the greatest open world simulators.*Over agreesive cops*Needs to be played twice to fully understand the beggining. (or at least for me)Online Pros *Team up with friends.*Updated bi monthly.*Alot of missions to do.*Exciting heists.Cons *Difficult to get money without friends.*So much to get.*Modders. Everything about modders ruins the game. They ruin the grind aspect and/or get you banned.*If a modder gives you 40K rockstar will basicly take all of your money unless earned from a mission/heist (I would know rockstar took away 5 million from me because a modder gave me 120K and I sold alot of my old cars then the next day saw all of my money gone except 16K)*Boats are STILL annoying to drive and are required in some missions.OVERALL Grand Theft Auto V is a game so exposed to everyone with YouTube that so many kids go on and ruin the experience. Without the modder problem it would be a 9/10 for me but not only do they have modders they have trollers and rockstar has a poor soultion to fix the wallets of those who got money from the modders. So I rate this 7/10 and even if modders are fixed I will still have it below 9 for that fact that rockstar has stolen so much money from me and even gave me a 5 day suspension for being framed by a modder tool called "frame" (It kills the entire lobby under the persons name who is being framed)

review: Having put over 60 hours into the game in the last few weeks it's a wonderful story mode game. The characters both playable and non are colorful well voice acted and a joy to experience. I like the map it's big enough to give you a great variety of terrain. The main story is engrossing and fun to play. Tons of side missions to do and fun little "random encounters" to do as well. Guns lots of types and modable to an extent to improve them. Also even more modable is the cars.I haven't played a GTA game since San Andreas and I must say this is a wonderful addition to the series. I caught it on sale for $29.99 and well worth it. I have not tried the online game but I'm not sure I will. Lots of horror stories about people getting banned with no appeal process.

I have so much fun playing alone or with friends and love the level of customization and freedom in the game.Sometimes life can be tough but when you have an opportunity to escape to a life like world filled with tons of opportunities it makes everything better.I want everyone to buy this game because they only plan on making it better and adding content in the future so pumped for GTA 6 when that day comes DBUY BUY BUY!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The most beautifully crafted openworld with life like similarities to LA. The general attention to detail and immerion is through the roof. The ingame websites news radio etc reflect your actions. Npcs respond to your actions and their dialogues change ever so slightly if you restart a mission or take a different route. Finding these little details was a big part of the fun for me. The graphics quality is pretty good and the options menu is as good as it gets. There are so many side missions and things to do. Exploring the world with various vehicles is also very fun. The campaign is engrossing with a few options and choices to make every now and then The concept of 3 main characters and switching between them is very entertaining. Tons of content!Cons No direct option to restart a mission from a checkpoint. For me the online component is pretty mediocre and can be hit or miss. Can be good if you play with friends instead of randoms.Nevertheless the base game itself is wonderful and is worth the price.

review: I'm not sure how much more I can say about this game that hasn't already been said.I've only played the online portion of GTAV and it's kind of polarizing. It can get boring very quickly and I often find that if I spend at least 5 hours playing I'll want to play something else. This is due to the game feeling REALLY grindy online. There are some issues I've found at least with the UI and matchmaking that I don't particularly like. Let's say you're trying to join a race and you get automatically queued to be in a race where someone made a map that's literally a loop. There's no way to leave that match besides joining a new online session which sounds insane to me. The last thing I would ever want a game to do is force me to play something I really don't want to play. This can be incredibly frustrating when you're trying to play deathmatch and 90% of the time you get custom maps where it's just a box and you literally stand around and shoot at each other. How is this fun? I also have a problem with the apartments. They don't really add anything to the gameplay. Why is my character showering? Why is my character watching TV? They spent more time making this game realistic than they did making it fun.But I still recommend it because when it lets you have fun the fun factor is pretty amazing.

review: This game was great the first few weeks after the PC release.Single player is great multiplayer is even better but the game became riddled with cheaters and as is it is pretty much unplayable. Today's sessions which led me to uninstall the game (different sessions) * someone gave me 5 million money which made the game pointless* person travelling with superspeed (overcoming on foot me in a jet)* several people with god mode* several instances of people instakilling everyone around the map* several instance of self exploding when in a jet or when entering the military airfieldand these are just some that I knew were going onAdditionally * the game has great number of different modes but except for racing it is seldom possible to fill a lobby* low level players get invited to heists which they can't pull of* loading times are out of this world constant searching for lobbies returning from lobbbies etc.I liked this game but knowing how the game experience turned out I would not recommend it for more than 30EUR or so

review: GTA V I needed roughly 18 Hours for all Missions without doing many sidethings and I really enjoyed it. The Characters are great well made and solid. The comedy is ing great either the radio or the characters or random dudes standing at the side of the road I ing love listening to these little conversations. The missions are also great full of humor but still good to play. Everything seems polished and yes there are some glitches here and there but for nearly 18 hours with 4 6 glitches and bugs for a game of this size is complety ok and these dont even destroy gameplay. Driving is awesome police is to say the least lame but whatever the heists are great. From Repo to Business... love it! GTA V is more for someone who likes a story and some good missions less fun is there to have when only roaming. Online on the other hand is a cluster and I dont like the long loadtimes of sometimes up to 3 minutes and then waiting for someone to join which incedently is a troll and crashes the heli. Thanks bud... otherwise also great.

review: It's GTA V I've played it on PS3 and I bought it again to play with a friend on PC with the heists finally announced back in the days. title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So... you decided to get GTA V. You paid up the ridiculous amount of $69.99 (Canadian Dollars) despite it being out for around 4 YEARS. You get in single player for the first time then play the first mission... It looks amzing and you are having lots of fun. You arive in Los Santos after playing the prolougue mission thing.After you've done some missions you stand around for a while near a police officer then the police officer gets angry at you and shoots at you for no reason except maybe loitering? &gt _&gt Then you try and escape in your max upgraded super car but unfortunatly for you they have a insane boost and keep up with you.You finally get away from them very far away. You think your safe then *POOF* they use their intersteller warpdrive transmissions they aperrently have and they're on the road ahead of you.You fly through storymode and realize how short single player is compared to other GTA games.You are dissapoint now.You see Online and you click it you enter a room where your character creation starts with horrible options.Finally your done and you arrive in Los Santos with your plain character that looks like everyone else.After that you get to choose your crapy cheap starter car.After a bunch of begginer missions and crap you decide to buy some clothes.You paid $1000 Dollars for a pair of pants...You get blown up by a flying in a jet/helicopterAfter you've leveled up some and got better at shooting crap you decided to do your first heist.A nice car! you steal a Infernus (Nice sport car) You bring it to your garage and get a notifacations saying you need to buy this car from the internet... you are dissapoint (Agian)Some time after you've completed all heists you put money into a CEO office you get the cheapest one cause the others are really expensive.After you spent a fortune on a CEO office you yet again need to spend a lot of money on a warehouse.Unfortunatly you've decided to buy a shark card to buy more usless junk and cars that you're not even going to use.A person calls you on your cell telling you about buying a bunker. They sound like a c**t you hang up on them ten minutes later that c**t calls again you hang up on them again.You've been playing online for a while now as a CEO you've been grinding special cargo missions yourself for hours at a time and then selling the special cargo yourself for a dissapointing amount of $112 000. after many days of grinding and selling you almost have enough to buy that stupid thing you've always wanted then somone blows you and youre special cargo up. You are very mad now you join a different sesion and get back that cargo and sell it again. But then you get blown up again you get cargo back you try again you fail... You are furious after. You throw your controller to theground and slam your headphones on the table and you quit the game and you quit multiplayer tired of grinding and buying shark cards. Then you question why you played Online in the first place and why you wasted all that time and money only to quit. And if you join you only have a choice between SHARK CARDS or GRIND.Then you delete it out of your steam to save space with nothing left to do in that game.LADIES AND GENTLEMEN I Present To You Grind money and legally buy cars simulator _ This has been a review (or whatever the hell this is) By the Sammich ( ಠᴥಠ) ﾟ.*

review: Product received for free. Awesome game....not a masterpiece.First off the game is great. Good graphics and audio fun open world gameplay and tons to do. However i would not call ot a "masterpiece" as IGN states. A masterpiece imo (everyone has their own dont get salty) a masterpiece should have memorable characters and an unforgettable storyline as long as an enjoyable multiplayer. In GTAVs case..the story is lackluster and the multiplayer is filled with hackers that rockstar has done nothing about. Also optimiazation is pretty poor and requires quite a hefty rig to run smoothly at good frame rates. Lastly singleplayer is definately not as much fun after a while. All in all ita a great game but with its flaws.....its not a "masterpiece".

review: It's a really fun and good game if you play the singleplayer. Lot's of things to do and you'll even create you're own fun by discovering some really cool things. I've played the single player for about 50 hours now.But i would strongly recommend not buying this if you want to play the multiplayer. It's too broken to play modders are ruining the online experience and some bugs never get resolved. If you're lucky you'll get a lobby with no noticable modders (meaning they don't blow you up when you step outside your appartment) and have some fun with the people playing with you. If you are gonna play this in a private lobby with friends however it's a must buy.So i wouldn't recommend buying it for now untill the multiplayer gets fixed.Singleplayer 9/10Multiplayer 5/10

review: Absolutely worth the 18 months wait for Rockstar to polish this gem for the kind of hardware available on PC. The first person mode is an unfortunately narrow field of view but I'd always preferred to play GTA in 3rd person anyway. Online is actually being "policed" as it were by Rockstar to keep cheaters from ruining an otherwise great multiplayer experience. One of VERY few games I was willing to pay full price for and I would do it again.

review: Absolutely perfect. As good as it was on the consoles this is the polished perfected version of the game. We had to wait but it was worth it. I bought it day 1 and I've absolutely loved it ever since. With a GTX 760 and a 3.3ghz quad core processor I can run the game 90% maxed out. Anything less and you're selling yourself short. The graphics are incredible.

Online mode can be a bit rough around the edges but has greatly improved since it first became available on the previous generation consoles.On a side note it runs suprisingly well even on more limited machines albeit with downgraded graphics it still looks good which it nice because I can play it on my laptop and still have fun.

review: With over 100 hours in this game on PC and over 500 hours in total I think I've played enough of this game to give a thorough review. Please take note I will be reviewing for multiplayer and that it is my own perspective on this game. Pros So the game itself is pretty great. There are tons of things you can do in this game. Fly small planes that can only fit you and your buddy to planes that can fit the whole lobby and even a jet that can make a lobby frightened or more encouraged to fire a rocket at you. Getting high of a bong at home or getting drunk on beer on the streets then driving a supercar drunk. Taking a boat out onto the endless sea and getting lost biking up on mount chilliad (or skydiving to there) having races around Los Santos chasing the train trying to get on the train and not die and even having a brawl with someone on top of maze bank. The possibilities are almost endless. The graphics are also very nice and the cars oh yes the cars look extremely good. First person also makes the game more immersive and challenging. The AI people of San Andrea's give funny reactions and the customization for your character isn't bad either. Also to mention the smallest details in this game are fantastic.Cons Despite being an exciting game with a variety of activities available there are a few things that cannot be overlooked. First thing is how difficult it is to make money if you're new to GTAV Online. Right now the easiest way to make money is to grind missions. However if you're new to GTAV Online your low level kind of restricts your access to missions that give high pay and good rp (usually from 10k 25k). Heists give a good pay but half the time it will take a couple tries to complete just one. Not to mention how long they take. So essentially if you want to get a 10 car garage and a fast car asap then you have to grind missions. Which brings me to my next problem with the game. As I said earlier grinding missions is the easiest way to make money. The pay is also a bit higher if you're doing it with more people and if it takes longer than usual. For example if I do Rooftop Rumble (mission) by myself i get only 12k but if I do it with 3 other friends its around 15 17k (dependin on how long it takes). However with the prices of the coolest vehicles and armory right now it takes A LOT of grinding for those. Before the most recent update came out the most expensive super car was 1 million dollars. However now there is a car that costs practically twice as much. And now let's do some math. Let's say you wanted this 1 million dollar car by grinding missions by yourself. Each mission on average takes around 15 minutes if done without fail and properly. And each mission pays around 12k. This means it'll take around 80 missions which equals approx 1250 minutes (20 hours) just for that super car. How about heists? Heists it's a little different because it's a team effort and you can't screw up at all or you'll have to start over. From my experience most of the time you'll end up having to restart it once or twice and it'll take around 30 45 minutes to complete one even with your buddies. But if you have friends to play heists with do it it'll be worth your time more than grindng missions. There is another way to make money other than grinding. Shark cards or in other words purchasable GTAV Online Cash. However in my opinion these are crazy overpriced. A $20 Sharkcard can get you $1 250 000. As much as it seem in the beginning this money will run out IMMEDIATELY with the price of cool stuff in GTA. So in the end they aren't that worth. A million dollars can only afford a high end apartment with 10 car garage a sports car and maybe a basic helicopter. Even the $100 dollar sharkcard run out pretty quick with all the expensive cool stuff you can buy. In other words the game itself is worth 4 million GTAV cash ($50 + $10 Sharkcard) which shows how unbelievably overpriced sharkcards are. Other Stuff You Should Know About Finally hackers. They are rampant in GTAV Online. Probably half of the lobbies you will enter will have a hacker in it discreet or not. And I'm also pretty sure that at least 30% of the GTA PC community knows how to mod. So you will see flying boats explosions all over the city strippers with shotguns spawning around the streets and maybe JUST MAYBE if you're lucky their minigun's will fire money instead of bullets. Other than that it'll be cloudy with a chance of money bags. Have fun dealing with godmode.Final Thoughts This game is a Eh.... mainly because of it's current state right now and how closely it resembles the structure of a classic mmorpgI would only recommend buying this game if you have friends to play it with. If not then this game should not be worth $60 buy it on sale.6/10 great game but lacks balance

review: Been playing this game since it came out on PC and have 1 305.5 hrs of playtime. PLayed story mode twice after first run through went to online and to me online is better and now mainly play online. Have over 90 friends met through the game so now have an idea of who will follow through on missions.Got rained on with money over a year ago just quit server and avoided a ban which was not my doing anyway...nowadays i hear they are very strict on that so if it were to happen again would just quite the server i am on again. I prefer to buy a shark card from time to time and well worth it to play for a weekend plus plenty of money to be made from missions so why complain?Hackers are a PIA sometimes. For example just got my car out from being wrecked and was going to mod shop pull up to door and get exploded by a hacker who then flew away like a rocket...slight inconvenience since just had to repeat the process...honestly dont understand why people hack...and "hack" may be the wrong term.That said graphics are very good even on my GTX670 just lower resolution below 1920 and was able to increase some settings and there are youtube videos to explain that more and what to adjust. No problem for me as not ready to upgrade my 2012 video card just yet so could not be happier.The game did get me to buy a steam conmtroller just for the driving and it was worth it as well as all controls while driving are editable and only need the controller with some modifications to the buttons am able to do everything i need.Sum it up in one word FUN )ETA It would be awesome to add a full out DLC that extends original story mode i thought the story was amazing for a game and add new missions real missions in online mode and would be worth the price of game...iow's why bother with a GTA6 and make it a continuation since the game is too extravagant as is and the map graphics still hold up...imop.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: On one hand it's one of the best games I've ever played with some of the finest characters to ever appear in video game the best set pieces since HL2 amazing missions and buttery smooth graphics and game play. Trevor is amazing though he would stand out more in a world not entirely populated with foul mouthed psychopaths and Franklin does a good job as Ice Cube from Boys in the Hood. Michael's horrible family and his own dysfunction is amazing and hilarious. Los Santos is the most vibrant exciting lived in open world I've ever experienced. It looks SO MUCH like LA.On the other hand it's as insecure as a fifteen year old edgelord trying to grow a goatee so he can shave lines in it like the cyborg from Deus Ex as concerned with being "extreme" as a decade old Mountain Dew commercial makes a torture minigame unskippable and it hates women so damn much that it shows a skull ed Teddie Bear more compassion dignity and character development than the entire gender.Triumph and tragedy all in one Rockstar.

review: The SP is quite good though i still prefer the one character story line to be able to "connect" (?) with the character...Online it's not bad at all guys you have lots of things to do and a nice feature is that you can play in the online world by your own haha I mean of course you can play online alone but you can also "host" a private "server" (no extra software needed) to play with your friends ONLY or people that you can invite or your crew or whatever and log in to public servers when you just want to mess other players up jobs can be launched and taken from any server public or private and still open the matchmaking or close it regardless of which server you are so you can still play jobs with random folks while being safe from being trolled or killed by a hacker though after the job you MAY be placed in a public server it's just a case of going back to SP and back to private Online or use Passive Mode which won't protect you from hackers but it will from trolls besides if you are planning on doing another job it shouldn't bother you if you are exploded by a hacker... you'll be gone in no time... If you like the GTA you should buy it but beware that online is kind of a little tiny bit bugged very playable though...

review: First of all Hi! 3So i decided to write this review now even the game is now almost 5 years old.So i really like the story ... Nah I LOVE it. The story mode is unbelievable good and i think if you finish it you will think that too. But now we go on. I would recommend you to buy this game ONLY during a sale. (I will explain why) But if you have active m8s who want to play with you really much than you can also buy it for the normal price.Why? Because of the online mode of the game. The online mode is splitted. Sometimes it can be the worst game ever sometimes its really cool and fun to play. So if you go into the online lobby it takes you much time to load the game completely but thats not the real proplem because its the same with the story mode. So if you are in the lobby you have different options for what you can do now. The best thing is to farm money. But how? So there the real proplem starts If you want to make an acceptable amount of money you have to do heists and thats not that easy because you need a crew and an apartment. The cheapest apartment cost 108.00$ if im right and to get that money you can do jobs over the online menu of the game. Most of the jobs are very cool some are so bad that you cant play them but most of them are cool and give a normal amount of money 10.000 32.000$. So if you farmed enough you can buy the apartment and do heists? No! You have to get 3 more people who play with you the missions. Otherwise YOU CANT PLAY THEM! If just one member left while the mission is running the mission stops and you have to load the WHOLE online part of the game again. (Good Pc 3 min). Then you can start to search for players again. ( Thats why a crew of 3 more people is necessary. But hey there are more options. You can also do heists where you CAN play up to 4 people but only 2 are necessary. Now you think Oh hey how cool thats much more worth it and you get even more money from it! O Yeah thats right BUT You need to buy an extra building for this which costs you at least 500.000$ or more. WHAT?! Yeah this is how GTA Online works nowadays. (So that was a little explaination from me. So some more information Cars and literally everything in GTA Online is overpriced AF! People are really salty and sometimes so annoying that you wanna smash you pc The loading time of almost every part of the game is just TOO long! You can get just a random ban (+ Your Char. Gets deleted) just because a hacker reports you with a bot army (This happened to me! &gt I had 250 Hours in online mode. I was lvl 120. And i just got banned for NOTHING + OF COURSE My Char got deleted) The anticheat doesnt work at all! The rockstar support is even worse!So my final reason to say this is a good game? Because if you play with friends and dont interact with cheaters you should have a perfect gaming experience. Also the storymode is the best of the game by far! I d recommend you to play the Story mode first then try the online mode otherwise you ll maybe lose your will to play this game. /So thats all. Overall a nice and interisting game. Good day! )
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is fantastic. The story is fun the gameplay is great and the multiplayer rocks! I've purchased this game at release on console then again on a "next gen system" and finally once more on PC. I've got well over 100 hours into the game. 100%'d the story mode over level 100 in multiplayer and had some of the best moments in any multiplayer experience EVER with 3 of my friends doing heists. It's a few years old but has one of the best open worlds of any game i've ever played and it's constantly being updated still in 2018. If you like shooting driving or ragdolling down mountains please do yourself a favor and play this game.

review: I'd love to describe what I liked about this game but I really can't since it's been more than two days and I can't even play the stupid thing past "Grand Theft Auto V has exited unexpectedly...." Rockstar has completely ignored my help ticket and hasn't even released a statement acknowledging that they recognize the issue let alone are working to fix it. I've tried every reasonable and crackpot fix to be found short of fully reformatting and reinstalling my OS which I'm unwilling to do to play a single game. Worse yet these are all user generated fixes because and I can only assume this is true Rockstar is too busy pointing at a bunch of suckers (i.e. their customers) and dying of laughter (read choking on our money) to take ten minutes to draft a form post. It's not as if I'm the only one with this problem given the number of complaints and help requests I've seen on reddit Rockstar support forums and around the various "fix" websites I'm reasonably sure a fair number of gamers are experiencing the same exact issue. I'm going to let it reinstall a third time overnight but I'm leaning heavily towards asking for a refund. Out of ten friends (including me) on steam who have this game I'm the only one with this issue but if you ask me a 1 in 10 chance of not having your game work is too high.

review: Let me first put this into perspective The game itself is extremely good and I would recommend buying this game ON XBOX ONE/360 or PS3/PS4. Do NOT buy the PC port of this game until they do some SERIOUS patching because every single time I tried to play either story mode and GTA Online the game would cause my PC to crash and go BSOD. I have the latest drivers installed on my PC my specs are more than enough to run GTA V and yet every time I try to play the game it crashes and I get a BSOD message. I've tried lowering my graphic settings running it in windowed mode using compatability mode running the game as an administrator and yet it still crashes and I get the BSOD.I went to Rockstar to see if I could get some help only to find out that others are experiencing the same thing they are also having their games crash and lead to a BSOD. "It's one thing if a game freezes and crashes but it is another thing when the game takes my whole computer down with it! This isn't just a game breaking bug but a possible computer breaking one!"This guy CombatDurable in the Rockstar comments section stated perfectly how I felt because this game is causing my entire system to crash and could possibly end up damaging my PC if I continued so I had no other choice but to ask for a refund.My honest opinion is that you should hold off on purchasing GTA V for the PC until Rockstar patches all of these issues because there is seriously a problem here if GTA V is causing myself and other people's systems to crash and go BSOD.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: (updated at the end)A solid port not much better than console version but run smoothly ... as long as you dont mind Rockstar's ing social club. Nothing more exhilarating than twisting your thumbs while staring at the loading screen for hours since the game cant load past SC's authen check. On gameplay Single is ok as expected of a GTA game. Multi is okayish but somewhat misleading. The famous open world GTA is known for is no more than a glorified lobby every match brings you to a separate match instance. Nothing new since the game is already 2 years old but if you are like me who didnt bother reading up on the game before purchasing its something to reconsider.update 1 third day in and the game still refuses to load past the initial loading screen. This pile of is officially the worst purchase in my collection after Rome II total war. If you can dont buy it but pirate it. A port is still a ing port.update May 7th Rockstar have updated their EULA You agree not to .. reverse engineer decompile disassemble display perform prepare derivative works based on or otherwise modify the Software in whole or in part Although they issued a statement claiming no ban for single player modding We ll have to sit and wait to see how things turn out. TL DR thằng nào ngu thì mua game này crack khác đéo gì.

review: GTA V Singleplayer ReviewFirst Draft Version 1Clocking out at 102 hours at the time of writing and this without any GTA Online counted as I have not yet started Online even once.IntroductionTo be fair Grand Theft Auto needn't a big introduction to most people as it is a huge and ifluential title. But nontheless I shall give it a quick rundown. So what is Grand Theft Auto V? Well some people say it's a sandbox. Some call it a quasi actionrpg. Some just stick with third person shooter. And non is really wrong either it takes elements from most genres and bangs them together to make them work. And they really do. It's a game that gives the player immense freedom you can either go full psycho and kill everything that moves steal cars kill animals and so on or you can go play golf. This is just an example but the stark contrast is there. And this is the thing that makes 'GTA' one of the most successful franchises of all time. The freedom of doing whatever the hell you please is a satisfying thing indeed. Story (Spoiler free)In this game you're introduced to three protagonists a "hood gangster" a retired bank robber and well frankly a psychopath. In a series of events these three become connected and their three seperate stories become entwined into one in one of the most interesting ways I personally have ever experienced in a video game. At first I was not very impressed in fact but that might be because you start off as humble as this game gets a gangster. This alone is not a problem but I was generally put off by the fact that what felt was every third word was " ". And yes I am aware that this games plays on stereotypes and that in fact it is very common but it still felt silly after 5 minutes. Get past the small things however and youll find a rich and fleshed out story set in a great setting with immaculate attention to detail.MiscAs I mentioned in the introduction there is for example golf to play. Well that's not all. There's all kinds of side activities ranging from street racing to tennis from hitting money transports to getting "attention" in gentlemen clubs. It's a universe filled with things for you to do things to occupy you and this is one of Grand Theft Auto V's greatest features.Pros Great combat. Immersive gameplay. A ludicrous amount of features. Extreme attention to detail. Fleshed out story. Fun side activites. It's able to mix humor and seriousness in a way only Rockstar can do. Great music. Superb customization for both vehicles and characters. Impressive graphics. Near perfect voice acting on almost all characters (including pedestrians and random AI)Cons Some dialog feels a bit forced. I personally encountered bugs when tabbing out of the game crashing it but this might be due to other issues. During my 102 hours of gameplay my game crashed thrice. This is not as much as of a con as a general "fyi info". Flying controls suck really bad. If a cutscene is accidentally skipped I found no other way than to kill myself to cancel the mission and then restart it from the beginning. As you can tell most of these are really just nitpicking. The only real problem I had with this game was the flying controls. Flying helicopters was just the most infuriating thing I did in this.SummaryIt's bloody brilliant. Definately in the top ten best games of all time. When I finished the story at 83 hours in I couldnt stop myself from keep playing. Yet I found another 20 hours before I felt I could say that I am done with the singleplayer. And I have not even completed it to 100% yet. So do I recommend it? Maybe a tiny little bit. Maybe a tiny tiny little bit. Buy it if you like good games. I'm done here.

review: Despite many negative reviews due to shaky performance 'unjust' bans and plenty of bandwagoning I absolutely love this game. Always loved the core Online experience already put at least another 100 hours into it. Haven't experienced many bugs myself. Not one to complain about load times especially after coming from Xbox which was abysmal compared to this. YES the fact that Online is Peer To Peer is pretty BUT I haven't experienced THAT much go wrong with it however I look forward to dedicated servers.Story is excellent as always. Soundtrack is superb both the numerous radio stations and the OST. Great performance at High Very High on a moderate rig. (i5 3570K GTX660Ti 8GB RAM 1866).If you're not going to buy this game purely because of Rockstars 'stance on modding' you're cheating yourself out of a great time.

review: I don't understand the uproar over all of this. The game came out on PC less than two months ago and it's not like Rockstar is required to participate in the summer sale. You can buy the game on its own for its original price which is reasonable given how recently it came out. So instead of lowering the price (again NOT SOMETHING THEY ARE REQUIRED TO DO) they bundle it with older games and in game money for the same price. Still people are upset because the bundle redeems the cash card and makes it non refundable. However less than a month ago Steam refunds weren't even possible so I don't see this as Rockstar's fault. They didn't create the refund system. So why are they pairing the game with these things instead of other in game content? Maybe because all of the DLC they have created so far has been FREE.Honestly they are constantly releasing free updates to the game including weapons missions usable items clothing vehicles etc. again ALL FREE and people are upset that the price didn't go down?+ FREE DLC (new content still being released!)+ New playing perspective (FPS mode including detailed and functional vehicle interiors/dashboard)+ HD retextures for virtually all models+ New side missions for single player+ Increased foilage and wildlife+ Acutally decent console to PC port (few if any glitches)+ Even small details have been given improvements (camera filters more vehicle mods extra radio stations etc.)+ Can record and upload clips of gameplay+ And just like before the next gen port a generally fantastic game (story gameplay voice acting interactivity etc.)/ Graphically demanding game. If you're unsure about being able to run it buy the base game and test it there get a refund and get a bundle if it works Rockstar Social Club DRM. A pain to set up initally fortunately automatic after first loginPersonally I don't get the crap people are giving Rockstar for this. Yes it sucks that bundles are unrefundable but there's nothing greedy or "shady" about creating bundles with the only DLC that they don't give you for free. Yet the reviews are being flooded with negative reviews because people don't like the content that Rockstar is giving out for free for buying the game.

review: Was excited to play this game and got it to run on my Asus X55LA Specs Intel i7 processorIntel HD 5500 graphics Integrated Graphics (I know.. Not the best)8 GB RAMWin 10 OSHDD 1 TBA pretty solid laptop.Now I'm aware that my graphics aren't strong enough for the game but I'm able to run pretty graphically demanding games like FC3 L.A. Noire Life is Strange The Sims 3/TheSims4 and even Telltale games on medium high settings without any problems. In addition I did a couple things to make it run well and it does work on relatively normal low settings with pretty good fps and no lag/stutter. But my problem is that it overheats my CPU to 80 100 % within a couple minutes of gameplay especially when driving! I havent been able to play ONLINE and even get past the mission with the black guys in Single Player mode because of this. I've done just about anything in the book! I tried getting a game booster like Razor Cortex and disabled turbo boost by changing the power settings under "power options" and ended some tasks in the Task Manager but nothing seems to work! It still overheats my CPU and crashes! I don't know what to do but I guess I can say that this is a very fun game (I used to play it on the PS3 so I know what it can do) but if your laptop isn't well equipped for this game please save yourself some money and don't buy it. Do NOT listen to those people in the YouTube videos that show how GTA works on Intel because that doesnt matter when all it does is overheat your CPU. You need a VERY good graphics card to play this game without crashing.

review: DO NOT BUY THIS GAME it's turned to So Take 2 have done the unthinkable they stopped they have practically stopped modding on GTA V I like many others love this game because of the flexibility it gave me when it comes to modding I added hypercars graphics mods multiplayer mods and much much more to make this game that more entertaining and fun.If you are going to buy this game just to mod or just to play online with friends and I strongly urge you to stop this game ain't worth it because it's turning into a major cash cow for a large corporation and what they have done now has practically made a franchise stop being for the fans but instead it for the money now and it truly in sucks. If you do buy this game you will be probably be playing the standard online mode from now on and it sucks. Every online DLC has been over priced since the PC release in 2015 and its just been getting worse online money in this game is hard to freely accumulate to purchase the latest ingame vehicle clothing and whatever else. They have even made it so that if you have so many cars and you want to sell a bunch of them there is now a limit on how much you can sell and when you exceed that limit you risk getting banned for doing nothing. The current system often forces people to have to spend real life money around the $30 to afford some of the content and it's just sad to see this happen to a game that many of us loved. modding was a way of getting passed that and just having good old fun offline without it you just have a very basic game that's just overpriced and no longer for the fans and sad that the game has turned to

review: In the main story Trevor tortures Michael this is some information on torturing Torture is the act of deliberately inflicting severe physical or psychological pain and possibly injury to an organism usually to one who is physically restrained or otherwise under the torturer's control or custody and unable to defend against what is being done to him or her. Torture has been carried out or sanctioned by individuals groups and states throughout history from ancient times to modern day and forms of torture can vary greatly in duration from only a few minutes to several days or even longer. Reasons for torture can include punishment revenge political re education deterrence interrogation or coercion of the victim or a third party or simply the sadistic gratification of those carrying out or observing the torture. The need to torture another is thought to be the result of internal psychological pressure in the psyche of the torturer. The torturer may or may not intend to kill or injure the victim but sometimes torture is deliberately fatal and can precede a murder or serve as a form of capital punishment. In other cases the torturer may be indifferent to the condition of the victim. Alternatively some forms of torture are designed to inflict psychological pain or leave as little physical injury or evidence as possible while achieving the same psychological devastation. Depending on the aim even a form of torture that is intentionally fatal may be prolonged to allow the victim to suffer as long as possible (such as half hanging).

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Look this is not a game it's an experience a premium one at that. GTA V is like playing a movie. I'm not going to review the Online portion that did not appeal to me at all. The single player campaign is where it's at for me and let me explain to you why I feel the game overall fell flat.The story can't be faulted terribly. It's interesting at times but lacks urgency. I never get the feeling that my characters are ever in any real danger and mostly because Trevor's campaign starts off with him doing crazy over the top antics that nothing after feels believable. I do appreciate it for being very much like a movie. As the ending credits rolled it very much felt like I'd witnessed something similar to a true Hollywood gangster movie like Casino. I didn't feel challenged by this game. Some games don't need to be challenging but I felt like a better game could have been had if they had only made it somewhat of a challenge to get money and to steal special cars for your own use. The city portion of the map felt small particularly the downtown area. Sure looking over it at night looks pretty but then after a moment you realize wow the suburbs are precariously close to those sky scrapers. In constrast the outdoors portions were too big and boring to drive down after a couple goes. The game needed more talk show radio stations. I didn't enjoy many of the tracks provided on the radio stations. I enjoyed Sleeping Dog's radio more. I even wound up looking up some Sleeping Dog tracks on youtube something none of the GTA V songs compelled me to do.The main antagonist is weaksauce. He's goofy sure but really weak in terms of creating urgency for our characters. Once again you never really feel threatened. If you ask me Sleeping Dogs was the better game and I can't believe more people don't give that game a chance. Not only do we get a fresh setting in a beautifully realized Hong Kong but we also get a much better game as well in nearly every respect. Oh and GTA V sucks just for how easy it is for your car to disappear. Cars should simply have been saved on separate files and only lost if you destroyed them or sold them.But even still I'll recommend this game because there is fun to be had. Just... buy on sale like I did.

review: Update 6/19/17 Some new ideas have come to my attention if they end up being confirmed then the game does not deserve a negative review from me just because the companies involved have to keep their plans secret in order to stay a step or two ahead of GTA online hackers. I will update this review again once I am satisfied that I will be able to explain the theory I have been presented with (Which justifies the Open IV situation so far) in a clear and understandable way.Original Review 6/16/17 There are many games where a large portion of the playerbase enjoys the modded experience. This is one of those games and thanks to Take Two Interactive all single player mods based on the Open IV modding tools (The most prominent set of modding tools) are now considered to be hacking the game. The policy is a sledgehammer being used to get a dent out of a totaled car it is going about it in all of the wrong ways. I won't iterate what has happened here as it has been explained in hundereds of reviews already (Nerd Cubed explains this situation quite well) so I will not be reiterating it here. Take two Please spend a bit more time thinking about how to fix the online multiplayer hacking before just making a blanket "fix" that does not target the real issues and rather just ticks off the majority of the playerbase. Iterate VERY clearly what aspects of modding are allowed and not within GTA V and GTA online and maybe work with the modders (crazy thought right?) to start fixing GTA online hacking. Once something has been done to my satisfaction (An Apology clear rules for modding a plan for dealing with both current and future hacking no laying blame on any one employee or department) and then I'll be more than happy to drop my negative review.Now for an actual review Single player campaign is honestly close to perfection I cannot be happier about the many hours I sank into following these character's stories all the way through to their completion. Each is unique and prvides a hilarious spin on the sterotypes of people that live in California (being from California I can confirm the accuracy of the map but not of the sterostypes which are highly exaggerated) There is more than enough ways to earn money and I personally enjoy the stock market mechanics and being able to buy up buisnesses and homes accross San Andreas and then fill them with a lot of shiney things. The only annoyances I can think of would be the submarine mission (If you've done it you know which one) and that a few story missions force you into some very uncomfortable situations. Outside of that I have almost only praises for the single player aspect of Grand Theft Auto V I think it is a genius satire of the California lifestyle and of the social structure in place in the represented area of the United States.GTA Online is a different story. . .I have read of many horror stories of players joining public lobbies and hackers immediatly causing them to be banned and then these players have to go through a nightmare of customer service in order to NOT regain access to their accounts all progress being lost forever. I have personally never encountered any of this so I cannot comment on these issues and wheter or not they may actually exist. The worst I personally run into are players that immediately shoot you at the end of a mission to mug you for cash and one occation where I joined a session and apeared to be stuck in a cage. (Screenshot of it is on steam) I do not have any close friends that I play GTA with consistently so I play with random players mostly and the experience working through jobs and heists is certainly fun. The missions can be creative and challenging and there is something memorable about almost every mission I have completed so far. (I'm only Level 23 so I'm not that far in) But attempting to amass large sums of cash for new vehicles or personal living areas or garages is certainly a grind. Obviously encouraging players to buy shark cards. (Fun fact you can get a real minimum wage job and buy more GTA money than you could earn by actually playing the game) Once i've gotten further into the online experience I'll return and iterate on this portion further. But nothing is stand out awful from my experience and I can confidently say I have enjoyed my online experience overall.

review: This will be a 2 parter Gta Story Mode and Online.Story Mode The stroy in this game is awesome. In my first playthrough there was not a boring moment. I played it on the potato 4 times through and once on PC (mainly because I've been distracted by mods). It's truly a brillaint game. I think the map makes this game there are easter eggs everywhere and cool places to visit. A personal favourite for me is pimping up a kickass ride and going for a road trip across the map. It will entertain me for hours. The graphics are beautiful even on the lowest settings oh you have a bad computer? No worries! Just download a graphics downgrade mod. They're helpful if you don't have a good enough computer. Anyway back to point. The story is thrilling offering you to engage in stealth missions explosive missions air fights which include sniping pilots out of their chopper. There is high speed chases and even omre chaos. The 3 protagonists have some very intresting dialogue and you wont heistate to have a laugh from the monsterous activities of the psychopathic Trevor Phillips. This game is a MUST HAVE for any steam user. The gun mechanics are awesome and with a large variety there is something for everyones taste. The melee mechanics will have you screaming for the watch for hours and the car handling / aircraft handling is beautiful to drive/fly. An overall brilliant game. GTA Online Well. This has 2 sides to the argument. The cons there is always some driving in an armoured car killing noobs. There are quite a lot of hackers. The community isn't that nice (I guess killing hookers embraces anger of abusive parents?). Pros don't give a Load up a private session and play with friends. This game never ceases to entertain me. Me and my friends driving around saying we'll do a nice safe road trip which always ends up in death. It's brilliant and hilarious. As long as you have friends GTA Online is awesome. If you just plan on playing solo don't even bother. The heists are alright the races are alright. The main thing is messing around with friends.

review: Great game. Probably my favourite game on the PC right now. I have two main issues with this game 1) I have over 30 hours played and I've probably spent a good 30 50 minutes of that time in loading screens. The most frustrating thing ever is waiting for online to load for 3 minutes and then being sent back into story mode because you've failed to connect to an online session! Argh!2) The community. Setting up a heist takes hours because as soon as people find out it's only a setup they leave. People want to complete heists to make money but they refuse to put the work into the setup. Something definitely needs to be done about this.tl dr Awesome game! 10/10. Highly recommeded.

But quite honestly I don't think it should have been made for PC..I do recommend this game though it's a great game to have on any sort of device that it was made for I love playing it and I enjoy hanging out with my friends in it.. There's no reason to get this game what so ever.. Got the game for PlayStation/Xbox?? Sell it get money back and get this game for Steam cause it will be worth getting at the end of the day..

review: This game has a FOV (field of view) of around 85 (in first person of course) and this would be acceptable if you were to play the game on a TV at a distance however this is not high enough for most people who play at monitor and are much closer to it. While Rockstar has yet to offer a solution modders have already brought out mods that fix this problem which would be great! The problem is the game is banning people for using these mods even in single player. Rockstar either needs to fix their anti cheat to allow players to use FOV mods or they need to update their own FOV slider that goes above 85 to around 100 110 . As well as they must remove the bans they have on people who modded their game for a higher field of view. If you want to get the game believe me it is a fantastic game just be warned any type of modification for at least the moment will risk you getting banned (this does include single player as well).

review: This game feels extremely smooth and is one of the best sandbox games i have ever playedtl dr get this game!!!graphics 9/10i think that ac unity still have better graphics than this game but it is really hard to run at 60fps without a good gaming pc. and there are also lots of bugs in ac unity while there are less bugs in gta vthe reflections textures shadows godrays etc are really beautiful and there are times where i stop just to enjoy the view. at night or when it is raining the city becomes even more beautiful.Optimization 8/10i would have given it 10/10 if it worked for every pc that meet the requirements. it worked perfectly for me but not for some other people. as long as msaa is disabled pretty much everyone can run the game at higher settings. but the grass is an absolute fps killer though.gameplay 10/10really realistic really fun open world roaming lots of funny random events. the open world gameplay is one of the things that attracted me to this game in the first place.First person 5/10the first person gameplay for this game feels bad since gta v was not exactly meant to e a shooter game. i prefer 3rd person over first person but sometimes first person mode gives me a visual of interiors of cars which is sometimes a fun feature especially when i am in the back seat of a car.Story 8/10not completed with the story yet but it contains lots of fun events cutscenes and sometimes challenging missions. i think that more heists would be nicer though.Online 8/10while there is almost no story in online playing with other people is a really fun experience. but i hat it when there are people who keep screaming or singing annoying songs. but killing these people makes the gta online experience more enjoable.Comparison to other openworld next gen gameswatch_dogs gta v is way better than watchdogs even in old gen so watchdogs could not compete with gta v pcSaints row i think that the saints row games has better character customization than gta v but the graphics are nothing compared to gta v. i think that saints row(2 3 4) are at around the same level as gta but not gta vi can compare more games with gta v but i think that gta v will always be better.Overall rating 9.5/10gta v is worth the money but there are still some bugs in this game. if you do not want to experence the bugs or pay the full price you can always buy this game in the summer sale. but why wait?
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Online still has a fair share of bad apples that use ONLINE MODS that need to be stopped but so far I haven't face any issue online.Once again from all the modding community thank you Rockstar for the toughtful decision.
