review: Backdating and crypto hacking everyones PC's Rockjew games you and your capitalist corrupted views on your players But didn't surprised anyone most of them are jevvs and britsplaying their parlor tricks simulating another belief system within the game plot to get us on some wild goose chase as they continue to add into the plot years later which is stupid. I would but not really reccommend this game. GTA VI is going to be updayed a bit obviously But I know it's still going to be rigged as Like the red n blue coming after your character and they instantly spawn right next to you and boosted their cars to synchornized up to you in miliseconds. It's t rubberbanding that ruined it all. EA can go FU CK themselves for inventing/creating such atrosus garbage within a AAA Video Game. Same with Take two Interactive and backdating stock fraud motherchode Ryan Bryant CFO or whatever he is sneaking JEVV WOP BRIT.This is what it says about the investigation from this KlKE.______________________________________________2001 2006 Further acquisitions and regulatory investigationsWith Rockstar Take Two invested into developments of sequels to Grand Theft Auto including Grand Theft Auto 2 (1999) and Grand Theft Auto III (2001) along with spin outs Grand Theft Auto Vice City (2003) and Grand Theft Auto San Andreas (2004). By 2003 Take Two had revenues exceeding US$1 billion. In 2004 Take Two paid US$22.3 million to Infogrames for the rights to the Civilization seriesIn 2005 Take Two began a host of acquisitions spending more than US$80 million buying game developers.One of its largest acquisitions was for the development studios Visual Concepts and Kush Games from Sega for about US$32 million in January 2005. Both studios had been extensively behind several sports simulation games branded through ESPN and typically released updated versions each year using a 2K brand to differentiate versions (such as ESPN NFL 2K5). In 2004 Take Two had struct a deal with Sega to help publish these titles. Just prior to Take Two's acquisition Electronic Arts announced it had secured the exclusive rights to create video games based on the National Football League (NFL) and a fifteen year branding deal with EPSN effectively killing Visual Concepts' own NFL title and devaluing their others games. This decision led Sega to abandon the sports game market. Take Two acquired these studios and unique branding (including the 2K brand) as well as negotiated for exclusive rights with Major League Baseball for video games A day after announcing these acquisitions Take Two established their 2K Games publishing label to maintain the 2K brand moving several planned games from their budget software label Global Star to 2K Games. Take Two also established the 2K Sports operating within 2K Games to focus primarily on sports games. Take Two further realigned the other existing internal studios Indie Built Venom Games PopTop Software and Frog City Software and Take Two Licensing within this new structure.After the formation of 2K Games Take Two completed other major acquisitions. Firaxis Games was acquired in November 2005 for around US$27 million 25 Take Two had already supported the studio by using their acquisition of the Civilization license to support publishing of Civilization IV. Irrational Games was acquired around January 2006 for about US$10 million including both its Boston and its Canberra studio. At the time Irrational had already established a publishing deal with Take Two for their upcoming BioShock game. With the deal Irrational became part of the 2K Games label. It also acquired PAM Development from the Gaia Capital Group for US$11.4 million giving them access to the Top Spin series of tennis games.However during this period the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) had begun examining Take Two's business records based on complaints filed from 2001 that Take Two's earnings did not seem to match figures of game sales reported by NPD Group. The SEC's formal complaint found the company had purported sold product to distributors as a "parking transaction" for a quarter as to artificially increase their revenues for investors which it estimated was a US$60 million fraud. After SEC's issuance of the complaint in 2005 Take Take agreed to pay the US$7.5 million fine along with Brant and other executives paying fines totaling around US$6.4 million. However prior to that Brant had already stepped down as CEO to remain as chairman through 2004 after which he became Vice President of Production as he had been barred by the SEC from serving as an officer or director of a publicly traded company. Brant ultimately resigned from the company in October 2006 following a four month disability leave due to a bad backA separate investigation by the SEC found further issues with Brant and two other executives of the company in 2007. In an industry wide sweep against options backdating (receiving shares when they are priced high but backdating their ownership to when they were priced low) the SEC had found Brant had received backdating options of over 2.1 million shares though he had excised all options upon his 2006 resignation. Brant pleaded guilty to falsifying business records but agreed to cooperate with the SEC and instead of receiving up to four years in prison was fined US$7.3 million and barred from holding any "control management positions" in a publicly traded company.Further troubling Take Two during this period was criticism and legal actions taken against the Hot Coffee mod a user made modification to Grand Theft Auto San Andres that unlocked a hidden graphic sex scene that was built into the game with concerned politicians and consumers stating the scene belied the game's ESRB content rating. Among actions taken against Take Two included an investigation by the Federal Trade Commission for deceptive advertising to which Take Two and Rockstar settled in 2006 on fines for any future violations of content ratings. Take Two completed a US$20.1 million settlement related to class action lawsuits filed against it in 2005 over the Hot Coffee mod as well as to a class action lawsuit brought by shareholders over the options backdating fraud in September 2009.SOURCE https //en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Take Two_Interactive

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Probably an unpopular opnion but not the best GTA IMHO.Let me first say that I am a fan of the GTA series having played all of them. My favourite was San Andreas. I did not warm to the characters in GTA5 and most of the missions were acually quite tedious. Its a bit like the UK program Top Gear its just got a bit long in the tooth for me.GTA has never had a good user interface for me when flying the helicopter and airoplane seem to work opposite to what I expect i.e. if I set the keys up to be intuitive for the helicopter then I simply cannot fly the plane and vice versa. Some people will sat that this is down to me and perhaps it is but I dont have the problem on Just cause2/3. Also the mission where my propellor plane is chasing a jet and supposed to catch it I never did manage to do. I had to skip that section after half an hour of trying. I guess the big attraction of GTA5 is GTA5 online. However because i was already bored by the time I finished the single player story I just did not have enough energy left to explore the online stuff. Again this review is just my opinion but if you are undecided then perhaps it will help.

review: So after quite a few hours of playing I have to say something about this game 1. Don t start playing solo get some friends who already got some know how and can help help you out e. g. tell you not to unintentionally buy the worst items you yould get. 2. This isn t a very good game. There are still many things that should be fixed not only the countless amount of hackers but also missing In Game features like selling apartments (of course with losing money but still...). E. g. when I bought the game bundle with a Megalodon Shark Card (8.000.000GTA$) the first things I bought were 1. the most expensive apt. (which is actually totally useless) 2. A volatus (basically a chopper which is pretty impossible to land at least for newbies) and 3. a few of the most expensive cars (after a few days of playing i already realized how crappy they look).So don t just buy only cuz it s looking good. Most of the time you won t be able to sell it even if there is an own R* Support section for that (which doesn t do anything at all).But still this is a very good game. I mean I probably don t have to say anything about the Story Mode it s basically awesome. You have so much features and the story line is prett good and it has a damn hard decision at the end )Well the online mode is like I said at the beginning a bit different. You will mostly witness little kids crying on voice chat and LVL400 players literally bombing you with their Hydras Rhinos and whatever they own. So until you reach a solid level or invest much money in the game get a group of players who can help you out. At the end counting all the mistakes of this game would porbably take forever so I m ending this thing here. Overall I can really recommend buying this game not because of the many flaws but because of the pretty much endless options you have in the game.

review: Updated 24/03/18 New Content Added Outdated part is moved to the end Here as a player who purchased 2 copies for online part of this game if you are new to this game and open to some advice my advice is If you love the game don't waste your time on online mode.Those who OP this game never care your time and effort spent on this game and never listen to you.I get banned for no reason and my 800 hrs spent on it were gone which is the reason I came here for a conclusion of my 1600 hrs spent on the game. Yes I am done with this game. And NO I will not buy a third copy to encourage this stupid company to ruin my experience for the third time.Fairly speaking this game is awesome. The single player part tells a wonderful story while the city is a great playground for big boys (and girls as well). I was addicted to the feeling driving supers speeding on the highway or flying jets over the city. It really built an illusion that you are some kind of "crime master" and that's why I chose to come back even I was expelled for "violating EULA" for the first time.But here is my whole story. I loved this game and I preordered it on the first day it came out. When I entered online mode in 2013 the open sessions are nearly full of cheaters. I was so envious about their houses and supers. At that time no sharkcards were on sale so I got my hands on some mods for easy in game money. I was banned twice for a total 5 weeks which I really deserved. Then I decided to start over clean. After one year playing without any modding or cheating suddenly I was banned pemenantly. I was shocked and reached out to the support department for help. However all I got were autoreplies YOU ARE BANNED AND NO APPEAL. Then I turned to some other TPS game like Tom Clancy's Division. But I still missed my time speeding in LS streets and I thought I got it because I made my mistake touching the online modding (BTW that idea is so naive). I decided to start over with the help of my friends with a new account and be 100% clean no glitch no cheat all hard work. I kept an eye on the newswire to follow the latest discounts and bargain with supporter guys with some 500k GTA$ bug last Christmas or some mere 10% discount coupon. I keep myself away from crowded public sessions. I was even selling cargo last night till late. You guys tell me how can I be a cheater of something even close to that. But today I got banned again and my record was gone again. I reached out for support and all I got were autoreply again YOU ARE BANNED AND NO APPEAL. Fool me once shame on you. Fool me twice shame on me. I made up my mind keeping me away from any other future Rockstar works and you should probably do that too. DON'T BE IN LOVE WITH THIS GAME YOU WILL BE HURT. I kept my old comment down below it is written just after my third ban. I hope my story may help you save your money and time for more precious things in your life like exercise being with families or other games. Thanks for reading. Outdated content starts from here Rockstar has no real human employees.No man's company.Oh maybe there are still some survivers but the only thing they are doing is to sell more copies to the innocent players. updated 23/11/17 They keep adding vehicles that look fancy but cost a lot and recommend shark card for us.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Rockstar Games has been falsely banning many users for absolutely no reason. Not everyone who has been banned has hacked recieved hacked money or even been in the same lobby as a hacker. Several of my friends have been temp and perma banned by Rockstar for absolutely no reason. They did not violate the license agreement for the game. I would know this because I personally bought them the game and they installed it to play with me on GTA Online. They have been banned within a week or so of owning the game and Rockstar refuses to acknoweledge their ban and gives them a copy paste of their website FAQ. Here's the jist of what I'm trying to tell you. The singleplayer is a great. I like it. Multiplayer? They don't care about you. They don't like you. They won't care if you just bought the game or if you have literally thousands of hours on their game. They will ban you without appeal without reason and they refuse to list your reason saying it's private. I know that rockstar holds the right to suspend your privledges of using their online services but every single company I've used to play online lists the specific reason as to why you were banned and even gives you the chance to appeal said ban if you feel if your rights have been violated. Rockstar will not read this so I submit to you the reader do not buy this game to play GTA Online. Do buy it if you choose to play single player. Rockstar will sooner or later lose their fanbase because of this fiasco and they still refuse to acknowelege their own fan's complaints based on this system. I do not recommend this product based on Rockstar's mishandling of the current GTA Online situation. They have made millions of dollars from many loyal users and many of these users have not hacked at all. Ever. These users were banned based on a failure of an Anti Cheat system. If Rockstar were to read this I have but one thing to say to them directly I used to love your company and I too hoped that your company would continue to prosper however the mishandling the situation has resolved me to hope that your company sinks. I refuse to support your products now.Edit as of June 15th 2017 Take Two Interactive (Rockstar's Parent company) has decided to crackdown on singleplayer modding. This means that if you bought this game to use mods that require Open IV good luck. Open IV was discontinued due to a cease and desist that is poorly worded and has poor technicallity. This is a blatant attack on the community at large with the ultimate goal of the player caving from the singleplayer and forcing that player to play the GTA Online portion. They want you to buy shark cards just a mere few days after the CEO of take two said that the playerbase is not giving them (the publisher) enough money. What was not having the 4th best selling game in history not enough for you? Take Two Interactive has effectively shot themselves in the foot and has ruined their own credibility. I hope they understand the predicament the have gotten themselves into because this is one thing the PC gaming community in general will not allow them to get away with.

review: Honestly I've refunded 3 games before because of this for nitpicky reasons. But this cause is legitimate. I dived into the world of GTA online excited for a new start as a young illegal kingpin but I found that the only way to do this is by spending REAL MONEY!!!! I start up one mission and get kicked because I'm level 1. Eventually I do find a mission and wow I get $2000. This is not fun unless you micropurchase and I'm forced to play in invite only because literally every lobby I've been in has some guy running around in a UFO abducting me. 3 lobbies of these cheaters who either have some outrageous vehicles or can't die push me to going in a solo lobby. Fix these extensive online issues and Rockstar stop taxing so much for the damn DLC's and maybe I'll give this a purchase. I know that it took a hell of a lot to release this game but you charge 60$ for the game give me a break you don't need micropurchases. They wonder why so many people set up money lobbies well it's so damn hard to gain money! At the most you could gain 2mil every month if you play about 4 hours of missions everyday which isn't a lot in the online community. I'm dissapointed.

review: Online just isn't fun so avoid it. You can thank the community for that. There's just not enough of a penalty for people being the type of player that ruin a game. The story in this game was in my opinion pretty terrible. That being said it had it's moments. I remember the first heist mission in single player had me really excited about what the game had in store. I really thought to myself "this game is going to be amazing". It's all down hill from there. The strongest part of the game is being in single player and experiencing the city. Just traveling around free roaming is where the game shines. Interactions feel solid and the game mechanics are sharp. The game runs like a dream and looks great. I kind of wish the game had a single player create your own character and just a ton of individual quests like Skyrim or something. Toss out the nonsense story the game went with and just give a more general create your own adventure. Become a bank robber or a hitman or a vigilante whatever. They tried to tell a story and failed miserably so maybe next time don't try to tell a story and just let the player make their own. Make an actual zombie mode that would probably be fun. Add survival elements that you can toggle. Not everybody would want that but if I'm "living" in a city add in stuff like eating enough to survive needing sleep whatever else. What I'm saying is there is so much you can do when you create a city as large and interactive as the one they did. A lot of failed potential wasted on a story that was nonsensical and unengaging. And just to touch on the online mode maybe create user preferences for placing players. I wanted to play online to create my own character then build them up get an apartment whatever else. I didn't go online to have chaos mode when guys sit on top of buildings with rocket launchers and sniper rifles taking everyone out that they can see. Or some clown in a helo taking everybody out. Don't put me in that game because I'm simply going to turn it off and go play something else more fun. Maybe some people enjoy that gameplay and more power to them but put them all in the same game together away from me.

review: Incredible game!!First of all i want to thank my family especially allah for giving me the opportunity to play such a nice game (allahu akbar).This game may have some issues like don't get the promised 1.000.000$ at the end of a Heist but its still very fun and sometimes these issues makes you laugh even more. #FeelsBadManMaxGTA V Story Mode (MINI SPOILER)I haven't finished playing the story mode yet but i definitely can say that Rockstar made some ridiculous scenes like falling off the sky while you're high af. All of the characters have a unique playstyle it never gets boring ! *I love you Trevor*GTA V Online Can't say if this the most ever or the best thing. Here is a advise for you If you see a guy hacking money or doing some other stuff (flying around spawn you with every other player in the lobby on the same spot and instakilling you or spawn tons of planes so your PC/Game crashes) press alt+F4. You really dont want to get a 30 days ban and a complete character reset except it makes you horny.After i got a 30 days ban and a character reset for getting money by a hacker (unwanted) i started playing this again *facepalm*. The prices for some cars are silly but it also makes the car more "special" after you finally got it.To cut a long story short get some m8s to play this game!!111!!!!!1111!!!1PS I recommend this everyone! #DuLiestDirEchtDenGanzenScheißDurch? #iWantMy15minOfTimeBackPSS If i made any mistakes. I don't care dont correct me. My english teacher is a black sports teacher what do you expect? #bringdichumMax

review: Hhhmmmm...So I also own this game on PS3 and thought that the PC version of this (and since its been updated alot) will give me more and better of the following 1) Graphics....(yes) 2) Vehicles....(No) 3) Missions....(No) 4) Side missions.....(No) 5) General content......(No).Let me explain On PS3 and older generation devices you had lots of "special" vehicles when you bought a garage.....now you only have 1.There are no Bati 801rr.Other vehicles also removed from the game.The story (a VERY GOOD one) is still the same.No extra missions.No new content.No new or extra side missions.Except for the graphics the new generation GTA V was a step backwards for me. Pay more.....get less....If you want the nice cars and all the nice things we used to have on PS3.....then bad news. It's all ONLY available in online mode.And don't even get me started on the online mode thing!!!!!!They force you to play online which is not worth it at all then they also force all the stuff that will cost you REAL money down your throat.....nope does not work that way.I paid for a game that used to be very awesome and great fun to play and got a slap in the face!It would have been better if you kept it the same but why take away content????I bought this game for the great story and game play and the fact that I can do what I want when I want and how I want to NOT FOR THE ONLINE PLAY!!!!!I want to feel that I own that whole city and that I can do as a please.....not possible in online....And I am not playing online just to get the nice things we had for free on older consoles!If you own this on PS3 don't buy.If you have never played GTA V before buy it you will love it and never look back!But for the people that had this game before.....you will not be happy.I am truly saddened by the direction Rockstar is heading in with GTA V.

review: Great optimization for PC fun online play and well its GTA with $270 million dollar budget devopled by Rockstar North its a fun game. With a awesome story I played on the console and an free online mode while riddle with some cheaters. . . In my limited experince with 1 or 2 cheaters after 20 hours of online to date isn't bad to me. I feel guilty to say in both cases it was actually kinda of fun floating above Los Santos in car with two other dudes on mics taken on a crazy free roam ride with one.That all said the heists you perform the progression and customization of your character when you play online paired with GTAs whacky and crazy sequences of mayhem with others is great.I know GTAV didn't go on summer sale and instead Rockstar opted to retain the price give you $200 000 starting off cash if you did buy it during the sumer sale as model. Honestly I don't find that to be a big deal R* didn't want GTAV to be on the summer sale. And so isn't worth the negative reveiw as a game. You can buy it for $55.00 for the PC on Amazon right now if you'd like.

review: GTA 5 was already a stunning game but there was always a sense that Rockstar's ambitions weren't matched by the technology available on the PS3 and Xbox 360.The game would sometimes buckle under the strain stuttering along when the action got too intense while buildings textures shadows and residents would suddenly pop into view at the very last second.With these same sights now benefiting from a makeover on new consoles a return journey to San Andreas is too hard to resist.While these visual glitches haven't disappeared completely GTA 5 on new consoles performs at a much higher and more consistent level.Frame rates dip ever so slightly when you speed through the busy city districts and you might see the odd shadow or texture pop up a little later than it should but these instances are less frequent and harder to spot.The graphical upgrades are particularly evident when you take the time to walk around Los Santos and Blaine County as you get to appreciate the little details whether it's the puddles that form during a particularly severe thunderstorm or the way the new plants sway realistically in the wind.Increased draw distances something you really notice on higher ground makes it easier than ever to become lost in the game world. With more people populating the city and extra wild animals roaming the countryside GTA 5 feels more alive than ever. Being able to see this stunning landscape through the eyes of the protagonist makes the game world appear even more beautiful than before. We'd definitely recommend taking a trip to the Vinewood Hills and activating first person mode one of GTA 5's biggest new features to take it all in.First person is something that certainly benefits GTA 5 but doesn't necessarily revolutionise it a handy tool but one that isn't without its flaws.It's better for taking on a group of enemies in a wide open space but you'll struggle to see what's going on around you when behind cover in a tight corridor.It is however difficult to keep your bearings when you're chasing a bike that's weaving in and out of alleyways and it's hard to judge distances when you're engaged in a fist fight with a disgruntled pedestrian.Luckily it's quick and easy to switch in and out of first person so you can activate it when the situation suits you best. The game also makes clever use of the PS4's DualShock 4 controller in particular the touchpad light bar and speaker.The light bar for example will flash red and blue when the police are on your trail. It might sound gimmicky but is actually a helpful visual signifier when you're trying to escape their gaze and can't take your eyes off the road.Radio chatter and phone calls are now played through the controller's speaker which is a really nice touch and one that worked so well on games like Silent Hill Shattered Memories on the WIi as well as the PS4's very own Resogun. The touchpad meanwhile can be used to select weapons change radio stations and bring up a quick menu to check objectives and set waypoints. Being able to quickly check objectives came in particularly handy during some missions when we thought we were all clear but actually had to take out few stragglers before we could move on.That said having so many different functions set to what is essentially one button means that you'll sometimes mistakenly bring up a menu when you actually wanted to change perspectives.It's also difficult to quickly and accurately change weapons so it's probably better to just stick with the weapons wheel. Likewise the waypoint selection is limited so while players can set markers to various stores and activities missions are unavailable meaning that you'll still need to bring up the map from time to time.This year's release also launches with GTA Online out of the box giving users even more criminal and recreational activities to engage in when they fancy a break from single player.GTA Online benefits from new character creation options. Transitioning between single player and online is extremely quick and after a year of updates the online world is packed with jobs races deathmatches and items to purchase. Which also benefits from a higher player count with smoother action and improved visuals putting last year's launch woes to shame.That said Rockstar did a fine job of sorting the launch last year so we have faith that GTA Online will continue to provide fans with a compelling alternative to single player and a reason to keep revisiting San Andreas after the story has been exhausted.Speaking of the story mode it's slightly disappointing that there isn't any meaty additions to the campaign although Rockstar has introduced lots of smaller treats for returning players.Franklin for example is tasked with capturing the game's new wildlife for the Los Santos Tourist Board while Michael must explore the map to find a series of clues and solve a murder mystery.A host of new and returning vehicles further sweetens the deal including a blimp that can be dropped off to your location as well as a hatchet weapon that seems tailor made for the psychopath that is Trevor.These particular additions aren't enough to make up for the lack of substantial story updates but they do take advantage of GTA 5's greatest asset encouraging players to further explore the wonderful state of San Andreas.It's actually the radio that provides one of the most compelling reasons to return adding more than 150 new songs from artists as diverse as the Backstreet Boys Belinda Carlisle and Bone Thugs N Harmony.While the single player experience is largely the same the world in which it takes place is more beautiful than ever so you'll be astounded by the sights all over again.If however you've never visited Los Santos or Blaine County picking up GTA 5 on new consoles is a no brainer. This is the definitive version of one of the finest games of the last few years and one that better lives up to Rockstar's lofty ambitions. HGunified recommends Grand Theft Auto 5 to all Gamers who haven't played this gem yet to get GTA V ASAP. This is a MUST Get MUST Play and MUST Experience Game. (10/10)

review: This is one of the best open world sandbox games I have played. So what makes this game so special?Now the story felt too long and felt a bit rushed sure some parts were good but after finishin the story I was thankful that was over so I'll mostly be reviewing the online aspect of the gamePros free DLC's yep that's right Rockstar have made it so you don't have to spend a single centCrisp graphics that yes are a little outdated but still look good.Heaps of stuff to do from robbing cars to racing around the desert.decent amount of customization for characters including tattoos clothes and piercingssmall jobs are constently on in sessions so you have an easier time trying to find extra ways to make money great to play with friends just to muck around or get stuff done like heists etc.Cons Hackers/modders are still a thing in sessions dropping money wiping weapons in session etc. Rockstar have not fixed this and probably won't considering it has been like this since I bought this game roughly 1 or 2 years ago Some of the community can really be toxic and salty try to kill you just for the fun of it or because you might be a lower rank than them. (but this is like basically all games nowadays that have PVP)You will have to grind a lot of Heists and other missions/tasks to get enough money to buy decent stuff like appartments assets etc.Playing without friends makes this game a bit boring at times.However if you are willing to spend a bit of time getting enough money for the things that help you get even more money have friends to play with and find a decent session where people aren't trying to Kill On Sight (KOS) then this game can be somewhat enjoyable.

review: It's the best looking GTA until now lovely detailed and has great gunplay. But still I feel I have to symbolically not recommend this game. Because there are a lot of systems in the game that just make me shake my head. I.e. a bunch of minor things that are really annoying. Like not being able to disable auto centering when driving a car in third person. Or not being able to walk normally when using first person. Also that characters keep swapping their outfits or loosing weapons when it's not necessary.Then there's the lack of RPG elements (San Andreas) and progression outside of story missions. The game and gameplay is so unbelievably story driven. There's nothing meaningful to do that is tied to progression outside of them. The money you make in side activities is trivial as hell. So they're on a "pointless mingame" level that is fun once but doesn't motivate you. This game is really surprisingly linear for an open world game. Purchasable buildings beside the air port and tuning garage are mostly boring buildings in the world you can't really interact with or enter.A more serious gripe is the messed up vehicle storage system. The only way to save your stolen or for a lot of money bought cars is to put them into garages. So you take your car out for a mission and it forces you to leave it behind it's gone. If you accidentally get it blown up it's gone. Compound works inconsitently and your cars can even vanish from your garage. There's really no point in buying and tuning cars other than for taking them for a short and careful ride. Pointless.Also this game really is dumbed down in comparision to GTA 4. Pedestrian dying in one hit the police not even really trying to stop you by ramming (just stupidly follow you for the most part) etc. etc.It's still a good game and I'm actually recommending it if said things don't bother you a lot. But this sort of bullsh ite in a huge AAA title? Why..
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: As with every GTA title to date It's been made to impress and does exactly that. The single player campaign is flawless and deserves an expansion since the characters were too funny and that'll be that. Beutiful graphics too 10/10 there no doubt about it and i'm not even running full spec settings!!! still looks amazing.But with all good things it must unfortunately come to an end.....If you are buying this game for it's online features I wouldn't recommend it to anyone despite all it's posh new stuff.There are multiple reasons for it too For starters the community is very much toxic and it's favourite word is "noob".....big suprise....people also like to trash you're vehicle repeatedly kill you for no apparent reason and then ofcourse there's the modders which is fair enough game has mods both SP and MP ones but the hackers/modders have found a way to spawn money ontop of you which sounds as pleasant as can be......then you'll get banned.....120% true stuff.But why so many hackers/modders? i'll tell you why too.It's because alike what happens with every "Pay for just about everything" franchise........it already has a cancer rotting and festering within' it...........They call this cancer.....SHARK CARDS!!!! A legal way for already rich millionaire dev's to fleece you for everything you got cause you like to drive cars that look cool and be one of life's "big boys"......The hardline reality being that not everyone has this limited cache of real life money much alike everything is stupidly high priced to buy ordinarily on this game now. Even by grinding missions you're talking months to get and upgrade 1 vehicle because they made those a wreck too reducing actual rewards and then ramping up prices in game items.......So based on the fact that a lot of people don't have that endless time or money available what other choice do they have apart from to hack? ofcourse...........you guessed it!!!! &lt it's SHARK CARDS... 70 $150 of real life money (more than some average in a week pay).........for 8 million gta cash.........ummmmmm no.........that doesn't sound right.......cause paying that much and recieving that much might upgrade you a single car or 2 at the absolute maximum not taking into consideration all the other fabulous new features that are always just out of reach unless you can whip up plenty and lots of ker ching!!!!!So nope............pants nada..........not recommended.R* have messed this game up completely by over pricing everything it's just not worth it...
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Thumbs up 50% 50% Thumbs downwhy?Good pointsIncredible history mode.When you pay for the game you don't have to pay more.Free DLC's.Farming. You can get for ingame money every item or DLC extras.Fresh content each 1 3 months.Event's special items and minigames.You can create maps &amp share them with the comunity or download maps from the comunity.Good character &amp vehicles customization.If you play on Private sesions with a lot of friends (good example for streamers). You will have fun and no problems about troll kid hackers.Bad PointsTinny map only a "big" island.If you use mods inclusive on history mode you get banned from online (wtf?).No workshop for mods (mods are ILEGAL)PAY2WIN. review: Ported my character over from PS4 after a friend gifted me this through Steam logged 90ish hours and I can tell you that after you've gotten your character over level 100 with the nicest cars you'll get bored and Rockstar only adds large updates once in a blue moon and it's only good for 2 5 hours before it gets repetitive and boring.Did I mention that Rockstar doesn't let you mod your single player experience? Yeah try to add a ScriptHookV.dll file from one of the GTA V mods online to your base directory then load up the game count the clock before Rockstar gives you a ban from online for "cheating".
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: All things accounted for with the immense amount of bells and whistles included in this package this is the best GTA ever made.Online content fully modifiable cars property for purchase businesses to invest in heists to plan (two choices per heist differing approaches) crews to hire three different characters to play with and to watch their stories unfold. Best graphics yet smooth and thought out.A new and beautiful feature to GTA V is the first person camera. It's amazing! You can see the cabin of any vehicle complete with dials in front of you! You can see down the iron sights on your weapon! You can mod your weapon and get a red dot scope to play Call of Duty GTA. The police are actually intelligent enough to flank you using any alternative entrance available to them! They don't automatically know where you are and you have no radius to avoid them in! You can hide in the same area you committed the crime as long as they can't see you you're in the clear once they give up interest! That said they're surprisingly better at searching than they've ever been before!The driving physics are the best of any yet the special abilities are fun the random quest content is amazing. There is only one complaint I can think of for this game no matter how long the story is it'll be too short.As always GTA is highly irreverent of 'traditional' American values. It speaks truth about the mythology. It is anti Republican at heart. Republican Space Rangers is all you need to know about where Rockstar stands. "Spreading American values...sometimes you gotta bomb an orphanage or two! Republican Space Rangers!"

review: If you're buying it for the singleplayer Short answer Yes I would say it's a must haveLong Answer gta 5 have one of the best storyline in a video game period. however there's not much to do after completing the campaign besides playing the online mode (which is utter garbage) or trying to get 100% save. If you're buying it for the multiplayer Answer NO THE MULTIPLAYER IS A GRIND FEST.Long answer You may think that you're going to get alot of enjoyment from the multiplayer but you're wrong. all you do in the multiplayer is grind grind and grind. and after all that hard work you finally get the item you wanted you relized that you just wasted your time and virtual money on something that you probably don't even need like most super cars that can be ing beaten by one that probably cost 1/4 of its price. aThere are a few thing that i think is a good investment in your time to grind but i think theres more thing you don't need than there are things that can actually help you. like for example the apartments The only reason you need them is for the ability to host a heist which can give you insane amount of money and thats it. you can't really do that much with them and even if you pay the extra 200k or even 800k for a more expensive apartment they don't really give you anything other than the location and the interior (the 400k is the same as the 200k only difference being how high you are in the building! and the 1M$ only makes the interior bigger and allow you to customize the theme).You may think that the multiplayer is deep and you would probably ended up spending alot of time in it but i bet most of that time is spent grinding heists ceo and mcs works. yeah there are adversary modes missions and custom games created by the community but how often do you think people play them? the answer is not very much.And before people think i'm just a poor guy (or that i get banned) that can't buy things that he want because its too expensive i'm level 150 and pretty much have everything i want (I have pretty much all popular pegasus vehicles like the hydra and buzzard mc business ceo work and 2 of the special vehicles (that being the rocket voltic and ruiner 2000). you may disagree with what i have to say but once you hit a certain point of experience in online you would start to agree with me more and more. unless you're that one player that never get bored of a game despite doing same thing over and over again. also the new updates seem to only add either new gamemodes and cars and not much else besides some bonus discounts (really? 50% off mods upgrade in the los santos custom shop? how about 25% off all supercars or pegasus vehicles) Edit The part where i said the game's campaign was shorter than most gta game is a mistake and i've removed it from the review
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Personally I have been waiting for around 2 years for the PC Version of the game to come out. Now that it came out It has only been 9 or so days and I've racked up 84 hours on the game.SHORT REVIEW As much as we all know that the PC Version was supposed to be "More superior" there is almost no new content other than the Rockstar Editor which I must say is fairly cool but at the same time I feel that GTA 5 MAY or MAY NOT be lacking additional content for the PC. As well as that as far as I'm aware Rockstar have not granted permission for any mods being used in the game itself but who's actually not going to try and bypass that? People have done so already. The game itself may be lacking content however the community actually continues creating things for each other. It is quite a community driven game to be fair however the community is restricted due to what Rockstar have limited the game to.In addition to this the port of the game is generally great unlike Grand Theft Auto 4's port over from console which was extremely buggy.All in all This game was worth my money and waiting time.Oh did I also mention the 60 FPS? It's smooth.

review: I've been playing this series since the very first one and would like to say it's been an excellent influence on me growing up and well into adulthood. Yes indeed.As far as this one goes the single player mode has recaptured a lot of the joy and manic fun of the earlier iterations for me. A lot of fun stuff thrown in just for the sake of it and sometimes things escalate way faster and more drastically than I was expecting. The multiplayer is a huge laugh especially with people you know (with the caveat that you need to find a server that doesn't have any hackers ballsing it up for everyone) and the quality of the PC version is just sublime both graphically and in terms of the feel of the controls. I drive and fly with a 360 controller and run around shooting with a mouse and keyboard with zero issues.The biggest downside on multiplayer is that even two of you can have a hard time getting a full roster to do 4 man missions sometimes and even then half the time one or more people you play with will die or up repeatedly like it's someone else's fault then ragequit so you have to start the whole process over again. If you want to ensure you have fun with the online missions bring your mates. It's not impossible to enjoy the experience with a group of randoms but it is very hit miss. Also sometimes a hacker in a malicious mood can really things up for you although Rockstar tend to be very good at correcting anything permanent that happens to you it's still annoying and disruptive at the time.Overall I give this 9 rabid fanboys out of 10.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Now dont get me wrong modding is fun but i think what they should have done is remove modding from multiplayer but keeping it in single player. in single play you cant harm anyone by using mods but its good they removed modding in multiplayer as it stops PEOPLE FROM BEING REALLY ANNOYING. But if a modder is in multiplayer and given you money i wont complain but being annoying that strikes a nerve. I would highly recommend this game and i think you guys are going about this update the wrong way. Just by disliking the game your just giving it bad reviews on such a great game and this is giving the wrong impression on people so please reconsider. the least thing you could do is give the game a thumbs up instead of a thumbs down when the update that brings it back if that ever happens.

review: Pros Fun gameCons Weapons keep disappearing off my online character One minute I have a pump action shotgun with a silencer and a flashlight next minute its got no attachments so I reapply them at the gun store then out of the blue the entire gun disappears out of my inventory and its getting stupidly annoying.Being paired with people in China or Russia and the game spazzing out and not being able to do anything cause of the horrendous lag I can run around and shoot but whatever the other players are doing is beyond me (yes I know get some friends in the local area but the majority seems to be either Russians or Chinese players so thats kinda hard)The loading screens if you could of just made it so the number of players are displayed on the 'txt' and have it actively update or something that would be great save me having a loading screen just to be told that the room is full hey it could of even be made into a black market app if the arguement against that is it being tracked txts would be a cake walk for the FIB to trace atleast if it was a jailbroken phone the app could be made believeable.0.1/10 had enough of loading screens and joining a room where I can barely do anything.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: If you have $60 there is no reason why you should'nt get this game. It has just about everything cars racing both 3rd and 1st person shooting and driving and just about as much violence and epicness you could fit into one game. This game has something that will appeal to anyone wether it be sensless violence or sexual content. The story is great lots of humor but nothing that will be going in the history books. The charactors are hilarious (especially Trevor). But the online really stands out. You create your own character that you will be stuck with throughout the online furthermore you can buy your own apartment steal/buy your own cars and fully customize them conduct complex heists and do fun yet challenging jobs to earn cash. And of cours the online game takes place in the fully open world were you can do practically anything you want. And with the new update you are allowed to use mods in single player so ignore any hateful reviews based off the banning of mods.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Pre purchased and waited patiently for the release. Wham Bam Crash!What I can't forgive is that Rockstar post a supposed fix for ONE of the suspected causes of the problem (The easiest one invalid characters in Windows user name) but totally ignore all the others. It is left to other forums to make suggestions and investigate fixes while Rockstar ignore calls for help.In my case it's the Launcher failure message as soon as I try to load the game. I have tried EVERY 'fix' mentioned with no success.OK so I have to wait until a fix comes or demand a refund. Problem is that if I refund then I loose the pre purchase in game cash bonus.I can't recommend what will undoubtedly be a fantastic game when it's fixed (as I can't play it) and I strongly advise potential new buyers to wait until these problems have been resolved. Maybe if this issue hits Rockstar's bank balance they will start to treat their customers with a bit more respect.I've been working in Customer Service all my life and the most basic requirement is summed in a single word Communication! Come on Rockstar what's going on?
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is all you can expect from GTA....Online is great with many activities to participate in receiving XP and cash for almost anything you have fun doing. Levelling is fairly easy and theres a tonne of content with regular DLCs 2x events and sales on various items within the game. If you find yourself having trouble with other players in a lobby the solution is a mere'Find New Session' away with also having the option to make invite only crew and solo sessions.800 hrs of gameplay so far and much much more to come. I never find myself bored.i do recommend finding a good crew to join as it makes a few things in game easier to complete.

review: I bought this game during the steam sale because several friends wanted to play it online. I purchased the game and 2 shark cards. After gearing up and doing a few missions I killed a bunch of players. My account was immediately banned for a month...1) I never said a word in public chat.2) I never installed any mods/cheats.3) I can't even imagine what I could have possibly done to get banned. This is a first is any game ever... I am still kind of in shock that I got banned from a video game... I submitted a support request with Rockstar that was immediately closed with a form response.There are plenty of games that are buggy incomplete or just not that fun. All of that can be frustrating but this experience is a new low in the gaming industry. I am leaving a negative review because of this and sharing my experience so buyer be warned.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Product received for free. Great single player game. Strong story great characters and the same old GTA fun. review: GTA V!How could I put something negative in here? It's GTA! Arguably the best game series is back! Although this game has been out for over a year on consoles I believe the PC version may have been worth the wait. If you haven't seen a single GTA video yet I'll sum it up. In this game you can just freeroam build an empire do jobs do heists get money use stock markets. Yeah pretty much everything you can do in real life including attending your local strip club. Only there are seemingly no consequences! Something negative about all GTA games so far happens to be the amount of bugs and glitches found in these games. Although every game in the series has been groundbreaking there tends to be a lot of issues with these types of things. I won't go into detail or drag anything out so I'll leave it at this.Yes this game is good.Have fun real world people!

review: As someone who loved this game at one time it kinda sucks that i have to leave a negative review but it has to be done. This game has been completely ruined not only by the shutting down of Open IV (whether or not they retracted this is irrelivant it shouldnt have ever happened to begin with) and also by the complete and utter destruction of the in game economy. In an attempt to get rid of hacked money and modded items rockstar went on a rampage taking away items and money from people whith no regard as to whether or not they actually hacked. The ingame economy is absolute garbage. the economy is super inflated and the missions and business ventures in this game ARE NOT a viable source of income. playing as a member of someone elses MC club or CEO associate is completely useless as you gain almost little to no money per mission. I could go on and on about this game but the fact of the matter is that GTAV is dead and greed is the killer.

review: I do not understand all of the negative feedback this game is receiving! I spent nearly an entire week glued to my desk playing it. From the fun and immersive story to the nearly limitless online play it's one of the most fun titles I've ever played. I think so far the only thing I've found to dislike about it is the poor optimization. I myself play this game on relatively high settings and pull around 45 60 fps. That being said a few friends of mine have struggled to run it on their low to mid range pc's. So if you are gaming on a low budget system I might go as far as to not recommend it unless you don't mind low video quality.

review: As a returning player I can say that I am surprised with all you can do in this game compared to the early 360/PS3 realease. Hitting X to duck in cars first person view of course and let's not forget NEON LIGHTS! PThis game was truly made for PC.With that being said however making your game appear next gen doesn't necessarily mean that it's next gen. When these companies start releasing games with less bugs and problems along with being able to reach a wide variety of GPU setups then I will say we have reached next gen. It was not always how shiny the graphics looked it was about how smooth the game was and problem free it was. This helped us enjoy a game even more so than how it looked.This is coming from someone who absoulely loves Rockstar. They have truly upon PC gamers by banning the usage of mods. If modding capability is a deal breaker for you then this probably won't be your game. I love modding but not enough to sacrifice $200 of invested money into GTA's shark card system. NOPE.All in all I get to see 3D chesticles in a strip club via first person and listen to my own music! 11/10 would get thrown out of strip club again.

review: This game should be considered a early release at best. There are so many bugs in this game and many of them could be fixed but as long as GTA is making them money who cares. The loading times are god awful and simple things like doing a check before you join a online mission to see if a lobby is full before loading it would be great instead of making you load the mission then telling you is full then loading the world you were just in again of course followed by GTA is not available and disconnecting you from online. Then there is the hackers or modders if you perfer to call them. There is no reason for this GTA already has a detection system in place. Hackers get away with it becuse they know that they will not be banned right away intead gta once it detects cheats it puts them into a quene to be banned the following week of whatever when it could be done right away. What the heck happened to the fun i use to have stealing any car in the game and storing it now I am forced to buy my cars to put them in my garage. Funny how only cars that are worth higher than $950 000 all have trackers. That way you have to grind for a car. Then there is the horrendous mission lay out let's use the lamar missions for example not really spoilers here but they are all the exact same things steal car kill people get surrounded and kill people oh yea how could I forget the most annoying character with absolute nothing of value to say has the longest cut scenes. This is just a couple of the massive amounts of problems with this game There are so many one could write a entire book on how bad this game is. The worst part is you would not know untill you played a decent amount of the game bringing you past the return period. So do yourself a favor and don't waste your money here there are far better games than this.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Spend hours in the world that you have come to know in single player but now with new missions new safe houses friends and random people from all around the world. Be thrown into a world where everyone is your friend and enemy. Definitely worth the money and the wait for it to download even with its few kinks that Rockstar is constantly ironing out as they go releasing free content too.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: 10/10 This game is a must have. And here's why If you haven't played this game on consoles before this just know it's like a perfection of many gamers dreams. It tells an amazing story with really interesting characters to boot that actualy has very mature and realistic story compared to any other GTA . On top of that the gameplay is amazing and tons of fun you'll never be bored and once you are you can play online with friends. Which is where the game truly shines. The multiplayter perfects open world multiplayer by giving you tons of choices of what t do and how to personalize you online perosna. This game does everything right and never ceases to keep me entertained whether it's on pc or console.Now let's get ot why everyone hates this game. Yes rockstar is actively reventing mods and yes they have absolutely every right to do so. Let's get this out of the way YOU ARE NEVER SUPPOSED TO MOD ANY GAME a developer may support it but it is always said that the games are generally made the way and are meant to be modified. However Gta V is a special case because unlike before Rockstar is actively stopping this. They have right to do this because you agree to let them and it is their intellectual property.You may have bought the game but they own the rights to the game GTA name abd it makes sense that they would protect like so. Mods remove their control over the game even in singelplayer which with hoow smooth annd easy the transition between SP and MP is they might be trying to prevent a more sneaky modifictation to make it through by even keeping them oout of singleplayer. They are simply trying to making the game more enjoyable for everyone.And let's face it Rockstar is a business. mods will extend the game's lifetime immmensely also increasing the time before they can expect a succesful GTA on Pc. Even though many PC gamers believe that is just fine it isn't and Id rather have a newer game than a bunch of mods. If they can release a newer game sooner it can be better and even more polished than this one.Even with that said however I do understand the need for outcry for complete lockdown. It's not hard to see it from both sides but something this complicated if left solely to the dev will take forever to fix. Gamers and modders should pu in their part to rockstar by at least not modding for now and simply making you point clear to them and the problem will bi solved much clearer.However I digress back to the matter of whether or not to buy this game. The answer is simple absolutley yes. It is understandable if your wary or completely against it if you wanted to mod but I would reserve judgement. I don't see Rockstar permantly banning all mods they are a smart developer and knows there is a huge lovew for mods. Up until they come up with a solution or the community finds a workaround. Until all that is fixed you will still have one of the omst polished and well made pieces of entertainment to keep you engaged.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I have just started playing this game and OMFG!There are just no words to do justice for this game mindblowing!Gobsmacked each freaking second i am playing this game.The details are beyond anything i have seen in the GTA series or any game for that matter an amazing improvement. Tuning the game to your likings with a ton of options makes it run perfectly on a great many systems.The game is beyond real what can i say? 200/100 pointsThis Q has had his jaw dropping on the floor every turn he makes.The game starts with a bang and continues on to become even more amazing each mission you take on...When you first break into that crib and see the details they put into creating the environment of the house you go OMG!!The suspense of actually walking in that awesome house with a near real family inside it and stealing that car noticing that you got a passenger in the backseat that holds a gun to your head while driving the car to that crooked shop... WTF!?The game takes you on this unbelievable ride you would swear you are playing in a movie.Seriously this is beyond anything i have seen before! This game breathes atmospherics.You have to experiance it to believe it but it is truly out there!Rockstar games? Godlike!!Now excuse me while i play some more of what has to be the best GTA game ever...

review: This game is great for new players and players who have owned the game on Current Gen or Old Gen Consoles For players coming from console i can say it is well worth paying for the community are alot nicer you rarely see people kill you for no reason like you do on console. Online also has the chatbox which makes it alot easier to host events and things in a lobby every player will see it and most likely read it and maybe join in with what you are hosting ). For Singleplayer you can use mods which just makes the game so much fun there are a variety of mods out there that lets you pretty much do what you want But i would be careful about what mods you are installing as some of the mods secretly transfer over to multiplayer which gets you banned so for now i would install the mods and just play Singleplayer and when you want to go online close the game and delete/uninstall the mods then play again and you will be fine. )

review: I got to say this is my first GTA game so I had a lot of expectations that needed to be met in order for me to like this game but I can't really compare it to previous games all my expectations were from hearsay. I got this game when it first came out but due to finals I wasn't able to play it that much until May. I've since put 144 hours into this game the most I have done with any game that I own on Steam in that month and all that time has been in multiplayer I haven't even touched the singleplayer. This game is so good that my dad who pretty much only plays WoW saw me playing this and decided to get this game and has loved it.It would take me too long to describe the pros for this game so here are the cons I have had issues with my latest driver (GeFore 980) and this game which has caused me to crash multiple times. However its a simple fix all I have to do is go and instal the 347.86 driver. (I haven't fully tested this out but I think the problem was when I had NVAA running I'll be sure to edit this to see if it works out) It can take you a while to get some of the more expensive objects such as vehicles or appartments but if you do heists and missions you can get that money in a surprisingly quick time while still having a blast If you don't have 3 other friends to do heists you will be waiting for randoms to join your game. However the wait time has decreased significantly since the game first came out. Now you might only have to wait 3 minutes but there is a good chance that it will be full sooner than that. there is no way for you to give money to your friends but that is understandable because that is how the hackers were able to give sooo much money so it's understandable whyOn the note of hackers are there hackers? yes. Do you see them frequently? More often than not you don't but you can from time to time. Are the hackers a bad thing? Absolutely not. They don't ruin the gameplay at all BECAUSE 1. If they decide to be and start killing you you just go into passive mode and they can't do anything to you.2. If you don't feel like going into passive mode you can always join another server that won't have one and it is as if nothing ever happened.3. Half the time you can get money from them because most of them are nice.4. They turn the crazyness of GTA Online from 10 to 11. There have been times where there were UFO saucers in the middle of downtown Los Santos blowing people up and my only reaction was laughing because I just got blown up by a god damn UFO xDOverall I got to say this game is amazing. I know that some of the cons may seem really outstanding but that's because I haven't listed the awesomeness and hilarity of this game. It is absolutely normal to be driving down the street crash into a NPC car get mad at it shoot the driver start going on a rampage (because it why not?) accidentally shoot a player (by accident I mean that it was unfortunate that the player had to cross paths with you during your rampage so now they must die) they get mad they call in a helicopter they start shooting at you with missiles and machine guns and then the next thing you know the entire server is fighting each other. In downtown Los Santos. With so many cops shooting at anyone and everyone that you would have thought that the national guard was being called in. All because you were doing 100 in downtown and got mad that you lost control of your car and slammed into a NPC.

review: You might wonder why I would not recommend this game. I'm sure it's a great game and has been great for many of you. Yet it hasn't been for me and here's why.If you are considering buying have a read first.I bought this game on the 22nd of March 2017. 2017 two years after release keep that in mind.Having a high end top specs system I would be able to play this game on the highest settings possible but I couldn't. After 5 to 10 to sometimes 20 minutes of gameplay crashes took place over and over and over again making me play the same first missions over and over and over again. But wait it got worse GTAV started giving me blue screens of death. On top of that my computer during regular use started malfunctioning. GTAV was hurting my hardware slowly but surely. So I did what we all would do go to google and look up why. At this point I found out that a lot of people have had all these issues from crashes to blue screens ever since release back in 2015. So I went to Rockstar's tech support.Now you would figure that after two years they would have found the reason why and would have fixed them. Wrong. After three weeks of being in contact with Rockstar's tech support it has been made clear they have no clue why this is happening. They have asked me to fix so many different things and play test and are now running out of ideas. Everything is still the same as it first was. When my hardware started malfunctioning on regular use I decided that this game was not worth destroying my computer so I opted for a refund.But wait there's more. Having playtested all those fixes I ended up with 11 hours of gameplay on Steam. Steam doesn't allow refunds when playtime has exceeded 2 hours no matter the reason. So I asked Rockstar's tech support but no budging came from that end either. Well played Rockstar well played.In the end I bought an expensive faulty probably console ported game that I never got to play that damaged my hardware that won't get refunded and used up way too many hours of my free time trying to fix it.That is why I do not recommend buying this game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

To enjoy the high graphics the PC port of this game offers you need an extremely powerful GPU and graphics combo. I can generate the graphics full blasts at 25fps which is suprisingly low for a brand new alienware. Also there is a large number of hackers in the community already ruining the experience for newcomers like myself. It is also very unclear as to what missions you can do to rank up as a low level player. there is no rank balance either. as a level 5 i played with level 400 people which is insane. wasted 60 bucks and hoping for a refund.

review: DISCLAIMER This review follows a purchase made not even remotely close to the events of the Summer Sale so do not be deterred. This is not a rant on how Rockstar does their buisness practices. Now settle in for a review on a game not a company decision.Despite many negative reviews on the multiplayer I have not ever encountered any hackers even in a full lobby. Connectivity may be an issue if your speeds are not very good so those with low network speeds may want to steer clear. The multiplayer is a great experience although I would reccomend friends tag along with you for the maximum experience. The more the merrier! With the inclusion of small storylines in multiplayer and Heists online for these things alone I could reccomend this game. The insane amount of customization and endless side missions like golf racing parachuting and deathmatch modes is really just icing on the cake. However leaving the story mode out would do a serious injustice to the immense praise this game deserves and receives. Without spoiling too much the overarching storyline that braches across three characters as Franklin Michael and Trevor each in their own worlds that are quite an experience in themselves (...Trevor...). The plot development in each characters personal life could almost make you forget that you have two other characters to play as it is so good! And for whatever reason if you get bored with the main story an abundance of side missions in the form of Strangers and Freaks and most listed in multiplayer are available as well in singleplayer. Subjectively this is one of the best games I have ever played. Objectively I think this game should still be considered a masterpiece to rival some of those instant classics for some. TL DR If you want a game that is damn close to perfect in an open world environment with great plot and character development with multiplayer that could be seen as an independent game to boot all wrapped into one package... Look no further.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Everyone knows what GTA V is so no need to summarize that aspect but people are seriously giving negative reviews because you can't do something (mods) that a) aren't necessary for the gameb) have just begun and will grow exponentially within the next couple of monthsc) can actually ruin online when s decide it's okay to cheat The game is great the metacritic score says it on it's own. regardless of mods this is a tremendous pc port that has been greatly fine tuned and optimized. I can't understand why people feel so entitled when this game is far beyond it's price tag on it's own. like i said keep in mind that mods have only just begun and Rockstar will probably make legit statements soon regarding them... don't listen to all the butthurt jerks.

review: Thanks Kat Williams the game now has dogs. (and cats)Thanks Skyrim the game now has bunnies foxes and mountain lions. (mountain lions will kill you BTW)Thanks Max Payne for slow motion special abilities. (Especially Franklin's slomo driving ability.)Thanks Rockstar game started on the first try.(Whew!)Thumbs Up Quick Save (No more having to run home to save your game unless you want to.)Driving is supreme. Best so far IMOReturn of bicycles. Yay!!Can carry more than one type of weapon i.e. rocketlauncher AND grenade launcher etc.Thumbs Down Cars still inconveniently disappear sometimes when cutscenes finish or outside of a garage etc. (All GTA games do this weird.)One of the main reasons I play on PC is because I don't like the console controllers. Luis from Liberty city made me buy one (or was it Microsoft) for that attack helicopter mission (Sexy Time) and now I've found that I need it to not only fly helicopters and planes but also for swimming underwater and parachuting pain in the butt...(At least you can switch seamlessly between the controller and the mouse/keyboard) Note get the controller with the wired USB and no more batteries...Otherwise turn off the radio and you should have a pretty good time in Los Santos/San Andreas.

review: It's the classic GTA formula you know and love except mostly bigger and better. But not in every way.+ Overall the gameplay and movement feel nice and fluid I'd say it's the best out of any GTA game so far. I did use a controller with the auto aim enabled though. I find that using a controller is much more enjoyable for moving around in third person and driving vehicles but aiming with a controller can be tedious so I turn on the auto aim to fix that. I tried switching constantly between keyboard and controller but it was too clunky so I decided to stick with a controller with auto aim.+ Each main character has an unique special ability that makes driving / shooting more fun and rewarding than ever.+ A lot of world filling content. Basically a large amount of content that makes the world feel alive and believable while adding a touch of humor and satire. This includes side quests dynamic events TV channels Internet websites Radio stations billboards text messages emails civilian discussions and more.+ A lot of video settings to tinker with. What you'd expect from a good port.+ First person mode is a great addition.+ The 3 main characters are great. Very good acting. Trevor is hilarious for the most part. The story is generally pretty good overall if you think of it as some sort of parody. Soundtrack is OK. Some good stuff some less good stuff. That's really subjective though. While the "realistic" restrictions has been somewhat reduced from GTA 4 it's still not perfect. For example you can't do fun things like trying to jump from rooftop to rooftop or car surfing your character's legs are just gonna give up and go into ragdoll mode. That can be funny at times but it's more of an annoyance than anything and you can even die unintentionally because of it. The mini games (Tennis etc.) are a nice distraction but... again they are a bit too realistic to be fun for more than a few matches. The novelty wears off quickly. Another "realistic" restriction I didn't like was how you can't permanently save a car in your garage. I mean what's the point of modding a car if you're going to lose it forever when you inevitably leave it behind or get it destroyed? And the realism is weirdly inconsistent because the cars of the 3 main characters always spawn back at their safehouse no matter what you do with them so... I don't get why they're not allowing us to save our own cars permanently too. A bit too much of the main story revolves around 2 of the main characters being childishly mad at each other.If you absolutely want a score I'd probably give it a 8.5/10 mostly for the sheer amount of content and the good stuff generally outweighting the bad stuff. It's honestly a great game and despite its flaws it's still one of the best games of its genre.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

I couldn't find a single car that didn't feel like it weighed 4 tons and neither of the cars I tried could take a corner. It really wasn't an enjoyable feeling. After some races I tried to play some freemode and found out the character is really unresponsive as well. It took the character so much time to start going right after I clicked right and the shooting felt really odd as well. Overall I had pretty bad time playing this game today and I will probably never play it again.

Overall it's pretty good game.And since the mods situations is resolved I guess it would be nice for people to change or at least delete their "boycott" reviews not only on store page of Grand Theft Auto V but other installments of this series as well as other Rockstar games available on steam platform since from the logical standpoint from now on reviews should be fair and square. review: New Review Take Two killed it. I will never buy another one of their products. Good luck trying to get people to come and play the new GTAs and RDR. Although 13 year olds will still buy it and GTA will soon just be used for baby sitting.Old bad attempt at humor At first it was awsome car chases random stick ups you name it my friends and I did it.Except cheat for which pretty much everyone I used to play with got banned for except none of them did once the ban hammer update started I logged off and haven't gone back on but I bet I probably got banned while away.The single player is awesome and if it goes on sale for 15 or 20 bucks and you haven't played the singleplayer I'd say go for it otherwise don't even bother at this point the game's life is almost over anyway you don't ever see full lobby after full lobby.The saddest part was the last time I was on the session was empty it was snowing and I stood on a cliff overlooking the city in which I had fought tooth and nail for everything I had the stars shown through the snow that lazily fell from the sky with a bittersweet feeling I got into the muscle car that I worked so hard to buy when I first started out. I drove slowly down the snowy trails my long gone friends had once fondly called deja vu road I soon reached pavement. I merged with traffic and went on a tour of the northern expanse of the island. I slowed to a gentle crusing speed as I worked my way through the upper class suburbs. The streets soon transitioned to the business district to which I attempted to cross at a high speedI didn't make it.I launched from my seat and tumbled through the air as I passed over the hood of the taxi I had hit. I rolled a few feet and stood up slowly. Looking back at the car for one last time all I saw was a totaled wreck. I turned away from the very thing I had obsessed over buying for the first couple jobs.I jogged a few blocks until I came to the hood. A few gangbangers eyed me suspiciously as I walked up to a sedan and drove off in it as if it were mine. In the rearview I could see the glittering bank tower to which I had spent countless hours to buy a small slice of that I could call my very own. Inside the cathedral of glass and steel I could imagine the vehicles I had collected yet barely used sitting underneath cold LEDs waiting to be called upon for an eternity. Once again a moment of distraction caused me to veer into a telephone pole.No matter I had reached the pier seemingly unconciously. i walked out to the end while gazing at the glow of the lights on the landing strip at the airport from which I had scrambled fighter jets and crash landed helicopters on. I soon reached the end of the pier the end of the road the end of my story.I stood at the corner looking out upon the city I produced the pistol given to me at the start of my journey the cornerstone of my criminal career. I had left all my other implements of death in the posh apartment I used purely as a safe house for staying in the city.I looked at my city my heaven and hell and then GTA crashed because this game still has sh*t wrong with it they should have fixed long ago.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

My system is well above the minimum specs (Win 8.1 i5 4690 3.5Ghz 8Gb ram GTX970 Geforce 4Gb) I'm running all the latest drivers I've spent days on any support forum I could find trying any possible fix I could find (reinstalled validated game files ...) but nothing works. All my other steam games run fine without any issues. Official RockstarGames support up to now has been limited to 'is your system up to date and do you match the minimum specs' (even though I've sent them my sysinfo and crash logs). And of course a refund seems to be out of the question... Very very disappointing.
