review: Wow GTA V...It's here the PC master race finally gets their hands on GTA V. This game on ANY platform is SPECTACULAR probably one of Rockstars best works. Here are some pros and cons of this game. I'll only be looking at the singleplayer side of the game for now might update Online in later.PROS Great NPC varietyAmazing graphics and open worldSo many activities3 Different playable charactersMemorable charactersCustomisation So much of it!A long long story taking me around 20 hrs without doing side missionsBut with every good game there are the consCONS Need a reasonably good rig to run this gameA few glitches here and there (Glitches will be updated later in the year)Rockstar Social has it's problems (Haven't encountered any personally)Price maybe could be a tad reduced considering this game has been out for 2 years nowKeyboard controls are not the best (I tried playing with mouse and keyboard couldn't get used to it so switched to Xbox One controller)So all in all in my experience I defiantly spent my money well and this games selling point is probably Online so if you have any friends who play this defiantly pick it up. If not I'd still get it just for the experience. And remember to check if your computer can run this game Pretty sure around 48% people didn't reach minimum requirements for this game. I give this game a 8/10.

review: After having fun the first few hours the game rapitly starts to feel dull. repeating missions over and over hackers no safe playing in public lobbys playing in a private lobby no fun alone heists only with 4 playersAnd dont get me started on the open world. All this game lives from is gimmicks. You can do a lot of stuff on the map but nothing that doesnt get boring after 5 minutes. Military field golfing and all the other stuff no real content all just little gimmicks. I miss the challenges the minigames and the gang wars of Saints Row. Having the smaller and simpler map Saints Row has way more stuff to do on its map.Also the zombie like NPCs. We all know the funny fail videos on youtube. You walk past an NPC he starts attacking and insulting you without reason. Going to near to an police officer he starts shooting you.Also the drivers are crazy kamikaze freaks that are out for a kill in every way possible. The NPCs in GTA5 are the worst and lazy Ive ever seen in 20 years of gaming.For a game that lives from (pseudo)realism and immersion I cant feel any immersion in this game at all.If you create such a gigantic and really beautiful map give us something to do on it beside finding bugs.

review: The long awaited GTAV PC.. What should you expect? ANY MAJOR BUGS/FIX'S Okay now expect some issues at first. Mainly lag. When i first got the game i couldnt drive a vehicle without such bad lag and stuttering the game waas unplayable. After some researching i realised that there were new "BETA" drivers for AMD which wouldnt show up on my autodetection software for auto updating my drivers. A quick google of "AMD 15.4 BETA DRIVERS" will help you get that fixed. As my game does now run superbly. (after i have made a few changes to settings) NVIDIA have also released a "GTA V READY DRIVER"Now im no computer guru and i dont have the best setup ever. Id like to think of my computer as a good PC kinda a bench mark for alot of Gaming PC's .. Its a couple years old now but features an i7 processor and x2 AMD READON 7850's ... So its not exactly a rust bucket. I have noticed (this seems to be more of a game engin error) rendering issues mainly when driving fast. The game sort of coughs and splutters a bit and i get drops from 60 80fps all the way down into the 30's for a good few seconds. Which is a significant drop and can be noticed alot. Have some hope guys rockstar have done a very good job and im sure they will get this issue fixed as a few on my friends have the same issue. **THE GAME IS STILL VERY PLAYABLE JUST STAY AWAY FROM RACES (if you have this issue)** GENERAL COMMENTS Im still suprised at how the the game runs using a mouse and keyboard the driving especially is very well done. Other GTA's has a very clunky feel if you didnt use a controller. But not on here folkes. Also I love the shooting when using a mouse it feels soo natural with me being a FPS player. The Online ooooh the online. Fantastic. Im sure you know by now what can be done online so i wont bore you. But it is so fun (when playing with buddies) The servers are a little bit "DeSynchy" but nothing horrid. SINGLEPLAYER This is definately a game for those who have loved watching the Evolution of GTA ever since the birds eye view days right up to where GTA IV left us. You may be thinking 'Other than GFX being updated what does this offer thats new in a singleplayer aspect?' Truthfully not a hell of alot. The only feature that i can think of my self that is 100% new is the character swapping how you have multiple characters as part of the story line and you can swap to any character whilst doing pretty much anything. Oh apolagies the first person feature too. So first person. Truthfully for me a bit of a let down you can tell its a feature added into a thirdperson game mainly the FOV but also the general feel you get. Its hard to explain but it just doesnt feel like a modern FIRST PERSON VIEW experience.Now i havent completed the story line or even got very far into it due to my social and private time being destroyed by the addictive nature of the multiplayer but its looking like this could be a very strong fun durable 'campaign'.If you really have any questions feel free to comment. And ill reply ASAP.

review: Fun to play. 10/10Replay value is low. 0/10 (once you have everything)Great graphics 10/10 (Excellent some of the best out there)Large map 10/10Inovation 2/10 (same old same old GTA Heists good 1 play through and buggy)Gun play 8/10 (its a pinch stiff not terrible)Flight simulation 10/10 (easy to learn )Worth the money 10/10 (I would buy it again for $60 if I was new)Driving 9/10 (some kinks in the physics nothing to shun though)As advertised 9/10 (Heists were over hyped and near impossible to pug)Storyline 10/10 Voice acting &amp Cut scenes 7/10 (some of the scenes I would have executed them in real life situation just for mentioning knowledge of things not terrible script writing though.)Interface 8.5/10 (felt like a load screen simulator online prepare to see alot of load screens and endless menu's that the cell phone takes a bit of the stress from)Character/car customization 8/10 (Loads of options but nothing really custom just lists of prefabs APB did it right in 2008 and in 7 years they still hold the ingame not at creation character customization I have ever seen even on a dated engine).AI 9/10 (Hardly notice thier activities even though they are inovative I think dead island really hit home on AI detactachable limbs/hitboxes sad that in all this time nobody has come close to making AI all that interesting.)Hope this helps ByU

review: No analog controller support on the PC!Everything about this game is screaming "Botched PC port of a console game." One would imagine that a car game on PC would have support for DirectX game controllers such as a steering wheel and pedals. If you would assume that GTA5 would have such support you would be horribly wrong.A car game on the PC that doesn't support PC steering wheel and pedals. Can you imagine it? Cause I couldn't until I saw this. I'm expected to be playing a 2015 game using keyboard controls from the 1980s! What is this rubbish?!?Not only is the analog cotroller support for the PC completely missing the mouse support is abysmal. Any of the menus are a pain to use with a mouse.Playing this game is making me feel like a filthy dirty console peasant.

review: GTA 5 or more importantly GTAO is one of the best online/GTA experiences ever The campaign was good and brought me back to that familiar GTA story feel that GTA4 killed for me. Swapping between Michael Franklin and Trevor is interesting and fun to see what is going on just before you jump in Story and attempting to get 100% completion to which I managed 89.7% Kept me involved for about 101 hours according to social club ONLINE However makes up the other half of my 450+ hour play at the time of this review. This is exactly what the franchise needed. IMO WIthout going into too much detail as there is alot to online i will say its not perfect but makes for one hell of a good time i often find myself spawning into lobbys where WW3 seems to be taking place Starting off was hard just stick to missions and robbing stores and you will get there A few quick tips for beginers.BUY ARMORED VEHICLES!!!! SHOOT FIRST....MAYBE? BECOME A STICKY BOMB SURGEON.DO NOT WASTE AMMO.BUY ARMORBUY SNACKSBUY REBREATHER (Trust me)DONT TAKE IT TOO SERIOUSLY!!!! Its a game with guns!!! people will kill you... ALOT As far as i have seen R* seem to update and put out dlc for technically "FREE". The vehicle prices are insane but they do suppliment with double rp and $$ weekend events but still if your not into paying more real world $$ for "SHARK CARDS" then you will be doning alot of mission grinding Heists can be fun and annoying all together. basically expect to fail 8/10 attempts and even get the one who drops at the last part kicking everyone back to lobby if you can manage a solid crew this isnt as much of an issue and finally HACKING!!! yes it happens ive experienced it about 6 times and yes dropping money on people just beware record your session if possible and report any real "ill gotten gains" to R* support For what its worth I hope this helps Ive been going solo and youtube has been a huge help there is alot GTAO has to offer for thoes willing to get their hands dirty and spend a little time in Los Santos

review: Every couple of years Rockstar Games produces great games that you can spend hundreds of hours playing and never get bored of because they are so fun. There is no exception with GTA V. GTA V is a fantastic open world game set in the present day. The huge world of Los Santos and Blaine County is yours to basically destroy. The single player campaign is excellent and allows you to play the story as 3 very different people. The story consists of some very well planned missions and side quests but the main feature was Heists. These are very carefully planned missions that allow you to basically rob a specific point in the world and gain boat loads of cash for it. None of these are boring and you can replay them tons of times so you can proceed through the heist in a different way than last time. If you don't like the single player style you can get online with your friends in GTA online which is very similiar to single player and you get to use this huge map how you want to. The online DLC is fairly common and when it does come out it is very well made and definetly satisfies everyone. In both modes you can customize your character in tons of ways you can purchase beautiful cars and apartments/houses that may cost a lot but are definetly worth the cash. Aswell as cars you can purchase boats planes or helicopters and bikes so that you can traverse through the open world sandbox how you want to. There is so much more to this game and it is definetly worth the money so instead of me going on you should just go and buy it. You will spend so many hours and have so many fun times.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So this is more a review on the Developers and the Publishers than the actual game.Rockstar is the developer and Take Two is the publisher. Take Two attacked the modding community something I and many others simply will NOT stand for. Thankfully Rockstar was able to smack some sense into Take Two and they're no longer actively attacking the modding community.I leave a positive review to say thank you to Rockstar. I realize it was very likely a reaction to the overwhelmingly negative reviews and reactions from every sensible person who plays videogames. But I still appreciate them getting Take Two to back the hell down let's home Take Two gets the message. You with our family we'll spam yours with negative reviews.Now this doesn't mean I'm happy with Take Two I agree with the majority of people regardless of whether they're apologizing now they still shot first. But I acknowledge that they aren't actively attacking mods anymore.

review: Now I know plenty of people have MANY complaints about this game. It's a reasonable concern. The game has its fair share of issues. You have to know how to tune them out. Let's start with the positives The story The story is very well done for a game that came out almost 5 years ago. It has it's moments of comedy seriousness difficulty etc. The story is in depth and much longer than most games. The content Yes I understand GTA Online is practically useless. However there is so much content to go along with it. Consider how much time went into the drug clubhouses the cars the races. All of it. There is so much content to be unlocked. Now we'll talk about some of the negatives. Hackers As any good game it has hackers. Now GTAV definitely has some more severe hackers people who can ruin your whole experience with the click of one button. GTA Online GTA Online is cool however it is practically useless. Most GTA Online is good for is flexing your cars your cash or doing Jobs. Other than that it's not that great.I know this is one of the shorter reviews however there isn't much to say about the game. My hours don't do enough justice for how much time I've actually spent in the game. Should you buy this game For the story mode or for the Job factors of GTA Online.I rate this game a 7/10.

review: Awesome game singleplayer is alot of fun. Took me about 40 50 hours to finish the story. Online gameplay is different but also really enjoyable. The community is risky players range from average 13yr old rage kids to 30 yr olds showing off their pimped rides and everything in between (tryhards russian screamers noobs modders etc). It is hard not to like the game because there are plenty of game modes to enjoy. Racing shooting flying parachuting running the most cycling players over in trucks... There are however several issues that makes me give this game a thumb down. The servers are by far issue number one. I have a decent game PC and run the game at 45 60 fps on high detail. I installed it on an SSD enabling me to load the single player in about 1.5 2 minutes (still quite long). Logging on in online however can take up to a full 10 minutes. Once you are online you can join game modes or just roam around. When joining a mission or a heist you will have to conquer another loading screen. This will take 1 3 minutes. After this time there is a possibility that the room is already full which means you have to load back into the previous session. I was planning on writing down an elaborate story about these types of issues in the game but I might as well just hit play again and use the 10 minutes of loading time to masturbate so I'll round this up. TLDR I recommend pirating this game to check out the story mode. If you enjoyed it feel free to buy the game and support the developers. If you really liked it give online a try. Be warned though Out of my 417 hours of gameplay I've spent approximately 80 of them logging in or stuck in loading screens.

review: 2 hours in witnessed homoerotic dog freaky times with commentary. The unabashedly violent narrative is awesome the writers and comedians working on the single player storyline are brilliant.Almost 200 hours in the work that went into creating sympathetic portraits for each character is shocking. I mostly play FPS' not RPGs this is a stunning blend of both. Additionally the environment and sound detail are exquisite.I would also like to take a moment to respond to boiler plate feminist critiques. The game lacks a femaile protagonist and I think a future version should feature one but the story and archetypes in play here are wholly nihilistic with the exception of Franklin and even that story line is very dark. There is nothing happy about these entwined stories but they are written exceptionally well the voice acting is amazing and the 'in game feel' (empathy for character) is striking. This is not a game that objectifies women it's a game that objectifies every last slimy detail of male fantasy and free market capitalism which by most 3rd and post wave feminist critiques is a heteronormative and male dominated world. The game's storyline is tragic for all involved and the immersive elements (radio talk show hosts reality TV shows corrupt beauracrats plutarchs autocrats mobs the rich and famous etc.) all suggest that our world sucks. There isn't much you can do to change in game what is effectively a portrait of modern society but it gives the player some pause some reflection on very well researched tropes and incendiary topics without holding back. Think of this game as the video game version of the monologues but documenting US culture unapologetic rapey terrifying confusing but well told.

review: TL DR GTA Online used to be amazing now I have to pay the carpenter to come out to my house almost once a month. The singler player is fantastic though. This game is ing amazing when it works. 90% of the time I play I can for about 20 minutes to an hour. Then I get the infamous "unknown network error". Literally everytime I try to play this game I get kicked out of the server before I can decide that I'm bored. It happens all the time. Every fix I've looked at online has talked about port forwarding opening ports switching routers using LAN cables. I'm sitting here like.. "why the doesn't rockstar just fix their game?". Tons of people have this issue and they're all told the same thing. "It's your fault." you Rockstar.Not only are the connection issues enough to make me wanna put my computer through the ing wall but the game is rampant with hackers. 9/10 lobbies have either some guy giving everyone tons of money (Which is great because let me tell you something. If you want ANYTHING better than a ing sedan be prepared to spend HOURS playing this game. You used to be able to heist pretty easily but now that's ed unless you have 3 other friends because there's always atleast one guy who leaves the heist in the middle of the session which completely s over the entire operation. Granted it doesn't happen every time but when there are now more cars worth 1 million dollars or more than there are worth less than 500k it's enough to make me wanna put my computer through the ing wall. Heists aren't the only option and there are actually many different ways of making money. The problem is that there isn't any variation in the amount that you get for your effort. Almost every activity in the game that isn't a heist is going to cost you about 5 20 minutes and net you about 5 25k. So I guess the point I'm trying to make here is that the hackers are almost ing necessary. Which is atrocious.)... I realize at this point I've droned on enough that you've forgotten what I was talking about before the parenthesis so just know that the hackers in the game are both a blessing and a curse. Half of them will shower you with riches the other half will consistently with you until you wanna put your computer through the ing wall. The combat has gotten pretty stale now too. Everyone and their mother has a minigun and an rpg. Armored vehicles are everywhere. Pretty sure there's a in car that shoots rockets now too. Don't get me wrong it's all cool in theory. Unfortunately though every fight nowadays boils down to trying to shoot through the tiniest little openings in the armor on these rediculous vehicles. TBH though it's still fun. Killing people that are just douching around in an insurgent is one of the most satisfying things I've ever done in a vidya game.AND THE ING COPS. GOOD LORD. They are literally demons. They're ing demons from hell and each one is worse than the last. They give no s. They show no remorse. They have eyes ING EVERYWHERE. Oh and god forbid you accidentally bump into one of em. They're relentless to the point where fighting other players is a goddamn cancer because the entire time you're trying to do so you also have the entire god damn police department trying to you in the I miss the rdr days when the law would eventually give up realizing that they are inferior to you. It doesn't make any sense. It gets so bad that you literally can't fire your weapon without declaring war upon Los Santos. It makes me wanna put my computer through the ing wall. The single player is great though. One of the best single players I've ever had the pleasure to enjoy. Trevor is my soul mate.

review: Briefly Worth the price. No mod support.I think already the single player is worth paying the full price. The storyline itself ain't that innovative or special but it's working and it's very good entertainment. It is however the mood you get and the immersion that makes the single player aspect so great.Online aspect of the game is pretty much what you would expect from it. I would have wished more variety from the gamemodes now don't get me wrong there is so much to do but if you are someone who have a lot of time on their hands like me then you will eventually get bored atleast if you play with random people which I do not recommend. Heists are just the kind of variation I would like to see more in the future a great addition to the game.No support for mods apart from making your own radio station makes game short lasting however and this is a big minus. Especially when looking back the history of other gta games modding community was there already. Actually because of the lack of mod support I was seriously thinking about not recommending this game but once I saw numerous other reviews already negative because of that I changed my mind. Saying that encrypting game data makes the game cheater free is total BS most of the cheating tools are third party anyway as far as I know. There also exists lot of online games which include mod support and are cheater free. It's like putting the cookie jar on top of shelf and saying you can't touch it all the good kids won't but does it really stop a cookie monster?

review: I wish there was a neutral rating on steam because GTA V was actually a very enjoyable game in story mode. The graphics were stunning which complimented the epic action scenes and stunning environments of the game. Combat is simple but not easy. The AI is still dumb as hell but what can you do? The story is amazing and put together really well. The voice acting is sharp and it's clear that a lot of time and effort was put into each scene. As usual driving the plethora of vehicles is very fun however the flight controls can take a while to get used to.All of this is only half of the game. The other half is GTA Online.It's not fun. All of the OTT action and humor that made GTA's story amazing is lost in the multiplayer. It's riddled with hackers and the lag is appaling. Money is very difficult to obtain. The easiest way to make some cash is by doing hiests. However due to the rather toxic community working with randoms can be a choir and trying to get in the same lobby as your friends is even more of a choir.Overall get GTA on sale. Whilst the story is great and you can sink a lot of time into it the lack luster online mode and the lack of any new single player content leaves much to be desired from GTA V. For now I'll recommend it but only for the story mode.P.S There are micro transactions to get cash in the online mode. Thanks Rockstar. Just what we needed /

review: I bought this game primarily for multiplayer. Sadly the main feature of the multiplayer Heists are quirky as hell to get working if you don't have a complete team of four friends on standby at all times. Expect 50 % of your time looking at a loading screen for no particular reason getting kicked out of the mission as soon as someone drops (which happens frequently even with friends) without return to host lobby. The automated feature to put friends in the same session also works only partially which means that you'll be spending time trying to gather up in the same session over and over and over again. Why don't just add a grouping feature Rockstar?We all stopped playing multiplayer after all this frustration waiting for hopeful fixes. Did I mention that loading times are really long even for high end rigs and that there still is random slowdown of FPS?Pick this one up on sale and don't expect much from the multiplayer. I cannot recommend it at full price at this point.

review: I'm not giving this game a thumbs down to make some sort of statement about modding or optimization. For the record I have tried no mods and the game runs better than I expected.This is a good game but I want to be clear It's not perfect.The singleplayer is generally very satisfying and the map is fun to explore but none of the characters are appealing enough for me to want to root for them. Michael honestly deserves most of the things he tirelessly es about Trevor's insanity never amused or moved me that much and Franklin just didn't have much originality in the scope of GTA protagonists. Maybe I'd have grown to like one of them more if there had been one protagonist instead of three I constantly had to switch between. In terms of Gameplay GTA V offers a huge world to explore but never really capitalizes on it. I was very pleased to see the return of purchaseable businesses but was annoyed at the clumsiness of dividing them between three characters and I was deeply disappointed that there was no option to buy safe houses in other parts of the map as in many other GTA games. Such would have been a great feature for this game considering how huge the map is. More than anything though my biggest problem with this game is that it feels set up solely to get you to play GTA Online which I found underwhelming. Here the game offers you the freedom it denies you in the singleplayer but forces you to participate in missions and activities with other players in order to progress. Aside from some missions most of these activities aren't that fun and detract from the freedom that makes GTA enjoyable.That said much of the game is really good. Rockstar has put way more energy and passion into this game than is the norm in these sad times and that much earns this game my respect. The map is refreshingly large and exploring it feels like an adventure. The first person mode is a great deal of fun. The cars are exceptionally well made and beautifully detailed. I'm not saying that GTA V is bad or even that it's not a good game. It's just overhyped. I'll still play it and I'll openly say that I like it quite a lot but it's not perfect.TLDR I don't regret spending the $60 to play GTA 5 but neither am I thrilled that I did. It's not something I'd recommend against buying but neither would I actively recommend buying it.

review: Great game. Good story. Wonderful port save for a few issues. Beautiful graphics. Now for the kicker Rockstar has never come out and supported mods for the game.Originally posted by Terk Here's the thing. The method currently being used to mod isn't really what most people think of as modding.ScriptHook is an example of DLL Assembly Code Injection which sneaks foreign code into the process in order to provide a method for an additional payload of code to hook/modify the game process in memory.The problem with this is that there is no way to tell what the payload is. Nor is there anyway to prevent the payload from working in only some areas of the game.That's the point a lot of people don't understand here we're not talking addons. We're talking DLL files that have been modified to allow a user to run ANY additional code they want and have the game accept it and execute it. There are no limits to what can be run with this and the trainer that comes as the included demonstration of scripthook is a very benign usage of the potential.To give you an example of the dangers of allowing DLL Injected clients to connect to multiplayer servers or any other client for that matter until recently in Reign of Kings hackers using the same method that scripthook uses were using injected assembly code into DLLs to modify files on the computers of other players on the servers they connected to and in many cases even the files on the servers themselves.When we're talking about DLL Injection there is no such thing as singleplayer mod or multiplayer mod. It's just foreign code being run anywhere the user wants. The only way to prevent it is to check the integrity of the DLLs of any client on connection and cutting the connection as soon as a disprecency is found. It may seem like overkill but the alternative is a complete loss of security for anyone using gta online.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA such an amazing concept but unfinished.The game focuses too much on making money and then there isn't actually enough to do after that. There is too much focus on combat and it feels as if they've just thrown some racing missions in there to appeal to the car fans. The game needs more mini games and more to aspire for than just a few heists to do over and over again. It's amazing the way the in game web browser works and everything but the only thing you can really do is buy vehicles and properties.I would love to see much more customisable properties and more to do with the money and maybe even more heists. At the moment the game just feels like a waste.#reviewedlikeapro #cringe

review: First off I just wanna mention that I played this game for Xbox 360 back in the day so what you read comes from a true veteran of the GTA v community.My first point is the story it's fun and the three main characters are well designed and feel real (despite you can make them look like total morons ) also the mission can be pretty fun from sneaking into a house to repo a car to flying a crop duster plane into the back of a titan plane just to attempt to steal what is inside. The story has wacky funny moments but if you buy this game for just the story you won't be dissatisfied but you will be missing out on a large portion of this game and that is of course GTA online now let's get one thing straight the online portion did not actually exist when GTA v originally released but there has but there has been many a update since the initial release to the point where a beginner wouldn't even realise just how far online has come. There is a lot to do in gta online so I'll just keep it simple there are missions that give you cash. There are offices biker clubs bunkers and with the recent update hangers that can help make you money in freeplay but leaves you open to being greifed by others but they are some of the best ways to make money and have fun without the tediousness of having to launch/join a mission lobby now in terms of what you can buy for both online and solo there is a lot of cars planes boats and of course Guns and since the gun running update rockstar has began focusing more on customisation of said guns planes cars etc however the most annoying thing about this game in terms of online is that many of the things to buy in this game are quite ludicrous is terms of price but I personally think that if you put the hours in you can earn everything this game has offer because the feeling of starting with nothing and having everything at the end is very satisfying and you can definitely spend hundreds of hours playing this game and if you have friends all the better just don't give in to the temptation of buying shark cards and you will find that this game can be a lot of fun to play.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is very difficult but I'm afraid I have to not recommend it. The quality of the game world mechanics and all the open world possibilities are awesome. For that it would surely be a wonderful game to play.But the problem with all the later GTA games is the way the developers try to force a specific story on the gamer. It feels like playing in a sandbox with some big kids trying to keep you from playing with the cool toys. I seriously don't understand why there is no Sandbox mode in this game and you are forced to either mill through the stories they come up with or you have to install some patch to enable the locked features. It's just boring.Certain weapons clothes garages cars etc. can only be found if you go through the motions of the quests in story mode. Even in multiplayer it feels like someone is holding my hands as I'm trying to play.The fun of an open world game is to be able to wander around and try new stuff. Having to follow an immensly detailed list of actions kills all the fun and creativity for me. There is no sens in creating such a wonderfully open responsive world with so much to discover and then nailing it shut and putting gamers on rails during the whole experience...I had hoped this GTA5 version would have less of that but it is actually worse than 4 in this respect.So overall I'd say this game is very disappointing for me and I probably won't be getting 6.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: In my opinion GTA V and online are fun and enjoyable. The things that ruin the game though is the pathetic amount of hackers still roaming through the game ruining the fun and the almost constant grind the game puts you through. The game does need to be reworked prices being changed and jobs having better payouts but If you dedicate a day or two in the game like I have you start to earn money quite quick. (Once you get into things like being a CEO and gunrunning money becomes easier to get yet in my opinion it's just better to vehicle cargo once the warehouse is filled with standard and medium range vehicles making all the vehicles sourced top range. Rockstar put a x2 bonus on vehicle cargo before the Smugglers Run DLC and I personally made 15 million in 3 4 days)

Doing heists is the only way to make decent money online and yet they are impossible unless you have 4 or more friends playing with you. In GTA 4 and San Andreas mods were a huge part of the game. In GTA5 however you can get banned for using them even offline and yet hackers are rampand online (and yet never give me money ( ) constantly killing everyone in the server.Single player is aight defintley not worth the money though.

review: Okay so I've had it for 2 days....played for 13.5 hours. Now this game I told myself I would only play just to explore that I didn't want to play the story whatsoever..but somehow..they're just so enticing. I mean you got that hood thug black guy stereotype you've got the father of a family that is disfuncitonal and you got this crazy dude. So far they're all interesting except the crazy guy I really like being the father cause he's cool but also has issues with the fam (. The game is solid love the stories graphically still nice and there's tons of stuff to do! Also for some reason I've laughed hysterically multiple times during this game I've never done it for any other one...for example I was casually walking and I wanted to push the door opened but instead I accidently fire a shot from my gun and everyone goes insane and I get instantly mowed down by the cops xD. Something hilarious also is that you can just flip people off while on a vehicle...oh my god I've been testing it and just sitting by people while I'/m on a motorocycle and flipping them off..and the guys literally grab you and throw you off your bike it's so stinking funny xD.Overall 11/10 highly exceeded my expectations.

review: Cons 1.Storyline is the worst out of all the Gran Theft series. Not once did I care at all about any of the main characters. I personally wanted to kill all three of them myself. 2. For an open world game each of the missions are extremely linear. 3.GTA online is a joke. And lacks any and all substance. DRM DRM DRM. Pay to win hackfest. 4. No ability to actually interact with the world that isn't through the barrel of a gun. No grab no substantial melee no human shield ability. No ability to pick up objects people or bodies. Complete lack of true customization.Pros 1.gameplay mechanics have improved over the last installment and the graphics are much better. 2.Mod community 3. As with all the GTA games the voice acting was supperb. And I give the actors credit for putting up with the horrible writing and character arcs.

review: This game has stunning graphics and that's it. The story and gameplay aren't worth it.There is absolutely no freedom when you are in a mission. Any slight deviation from what it tells you to do results in the mission failing. The closest you get to free will in this game is the rare instance where it basically gives you a bright flashing text saying "HERE ARE YOUR PREDETERMINED 'FREE' CHOICES".You don't even have that much freedom outside of a mission either. You can die completely out of the blue from random "events". The cops must have access to secret alien technology since they are able to inexplicably turn the front wheels of your car by just tapping the back of it. In reallity they were just too lazy to program the cops to actually go to the side of your car and perform a pit maneuver.The cops also apparently psychic abilities and teleportation powers.The story is forgettable. Every character is designed to be as irritating and unlikeable as possible so surprise surprise they end up being incredibly irritating and unlikeable. From the protagonists all the way down to the NPC's.The only character that's even remotely likeable only shows up once for the sake of literal and inexplicable "torture porn". It's so painfully obvious that this scene was just put here to force a controversy and get more publicity for the game. A good writer might have had this character return later in the story maybe to try and get revenge on the characters but that does not happen. In fact this part has literally no effect on the main story and could have effortlessly been left out.The entire world of this game is wasted on everything being a cheap joke written by a 12 year old who just discovered Family Guy. Every "joke" in this game can be summed up in one sentence "I am doing something wrong and not being self aware about it". There you have it. Literally every single joke that gets constantly repeated through not only the characters but billboards televisions radio stations and logoes.It's sad that the artists and programmers who had such attention to detail had to be lumped in with whoever wrote and designed the gameplay for this polished turd.The only thing even remotely redeemable about this game is the online multiplayer but even that's quickly turning sour.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game combines great game play consisting of third person and first person view and action packed missions great radio stations and next gen graphics perfectly. A huge map adds to the excellent open world experience. Realistic first person game play provides great satisfaction in action packed missions. A must play. This is a game which one must literally play before he dies if he is a gamer.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The missions are great the heists are amazing the characters are pretty interesting so all in all the singleplayer part of the game is amazing. You wouldn't expect anything less from GTA.But the multiplayer is a whole another deal. Sure all the missions are fun and the heists are even better the other game modes (like Races team deathmach and rpg vs insurgent) are just amazing. But the problem with that is that there is never over 30 players per server and with 25 people you are gonna be lucky as hell to find 7 more who want to play with you. Even if you decide to wait 20 minutes to start a match with 8 people and one of them leaves the game just kicks everyone out of the loby (And sometimes to a whole different server) so guess what now you have to wait all over again if you want to get into the game. Okey okey for missions and heists you need 2 4 people total so it's not that hard to get that manny sure but 90% of the missions (the begginer ones) are so generic and stupid i can't believe it. Almost all of them go like this 1) Go to the spot of the meeting or whatever 2) Wait for everyone to go into the position 3) Watch an unskipable boring cutscene (Not always the case) 4) goes down and you have to kill everyone and take a bag or a vehicle 5) Drop it off at the spot. tl dr Singleplayer 9/10Multiplayer 3/10 The only reason i gave multiplayer 3/10 is because unless you have some friends to play with its dead at this point. Huge loading times empty lobies nowhere near enough players per server boring missions. If you plan on buying this game now for the multiplayer don't bother because all you are going to be getting is one big disappointment.

review: Don't get me wrong I love GTA V it's easily one of my favorite games. I just cannot reccommend the PC version.PCs are stronger than Xbox One so the fact that my Xbox One (its not an S) can run GTA V but not my PC (which is about as old as my One) is purely awful. The game is slow things turn to pixels and when you're in a fast care everything lags like hell all because my PC wasn't strong enough to handle this game but my Xbox One was. If they can make a version that runs well on something less powerful than a computer they shouldn't have the specs for the PC edition extremely high in minimum.The only reason I would reccommend the PC version is that the game can install mods. If you're going to get this game for GTA Online save yourself some Steam money and buy it for PS4 or Xbox One.

review: Hello I just wanted to start off by saying that I review a game for what it is also compared with the previous titles in the series if a game in any franchise is messed up it's messed up I'm not going to sugar coat it and defend it to death like a fanboy.I also want to point out that I played Grand Theft Auto ( III Vice City San Andreas IV and now the most recent V at the time I'm writing this) with that said I have been playing these games pretty much from the start with the exception of Grand Theft Auto 1 and 2.Now if I am to rate the game purely for what it is and what it wants to be it's a fantastic game.If i rate the game from a Grand Theft Auto standard it's a dumbed down consolized game that appeals to people who let's just say have a hard time with games.The single player is awesome it could be a lot better my only wish is that is a bit longer on the mission counter.I was very disappointed with Franklin's side of the story he comes from the hood but for some reason Rock Star didn't bothered to give him a better story what I mean by that the gangs are barely used as mission structure so much potential was wasted with Franklin the fact that he lives with Denise from GTA San Andreas wich was CJ's girlfriend none of this is pointed out.If I was in charge of single player I'd Introduce characters from San Andreas.I would focus like two separate stories one with Michael and Trevor the other Franklin and Lamar with guidance from the old grove street families members Sweet and CJ the only ones left alive after the end of GTA San Andreas.The gameplay is awful.. driving cars motorcycles and flying planes (helicopters are alright) feel stiff on rails extremely sensitive and feel too much like an arcade game.Cars explode too easy and i'm not talking about falling from a 30 story building one example is.. I drove a car hit some mailboxes lost control of the car it started to roll and backflip all over the road touched the asphalt and exploded.Motorcycles drive really bad I can go as far to say that GTA Vice City is 1st GTA who has motorcycles has better driving.GTA IV driving was perfect a bit over the top but overall was great especially motorcycles felt real and genuine.Police is another thing that kills this game you can hide in a back alley miles from where you committed the crime and they will drive into that alley.The AI never misses their shots that's another thing that kills this game dead you can't go on a rampage because you get dropped within 6 shots.. yeahAnd don't tell me to use the characters special ability because the game is centered around that and if you want to play the game the classic way you die too fast. Because if you go against 6 dudes that never miss a single bullet without the special ability you get your A$$ handed to you. My opinion that's Bull$it.Imagine if Mortal Kombat was in a manner where you can only damage your opponent with x rays or special combinations ain't that bull$it ? yeah it is.. what if I want to beat him up just by kicking and punching but I digress.The Radio stations also for me it feels uninspired and many people feel the same way from what I read online.The radio overall was a letdown. Especially the Talk Radio didn't like it all that much.Now of course i did some nitpicking but unfortunately the things I pointed out kills the game if you come from GTA IV you will be very disappointed with this game.SO TO RECAP You can't have fun while driving.. car flips around if it lands on anything other than it's wheels it explodes not all the time but a good 70% of the time wich is a lot anyway.You can't start shooting left and right the cops come and drop you so fast.The driving part of the game feels out of place. ( i got used to it now but I still don't like it).SO.. do I recommend this game? definitely yes BUT take in consideration what negatives I pointed out wich are genuine game breaking and unfunny.Thank you all for takeing your time reading this cheers.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is boring as hell. Same old heists and t missions. Now the situation on PC online is that no one even joins the heists or mission. So basically in GTA V online you join and t around by driving in random places. Not to mention you get spammed by t Prison Break heists invitation. GTA V offline is worse. Best GTA story mode was in GTA 3 which really had a story. This story mode has no story in it and full of racism and adult content. Now they have openely added hookers and strippers that show their boobs in the game and you can literally them.Worst part is that if you want to enjoy all the features like $10 million plane etc then one thing is guaranteed that you can never make that much money by playing Heists especially when no one joins them. If you try to use trainers to get money so that you can explore all the features of the game then Rockstar BANS you for so called CHEATING. How the hell a game who fundamental concept is cheating and crime can BAN you for Cheating? Basically they don't want you to enjoy the game the way you want to. I am really disappointed with this game. I don't recommend anyone to buy it.

review: I don't know what to say about this. Because while the campaign is still amazing to this day and the added first person view feels very natural the multiplayer is a mess. So if you wanna try the singleplayer go for it.As for GTA online the thing that keeps this game alive and adds replayability I just can't recommend. Don't get me wrong it can have it's charm and fun moments but everything feels like a job and a grind unless you are a spoiled kid who has shark cards. Even with shark cards it will put you at a loss if you try to spend it wisely. Buying a drug house to break even could take you 20 hours of repeating the same quest over and over and that's if no one who hacks or has millions doesnt blow up your cargo making you wait 2 4 hours real life time to fill up your drugs again. It's and it feels nothing feels satisfying the physics between players lag and rockstar cares nothing about you progressing and wants to break your spirit until you buy their microtransactions. To add to that they are extremely ban happy on innocent players but yet 99% of matches (not joking being serious) have 1 2 hackers. The matches that don't have hackers will eventually. They never get banned and you will be in these matches for hours with nothing happening. They will teleport you lock you in cages insta kill you force you to use emotes blow up your car glitch your missions until they break. This all happens in a game run by a multi million if not billion dollar company. It's a blatant and insulting slap in the face to people who love their product and while the constant updates and pure ton of content are amazing it still doesnt help the fact it's all overpriced and too hard to get to be worth it. Don't buy this game if you want multiplayer it will drain you
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: gonna start off the bat with BUY THIS GAME WHILE ITS ONSALE. yeah i may make it sound like its great and all but if you want your money's worth buy it when its onsale 45 dollars at most. if you're white and have a ton of money go buy it idfc.so like you'll spend 100 hours in story mode at most if you plan to goof off and replay it but just doing main missions can take 5 15 hours depending on your speed. if you use mods you may spend more time in it but if you wanna play online mode you've gotta uninstall them which absolutely sucks. if you speedrun it then maybe 5 10. keep in mind at least 70% of story mode is driving to your destination. franklin is as black as this box you had to hover over to read this text btw so watch our for police my only complaint with story mode is how it can be super tedious sometimes and how rockstar doesn't really utilize the open worldness since its so empty. IMO it's the worst story out of all the GTA games (1 and 2 don't count 3 is debatable between worst and 2nd worst) but that doesn't mean its bad.now for online the big part2 minutes minimum of loading with a god like computer because rockstar refuses to use dedicated servers so you've gotta use peer to peer if you have no friends you'll get bored after maybe 100 250 hours. with friends you'll have a lot of fun 1000 hours before things start to get boring for me at least.the problem with this game is repetition and grinding. there's a lot to do but all the adversery modes are boring with a few exceptions. after a few hundred hours you've already experienced most of online so you're mainly just doing freemode missions and businesses to make money or fighting some tryhard that thinks putting a KD ratio on his college resume will get him anywhere in life. SPOILER ALERT it doesn't actually get you anywhere and shows how much of your life you wasted there are also modders which is pretty much 99% will ruin your day and 1% will be nice and give you money.this game is also super buggy and has a lot of glitches that can give you the upperhand in combat or making money. also if you plan to use glitches in combat with others at least do it as self defense and not attack people with it otherwise you're just gonna get looked down upon. if you've ever played dark souls people will point down at you if you use glitches. (to the people who doesn't get the joke pointing down is the ultimate way of showing disrespect in that game)as i mentioned earlier tryhards and hostile people are extremely annoying. these are the people that will kill you for no real reason what so ever. typically they mess with lower levels so the higher level you are the more safe you'll be (theoretically) but there's always a threat. it's also the worst when they destroy some business supplies the feeling you get is just pure hatred right afterwards. if you're one of these people please go kindly die.nevertheless this game is extremely fun. aside from glitches repetition grind and people ruining your day it will give you a ton of entertainment. initially i bought this game with my friend but he didnt like it too much so i made friends while playing this game and i still talk to them today (yeah i'm a weeb for having online friends i already know). there is no right way to play this game which is great and all.

review: You can say whatever you want about GTA's story gameplay graphics and so on. But the scripting/hacker dilemma is out of control and has been so for some time now and that's inexusable for a company of Rockstar's proportions to let that slide so heavily.I take long breaks (weeks to months) inbetween sessions but everytime I return I'm immediately greeted by a hacker/scriptor via some form. A few rare are friendly but they all exist and operate openly causing city wide disturbances mass spawning vehicles money and npc's aim bots god mode superman flight city carpet bomings. Anything you can think of.Rockstar and supporters irresponsibly put the burden of hackers on the consumer by telling us to fill out reports to solve the issue but I paid for a "finished" product that functions as described and I don't remember reading about a hacker faction/regime in the game description. One could literally sit all day going session to session reporting and never even reach the stack of shady sneaky cheaters. If the game's hack detterenant system is that ineffective there's something essential wrong in the system itself and that responsibility does not fall on the shoulders of the consumer.When the online gameplay is no longer a hackers circus paradise I will change the recommendation but there's just no excuse to rampant hackers with a budget of GTA V's magnitude regardless of gameplay or otherwise.

review: This is most likely the worst PC port I ever saw. It should be playable if you got a licensed XBox controler OR a numpad.Otherwise you cannot do airmissions at all and anything involving controlled flight comfortable.I have no idea how any programmer worth his or her money do that but they totally FAILED making mouse control for the entire Air parts. They took the existing concepts that have been around for 2 decades and did everything to make it useless.I can't fight the controls in addition to the path the NPC's and the other players.If steam would allow refunds I would ask for one. I can't remember when I was last so utterly infuriated at a control system. I doubt there has been one like this since the old days of the sega mega drive and that one at least has nostalgia on it's side.The FPS part has issues too. It is basically a cover shooter but without effective cover that gives more then 90% protection helpfull placed cover due to the open world self regenerating health/shield mechanic or high HP and cheap revival that make cover usefullBut with AI that can jump up behind cover aim and shoot you and go back into cover before you even have a chance to aim at them (much less for the headshoot you will need) AI that has no issues hitting a mooving target no mater how impoossible it is for you to hit them while moving weapons that can one shoot you regardless of armor and healthOtherwise it is a racing game with oversized hitboxes making not hitting anything near impossible driving physics that result in even the smalest impact at low speed either totally stopping you or letting you make pirouettes on the street minute to half hour long chases where you enemies are the traffic because the target won't even be on your minimap much less in your sight no in world target markers or path markers making it hard to even know who or what to shoot or where to drive a small angeled rotating minimap as far from the center of screen as possible to minimise orientation while also dodging traffic cars that can't be stopped by anythng less then a RPG or sticky bomb while having a driver that can die from a single bullet

review: I've played this game thrice now each time on a different platform. Each version has been more fun and chaotic than the last. My first playthrough was on the now inferior Xbox 360. The graphics were gorgeous. They were a sight to see. Third person shooter 3 playable characters who worked together in heists and missions. Gameplay was solid. The attention to detail in this game is amazing and you'll have to play it to know what I mean. Now here is where one of my favorite multiplayer experiences ever comes in. GTA Online. It's really hectic and not quite what I had in mind after watching trailers and stuff. But still on October 1st 2013 my friends and I went to our houses and logged into Xbox Live. We decided to make our crew. We kept going back and forth on names and when we went to enter them they had all been taken. Then my friend Luke told us to just start playing while he got a name. 15 minutes later he says quietly "Done." Two seconds later I get an invite to the "Love Bunny Crew". And our crew tag was LOVE. Jesus that makes me laugh every time. We had a blast. It almost felt like DayZ in the sense that you couldn't really trust anyone. Except in here unlike DayZ almost EVERYONE was a total prick. At least in DayZ there is about a 50/50 chance that they are friendly. Ugh. Anyway I loved it. But then I lost my disc in mid 2014. I heard about a possible port er 'remaster' to the next gen (Current gen really.) consoles. I'd had a PS4 since December 15th 2013. Exactly one month after its launch. And almost a year later GTA was being released for it. Keep in mind my current gaming machine was built in early January. A few weeks before the release this trailer was released showing off GTA V in first person. This was mind blowing for me! I had always wondered what it would be like to have a GTA V in first person since I saw some gameplay of GTA San Andreas and GTA IV in first person. I thought it was going to be game changing. In reality while it is nifty it's kind of gimmicky. I went to GTA Online and found out that I could transfer my old 360 character. Boy was I excited! Same drill really. Fun open world chaos. And the multiplayer was the same ol' "shoot first ask never" routine. It was fun. But the my machine was built two months after in early January that next year. I was ready for the PC version to come out because I wanted a game that could bring my machine down to its knees. This isn't the game. I can run this 60 frames per second easily. Director Mode and Rockstar Editor were added this time around. Pretty much the WHOLE reason that I bought it AGAIN. Worth it. The other day I tried going back to the PS4 version mainly because I'd misplaced my keyboard that day ( don't ask) and it was UNBEARABLE. 30 frames per second no mods and JESUS CHRIST did the PS4 crash it? I don't know does a bear in the woods?So in short PC goodness 10/10 would club hooker to death again.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Even though I got banned it wasn't my fault.So I am going to start off saying that my PC is terrible(If I know how to send specs I'd do it all I know is that I have an AMD Motherboard and processor)I was playing a pub lobby helping my friend with CEO work and this guy jumped in my car and jumped out and suitcases were flying behind him immediately my FPS went from 30 to 2 due to the entities on my screen.He came back in my car and spontaneously combusted and destroyed my friend's CEO objective T20 then he teleported to my spawn and started dropping masses of suitcases on my head giving me $2 000 each one.I tried to leave and disconnect but I tried to press ctrl + alt+ del alt + f4 and alt + enter but my PC was running 100% CPU and Memory so no matter what all my commands were frozen leaving me on a still screen on my character jumping with suitcases filling the screen.I went to turn my PC off and came back on in an invite session only and I went from 1 million to about 6 million and my friend said that I am going to get banned not knowing what to do I just enjoyed the money before my ban in empty sessions bought a Savage CEO office Insurgent I was happy but sad knowing this is going to go because of my ***ty PC and terrible communities.Buy this game so you can feed rockstars greedy company that doesnt help people when they need it.

review: THUMBS DOWN.From the start of this game I'm treated to some DRM nonsense as I try to register for an account for Rockstar (And WHY do I need to register for a game that I bought with MY MONEY EXACTLY?? I already paid for it the game shoudl be mine without any privacy pay walls) but have the window fail to connect to the main server about 5 different times forcing me to register on the website (joy of joys)Then I have to restart the game about 5 different times JUST TO GET IT TO TURN ON WINDOWED BORDERLESS MODE.And THEN ANOTHER 20 TIMES *JUST TO GET THE GRAPHICS SETTINGS TO FING STICK*!!! And all the while I'm RESTARTING like 200 goddamn times.AND THEN THE GAME STOPS READING MY KEYBOARD!MY LOGITECH USB CONNECTED *WIRED* KEYBOARD SO MY CHARACTER IS *STUCK* IN PLACE for some reason despite being not stuck JUST A SCENE EARLIER!!!!!!!Do 5 year old psych ward patients program this game? What kind of an imbecile do you need to be to program a game THIS POORLY. AND THEN to levy a creepy private info wall that both needs your steam account (for SOME REASON) AND needs you to REGISTER with Rockstar?WHY AM I REGISTERING WITH YOU ROCKSTAR. So you can steal my info? Try to control me? Spy on me passively by raising a last minute blue balls private info "pay"wall that I have to give you all of my favourite s ex positions on so you can control me? Basically Rockstar is becoming the new EA.Here's the funny thing GTA V isn't even that good. It's too realistic. Vice City was classic Rockstar. There was a strategy layer where you had to capture turfs and earn money from them buy businesses...there were jumps everywhere the cars felt amazing...Same for GTA III. Since GTA IV the GTA series have been getting more and more boring and realistic and just meh. GTA San Andreas was the last real GTA Rockstar can go and jump on a pipe see how that feels for a change becase that's all they deserve.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: SINGLEPLAYER RATING 10/10The game is great even after 4 years from its release. The story mode is rich in story. The plot and the storyline is written well. The missions in single player is absolutely entertaining (especially Trevor ones). The heists were absolutely fun and exciting to do. Finishing single player is totally worth doing so over and over.GTA ONLINE RATING 5/10 Because of hackers. THUMBS DOWN FOR THIS.I really love the game but lets go over to GTA Online. I love how there's always new content in GTA Online. There are so many things to do but you can't do everything in one day. From mini games like arm wrestling to car racing and all that to CEO jobs MC missions heists and everything is very entertaining time will past so fast playing GTA. The only downside for me is that there are plenty of hackers roaming around the free world in their 'godmode' state eating 10000000000 headshots and not die at all. Hackers can also make you want to lap dance for them because they are a bunch of fa.ggots who like men to lapdance on them. They can also teleport anywhere they want to so basically they ruin the game for legitimate players in public servers. /Where is the option for private session now? I can't seem to find it either. Get your shiit together Rockstar. EDIT NOV 23 2018 I am still amazed how timeless this game is becoming. My opinion still stands on how bad Rockstar support is though.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: From a technical and design perspective Grand Theft Auto V sets new bars. The world it presents is unrivalled in authenticity and vibrancy. It feels fluid and alive. Time passes organically characters' lives progress and there is a simply astounding quantity of side activities in which to engage. It's quite possible to explore the state of San Andreas for hours without moving the main story forward a stitch. In fact that's part of the fun. And it's all been polished to a glossy sheen. The controls feel great the visuals are lush and a brilliant graphical interface empowers players giving them all the information they need and only the information they need exactly when they need it. However the writing isn't quite as sharp as it has been in previous installments the humor is a bit broader and less sophisticated and the main characters aren't as well developed (probably because there are now three) but this only impacts the overall experience a little. It remains a very impressive game.Keep in mind though that much of the content is unequivocally geared for adult audiences. And even then it will not be for all tastes. Grand Theft Auto V puts players in the roles of criminals who show little remorse for their evil actions and often even take pleasure in them. It's a dark fantasy with the potential to prove immense fun for those who are mature enough to properly appreciate its adult humor and able to clearly distinguish between right and wrong. It is not a game for younger players with developing psychologies. And adults who don't have a taste for role playing a life of crime should probably give this game a wide berth.

review: Okay I think I have a lot to say about this.First things first this game is wonderful. I beat the game a couple times on the original xbox 360 version and I'd rate the story mode 4/5. Lots of things to do in this game and the map is pretty big. I really enjoy riding a bike up the mountains and then parachuting off or surviving with a 5 star wanted level while on the tallest building in the game. Singleplayer in this game is fun already and adding mods ontop just makes it 10x better. Would I reccomend getting this for the singleplayer? Yes. Oh hey! There's also a nifty 'online' mode. I had lots of fun doing multiplayer in GTA4 so surely GTA5 has an even better online mode seeing as there are millions of things to do in singleplayer right? Well sure I guess. GTA Online has lots and lots and lots of activities to do. You can rob stores play golf murder people have an arm wrestle (RIP fingers) rob banks race etc. There is just so much to do. However I wouldnt do multiplayer unless you have friends to play it with. 9/10 times there is a modder in an online server that likes to bomb everybody thats in the server or just spawn random stuff to annoy players. Even if you play in passive mode (Essentially disables PvP) they will still often do stuff like blow up nearby vehicles teleport control you and your vehicles etc. Now if you either play in a closed session by yourself (limits the available activities) or play with your friends the game is pretty great. Money is NOT as hard to get as people make it sound. I got the game a few weeks ago and already managed to get a nice apartment and some vehicles. It just takes time. Even if you play for an hour a day you can easily rob a few stores and get at least 10k a day. If you are looking for fast money whenever you get invited to an organization accept it. As long as you are within a radius of your CEO you will get paid around 5000 every 30 minutes and if you do missions with your ceo you can easily make 20k or so in an hour. Anyways thats my review.TL DR Singleplayer is great Multiplayer is not always great unless you have friends.

review: Finally at last GTA V has finally come to PC i gotta say this is a much more improved port than GTA IV but however i did notice some things that are not right and rockstar may need to fix them and also some things are kinda weird for me. here are some pros/cons for this portProsGTA V PC portAwesome 1080p support (i'm currently using this)Graphics improved from console (at least from my eyes it is)very good optimized (with the 3.50 driver from Nvidia)Rockstar Editor is very unique and cool (exclusive to this PC port only)Looks beautiful from my monitor looking at Los Santos being aliveMods (There are no mods out yet but this will be one of the main reasons of why this port is so succuseful)ConsSome unoptimized areas (sometimes when i got to some areas such as open plain desert my fps will drop but when i go back to city it's back to 60 fps rockstar please fix/improve this asap and also i use a ASUS GTX 970 and when i set up the graphics i've only used like around 2.0 3.3 GB of VRAM and also by the time i set up the graphics options the bar was green which i think it meant it was stable and optimized but apparently it completely didn't. )Kinda weird controls for helicopter/plane (not really a bad thing but it's just feel unfamilar i can't remember any PC games that have this controls you use the number pad to drive forward? i'm not familiar with it but i will have to master this controls and get familiar with the controls so not really a game breaker or will lose verdict points)So yeah that's all at the moment i feel playing this port it's a excellent port possibly the best GTA game port ever. Well done Rockstar you earned yourself a very well made cookie for your efforts put into this port. )Final Verdict 10/10 for being the best port.

review: *Note This game was posted 1 week after it got released I will not be updating my review for any future updates.*"Grand Theft Auto V is a game about exploration and survival in an infinite procedurally generated galaxy"That is what this game was supposed to be a game with an amazing galaxy which you could explore with loads of features which were promised.But in reality we got a game that is all about grinding.You start of with a crashed space ship on a planet you will have to find resources to repair your ship which is a relatively easy task unless you spawned on a planet with almost no resources which was my case.After you finished that you can finally explore the "infinite procedurally generated galaxy" but after around 10 hours of gameplay you will realise that the "infinite galaxy" with "endless possibilities" doesn't really have "endless possibilities" especially with the planets.When you played the game and paid attention to details you will know there are only a few types of planets "water planets with a few islands extreme planets ice planets dead rocks with no form of life and plants hot planets and planets with a lot of flora and fauna".all of these types of planets for example two different ice planets all have very similar flora and fauna which gives you a feeling that you already explored that planet while you didn't.Once you saved up enough for a new space ship buying your first space ship is very exciting you get excited you are hoping for a faster ship you want to rename your ship as they promised in the trailer you hope you will have cool weapons for your ship.But after flying for a couple of minutes you will realise that your ship functions the same as your first ship there is no different speed in any of the space ships you don't have ships optimized for combat trading or exploring which was also promised you can't even rename your ship which was of course also promised.The space combat is not exciting either you are always out numbered and the space pirates have 100% accuracy.The space combat feels boring and annoying every time you are traveling with your pulse drive those space pirates show up you will think to yourself "god why?"Of course you can decide to ignore the space pirates by flying into the atmosphere of a planet or a space station but then again they won't follow you in the atmosphere which was also shown in the trailer.if you happen to find a portal at a planet don't even bother to try activate those things they aren't working this was also promised in a trailer by the way.Want to play with your friends like Sean Murray said in a interview don't even try you can't.If you happen to come across a research facility you can shoot your way inside if you fire a couple of rounds at the door then the sentinels will come after you but don't worry about that just shoot the door until you are inside then the sentinels will leave you alone you can just ignore them because they are barely any threat.I think I made my point here the game is repetitive boring and after a while it just turns into a grinding simulator.It's really a shame to see the game end up like this I've been following development since 2014 and have been hyped about it since I knew about it.But if you compare the trailers to the actual product you will realise that Sean Murray has been lying.I am done defending this game I defended it for a couple of weeks but ever since I saw playstation users are getting updates I am done defending it.The developers took a huge on all PC users.Coming to a verdict I am giving this game a 4/10 it was fun for a couple of hours after that it becomes boring and repetitive.I recommend for the sake of your 60 euros to stay away from this game as far as possible.

review: It's not like this game needs more praise but oh well. This game is a masterpiece. The world is just so packed with content and small details that it's mind boggling. The multiplayer is cool I guess. I mostly just did the heists with my friends but the PvP stuff there is cool but not enough for me to dedicate hours to it. I'm here for the single player and it's just so spot on. The visuals not just for a game of this size and scale but for any game are seriously impressive. The characters and voice acting are film worthy (GTA would make for a great show on TV). The missions are great especially the heist missions. Planning is simple yet fun and feel like you're really planning one but they are still streamlined enough that you don't get bogged down. I really really love that Rockstar did the 1st person mode. Having to download mods for that in past GTAs resulted in not the best quality but it really works in GTA V. When seeing footage in Youtube videos it always weirds me out when I see people plating in 3rd person as I remember "Oh yeah GTA can be played in 3rd person." The shooting driving hand to hand fighting and all the rest of it just works so well and is so well done. If they ever bring Red Dead Redemtion over to the PC I really hope they 1st person ify the game.One of the easiest 5/5s I can give.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The singleplayer portion of the game is fun. Hours of stuff to do in singleplayer. Online however more stuff to do but sometimes cheaters are present. Ignore them and do your own thing.
