review: GTA 5 s first innovative step is to drop players in the shoes of not one but three protagonists which they can then switch between on the fly. In missions that involve all three players are given a tactical edge as they re effectively given three vantage points to view the action through.Can t target an enemy with a clear shot with one character? Simply switch over to a second character that just happens to be situated in a raised position with a sniper rifle.In some of the missions GTA V's multi pronged interface offers different ways of playing the same mission. In one instance players can cover one character with a sniper rifle as they sneak onto a boat or they can play the character on the boat and transform the experience from a shooter to stealth mission.The quick change mechanic also keeps the action moving at a pace. Finished a mission but don t fancy the lengthy drive to the next one which just happens to be on the other side of the map? Simply switch characters and get stuck right back into the action.Every mission has a rating ranging from Bronze up to Gold and a list of mini activities players need to clock in order to score a 100 per cent completion. For the first time in this series players now have the option of going back and replaying any mission they ve attempted at any point in the game they choose.The missions themselves vary from tried and tested templates familiar to GTA fans to some truly imaginative action packed shenanigans we won t spoil for you here. The centrepieces of GTA 5 however are the Heist missions.At certain points during GTA 5 s narrative players will be given a target to take down. In the past this sort of activity would simply take the form of a self contained mission but here players have two approaches in how they tackle a score. They re initially briefed on their options and are able to pick out crew members to assist on the job.Each member will want a percentage of the take and usually their percentage reflects how skilled they are at what they do. Crew members also improve with each score but their percentage doesn t so it s possible to level a rubbish hacker for example up to the point where he s rather good at his job but he ll still only ask for 4 per cent of the score.Once the method and crew are selected players may find they have to scour the city for some equipment like high grade military tech for a bank job or a fast car stashed in a parking lot for a getaway. Once all the equipment is assembled the heist commences and without giving too much away because really they house some of the best moments in the game it s some of the best game design Rockstar has pumped out into the world in ages.All the GTA playbook is brought to bear driving gunplay precise timing and the ability to outrun the cops with a four star wanted level as the Heist turns from nail shredding tension into a high octane action set piece.Not only are the Heists immense fun to play they feel like a natural evolution in the GTA series. Best of all a lot of this mayhem has an immediate pay off in the form of cash once all the crew has taken their cut naturally.And there are tons of things players can spend their cash on. Weapons armour clothes masks car upgrades custom jobs and properties and businesses are all up for grabs. As was the case with GTA 4 GTA 5 is set on a sprawling map filled with activities to occupy players for ages.Los Santos is Rockstar s cracked version of Los Angeles and anyone who has been to the City of Angels will crack a wry smile at the recognisable landmarks and neighbourhoods it contains.The city is simply bursting with events and mini games. Players can take part in a round of golf a game of tennis or even attempt a triathlon. They can improve their aim at a firing range transport contraband via land or air or engage in a spot of skydiving. Incidentally each time you use one of the three characters in the game in some sort of activity you level up their abilities.If you play a lot of tennis your stamina will go up. Spend some time at a firing range and your skill in firearms will increase. No activity is a waste and God knows there s enough of them to keep players engaged for hours.The map of Los Santos also feels looser less claustrophobic than GTA 4 s Liberty City. While i loved 2008 s Rockstar flagship release I have to confess that the constraints of the Liberty City gridlock prompted me to drop a small fortune on cabs.This hasn t been the case in Los Santos it s possible to navigate the streets highways back roads and off road routes without taking your foot off the gas and given the beauty and attention to detail of the world around you driving for extended periods never feels like a chore.In truth GTA 5 harkens back to the Bacchanalian sense of chaotic freedom that existed in the earliest third person GTA games (III Vice City and San Andreas). In Los Santos you re restricted only by a lack of attention and your lack of imagination. This is a town where you can enjoy a rollercoaster ride race down the side of a mountain on a bicycle or buy a parachute nick a dirt bike and then head off into the hills for a spot of motorised base jumping.There s also a rather decent story underpinning all of this action even though it will strike fans of the gritty GTA 4 as somewhat more hyper and more deranged. Rockstar North has always presented GTA as a twisted satire on American culture but given the extreme turn politics and media in the USA have taken in recent years GTA 5 s satirical edge is sharp enough to sever bone.The three protagonists at the centre of GTA 5 are all pretty unsympathetic characters although it s a testament to how well written they are that they re not bad company for the 26+ hours it ll take players to blaze through the main story mode.Franklin is a hustler from a rundown area of Los Santos who has grown tired of boosting cars for a repo business and is looking to make his mark as a professional criminal. His job causes him to cross paths with Michael a retired heist man who is being driven slowly insane by his selfish family.Franklin s looking for a mentor. Michael even though he initially doesn t know it is looking for a protégé and most importantly a way to end the mind numbing tedium of his day to day routine. It s not long before their activities bring them to the attention of Trevor a violent former partner of Michael s from back in the day. Once he s added to the mix everything goes sideways.This trio of characters are pretty hard work initially. Franklin is arguably the most likable of the three but since he s a criminal on the make he s hard to root for. Michael in his own words is a great thief but he s pretty much rubbish at everything else imagine Neil McCauley from the movie Heat stuck in a never ending episode of The Osbornes and you ll get a clear picture of his existence.As bad as the pair of them are however they re almost angelic when compared to Trevor who is probably the darkest anti hero ever created in the gaming medium. A raging psychotic driven by equal parts speed and hatred Trevor comes across more of a force of nature than an actual person.He s erudite and intelligent but wholly nihilistic and completely unpredictable. He s the sort of bloke you d cross the street to avoid. Trevor is as likely to slit your throat as he is to defecate on your carpet as he is to offer you a lift to work all depending on how badly hungover he is.Verdict 76/100

review: GTA V maxed out at 1080p with 60FPS? What more can I ask for? All I can say is all the wait was worth my time. Fun game great characters and has a good story too! One downside though is that the game shouldn't be run with an overclocked GPU it freezes in every couple of minutes. But who needs an overclocked GPU if the game runs at constant 60FPS with stock clocks? 10/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: If you've never heard of this game get examined. The best of the GTA series so far and one of the best open world games. The story is fantastic and very well done. That's all I'll say on that no spoilers here.Fair warning Using a keyboard and mouse with this game sucks. I definitely recommend using a gamepad. The PC version also requires you to create a Rockstar Social Club account whereas the console versions didn't.Tons of cars motorcycles boats planes and helicopters to choose from most of which mimic real world vehicles. The handling is pretty good on most of them.Single Player For being a bunch of criminals the trio of protagonists are a likeable bunch. You have your middle aged upper class family man retiree. Then there's the younger guy from the hood. Oh then there's Trevor a total psychopath. Through the course of the story the three end up together.Blood sex torture kidnapping drugs murder arson swearing racial stereotyping corruption... if you're easily offended don't buy this game. Don't buy it for your kids either that's just a stupid ing thing to do and as a parent you fail.GTA Online Sadly full of cheaters and modders even more than the Playstation versions since it's so much easier to mod a PC game. If you want to play online I'd recommend getting in with a good crew or playing with friends. Aside from the cheating the only other bad thing is the way communication with the servers is done when near other players. If one lags everyone lags and physics seem to go out the window. I never really ran into this on Playstation and have rarely seen it on PC but it does happen. Aside from those negatives the missions races and other activities are fun especially with friends.If you want to get public lobby's solo there are ways to make it happy. Google that Is it worth the price tag of $60 for what is really a 2 year old game? It was to me. I haven't enjoyed a GTA game this much since Vice City.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: A fantastic well optimized game with a good deal of modding potential if that's your thing. The game looks gorgeous on PC especially in 60FPS. Don't come into this game expecting a super complex story or deep mechanics it's GTA. Shoot cops and blow up.That said the online is ing terrible. Only play it if you want to have an hour or two of fun with friends. It's a grindy mess that's meant to make you eat up Shark Cards but they very rarely ban cheaters. Cheaters in this GTA Online can reset your (not just their your) level spawn in NPCs and change their playermodel give themselves weapons from singleplayer (like the taser which can infinitely stun players) and even spawn in ing objects. Like a windmill or the giant yacht from singleplayer. And that's just the tip of the iceberg.Get it for the singleplayer because the devs don't care about the Online beyond milking you for money.

review: After playing Grand Theft Auto V for a decent amount of time I can come to the conclusion that this game is great. It actually took me a while to find my spot in this game. There are so many hackers and cheaters that make your playing experience a terrible one but the game is fun.I was about 2 hours into my GTA Online experience and I met this one hacker. He insisted on teleporting me in the middle of the ocean over and over again. By the time I was able to swim to land I would be dead. Hackers ruin GTA.I finally met a nice hacker that gave me some cash bags. I bought myself a Zentorno and maxed it out. Then the hacker spawn killed me for 30 minutes because I "used his money wrong".So even though this game is full of hackers it's still fun.BUT WAIT! THERE'S MORE. I FORGOT THE STORYLINE!nah no one plays GTA for the storyline anymore

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is awesome. GTA Online is one of the best things ever! I never play with random people though. We create a private lobby with friends and then we have tons of fun. Like literally TONS. After the latest racing update it's even more fun. Racing is more "crazy" and feels like Trackmania. I love Rockstar for what they did with the game.However although I never met cheaters but from reading forum posts reviews on Steam I can see that it is really a big problem. It's a bit shame that Rockstar are not giving more effort on banning them and leaving innocent people alone. So advice for anyone who is already playing this game or going to buy it in the future take few friends and play it with them. Don't go into random lobbies because it's not really fun. Not only because of the cheaters but because it's just random deathmatch on the streets. Just gather your friends and you will have TONS OF FUN!I recommend this game for people who can play it with friends. Otherwise it's just too messy at least for me.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I'm going to be honest with you. This game ing sucks. As much as rockstar wants to say "oh look! we're adding new content!" that doesn't fix how this game is just another pay to win. I have only spent money on the game copy alone and you see 300+ hours and I don't even own a decent car aircraft or even a decent business. Sure I didn't know what I was doing the first 100+ hours but why should I have to know? Why should I have to go out of my way to watch guides on how to earn the most money possible when that option should be there in the first place. The only way to make any decent money is through the businesses (which take forever to actually generate a good income) doomsday heist (which is more of a "lategame" heist plus anybody can force the whole heist to restart over and over) or just have a modder give you money. Don't take this the wrong way GTA 5 is one of the most impressive games I've seen over the years. The problem is that Rockstar treats it like Valve treated TF2 and CS GO. They're just too greedy to listen anymore.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Boring incredibly easy uninspired tedious. Majority of missions are drive a &gt b or do some annoying minigame occasionally you get to shoot someone but it's so easy it's boring too I don't think I died a single time during a mission to gunfire. Story is generic trash too (Trevor's character as a minor exception).
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: nice game
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Crashed and corrupted my Win 10 upgrade forcing me to revert to Win 7. Bugs everywhere. R* will ban you for attempting to mod yet the game is filled with modders. You will lose money you will die a lot you will wait through painful load times you will glitch out consistantly falling through the map is normal. Want to do a mission to get some cash? Either the lobby is full or the session timed out. Not a very good online experience at all. Again I am disappointed in Rockstar but more so in their behavior towards the modding community.Edit So after a long drawn out battle with Rockstar Support over bugged crates hackers/modders random bugs missing car emblems crashes and lost progress I find out that Rockstar is finally after years of being released trying to fix the issues of hacked money &amp modders cheating. Poorly but they are trying. They are also giving away $250 000 in free cash to anyone who logs in before Halloween which seems like a pittance compared to the high prices of vehicles usually over a $1 000 000. I walked away from the game since support wasn't willing to fix my account even with uploaded Youtube footage of bugs and hackers. Rockstars support or lack there of for this game is appalling. I have never played a game where I had video proof of a player modding presented it to support and they stonewalled me until the ticket was closed. It's appalling support behavior that tickets get closed without being resolved? 4 times?

review: Awesome game. Singleplayer is amazing and worth the price on its own. Online is quite controversial because of the random bans which has never happened to anyone I know and hackers which I have never really come across except level 10000 people... title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I think anyone could talk about this game for hours but I ll keep it briefWith a developer like rock star make a great game and then goes on to promise that the game would be constantly be supported by great FREE dlc you are blown away and expect a lot. Then the devs went and took a sledge hammer to the foundations and broke that like it was an elderly person with brittle bones syndrome. I will not be talking about the single player because it is good and I believe it should carry the game but then the updates affected overall performance and really messed up the great experience i had. The multiplayer even after ll these years feels gimmicky repetitive and boring without friends but this doesn t mean anything. The micro transactions are ridiculous and while the DLC is free all of the new guns vetches property and other extravagant thing must be bought with in game money and in short are way to expensive because there is no constant way to earn a lot in this game making it feel like a grind. In short great game but the devs went a royally buggered it up. Honestly it feels like this game is dying and is desperately trying to stay relevant to kind of like Dwayne Johnson in Tooth Fairy but at least that movie was from the start GTA online could of been a diamond but turned into a heap of in the shape of a diamond

review: 1248 hours and 1230 of them were spent too intoxicated/idling/crashing cars. The most fun to be had in this game is ignoring what the game designers want you to do.garbage update december 2018 game is still full of scriptkiddies and tryhards I can't even play the new content because script toddlers keep turning me into props exploding everybody and just generally doing what children do which is because....This game has no anticheat. Scriptkiddies are as common as trees in a forest. 98% of all money I've spent has been given to me by scriptkiddies. This game is a joke even indie game devs can manage to figure out some form of anticheat. This is p a t h e t i c Old Review I do not and also can not recommend this game to new players or potential buyers. There's *no* anticheat whatsoever and that's only the first and biggest in a long line of severe status issues.Summary of SP It's a good GTA game I guess I beat it once but the only reason I have this game is to play with friends.Summary of Online The world's greatest game engine with the world's worst game built on top. It's no Superman64 it works fine but the game mechanics themselves are abysmal. It's a game designed to make you and everyone around you into the world's worst for meager reward. Tedious repetitious grinding that other players can interrupt destroy or steal. A multiplayer grief simulator where griefing is actually rewarded. The perfect game for absolute trash.Current State of Online (OCT 2018) Still full of scriptkiddies with trainers this coupled with the abysmal community and the incredible level of toxicity the game is designed to reward avoid playing with anybody in a public server. You can do this by (while in an online server) opening your task manager opening your resource monitor and suspending the process for 5 seconds before resuming. Ditch the leeches.Oct 18th 2018 Take Two files search and seizure warrants in Australia instead of having their game designed well programmed well just generally made to not be a big mess full of hackers. Why make anticheat when you can just try to use irl law? Bunch of in trashbag idiots. RDR2 is going to be ing terrible.Oct 2018 Wow this is just.. terrible I really thought *something* would get better. Reinstalled played for an hour. The first 3 games were full of hyper aggro s that kept exploding the stores I was trying to browse the remaining 2 games were full of gigantic props spawned in by scriptkiddies. Absolute trash companies with 1/16th the budget can manage their game better. Install FiveM and forget Rockstar exists because holy what an incompetent group of dumb idiot upsMarch 26 2018 Rockstar's crap anticheat software just managed to ban hundreds of people some of which had their accounts straight up wiped. The sentence below this one is from February and describes how the game is full of modders. Rockstar can't even ban the right people holy what is happening? Every few months this game has some new drama come out about it it's crazy. Rockstar is the game developer equivalent of a high school lunchroom.Febuary 2018 Modders are a constant problem playing with friends is equally problematic and this game gets worse every day. It's depressing. Unrelated note I find it abhorrent and annoying that rockstar put an RDR mission in the pc version of GTAV knowing full well that they never ported RDR never will and the PC release of the next Red Dead game will probably be a full year behind the console release. I won't be buying any more rockstar games for many reasons and this is one of them.Online in depth Apparently the mastermind behind GTA in its inception was a guy and his team who were eventually fired after an executive above him got jealous that the online was so incredibly popular. Sam and Dan Houser did this by sending him on a 6 month leave not paying him for the leave firing his staff while he was gone and firing him when he returned (as well as other insane practices). For this they received a $150 million dollar lawsuit from their own former employees so if I'm not being clear enough &gt &gt the people who run this game are *literally criminals* and aren't even associated with the things that made GTA Online a cool experience GTAV a good game initially and GTA as a whole.&lt &lt It's evident made extremely clear by their obvious mishandling of this absolute mess of a game.The engine is fun to play inside with friends but it's hard to enjoy since the game design is a garbage fire and might be the worst online of any game I've ever seen including korean MMO's. 'Handled poorly' is being generous it's filled to the brim with modders and it's designed to reward you for ing with other players. No moderation no game balance nothing. This game is made to make you so angry you end up paying for ingame currency (that modders can spawn for you but won't unless you pay them see how gtav created a nonexistent criminal economy accidentally through the world's iest planning). Regardless of which though both scyophants and the children of even dumber sycophants still ended up paying for this currency and thus funded this awful refuse dump of a game getting 4 releases. People actually pay for GTA currency. Sometimes I spend an entire day with a gun to my head wondering if I want to live in a world full of people who pay for GTAV money.Oh and Rockstar's incredible ineptitiude regarding this pay for garbage model has created an environment in which players are paying players to mod them in money. They're so idiotically inobservant they somehow created a criminal economy in a game about criminal economies and yet have no idea how to handle it. It's both embarassing and ironic. Fire whoever's putting these ing heists together fire everyone working on them. This doomsday is trash. These heists were trash. Everything good about online has nothing to do with this awful tedious monotonous repetitive absolute ing DRECK. I like how people will reference GTASA when talking about this game. Which is literally nothing like GTASA.I'd say this is absolutely without a doubt 100% confirmed no lie I'll sign a contract the******worst most unbalanced poorly thought out poorly designed no effort pile of diaper scum trash game I've ever seen in my life built on the most advanced game engine I've ever seen in my life******Did I mention take two sent DMCA takedowns to SP modders meanwhile the online is quite literally filled with modders in every server?Play GTAIV and save yourself the frustration. This game is bad. It's so bad I wouldn't buy it for anybody nor would I admit to playing it. It's an embarassment. It's gross. It's the gum stuck under the table. this game

review: GTA V is a really fun game....That said...One of the biggest problems is that it's STILL being sold for $60 USD. If possible only buy it on the rare chance it goes on sale. Another issue is that hackers are constantly finding new ways to grief other players. If you even suspect that there's a hacker and you are with a group of friends that make up the majority of the lobby just vote to kick them out. Otherwise just find a new lobby. Do not stick around. The only exception is if there are hackers / modders that are giving out free money. They're doing God's work because the other major problem is how expensive everything is. This game is literally built on microtransactions. The only reason it hasn't been lynched by the gaming community is because the payouts for in game activities and jobs are more or less reasonable and you can actually advance without stopping to drop extra money on the game if you really don't want to.3.7 out of 5 4 out of 5 if you play with friends. Get it when it's on sale though. Don't pay $60 for it.

I am so glad that rockstar stepped up to the plate and made this game live up to the hype aside from some early download issues which are to be expected with the amount of people hitting their servers at one time. review: I have spent $60 pre ordering Max Payne 3 before it was released. I spent $60 US on GTA 5. I have never played either game and most likely I never will. The problem I have isnt with the games per say it is with the rock star social club (which is a fancy way of saying always online DRM with a lot of snazzy social features). At some point i must have logged onto my steam acccount at a close friends house and now somehow in a way that only rock star can explain my steam account is linked to his rockstar social club account. That means that when i try to launch many of rockstars games i get one of two different errors (depending on the game). Both errors can only be fixed by submitting tickets with many screenshots serial numbers and screen shots of serial numbers. In my life i have bought 1000's of games (many with very restrictive DRM). In my life I have also only submitted tickets on MMOs. I have neither the time nor the patience to waste more time (other than the hours of research i have wasted on the internet looking into this issue) than I already have. I wont be submitting a ticket so that rockstar can be convinced I am not attempting to pirate their triple A multi billion dollar franchise. I would rather spend my time playing any of the hundreds of games i currently have access to. Their DRM (if they have any) is not so restrictive that their customer service gets overwhelmed when they launch a product and/ or patch a product. This seems to be a problem only rockstar and ubisoft have.

review: You will complete the story in 24 48 hours and you will just simply run out of things to do fast. Earlier GTA games had better and longer stories. Now most of the game is just side missions like stunts (as if you can't do stunts on your own and they really had to show how "hard they worked" on the side missions) collectibles (collecting things which you run into by luck) and just simple missions like going from point A to point B killing someone going to point C to finish the mission. GTA V story mode has not received any updates which would bring new vehicles weapons or anything at all. Zero.In December 2013 Rockstar announced that they planned to release downloadable content in 2014 that expands the single player mode and creates new story for the lead characters 20 however no single player expansions have been released.They didn't think that single player DLCs would bring them much profit so they dropped the single player and worked only on Online where they could concentrate on the 12 year olds who bought the shark cards with their stolen parents money.GTA Online is the main reason why they don't lower the price. GTA Online is broken. Cheaters rule the public sessions (something like servers but only for max. of 30 players) and normal players are their es. They can take your weapons crash your game (so you have to restart and enjoy the continuous loading screens) even when you are in passive mode (where normal players can't do anything to you) they can kill you with the cheats they have. About a year ago one person shared a way how you can get into a public session just on your own (in private sessions invite only sessions friends only sessions you can't do missions of updates where you have to go to point A kill people take supplies and drive it to point B) so there would not be any other people who could destroy your supplies and just make your gameplay into wasting time. You need to break a broken game in order to play normally. Sounds good right? GTA Online is now all about wasting time. Kids just shooting everyone they see in freeroam calling other people noobs and just non stop raging. Cancer. Besides the community anti cheat everything you have to love the time they take to fix things. For example the phone icon near the map which basically tells you have unread messages or invitations to missions. After some update they somehow managed to it up so that when you enlarged the map (pressed Z) the phone would not be right next to the map but a few inches to the right side of the map. How long did it take for them to fix that? From 6 months to a year probably. They took that much time to fix a god damn sprite position. And the broken chat while spectating other people has not been fixed probably since the release for PC. And these are just simple things that they have not managed to fix. They fix only the things that impact the income for their company. That's it. In 2016 cheaters were running wild. They had the ability to abuse game features so that they could remove other players money. It was the personal vehicle insurance feature. What did they do? They disabled the feature. That's it.https //www.youtube.com/watch?v ZsXpW NJw_YYup that's exactly how the flag waves when you drive the car 3 mph.https //www.youtube.com/watch?v OTiNq rIfLoAnd you really have to enjoy the only normal thing in Online heists. And to actually enjoy them you have to inspect people you join or people that join your heist lobby from head to toe so you don't waste your time with dead brain people. So even when you waste all that time to wait for people to connect even after kicking all the level 8 people after your inspection from head to toe you have to be lucky enough to actually not get people that would crash into the back of your car and it gets destroyed because of it. And here you are sitting and thinking that you could have had fun playing the game after doing something and being tired.https //www.youtube.com/watch?v asa08_Vxwl0So yeah the only excuse for the price is they think that they are doing a good job with GTA Online even if the person is not interested in it you still have to pay the money for it even if the single player mode had no real updates and the price is still the same. And the only way to prolong the single player experience is by adding modifications yourself. Take Two/Rockstar had a thought about killing the main most popular single player modding program that has been around 10 years already. They wanted people to come and play GTA Online so that they would get fed up of the endless grinding in the game and buy a shark card that costs more than their entire game (80$) and you could buy not even all the things from only one update. This was the reason why GTA V had been negatively Steam reviewed by people.https //www.youtube.com/watch?v 0gKlBIPR_okhttps //www.youtube.com/watch?v JDxBnZSb1j8The player base of this game is mostly brain dead people.You could invest those 60 30$ more wisely rather than into this crap.Also here's something more to read on the game https //www.reddit.com/r/gtaonline/comments/6wxgvm/gta_online_is_a_victim_of_accretion_where/

review: Bought a copy through the 'Social Club' by accident and found out instantly upon installation that it was from an outside source that controls your keys. I didn't much appreciate that but the game was still there despite not having steam achievements or integration. So I purchased it again on steam only to find that it has the same Social Club garbage plaguing it as well. Now apparently you can't share an account with another user and play at the same time despite having two copies of the damn thing so you move along to customer support and they say they can fix it but end up transferring the Steam key to another account so you're left with the initial crap version you didn't want without telling you. Then they move you to another employee later on to tell you that they could only transfer the Steam version because it was purchased last. They'll suggest you link your steam account with the user that they're transferred your key to while losing your progress (even though there is no option to) and insist they cannot do anything about it even though they're in full control of your account. It took me two weeks with short and single responses during this period to get nowhere so basically I purchased two copies for cryptic responses so I still can't use either version nor can I get a refund because of their slow responses. Being forced through an outside source is a major flaw that puts this corporation in control which I won't be doing again with any other purchases. Avoid Rockstar purchases at all costs. The story mode was terrible boring with a bunch of FMV cutscene filler. I got it for online to play with someone else but there really isn't anything to do there some 'races' that are like playing Hot Wheels for little kids point to point races run around and shoot eachother for no reason mode 'heists' that feel as though you're accomplishing nothing transform races another kid mode basically. The only part of the online experience that is eye catching is being able to drive around together which gets old really fast being that you can go into a select number of places marked on the map and the others are all like those little plastic car toysets from the '80s store fronts with stickers on the front to tell you what they are with no interior. They've really made no improvements over the last.... 5 6 years? And the game still sucks.2/10. Even their radio humor has dwindled to the point of just being annoying. This game is basically a money grab that's been going on for years push out 'new content' that isn't really new same old just to keep that price tag up to $60 and try to entice users to buy their useless money content.

review: This was IMO one of the most dissapointing games ever even when It got first released 4 years ago. The Story was short boring uninteresting and the map was also lazy designed with like 90% of the land that is not city being an empty uninteresting landscape of hills. Online... Ohhhhhh Online. Online was good at the start of the game they tried to do a story and the payouts were very good so you could afford almost everything by just playing the game. Because Rockstar Games and T2 are now even more greedy than EA new content is locked behind new stupid paywalls that they add every update now though they could have implemented them in an earlier Paywall (Paywalls are Bunkers MC Clubs and other Bases etc.) The Payouts you get in Heists and Business Grinds that take like 3 4 hours are NOT EVEN CLOSE enough to buy 1 new vehicle. The more business and properties you buy the more your DAILY rent increases. This means If you have a Bunker and a couple of apartments for example you have to pay 20k a DAY ! Rockstar just makes content expensive as possbile and Payouts low as possible so you have to buy Shark Cards. My last thing that I can mention right now is that this game is a nightmare to play because of the optimization. I have a GTX 970 and im playing at lowest and my FPS are like 30 40 FPS. Especially in the Offices during day the FPS is about 20 30. Absolutely UNACCEPTABLE. Do not buy this game. Its gone to and it a middle finger to its Franchise.

review: OK lets break this down. Check me out talking like i'm somewhat important in your life or the gaming industry. Fact its Grand Theft Auto. That alone is a name that means something in our universe but people want to turn their backs on the game that gave us so much freedom we get bored with it. The very game that has stood against the monstrous wave of people against it. They've protected our gaming freedom i get that shark cards people off but they aren't EA or Konami. I know i'm defending an "evil" with 2 other "evils". Remember GTA 5 almost got tanked by schools and the goverment? They made it so cops come after you for the smallest thing even to the point its annoying. Even if you hit a gang member cops come. We still got the game though. The biggest problem to date on this game is HACKERS. People who in my opinion are so down about themselves they set out to ruin the exprience of the game. It's like the darkside of gaming and it sucks. Thats the main problem I'VE seen. See what i did there so no one could be like "ummm excuse me i've had this problem this problem and this problem." So buy the game if you like GTA don't buy the game if you don't like GTA (or have the money its not cheap.) This is the part where i plug in some nonsense about "like my reviews? then follow my curator page." NO i'm just fat dude sitting at his computer who wants to take the aggro out of the gaming world and focus it on being a gamer not being a critic over every little thing. Play the game or walk away wall textures aren't always important.

It has beautiful graphics great gameplay so much replayability and humor that will keep you interested the whole time.As for online yes the servers can be janky but I personally love it. I love the interaction (though most of the time it's annoying). For me that's what I find is missing in a lot of games that online interaction with other players. review: This is a great game with a terrible multiplayer that's filled with microtransactions. Yes a AAA full priced game with microtransactions thanks to that multiplayer is a grind dull long painful grind. I waited before buying this game for a long time about a year because I wanted to wait for single player DLC... that never came. Game never really dropped the price all that much by that I mean not at all. Modding kept the game alive. Of course with microtransactions modding wasn't allowed in multiplayer something that would make the mode fun but given that taxi missions in vanilla single player are more fun than multiplayer with mods we all had a blast. Now Take Two Interactive and Rockstar Games want to kill mods. All of them. Mods that make this game alive years after release. I cannot and will not recommend supporting companies who aren't consumer friendly companies that treat people giving them money like Pirate this game if you have to it's really good but don't buy it. Don't give them your money.EDIT // So Rockstar released a statement... Let's see Take Two s actions were not specifically targeting single player mods. Unfortunately OpenIV enables recent malicious mods that allow harassment of players and interfere with the GTA Online experience for everybody. We are working to figure out how we can continue to support the creative community without negatively impacting our players. In the first sentence you distance yourself from Take Two. Nice. Unfortunately Rockstar is a part of Take Two Interactive so either it's a case of left hand not knowilng who's being kicked in the balls by the left foot or... you think we're going to forget that you are Take Two as well. Let's say that OpenIV does have a hole let's say that it is the truth... WHY WON'T YOU WORK WITH THE MODDERS TO FIX IT!? OpenIV was made specifically for single player it wouldn't even allow to go online so that's hard to believe but since you like to support the creative community so much why didn't you said anything to them BEFORE bringing up a lawsuit? Modders aren't a malicious force... For 's sake half if not more of Valve games started out as mods! Besides if you gave a dead dog's of a damn about Online then you'd remove microtransactions from the game. Or made Online a standalone free to play game...EDIT #2 // OpenIV is back. Multiplayer still sucks no single player DLC Liberty City WON'T be modded into GTA V. Still a negative review.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The campain is amazing with fun and interesting characters even the watered down online grind feast I found a lot of enjoyment out of.I just wish that there wasn't this big insentive on paying MORE MONEY for shark cards instead of building a fun online experince. Don't get me wrong doing the online missions is fun at first but after the 100th time trying to scrape enough money to buy that new car you want really makes you feel the grind. You can get money in faster and in more fun ways BUT you need to pay a large sum of in game money inorder to gain money faster. (example being supply bunkers and VIP stuff) There was also the whole "all mods are illigal" thing going on. I don't know rockstar's or Take Two's stance on that anymore but it was something that happened and really shows how little they care about their community. Also they censored 'Rockstar' in the in game chat and I have no idea why. All in all it's really fun but I feel the spirit of the old GTAs maybe fading from this franchiese.

review: Ehh... So it finally happened T2 finally grabbed R* by the and made us players their . The reason behind the recent OpenIV torm is beyond me The tool does not allow you to cheat online in fact openiv.asi will shutdown your game if you ever try to go online with with openiv.asi installed. They targeted a harmless singleplayer file modding tool while doing nothing about all those memory hacking trainers kids use to cheat online.OpenIV literally saved this game for me because I can't stand this game's vehicle handling it's just so arcady and unrealistic. OpenIV allowed me to make my own more natural and realistic handling file and put it into the game so I can play it without wanting to puke.If they don't reverse this decision I will stick with version 1032 the last moddable version and play it till I die. I never cared about online anyway this game was and always will be a singleplayer game for me.

review: Ok I'm not normally the guy to leave bad reviews on a game that I enjoy just because of some stupid political but OpenIV actually kind of hurt. ive never used it in GTA5 because i mostly play online and yer not supposed to mod the online stuff. but on GTAIV i used to use that tool all the time to mod out all the textures in my game and let nikos car be a bugatti and all the taxi's where CTS's and so on. that tool was an amazing way to customize your GTA experienc and make it lest of the same old tired gangster story that it actually is and mor of a custom fun experience. killing this tool hurts more than just angry gamers like me that liked to have fun ing wiht littel things theres an entire youtube community dedicated to messing around with stuff in GTA there are numerous mods that not only improve gameplay but also imporve the overall look of the game (hd texture mods) and there are several custom events that cant be done without mods youve killed that off rockstar. youve turned your backs on a large percentage of your players and im not cool with that. heres the deal I get why you did it you where lazy and didnt bother locking down the multiplayer code properly and openIV is able to edit it. hows about instead of censoring people you increase the security on the multiplayer code and fix it so that open IV cant make changes to it anymore or better yet hows abouot you work with the developers of the tool and use what theyve done to make steam workshop mods for the game that way you have more control over where they are running. but i digress you as a dev are lazy and just want those shark cards. and Im done at this point i cant support any further development on any franchise you make untill you fix this up of yours.

review: If you want to spend hours feeling frustrated GTAO is the game for you. Never have I wanted to enjoy a game so much yet could not because of the sheer "maldesign" of it. Glitchy buggy cumbersome full of modders and to top it all off Rockstar Games leaves MUCH to be desired when it comes to gaming support. Something goes wrong in the game and you need help? Forget it. You get a robo "copy and paste" automated response from them. "Pester" them too much and they block you from their support page. Game wise loading screens can sometimes last up to 5 minutes or will just lag out entirely and drop you back into single player. Glitches/bugs never get fixed in a timely manner. Everything in the game is insanely expensive and it takes forever to make money (their way of trying to force you to buy in game currency with real life funds). Also due to poor design there is no way to keep modders at bay so it is highly likely that hours upon hours of your time making money in the game will be ruined by someone with a simple mod menu. Every day in public sessions I encounter modders and they make it impossible to get anything done. Most recently Rockstar has conducted a "money sweep" removing funds from peoples' accounts for no reason even those who have never received modded money or did but already had the modded money removed in previous sweeps. Some people have had millions upon millions of dollars legitimately garnered through thousands of hours of gameplay taken away by Rockstar. Others yet have had in game money they bought with real life currency wiped as well. As of yet Rockstar has offered no real explanation or given any of the funds back. At the very least GTAO should be boycotted but I'm in agreement with the people who are saying that Rockstar Games should be reported to the BBB. Until they design a better online game and take some lessons from other major MMO's support teams I'm laying low on this game and sticking to a game that provides a more all around rewarding experience.

review: to be honest i revisted this review cause i know something just aint right. well there are lots of things that are wrong but lets start with what bothered me and so also what i enjoyed of . when i was just a kid i used to mod the first title all by my self. no one instructed me on how to do it i was just looking through the files and i explorer what each code means and i made a notbook list of all codes and so i could change stuff in game. yeah i'm talking about the first ever title of GTA. i read the news now days and i know this game delivered so many hours of fun through all of my childhood. it was there for me even though i never purchased it as a kid. most of us i think the majority were downloading it through pirate websites. now its wasn't really just the first the seconde nor any other sequal it was most of them. ofc this doesnt mean rockstar didn't made any money at all but still it means they didnt gained all that they could have.so i got this game as many of you i think somewhere at the first months after it was realesed and tell you the truth i was disappointed !!! i hate the fact this game was so big that even my connection would have it self when start loading. i have seen the game saints raw the 3rd and i hoped rockstar could have use this technology for their benefit. entering missions was absoulte madness i cold wait 30 to 45 maybe more minutes to start a mission and within the first 2 attempts someone was giving up and left us all to cry for another 45 minutes. considering not all of us kids with 8 hours spare time at a day cycle this was simply stupid. one of the biggest issues was the progress and so in different days i came to play i was starting the game and i had to start with the single player first mission in order to be able to play the multiplayer. rockstar failed to purchase a 20 MB on steam servers in order to deliver us an easy game saving system. its now 19/6/2017 and few weeks ago i was about to start play gta after long time not playing . i got a message saying i cant go in multiplayer cause of messing around with the game files and folders. now 60 + gigs its not a easy task for someone who on daily basis playing multiplayer games and with only about 10 mb speed connection that was seen impossible. yeah yeah yeah.... despite all i still think this game is awesome and at the most part delivered a great expiriance. i know it was worth the 59.99 $ i spent on it. this game still deliver free updated and content even 2 years ++ after. people made so many mods and it have been even much more fun as more mods were intoduced. mods gave you freedom of money in game you could enjoy stuff that other than climbing the ladder you couldnt achive. i just want you guys take in consideration the fact that this game make no money at all from micro trancitions. not that people dont buy it but not many to make it worth to keep maintaing a game 2++ years after it published. i know that ps4 and xbox owners probably are the real income for this game though i know that pc users were here first and supported this game since it born. pc users were left behind for over a year or 2 if i recall corectly. me myself i was ruined when i found out i need to wait . i know that many like me were felt betrayed . anyhow. this is all i wanted to write with the hope that someone at rockstar will take this info and actually do something about it if there is something to do at all. i like this game and thank you rockstar for hours of gaming days of gaming and years of gaming. you are great and you deserve to be treated well. i dont care what people say i know there are devs there who need to put a food on the table and feed their kids and pay for educating them and so on.... you delivered the most out of those 59.99 $ and after this i suggest you guys start make changes of your own to this game. shut down the mod if needed as long that you deliver us with good DLC's or keep it open and let fans create what they want . for all i know is that nothing is for free and you need to keep this studio alive. sorry for grammar and spelling sending love from israel ! &lt 3

review: For me Grand Theft Auto V s extraordinary scope is summed up in two favourite moments. One is from a mid game mission in which I flew a plane into another plane fought the crew hijacked the thing and then parachuted out and watched it crash into the sea to escape death at the hands of incoming military fighter jets. Another time whilst driving around in an off road buggy I got distracted by something that looked like a path up one of the San Andreas mountains. Turns out it was a path and I spent 15 minutes following to the summit where I nearly ran over a group of hikers. Typical! one of them yelled at me as if he nearly gets run over by a rogue ATV on top of a mountain every time he goes on a hike.I could go on like this for ages. GTA V has an abundance of such moments big and small that make San Andreas the city of Los Santos and its surrounding areas feel like a living world where anything can happen. It both gives you tremendous freedom to explore an astonishingly well realised world and tells a story that s gripping thrilling and darkly comic. It is a leap forward in narrative sophistication for the series and there s no mechanical element of the gameplay that hasn t been improved over Grand Theft Auto IV. It s immediately noticeable that the cover system is more reliable and the auto aim less touchy. The cars handle less like their tires are made of butter and stick better to the road though their exaggerated handling still leaves plenty of room for spectacular wipeouts. And at long last Rockstar has finally slain one of its most persistent demons mission checkpointing ensuring that you never have to do a long tedious drive six times when you repeatedly fail a mission ever again.Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent wickedly comic and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary post economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire it rips into the Millennial generation celebrities the far right the far left the middle class the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar s sharp tongue including modern video games. One prominent supporting character spends most of his time in his room shouting sexual threats at people on a headset whilst playing a first person shooter called Righteous Slaughter ( Rated PG pretty much the same as the last game. ) It s not exactly subtle he literally has the word Entitled tattooed on his neck and the in game radio and TV s outright takes don t leave much to the imagination but it is often extremely funny and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto s San Andreas is a fantasy but the things it satirises greed corruption hypocrisy the abuse of power are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.Grand Theft Auto V s plot happily operates at the boundaries of plausibility sending you out to ride dirt bikes along the top of trains hijack military aircraft and engage in absurd shootouts with scores of policemen but its three main characters are what keep it relatable even at its most extreme. The well written and acted interplay between them provides the biggest laughs and most affecting moments and the way that their relationships with one another developed and my opinion of them changed throughout the story gave the narrative its power. They feel like people albeit extraordinarily f***ed up people.Michael is a retired con man in his 40s filling out around the middle as he drinks beside the pool in his Vinewood mansion with a layabout son air headed daughter serially unfaithful wife and very expensive therapist all of whom hate him. Franklin is a young man from downtown Los Santos who laments the gang banger stereotype even as he s reluctantly seduced by the prospect of a bigger score. And then there s Trevor a volatile career criminal who lives in the desert selling drugs and murdering rednecks a psychopath whose bloodthirsty lunacy is fuelled by a combination of methamphetamine and a seriously messed up childhood.The missions flit between their individual stories and an overarching plotline that involves all three and it s a credit to GTA V s versatility and universal quality that each character has his share of standout missions. As their arcs developed I felt very differently about each of them at different times they re not entirely the archetypes that they seem to be.This three character structure makes for excellent pacing and great variety in the storyline but it also allows Rockstar to compartmentalise different aspects of Grand Theft Auto s personality. In doing so it sidesteps some of the troubling disconnect that arose when Niko Bellic abruptly alternated between anti violent philosophising and sociopathic killing sprees in GTA IV. Here many of Michael s missions revolve around his family and his past Franklin is usually on call for vehicular mayhem and extreme murderous rampages are left to Trevor. Each has a special ability suited to his skills Franklin can to slow time while driving for example which gives them a unique touch. Narratively it s effective even off mission I found myself playing in character acting like a mid life crisis guy with anger issues as Michael a thrill seeker as Franklin and a maniac as Trevor. The first thing I did when Franklin finally made some good money was buy him an awesome car because I felt like that s what he d want.Trevor feels a like a bit of a get out of jail free card for Rockstar providing an outlet for all the preposterous antics and murderous behaviour that otherwise might not fit in with GTA V s narrative ambitions. I found his violent insanity a little overblown and tiresome at first. As get out clauses go though it s pretty effective and Trevor s over the top missions are some of GTA V s action packed highlights. It s a successful way of solving a problem that s prevalent in open world games the tension between the story that the writers are trying to tell and the story you create yourself within its systems and its world. Grand Theft Auto V accommodates both masterfully allowing neither to undermine the other.The actual act of switching between them also provides a window into their individual lives and habits fleshing out their personalities in a way that feels natural and novel. Pick a character and the camera zooms out over the San Andreas map closing back in on wherever they happen to be. Michael might be at home watching TV when you drop in on him or speeding along the motorway blasting 80s hits or having a cigarette at the golf club Franklin might be walking out of a strip club munching a bag of snacks at home or arguing with his ex girlfriend there s a good chance that Trevor could be passed out half naked on a beach surrounded by dead bodies or on one memorable occasion drunk in a stolen police helicopter.It could be nearly anything because there is a bewildering multiplicity of things to do in the new San Andreas tennis yoga hiking racing on sea and on land flying planes golfing cycling diving hunting and more. The missions are an able guide to both San Andreas locations and its activities touring you around the map and whetting your appetite for independent exploration of it all. The way that we re introduced to San Andreas never feels artificial the map is completely open from the start for example which contributes to the impression that it s a real place somewhere you can get to know. If GTA IV s Liberty City feels like a living city San Andreas feels like a living world. I saw people walking their dogs along the beach in the country as I jet skied past arguing on the street outside a cinema in Los Santos and camped with tents and everything +rep

review: Normally I wouldn't review a GTA game because come on we all know it's awesome but I was blown away to see that GTA V had a "Mixed" critical reception. Then I read on and realized it's because of all these GTA Online crybabies wailing that Rockstar banned them for cheating and ruining an online game but they claim they did nothing at all. We all know when you see the little brat child in the toy store being dragged out by his mother for misbehaving and he's screaming he did nothing wrong that the raging child is the one telling the truth. Right. You got caught for breaking the rules you're angry you got caught so you come onto Steam and slam a near perfect game that deserves WAY better than a "Mixed" critical reception which angers me. I could careless about GTA Online but go onto Rockstar's forums or reddit or something and complain. GTA V is incredible and PC is the quintessential version an easy 9.8/10.

review: Take Two sent a cease and desist to Open IV which is ONLY used for SINGLE PLAYER Mods. Yet they let mods run rampant Online which basically ruins the game. They are attempting to ruin Single Player to force people to go online and buy micro transactions. Just look at this quote by Take Two CEO "You can t give stuff away for free in perpetuity there s no business model in that. But we re not trying to optimise the monetiziation of everything we do to the nth degree. My concern is if you do that the consumer knows. They might not even know that they know but they feel it."Update RockStar interceded and saved OpenIV Good Job listening to the community. I am going to leave the comment of my original review so we don't forget but now I can recommend this game again!

review: So I got GTA5 pretty much on the start when it was freshly released on PC and on Steam...Was I happy about it? Yes.Did I play all night long only taking breaks for nature's calling? Yes.Did I feel that the game is being dragged through? No. Everything on the side was just like a cherry on top of a well crafted main story.Was the ending climactic? Oh absolutely!And is online any good? Even a few years later? You bet your it is.The game is charming in a lot of ways. During the first mission you are being thrown in the center of the action. Shooting alarms explosions... Your typical action share. But it ends quickly and slows down letting you take the role of Franklin. And let me tell you something... "Maybe if you get rid of this yee yee haircut..." You know what I am talking about. Franklin is nothing special. Just a guy who had rough upbringing and uses every opportunity to push through. And the story being built around it is awesome. Just as well as around Michael and Trevor (who I don't know what people like for. He's an all the way through). Where was I going with this? I don't know. But here's something get the game and you will have a lot of fun time in Los Santos. Be it single or multiplayer. Peace!

review: Story is boring and uninteresting. They went for a new style thats much different from GTA IV including playing as 3 characters instead of one but in my opinion this was a mistake. It doesn't allow you to connect with the people you play as or really feel that they are in any kind of danger. You don't have as much freedom as you did in GTA IV neither do you have similar mechanics and physics. The game plays more as a cartoon where as GTA IV felt realistic. Online is nothing but a mess and will be an awful experience to anyone just buying the game. The developers made Online more of a Pay 2 Win type where unless you drop hundreds of dollars on the game youre gonna be working for a solid week grinding boring game modes to get a single thing you may have had your eye on and in the end it wouldnt have been worth it. The developers are also attempting to remove all mod support for the game entirely so if you wanted this game for that I would recommend taking your money elsewhere. You can easily find hundreds of games on Steam alone that are far better than this pile of garbage.

review: This game is clean the Content in the game is very life like and the plot is deep. I would highly recommend this game for the graphics the originality and frankly I can't play another game now because of this. I am hooked this is way better than any prevoius GTA installment. I have not tried to modify the game like Skyrim yet but I can see that this game is perfect for it. I love the concepts of switching through characters who are in different life situations to get their experience as well as the character creation on GTA Online. Once you get this game you do not really need another. One down side is that it holds up 63 gig of space on the SDD and the graphics are demanding even for high end cards like GTX 770+. It should be because the graphics are clean. Thank you Rockstar for a good deliverable for the PC just wish it didn't take this long to get it...

review: Practically everything is perfect with this game. Sure some items could be cheaper the textures better optimized and the online connection more stable and the loading times is shorter. But after taking into account you can solve all of this with some investment (better PC faster Internet if you must buy everything shark cards) then practically no game can match GTA's story soundtrack map realism and the sheer variety of things you can do both in story mode and especially online. A must buy for everybody with the time money(23 in sales) and simply appreciation for a high quality very diverse and fun videogame.

review: So after so many years GTA V is still a game that I play as if it's a new game. The game has been Amazing since ps3/Xbox360 and it just gets better and better. Owning it for ps3 and ps4 wasn't enough and I had to get it on Pc too. Yes a lot of the things ingame require A TON of grinding which you can skip with some micro transactions but from my experience it's not the hardest to grind for something you really want ingame. Most are here for the Online part of the game but if you aren't or even if you are the Single Player is worth playing and more than once too and your choice of First or Third person. New content gets frequently released for online and the game doesn't feel abandoned even by the slightest.If you wanna mess around with friends there are tons of things to do keep your friends close and your enemies closer and if you don't have any friends Trevor will help you out XD

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Alright yeah I'll come clean.I played this game for a long time since about 2014 and just about the entire time I was a modder in online. It was on and off because between every update it would be a bit before a new working menu came out but I'll say this my wallet stayed fat. I liked it. I was good at it. I was alive.Then earlier today I got an email that I had been permanently banned lol.But that's it. That's what's supposed to happen. That's just the path of playing this game go into online get a menu around with it subtly enough that Rockstar doesn't catch you for as long as you can and when they do that's it. Game over. Good ending. The longer you last is the better the ending and my ending was great. The bad ending is wasting ungodly amounts of time and/or money to try and get the same things and so much less and not getting banned. At least getting banned gives you the affirmation of knowing you cheated some sort of system for some amount of time.But that doesn't mean online isn't fun. It is fun when you have power. But getting power isn't worth it if it means doing it legit. No one wants to do something where the reward isn't worth the effort/price. The in game currency is at its best deal $8 000 000 for $100 real life dollars. That's nothing. That isn't You can't get in this game for $8 000 000. Never buy Shark cards please for the love of God.Modding gives you the same power for nothing. You get all of the best parts of the game (driving nice cars flying kickass planes owning a nightclub killing twelve year olds with an orbitial cannon having money in fifteen digits) but now instead of the meager satisfaction of knowing you had to work 6 8 hours to make the money to buy one car you now have the mighty conniving satisfaction of having broken the rules and stood up to Rockstar and whatever and have a warehouse full of militarized sports cars to show for it. That's why I did it that's why anyone does it because the only alternative is to a) earn your cash legit (haha no) or b) not the play the game at all.But that doesn't make the game unfair either. Rockstar can design their game however the hell they want and if they're designing games for people that enjoy commitng countless hours of labor to earn meager rewards then so be it. And if you read that statement and think "that sounds ing stupid" then the game isn't for you. Don't buy it don't play it whatever. It's your time and money no one is gonna make you play gta online. But if you play the game and break their rules you can't be surprised when you get banned.A lot of people tend to complain about getting banned for no reason and that they've never modded in their life and I find that hard to believe because only an absolute imbecil would play the online for this game without modding. Seriously if not for the fact that making money takes a stupid amount of time on the same missions and jobs then for the fact that there will always be people trying to kill you. Seriously if you want to play gta online and you aren't willing to take the risk of getting a mod menu and spawning in some cash just don't play it at all it's not worth it to you.And if you really did get banned for nothing then it was probably out of pity for being stupid enough to play online legit and they just wanted to take that chance away from you before you wasted any more of your time. And to that end it was probably for the better.P.S. For adding cash (in moderation of course) I personally reccomend Doggo menu or Teteus. It's also got some nifty stuff like vehicle spawners and whatever but it's an injection so be careful. But if you just want a reliable player/vehicle god mode 7r14ngl3 has never let me down. This advice may seem moot coming from someone who got caught but it did take them four years to do it so you choose.Me I'm done. I beat the game and I won. I won when I downloaded my first menu and I kept winning for a long time and that winning was fun. I got my money's worth our of this game and with a little care so can you so I give it my reccomendation.

THESE DLC WILL KEEP COMING AND NOT STOPPING..its annoying how u will get spamming on and advertising every 5 minutes while u are free roaming exploring stunning Los santos drive cars or shooting with someone AND the players that annoys you in free roam...THESE AI will keep calling you no matter what you do. "Hey go to foreclosure.mazebank. BLAH BLAH BLAH" FROM RON FROM LESTER FROM MC FROM CEO FROM etc..... I mean GO YOURSELF its annoying! The rest its pretty good believe me Offline and Online are both fun to enjoy graphics story gameplays are amazing &lt 3 Huge addicting love!...But advertisement are killing the game otherwise stay with fake one and play offline if you are not serious with online with ur friends...because nowadays ONLINE are EFF'D UP...Stop spamming to all the players and yes plz banned the hackers already ALSO..Rockstar started to turned original grand theft auto into a fantasy saints row already where's the original realistic mastermind or gang stuff goes?...Please improve it...i know new things must come but the way u do is what people loves. review: Very nice and engaging story mode one that doesnt take itself too seriously but still engages you. Defintely a game to play if you wanna just unwind from playing Dark Souls or some Online is pretty bad though. Load times take forever (both on the ps3 and pc that I own much better on pc though thankfully) servers time out too often like 50% of the time I get kicked out for some t reason and then I have to load again. If you get past these flaws however the online mode gets very additive. There's no better feeling tha buying a luxury with your hard earned (illegal) money after 2 3 days of hard grinding on heists. Communty maps really make the Online gameplay feel complete and enhanced. THe racing imo is more fun than entire racing games such as Gran Turismo (albeit less realistic) and the community from my experience at least has been fairly nice and friendly and most importantly COMPETENT! Most annoying thing about the ps3 version is how incompetent heist members usually are and pc seems to not have the same problem.Overall if you have a good enough internet connection and are willing to put up with the admittedly annoying and extremely flawed loading times and connectivity issues this game is very much worth it!

review: I bought chrome rims for my armored car (Insurgent).The price?88.000 GTA Dollars.This game is ridiculously time consuming as you have to grind hours to gather the absolutely absurd ton of cash to buy anything relevant. Although if you have friends to grind that money with it may be worth the work in the end.8/10 (sometimes) the best pastime with friends. If you have the money for this game just use it for something else unless you have friends who really want to play this game with you!EDIT Oppressor MKII was NOT a healthy addition to the game. The Oppressor was already one of the hardest things to kill in the game and now you can get a countermeasure for missiles and infinite flight while moving faster than the speed of sound. Only buy GTA V if you are prepared to grind money with even more flying motorcycles harassing you in the process.Oh and also be prepared for an orbital strike destroying your cargo. It will happen surprisingly often.

review: GTA online whilst once an interesting and fun new idea... Is now an unambiguously cynical pile of rubbish.A griefers paradise where the rich/lifeless pay/grind their way to the biggest and best toys and proceed to ruin any fun anyone else might be having. Make no mistake this is a toxic community and it makes perfect sense why it would be when R* are so happy to sell the tools to make it so.The updates have long since ceased enriching the experience. New content is incredibly lazily produced and is basically designed to sell you shark cards. People like to argue that you can easily ignore this new content but if you don't buy it you get spammed with messages and phonecalls from in game characters reminding you that you haven't ponied up for it yet. Almost makes you miss the days where they were just pestering you to play a bowling mini game and go see "big American s". This is a great way to crash a plane/die in a gunfight too since your controls get hijacked until you've dealt with the phonecall in one way or another.The glory days were when the heists were just out but there's only a handful of those and they do get old (cool as they are...).The singleplayer is pretty good but you probably knew that. This is GTA 5 we're talking about afterall... It's bigger than Jesus at this point. I only really write this to communicate the frustration. GTA online was a pretty good thing with a lot of promise and it's been thoroughly thoroughly... thoroughly buggered senseless by the forces of unashamed greed.They killed the magic. It turns out when you do that it makes it far more obvious what the shortcomings are in the driving the shooting and the godawful community.If you have a time machine and can go back a couple of years this is recommendable. Right now I'd stay clear unless you're buying at a heavily discounted price to do the singleplayer content.

review: Still unbelievably awful support for multiplayer and extremely toxic stand toward modding. The game came out in 2013 and it STILL retails for $60 and goes on sale for $30. Thats kind of insane. The price of ingame purchases is absolutely disproportionate and is unrealistic to grind for everything. When I can make 500k in about 6 hours of work assuming a modder or some griefer doesn't destroy my cargo but the new motorcycle costs 4 million dollars something isn't balanced correctly. Every single multiplayer lobby is filled to the brim with modders almost without fail. So you want to join a game and do some gunrunning with the boys? Well prepare to have your cargo destroyed from miles away by a flaming exploding blimp spawning on top of you because modders are either not punished or aren't detected well enough. That being said I have almost 400 hours on PC and another 400 on PS3 so I guess I can't really give this a negative review. I STILL have fun with the multiplayer every time I play it. If you are looking for a bug free hassle free "hacker" free multiplayer game this is not it. Look elsewhere. This game is a broken modded to hell microtransaction machine. But it's pretty fun tbh.
