title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: First and foremost its expected that GTA has a good singleplayer campaign and they don't disappoint there. With 3 main characters I thought it could get pretty unorganized but the devs did an excellent job keeping the campaign cohesive between all three characters and giving them each their own unique feel. One is example is they each get their own side missions and contribute their efforts to the main story. Driving/Combat/Thrills are all there and brilliant. An important note In GTA 4 there was a "tunneling effect" when driving that has been removed. I thought It added an interesting element to take into account when driving at high speeds but it was a bit overboard on the effect so I'm kind of glad they got rid of it. I don't think it would've worked well enough in this iteration. An FPS mode was added in a later patch honestly was a bit disappointed by its implementation why? Well for one the interiors of the vehicles look pretty garbage hardly any attention was made to them and there's nothing really to interact with inside your car so its pretty pointless in that aspect. I guess if you like racing and shooting in fpv then its nice to have. The one thing I really really missed was being able to buy property in GTA 4 and that's back for GTA 5. But its almost like an afterthought in the singleplayer sure you can buy your garages and it'll save your vehicles but when you buy businesses you can't go inside them they cost a rediculous amount like $150 million or whatever for a beat up old theatre. The sad part is that after you finish the story you don't even get enough money to buy a good portion of commercial stuff. They do offer a bit of content in free mode but it gets stale and highly repetitive after only a couple missions. Helipads and Docks are now available to buy in GTA5 so if you have helicopters and boats you can store them there. Overrall I kind of enjoyed the story in GTA 4 a bit more than in GTA5 you could feel your progression in a very real way you started from the bottom and slowly got better and better the map started to open up more and you could meet new people. The relationship system was equal parts interesting and annoying though it didn't feel tacky. Trying to do stuff with contacts in GTA 5 feels tacky they almost never pick up when you call them and they never want to do anything. If you're lucky you may discover a few new missions.As for GTA online gameplay well that part surprised me a bit I don't think I've ever played in a multiplayer where elements and characters from the singleplayer carried over to the multiplayer space as much as it does in GTA 5. Sure its a supporting actor running the show but its a nice change to see cutscenes missions and meaningful content to do in GTA online. Note Trevor does make appearances. The quality and quantity of customization is really good though in an odd move they made a seperate specialty car shop (not the odd part) that is firstly blocked by an ingame paywall so before they even touch your car you have to pay them and then once you do the customization options cost such a significant enough amount that its almost not even worth it. The DLC thats been added to the online game has introduced some cool content but it too gets pretty repetitive. The sad part is is that what the devs imagined as the most fun part of this content is also what ruins the experience. Basically you have to do a job that almost always involves a bit of transporting and its the rest of the players in the lobby's choice to stop you or make it incredibly difficult that the payout isn't even worth it. Sounds kind of fun right? Well it sort of can be with a group of friends. The problem is for solo players or even groups for that matter are at a serious disadvantage from the beginning. Why? Well for one the opposing side gets access to some seriously OP vehicles and tools (to be fair so does the transporters if you have enough buddies). I'm talking wiping you in one shot type of OP traditional weapons aren't really that good enough OP must have equalivalent type of vehicle to counter it OP. Or there is absolutely no counter type of OP. Everything before that last one alludes to some powerful favorite vehicles of the wealthy. Like a Delorean that can shoot missles and take off and land and also dodge homing rockets with ease or there's the very similiar motorcycle version that seems faster. Apache helicopters attack jets the batmobile etc. But one thing you can't stop no matter what you do is the Orbital Cannon. This sucker shoots down a beam that pretty much instantly wipes whoever and whatever is in its target radius and there is not one godd*mn thing you can do. There are limitations in place like it costs $1 million each shot and it has a long cooldown after you use it. One counter would be maybe to send out a decoy and hope the aggressor takes the bait but if your facing say a lobby that all have access to the weapon then there really is no counter. As you'd expect this entire system opens the game up to a heavy amount of griefing. Hacking is also rampant with groups of people embracing god mode or spawning random obstacles that basically make the mission or free mode unplayable. Below I'll address actually getting into an online session.Loading....(20 mins later)No seriously if your an average joe with an outdated processor and still using a hard drive expect to have enough free time to get a haircut (don't even both setting up an appointment the extra 10 min wait is well worth it) get that done come back and THEN GTA Online MAY HAVE loaded if it didn't get some random error teleporting you back to the main screen or reinstancing you into Singleplayer. I mean honestly this game has one of the worst if not THE worst loading screen I've ever seen slightly ahead of Skyrim on 3rd Generation consoles (PS3/Xbox 360). Because at least with Skyrim it would load decent enough that some of the longest loading screens would still be a surprise. For a game with a budget reaching over $250 million (the highest ever for a video game and topping most hollywood film budgets) that's a huge disappointment. I expect more out of the developer to optimize their game. To their credit the game as a whole is well optimized but the online loading screens are horrendous. And hey if it's just a matter of not having enough time to get it addressed by the release date then yeah I'm willing to give you some leeway if you at least say your working on it. I mean surely after the horrendous launch issues I could understand if it would be on the backburner till that was cleaned up but even now 3 years past release and yet still no fix. It's unacceptable. Money and Time clearly weren't the issues with the game grossing over $6 billion in revenue (most ever for a media form). Its just a simple case of Rockstar the developer and Take Two Interactive the publisher (TakeTwo owns Rockstar Games and its their publicly traded parent company) taking their cash cow and running. That's not a tactic I support so I'll be sure to remember that when I consider buying the next installment if there will be one or a TakeTwo game in general.Final Thoughts If your looking for a game with a solid campaign and a trolley multiplayer then GTA 5 is your game. Personally for me I wouldn't pay more than $20 for this game. There is classic GTA fun there but its overhyped.

review: Product received for free. Now let me be 100% honest This game is fun. Amazingly fun. If you play with your friends they're gonna shoot your face off with a shotgun and two seconds later you'll bomb them to the moon with a grenade. You're going to drive straight into them and ram them off of the road only to realize that they sticky bombed your car and you're going to spend the rest of the day not knowing if you should get them back or apologize. The story mode... let's be real nobody cares about the story. There's 2 white guys and a black guy who steals cars and they work for the FIB (FBI) and some stuff happens. But the online mode is where its at.In the online mode 70% of the game is epic dumb fun and 30% of the game is annoying filler garbage.Online forces you to repeatedly grind out missions or heist to buy apartments motorcycle clubs garages and cars everything requires you to have money that is very very tedious to gain. Rockstar who's the company that made and maintains the game (obviously) removes every way to easily gain money so that they can earn more IRL $ by purchasing shark cards which give you GTA currency.As a word of advice don't buy shark cards.Shark cards seem okay but $60 for a couple millions in a game that already costs $60 is NOT a good idea especially if it isn't DLC.Speaking of DLC all of it is free and after grinding out that $$$ though the game is very satisfying. At one point in the online DLC heists you have to jack a flying car to take down an organization that'll blow the world into smithereens and you have to go underwater in a car that transforms into a submarine to get information from Russians. This creativity and fun that Rockstar had gives the game its life and is debatable whether or not its worth the hours put into grinding. But IMO it is worth it.3/5 A fun little game to play with your friends for countless hours of enjoyment.Edit gremmer suk

review: If ever a game deserved some sort of middle "I kinda liked some of this game but other parts not so much" sideways thumb rating on Steam it's this one.The single player portion of the game is fantastic. The online portion (once you beat the heists) is not. Once the heists are done online gets to be a boring repetitive multiplayer mode that just feels dead. The online game world is devoid of most of the features that make the single player game more lively.Single player has animals better NPC interactions (random fights drag races etc..) the missions are more enjoyable and the world itself just feels more alive. Multiplayer has no animals you can't really interact with the NPCs (your character will be a mute no matter which gender you pick) the missions and heists (while fun the first couple times you do them) get old fast and there's just this overall feeling that there is less in the online world to make it interactive.Saint's Row 2 came out in 2008. That's EIGHT years ago and you can make a character with a choice of one of three voices per gender in that game. Even Bethesda recognized that the cliche of the player protaganist being mute was old and gave your character a voice in Fallout 4. The online character creation in this game is lacking SEVERELY lacking in the ONE thing character creation in any game should have CUSTOMIZATION.Rockstar claims that some of the elements of single player were removed from multiplayer because there would be a strain on their servers. What is more likely to be true is that the multiplayer enviroments were dumbed down because of console limitations. Consoles would not have been able to handle multiple players playing fetch with dogs shooting mountain lions or swimming with sharks. PCs could have but because consoles can't PCs get what could have been a fun feature removed.Once you beat the heists and enough missions to see how repetitive they are you will get bored. Sure there is golf tennis darts and arm wrestling. Like everything else they are fun at first and then not so fun after. There's always shopping in one of the six types of shops. Again gets old fast. Rockstar took an engaging single player world and dumbed it down for its online model and hoped nobody would notice. People have though.The single player has memorable characters amazing city and rural enviroments that feel alive (thanks to animals FFS the online world has no BIRDS either) and missions that are fun to play. The online component has a few heists that are fun to play with your three other friends and a few PvP events if you're into that (and lots of opportunities to grief other players if you're into that). Outside of being killed by a pink RPG wielding player in his underwear and an anime mask the online world around you will feel much more lifeless thoughMy advice? Buy it. On sale only. Never pay full price for a game where 50% of it will get boring much more quickly than the other 50% of it.EDIT Oh right forgot to mention the microtransactions in multiplayer. If you hate those like most normal people you'll hate them here too. Most items in MP have had their prices jacked up and since missions and heists don't pay out much you'll either be saving money for a long time or giving Rockstar/Take 2 even more money to buy their in game money. Take 2/2K loves microtransactions in their full price games. My advice still stands don't pay full price for this one. It's a horrible business practice.

review: Grand Theft Auto V Well this was definetely a long awaited one for me originally I played GTA V on console and I was thrilled by it! it was such a great open and beautiful game but like ANY game it has it's flaws and I'm going to talk through them enjoy!Well one of the main things that almost discouraged me into not pre ordering was the port when I played GTA 4 I must admit the porting was absoloutely devastating and I couldn't drive anywhere without atleast 40 buildings going invisible... but y'know what? the port on this game is absoloutely brilliant the reason being was because the Max Payne team handled the port GTA 4's port was actually ported by the Rockstar GTA Team (that's why it was so bad no offence) on console I was 100% one of those guys who would just love to role play by myself and roll around in a cheap tuned car instead of a brash chrome bugatti veyron with pink neons wearing a pink suit and a bright green top hat like a lot of players I like realism and if you do then this game is great for that the story mode is great and I never found a single glitch the story line was dynamic exciting and awesome! but... the length I completed the whole main questline in around 2 days GTA 4 took me a week I was disapointed at first but I gave Online and other aspects to the game more chance to improve me lets talk about that huh?The Grand Theft Auto V Online experience for me was... well great! but at the same time upsetting.Why? well I'd love to kinda roleplay and do my own thing wheras I would be very much attacked by anyone on the street I just wanted to make friends man! but I guarrantee you if you go up to 5 people and honk your horn atleast 1 will shoot you take your car and give you the finger... pretty rude huh?races and activites are great but the player customization needs more diversity.Online is great but you need to be ready to be attacked by random guys and that kids is why you always carry your automatic rifle grenades RPG's pistols SMG's snipers and lets not forget fireworks launchers!Anyway I'd give the online experience a 6.5 / 10 and that is high for my reviews.I'd give the story mode experience a 7 / 10 the 3 that was dropped was mainly the length.Now lets move on the game mechanics... kinda... umm yeah. Well basically if you want to play this game DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT have a bad computer now personally I played this on an AMD FX 4350 a mid / high range processor but not the best I would highly recommend 4096MB GDDR5 Space and a 6 8 core processor later I played on an AMD FX 8350 and It was a lot better here's my chart for the FPS I got.low 140medium 100high 80very high 65 70ultra 50 60 I have a mid / high range system but if you want the Grand Theft Auto experience Make sure you have a high powered PC I would recommend the GTX 970 4GB so you can run ultra textures with no lag In terms of processors I recommend the i7 4770k or the AMD FX 8350.Anyway the whole game hits a solid 7 / 10 VERY HIGH IN MY BOOKS!i'd recommend this but don't get this on your minecraft laptop and do not get this game if you have severe anger issues.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I really tried to like GTA V. I tried my hardest. At the moment my friend and I are stuck failing to complete a mission online due to crashes and crazy AI. I spent 3 days diagnosing CTDs and freezes with Rockstar support who eventually just had me reinstall .net 3.5 directX and the entire game and social club.The online is shockingly bad by any standards let alone that it's created by one of the richest game development studios on the planet. It took my friend and I 2 3 days just to figure out how to select the missions we want and even then there is a myriad of frustration and problems. When you complete a job the game gives you the choice between 5 randomly selected "jobs" (which could be just multiplayer deathmatches or races) or to go back to free mode. Why can't I select the next job from the list like I did the first job? You also receive straight up harrassing phone calls in game from NPCs telling you to buy property you can't afford and THERE IS NO WAY TO DISABLE THESE CALLS. They can call you in the middle of a gunfight disabling your ability to fire your gun. This has been complained about since 2015 and it's still in the game.The missions are a grindy slog. Setting the difficulty higher means enemies have preposterous amounts of HP sometimes taking 5 6 shots with the marksman rifle to kill and aimbot directly at your head the instant they have line of sight. Enemies also infinitely respawn in missions I've played often directly on top of you sometime headshotting you before they even materialize. Some missions also lack any sense of strategy as there is only one way to approach them (one path in one path out go into this tight corrodore and kill someone).Then there are the unskippable cutscenes. As if we don't have enough unforgivable t at this point why in the world are there so many unskippable cutscenes in online?! It's also relatively difficult to earn money early on especially since the missions that don't pay complete garbage require you to own property that costs $200k minimally. This creates a much larger barrier to entry than there should be as you complete missions which could take minutes or hours and award a pidling $10 20k.The single player is passable. Most of the characters are unlikable psychopaths but I guess that's standard for GTA at this point. Missions are pretty for the most part. The first heist (only one I've completed so far due to numerous crashes and freezes) was great. I wanted to be doing only those missions however it was immediately followed by a mission doing ing yoga with Michael's wife. What the is that Who wants to do yoga in a GTA game? right off.Overall GTA V is shockingly poorly made garbage. It seems impossible to me that a studio could spend $100mil designing something this ugly unfriendly to users prone to crashing and exploitative. GTA V is total .

review: Offline Great Story Get it when it's on sale. Still worth the 30 bucksOnline Get a rich to actually succeed.EDIT From today on I won't recommend the game anymore at least the ONLINE part. Here is why Shark Cards and artificial InflationIt's a MASSIVE CASH GRAB. If you haven't started like 2 years ago don't even try now.The Lazer (Jet) was recently made available for the personal collection in GTA Online. A DAY ONE VEHICLE for virtually 6.5 million ingame bucks. Thats 80$ in shark cards(!!!). And the jet doesn't even have ANY benefits compared to the one you can steal besides spawning it. It's a ing joke.Don't get me wrong I have yet to purchase any shark card but some folks apparently are. Shark card revenue was at around 700 Million Dollars by the End of 2016 A YEAR. Combined with an additional 10 million shipped GTAV copies since February it's a nice fat cash cow for Rockstar.And yet they aren't introducing any quality content like new Heists and keep to their cheap content because it works. But the players buying shark cards most likely don't know what they are getting into. The value of ingame money has steadily decreased since release due to inflation but they have not adjusted the money you get with shark cards.In the beginning you "needed" a Supercar for around 1mil and an appartment for around 500k to be able to enjoy the game in full. NOW you basically need 4 6 times the amount to get a glimpse of new content. That's a massive grindfest for new players At the moment you can do around 700k ingame bucks/hr with Hangar I/E CEO Hangar Bunker &amp MC. BUT it will need at least 2.5mil for Bunker and added up around 8 mil for startup costs. I let you do the math...Bugs Glitches &amp CheatersMoney glitches and bugs benefiting players are fixed in mere hrs/days.Gamebreaking bugs are just as it is and mostly never fixed.Nuff said.Griefers Cheaters &amp Drip FeedingPublic sessions are virtually unplayable if you plan on earning money. They implement predatory mechanics like several paywalls griefers rewards and public lobbies requirements for "new" updates that are no more than clones of Finance and Felony with more overpriced stuff boring unwanted and uninspired adversary modes and months and months of drip feeding. The anti cheat protection is still a joke and you will have cheater breaking the game in mostly any public session you join.No Single Player DLCThey also promised a single player DLC ages ago. Not gonna happen since it doesnt make money in the long run. RS and T2 is focused on maximizing their profits through adding cheap copy paste content and I seriously expect them to continue in RedDead and the next GTA as well. That's their business model one that disrespects consumers and fans of once upon a time a great franchise an epitome of sandbox genre games.The bottom lineIf you dont want a second day job to actually be able to afford anything STAY AWAY FROM ONLINE. Rockstar and Take Two are now as obnoxiously greedy as EA Activision and Ubisoft. And if you have established something in Online ask yourself when was the last time you actually had fun playing GTAO besides grinding for cash.Games should be meant to be fun not a massive grind and a second job

review: GTA 5 remains the new gold standard for the genre that this series created. It's also a testament to how PC games should be made. While most developers will churn out a crappy and halfhearted port alongside the console version Rockstar sacrificed the release day hype and spent months getting this PC version right.The more that knockoffs of this game come out the more I appreciate it. I just wish they hadn't abandoned the single player campaign. To date over 2 years later it stands with 0 DLC campaigns in a story and setting that could definitely have used more exploration.

review: One of the most beautifully crafted games I have ever played. Everything from the physics to the single player storyline is amazing. Absolutely a work of art. So much attention to detail and so much to do.However. There is an issue with this amazing game. And it ultimately comes down to Rockstar. If you are expecting community ran servers and nice navigation of multiplayer lobbies you are going to be SEVERELY dissapointed. Rockstar not only leaves glaring balance issues with weapons and vehicles but also is very slow to fix multiplayer issues. They have sinced improved it (from release) however it still lacks many features that should be standard in a AAA multiplayer free roam game.Ultimately The game itself is a 9.5/10 but due to Rockstars greediness and laziness when developing the PC multiplayer I give GTA V an 7.5/10. Most other games given the terrible treatment that Rockstar gave GTAV would be a 5/10 but the absolute brilliance of the game itself outshines the terrible job Rockstar have done with it.

review: I've been playing GTA since the very first one. I've enjoyed it immensely since every single one they have released and was even playing GTA Online before when san andreas supported it unofficially. They also had a GTA3 online. Cops and Robbers for anyone who was familiar they should know what I am talking about. Let me start off by saying I just recently purchased this game. It took me a while because I didn't have a PC to run it so as soon as I upgraded this was my first purchase. I started it up and was impressed from the moment I started. They have done so much with this game it's production value is through the roof. There are so many things to do so many subtle nuances so many winks and nods. It's worth every penny. Some people won't like it. That's okay I've seen a ton of negative reviews and it got me worried that this might not be a good game. They were so wrong. The fun I've had playing this and discovering things is just through the roof. It's amazing. When you are running for your life or trying to make a getaway it gets the heart racing! That's just one of the many things that make this so worth while. It has replay value as well. I love it I enjoy it and I am super happy I purchased it. This game gets a million stars out of 5. In summation the story is awesome you have 3 players that you play as. You can switch between them and play as whomever you want. I'm super impressed!

review: According to all known laws of aviation there is no way a bee should be able to fly. Its wings are too small to get its fat little body off the ground. The bee of course flies anyway because bees don't care what humans think is impossible. Yellow black. Yellow black. Yellow black. Yellow black. Ooh black and yellow! Let's shake it up a little. Barry! Breakfast is ready! Ooming! Hang on a second. Hello? Barry? Adam? Oan you believe this is happening? I can't. I'll pick you up. Looking sharp. Use the stairs. Your father paid good money for those. Sorry. I'm excited. Here's the graduate. We're very proud of you son. A perfect report card all B's. Very proud. Ma! I got a thing going here. You got lint on your fuzz. Ow! That's me! Wave to us! We'll be in row 118 000. Bye! Barry I told you stop flying in the house! Hey Adam. Hey Barry. Is that fuzz gel? A little. Special day graduation. Never thought I'd make it. Three days grade school three days high school. Those were awkward. Three days college. I'm glad I took a day and hitchhiked around the hive. You did come back different. Hi Barry. Artie growing a mustache? Looks good. Hear about Frankie? Yeah. You going to the funeral? No I'm not going. Everybody knows sting someone you die. Don't waste it on a squirrel. Such a hothead. I guess he could have just gotten out of the way. I love this incorporating an amusement park into our day. That's why we don't need vacations. Boy quite a bit of pomp... under the circumstances. Well Adam today we are men. We are! Bee men. Amen! Hallelujah! Students faculty distinguished bees please welcome Dean Buzzwell. Welcome New Hive Oity graduating class of... ...9 15. That concludes our ceremonies. And begins your career at Honex Industries! Will we pick ourjob today? I heard it's just orientation. Heads up! Here we go. Keep your hands and antennas inside the tram at all times. Wonder what it'll be like? A little scary. Welcome to Honex a division of Honesco and a part of the Hexagon Group. This is it! Wow. Wow. We know that you as a bee have worked your whole life to get to the point where you can work for your whole life. Honey begins when our valiant Pollen Jocks bring the nectar to the hive. Our top secret formula is automatically color corrected scent adjusted and bubble contoured into this soothing sweet syrup with its distinctive golden glow you know as... Honey! That girl was hot. She's my cousin! She is? Yes we're all cousins. Right. You're right. At Honex we constantly strive to improve every aspect of bee existence. These bees are stress testing a new helmet technology. What do you think he makes? Not enough. Here we have our latest advancement the Krelman. What does that do? Oatches that little strand of honey that hangs after you pour it. Saves us millions. Oan anyone work on the Krelman? Of course. Most bee jobs are small ones. But bees know that every small job if it's done well means a lot. But choose carefully because you'll stay in the job you pick for the rest of your life. The same job the rest of your life? I didn't know that. What's the difference? You'll be happy to know that bees as a species haven't had one day off in 27 million years. So you'll just work us to death? We'll sure try. Wow! That blew my mind! "What's the difference?" How can you say that? One job forever? That's an insane choice to have to make. I'm relieved. Now we only have to make one decision in life. But Adam how could they never have told us that? Why would you question anything? We're bees. We're the most perfectly functioning society on Earth. You ever think maybe things work a little too well here? Like what? Give me one example. I don't know. But you know what I'm talking about. Please clear the gate. Royal Nectar Force on approach. Wait a second. Oheck it out. Hey those are Pollen Jocks! Wow. I've never seen them this close. They know what it's like outside the hive. Yeah but some don't come back. Hey Jocks! Hi Jocks! You guys did great! You're monsters! You're sky freaks! I love it! I love it! I wonder where they were. I don't know. Their day's not planned. Outside the hive flying who knows where doing who knows what. You can'tjust decide to be a Pollen Jock. You have to be bred for that. Right. Look. That's more pollen than you and I will see in a lifetime. It's just a status symbol. Bees make too much of it. Perhaps. Unless you're wearing it and the ladies see you wearing it. Those ladies? Aren't they our cousins too? Distant. Distant. Look at these two. Oouple of Hive Harrys. Let's have fun with them. It must be dangerous being a Pollen Jock. Yeah. Once a bear pinned me against a mushroom! He had a paw on my throat and with the other he was slapping me! Oh my! I never thought I'd knock him out. What were you doing during this? Trying to alert the authorities. I can autograph that. A little gusty out there today wasn't it comrades? Yeah. Gusty. We're hitting a sunflower patch six miles from here tomorrow. Six miles huh? Barry! A puddle jump for us but maybe you're not up for it. Maybe I am. You are not! We're going 0900 at J Gate. What do you think buzzy boy? Are you bee enough? I might be. It all depends on what 0900 means. Hey Honex! Dad you surprised me. You decide what you're interested in? Well there's a lot of choices. But you only get one. Do you ever get bored doing the same job every day? Son let me tell you about stirring. You grab that stick and you just move it around and you stir it around. You get yourself into a rhythm. It's a beautiful thing. You know Dad the more I think about it maybe the honey field just isn't right for me. You were thinking of what making balloon animals? That's a bad job for a guy with a stinger. Janet your son's not sure he wants to go into honey! Barry you are so funny sometimes. I'm not trying to be funny. You're not funny! You're going into honey. Our son the stirrer! You're gonna be a stirrer? No one's listening to me! Wait till you see the sticks I have. I could say anything right now. I'm gonna get an ant tattoo! Let's open some honey and celebrate! Maybe I'll pierce my thorax. Shave my antennae. Shack up with a grasshopper. Get a gold tooth and call everybody "dawg"! I'm so proud. We're starting work today! Today's the day. Oome on! All the good jobs will be gone. Yeah right. Pollen counting stunt bee pouring stirrer front desk hair removal... Is it still available? Hang on. Two left! One of them's yours! Oongratulations! Step to the side. What'd you get? Picking crud out. Stellar! Wow! Oouple of newbies? Yes sir! Our first day! We are ready! Make your choice. You want to go first? No you go. Oh my. What's available? Restroom attendant's open not for the reason you think. Any chance of getting the Krelman? Sure you're on. I'm sorry the Krelman just closed out. Wax monkey's always open. The Krelman opened up again. What happened? A bee died. Makes an opening. See? He's dead. Another dead one. Deady. Deadified. Two more dead. Dead from the neck up. Dead from the neck down. That's life! Oh this is so hard! Heating cooling stunt bee pourer stirrer humming inspector number seven lint coordinator stripe supervisor mite wrangler. Barry what do you think I should... Barry? Barry! All right we've got the sunflower patch in quadrant nine... What happened to you? Where are you? I'm going out. Out? Out where? Out there. Oh no! I have to before I go to work for the rest of my life. You're gonna die! You're crazy! Hello? Another call coming in. If anyone's feeling brave there's a Korean deli on 83rd that gets their roses today. Hey guys. Look at that. Isn't that the kid we saw yesterday? Hold it son flight deck's restricted. It's OK Lou. We're gonna take him up. Really? Feeling lucky are you? Sign her

review: After hearing about Take Two's CEO's opinions that there are not enough micro transactions in not only GTA but many of Take Two's games and perhaps in the gaming industry as a whole I cannot in good consciousness recommend you buy this game for any reason other than to play around with your friends in an invite only lobby. GTA's economy is completely ruined payout for missions is insubstantial in comparison to the exorbitant price of most in game items and the only way to bridge that gap is by paying real life money for a paltry amount of in game money. Now with the most recent ban waves targetting most remaining mod menus and money hacks they have removed any rogue element capable of providing a player with money without the need to pay real life money or days of grinding for a single car (or even a simple customization item for a car in the case of the extremely overpriced low riders).Most importantly they are now also targeting single player mods banning your account completely for altering your single player experience. Meanwhile on the topic of licensed and legitimate single player DLC Take Two (Or Three Or More) remains completely silent leaving the user to enrich their own single player experience with mods before deciding to do an about face and ban all mods. In their latest move they have issued a cease and desist order to Open IV a popular modding tool used by many to add mods to their single player GTA campaign (with code implemented specifically to stop the user from using those mods in an online lobby).No matter your stance on single player and multiplayer mods hackers or ill gotten gains (ironically the entire spirit of GTA) you should do well to avoid getting this game unless you are willing to give hundreds of dollars to a company parading its extortion as innovation.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: How much do I love about GTA5?Myself can t judge it.I merely watch the full gameplay process of the offline mode three times buying a brand new U disk only to help my friend install GTA5 on his cracked XBOX though I did not play that on XBOX later on.Then I pre orderd the PC version of GTA5 almostly the first day it is released on steam even though I was still using the little stupid macbook air (even unable to run San Andreas on that).Later on that winter I bought a new computer 50% because I am dying to play this.Now I almost finish the story mode even though the frames never being a stable number over 30.All that t above is my own story of GTA5.Now it is time to talk why I suffered that much to play a game that I ve known the whole story clearly .No complicated firstly or secondly merely two words FREEDOM and REALITY.The game is full of freedom and the freedom you dare not experience in real life is especially emerged.I am not that kind of insane dacnomania in the game not only because that I am not skilled enough to deal with the LSPD.Through my 28h story mode gameplay so far the thing I am most willing to do is controlling Franklin to buy or simply rob a sports car driving 6 kilometers to reach the garage he owns turning the car to a monster of speed and function then drive 6 kilometers back home.The trip is not boring at all when you drive across highways country roads grasslands and so many other topographies.You can drive as fast as you can shoot the who crashing onto your car or say hello to those who also drive thrpugh the quite little town at dawn.Even though I commited suicide due to my unconsciousness I only have to pay 5000 and everything goes back as if nothing have happened.Every meter I drive through makes me feel like I am the main actor of FAST AND FURIOUS.My driving do not need a purpose like other racing games it is so ing awesome that s why I enjoyed driving on GTA5 that s the freedom I expect from GTA5.Then reality?I do not mean things like super visual effects from my cheap computer I mean something that is naturally happening in real life but normally not in the game.I was shocked abou t the details of the game.Even that the gunshot can put out any light I saw surprised me a lot.It is always details that matters.the motto also suits gaming industries.There are videos about 50 tremendous details about GTA5 on youtube.After seeing that you will have the same feeling on the greatness of the game.Maybe time to talk about the story?From my perspective this game is all about several shocking robbery in Los Santo.In between the whole time the love story of T and M could be regarded as the connecting thread.I can t talk much about the humanity because myself is to young to figure it out.For me?Treavor is a kind psycho Franklin can be something in the future and I can understand all that Micheal have done but maybe I can t accept that if I were T.I hate the ending to become a tragedy so I would pick C.Prejuiced by first impressions guys I can control are good guys and those who oppose us are bad guys.Good guy survives and kill bad guys one by one standard Hollywood ending exciting enough!People may argue about that I judge three leading characters simply as good guys.That is because I have gradually fall in love with these three totally different s.Why are the writers in rockstar so ing clever?I don t know why I would spend an hour or two writing this piece of especially when several tests are merely several days ahead.Maybe admire it just like others finished a good movie?All in all I guess if I define GTA5 as a masterpiece there are not that much people would disagree and kick my

review: So after playing this game onboth my old Xbox 360 and now on my PC i have to say its a game worth getting. I have just scrolled down throught the comments of what somepeople are having issues with. First one will be getting banned for using Discord overlay system. I can understand that the Discord overlay system some people really like and enjoy but in my opionon i dont use it and i really dont intend too as you can really easily ALT Tab out of the game just to see who has joined the channel. On top of that you can also play in boardless windowed mode (as i do because i alt tab alot).Second one is complaing about hackers.Yep i perfectly understand where people are coming from with this as i have had it in my lobby but what do i do? simple i make an invite only lobby and invite my friends to play. It makes it stress free from hackers as well as after finishing a job since you go back into that same invite only lobby.Last one that i would like to talk about is there customer service.Ofcourse everyone has had some sort of issue ether it being IG (In game) or OG (Out game) i have had many issues with buy GTA Online cash and not having it shown IG. I contected customer support through e mail saying 'I dont have the money i just spent on IG' (something like that). After a day they sent me an e mail apologising on how it had became an issue and few hours after that i got the cash.I really do feel sorry for the people who are having issues with the GTA Online service personally i havent had any issues as of yet though i would recormend that people just run the game in boardless windowed mode with NO voice channel chat overlay.As for the game itself i love it theres so much to do with random people and even with friends. I have spent hours on GTA Online and every time i do i always enjoy myself.

review: I would love to say that I loved this game but I can't not now in it's current version. After pushing back the release date of this game multiple times there are still too many infurriating bugs with this game. There is the huge issuse of extreme framerate drops which are common even post patch an issue that happens regardless of the settings you are using.Even with the framerate issue I got through the campain portion and enjoyed it. After buying all the properties and ransacking the town with tanks and choppers i grew bored and decided to try out the online portion of the game. I was impressed at first I liked the idea of having your own character within the same map you were familar with and incorporating characters you had already come across made for interesting missions but there is a huge caveat.... It was fun when it worked.I kept track of all of the different times there was an "unknown network error" or if my mission unexpectedly stopped (not including when people left). Over the course of about 90 minutes I had 7 such issues. 7!!!! what makes this worse is every time your network errors occured it automatically loaded the story mode and had to reload online. This is a slow and annoying process that probably took at least 15 minutes of the 90 i played. If you take into account the time spent waiting for others to join and the frequent times when the host terminated the game or kicked you from the mission the amount of time you were actually playing was probably close to 40 minutes.So it is very simple why online mode sucks right now I spent 50 minutes waiting to play 40 minutes worth of game. This is not my only experience where i had a plethora of issues it is merely only the only one I bothered to keep track of. There are also numerous other bugs and glitches I experienced while playing not to mention the number of times I had waited only to have the host leave and ruin the set up or heist mission.I really want to like this game. I pre ordered and tried to remain positive even after numerous delays but now I find myself thinking why wasn't it delayed longer if the game still has this many issues.My hardware specsfx 832079708 gb ram 1600 mhzwd black 1tb hdsamsung 840 120 gb ssd (for os plus a few things)
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is super duper fun to play . Best GTA since Vice City . The online session is fun only if you have friends to play with or it can get kinda boring.But there are alot of modders in online that make the game "unplayable" and not fun.A lot of people are complaining about taking away their mods but it doesn't take away the fun factor of the game. In fact getting into a game without a "godmode" killing everyone and trapping you is actually makes it enjoyable while roaming around in online. The single player is well done and well written. Once the story kick in the overall enjoyment of the game and its really fun to play. Just like GTA 4 the characters are entertaining but better.If you haven't played any of the GTA franchise do yourself a favor and pick it up. It's worth the money though i got a bargain when i bought the game but still it's awesome.The online is like playing an MMO with all the grinding. The heists both online and single player are super exciting.

review: It's a testament to the incredible world constructed by Grand Theft Auto V an island brimming with interesting people and colourful places and countless things to do but also with an unmistakable playful character of its own that I am able to spend the past several months avoiding the main story missions entirely while still having an incredible amount of fun. I've instead spent this time walking and driving around admiring the many landmarks of the world killing and stealing and doing good playing games and taking challenges and coming up with challenges of my own losing myself in the bright lights of Los Santos and the endless deserts of Blaine County. During these several months of total freedom I've felt immersed in a way unparalleled across any other video game before or since. I almost want to abandon the main story for good at this point becoming just another wild citizen in this wild world.If you're a boring sap like me who wants to buy all the latest open world FPS games just to play them like a walking simulator GTA V is worth the price of admission right there. (Well the excellent mods are also a factor.) Lots of games have worlds you want to live in but Los Santos is a whole level above that from the moment you start the game you're living in it already.

review: I've had the oddest of experiences with this game on PC. I originally played it with a Radeon 290. Some framerate dips but overall it ran really well no problems played on high settings with some performance demanding things pushed down.Upgraded to 390x textures take 5 seconds to buffer out. Some are totally nonexistent. Full geometry missing when you're driving fast. Framerate was fine but its totally immersion breaking watching the game world pop up around you everywhere you go. Even if I set the settings to low. I never run anything on low.I'm playing The Witcher 3 on ultra getting 45 60 fps (I have some things like grass density water quality and hairworks below ultra for this). So I don't think my pc is too underpowered. I eventually got it to run alright but it became one of those "tricking my game into working" experiences. Digging through forums that say "oh I changed the launch settings to _____________ in this command line and I set my memory prefernce on my ram to __________. Also stop running any virus protections software and aim your desklamp at a 45 degree angle toward the darkest corner in your room."I'm not too tech savvy I just want to play the game. Anyway I've played countless hours on my 360 and I loved the game. So this is a yes but... I hope it works for you.I hope it works for me eventually too..

review: Pros Single player is pretty good but gets old.Graphics are awesome.Cons Multiplayer is Modders constantly make the game no fun. But even if they aren't around one guy with one rocket can undo two weeks of work trying to build up wealth to buy something.This game is purely pay to win. If you don't want to spend a few hundred USD to get some decent stuff and then just fart around trying to ruin other peoples' days while they try to ruin yours don't bother.Also full of massive obvious bugs. I'm playing on an i7 3770 2x8gb DDR SSD and GTX 1060 and load times vary from maybe a minute or two to 15 or 20 minutes. when you try to join missions which are the only way to get out of the normal game world that is totally unplayable it will tell you that the session you're trying to join is full and then even when you hit cancel it will give you a 20 minute load time even though you didn't go anywhere.Overall the game consistently leaves me completely off by the time I log off and I make more in game money by watching grass grow from my front porch than playing their missions (when they'll let you actually play them). My advice is to save your money and buy a game where the people who make it actually want it to be fun rather than sucker in stupid people to pay a lot of money to buy the greatest stuff and try and compete with "hackers" that are invulnurable and teleport themselves to you or you to them to kill you because that's somehow fun even after years of the game being out.

review: It is difficult to reccommend this game as it has some novel ideas which i really appreciate. I like the game i play it regularly but i leave feeling like i haven't accomplished much. They push the game like a facebook game online and they've completely forgotten about single player.They also didn't stick too much detail into the single player. The characters are each okay they aren't that special. The special abilities and the 3 or so heists are really cool additions. They completely throw out some of the cool aspects from GTA IV. I get that it wasn't the most popular in the series but the main characters especially niko had a lot of character. You empathize with him you get to know his morals and how he thinks. What drives him whereas in 5 you get 3 characters each mostly motivated by money greed that sort of thing. And it just kind of falls flat on its face. The only exception being Trevor who is sadisticly crazy and has mental illness.

review: This is game is fun to play even though I despise most of the characters. I do not like the grind in the multiplayer at all but I value the sheer amount of fun things to do as far as gamemodes go. This might have the worst soundtrack of any GTA game. I do like that parachutes and other gameplay elements were not locked behind a DLC single player paywall. I actually respect that this game has enough content that it does not need single player DLC. The heist missions are some of the most memorable missions in any GTA game ever. This is not my favorite GTA game but it is still a good game to get when it is on sale. I genuinely had fun and got to 94% completion on PS3 years ago. I had enough fun to buy this game again for PC. The optimization of of this game is actually good for Rockstar standards and it runs fine on my rig. I have always enjoyed the sense of humor of Rockstar and this GTA follows along with funny TV shows and radio segments like the others. This game is actually decent satire at times. I like the way it pokes fun at Conservatives Liberals video gamers Hollywood celebrities etc. Some of the content can be a little frustrating at times but it is far from the most frustrating GTA game imo. My favorite game in the series being Vice City and that game sure as hell had some frustrating parts. I'm just happy this game runs good and it is not infected with something as as GFWL (Rockstar Social Club is not that bad). Hopefully the next GTA game released on PC runs this good or better and it is not held down by horrifically bad DRM (looking at 4).

review: I have play this game for over a year on the Xbox 360 not once did I complain about the Heist the lack of vehicles lack of missions and etc. I didn't care about all that. I cared more about the experience. My friends and I doing dumb sh** in GTA Online. First of all the Single Player aspect of the game is great. It doesnt follow GTA 4's mistake of repeating the same type of missions (ex. follow target kill target go to place to kill target etc.) each mission in GTA 5 feels unique especially since Switching Character was a thing and makes every mission unique and diverse and how RockstarGames used this aspect was very well executed and it made sense in the missions.For GTA Online I really enjoyed what I had played on my last gen Xbox 360 the experience of an open sandbox game and with your friends. Planning epic planes and gettaway cars because my friends and I were going to rob a convinience store?? That sounds stupid! And it was but that was the whole point of GTA Online having FUN in anyway possible especially with your friends. GTA online isn't ment to be played alone I recommend you bring a friend with you if you dont have any friends then make some friends!!!!Everything I have explained about GTA Online was on last gen I can't begin to explain how much the PC version captures everything that I loved and gives me more. A more rich and visual improvement over the last gen console. Personally I don't see a huge difference between the current gen consoles and the PC nor does it matter what matters is that everyone who has been waiting for this on the PC may now get to enjoy one of the greatest open world sandbox games on the PC.GTA 5 and Online 10/10

At this you can also drive submarines get inside network connection and buy stuffs.Tuning design have lots of improvement and now you can make you car even faster or cooler than the past GTA's was.History is a little hard at begin but you will adapt after a few hours playing and will enjoy every role and every char. I think they made this to don't let the game keep same boring thing where you need keep chaging hairstile cloths make your char more stronger. title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Just a Disclaimer this is both at times my opinion and an honest review so don't get made at me if I offend you in any way Oh GTA... by the looks of me you may think that because of my decently quanitative hours that I spent towards this game that I like the game and had fun 100% of the time I played it. WELL looks can be deceiving. GTA V is at first a good and solid game but when you encounter your first noob try hard or hacker your whole experience gets wrecked. Noobs will try to ride off of your success F.E. if you have a heist loaded up there is a chance that a noob will join in thinking "Oh I can get easy money off of this." The try hard will push him/herself to the limits to be the very best the can be or at least that's the vibe I got from them at first. But the more and more you cross paths with a try hard the harsher they get. Try hards can go to the point of putting you down using profanities and a combination of words that will certainly not make yourself feel good. They can do this if you were to do something little like accidentally die or do the opposite of what they told you to do. But finally the hackers. Hackers can sometimes prove to be useful by giving you little bits of money or saving you from try hards that are bullying you just to get a kick out of it but around 75 80% of the time they are they to mess up you gaming experience by bombarding you with RPGs tazers or just launching you up in the air and burning you with magical fire... yeah because that makes sense. There is ALOT MORE that hackers can do. F.E. they can teleport into your car and kick you out of it they can summon a cage around you and finally they can troll your cargo meaning they can destroy your precious goods that you can collect for money. Another thing that I will rant about are the heists. Heists in GTA are fun for the most part which basically means if you fail too many times on a single section it will start to get infuriating and aggrovating. This is because whenever you do the section and fail so many times you start to get sick of that part and will eventually make you want to rage quit. Also I believe that some parts of heists are incredibly unimportant towards your final goal. Heists in general are just plain boring my example will be the first heist. You drive to where you are going to rob then you drive back to Lester's base after that you drive back to your house. The second part is you driving to a parking garage then killing a bunch of people then you get into another car which is bullet proof and you drive back to Lester's base. And the final heist is you driving to Lester's base driving to where you are going to rob (really the only fun part about this heist is you choosing between Crowd Control and unlocking the Vault/Safebox) when you get there you rob the place then GUESS WHAT you just drive. So basically the point that i was trying to make here is that for most heists 60 70% of the gameplay is just driving.One final thing that I will rant about is everything is unrewarding. (This one is just my opinion but maybe it will apply to you too) Whenever I started playing GTA I wanted the Deluxo/the ripoff of the DeLorean from BTTF. I wanted the Deluxo because it could fly... I mean who doesn't want a flying car so i worked my butt off grinding money to get the Deluxo and occasionally newer and better equipment. But then the most glorious moment in my GTA career happened I got the Deluxo and I have to say driving in it was fun for the first 3 or so times and then it just got mundane and eventually it became not as great or as epic as I thought it would be all of those hours ago.So I'm just going to say that GTA is not worth $30 I mean the graphics are amazing but overall the experience isn't worth.In my opinion.

review: If i said that the specs that Rockstar quote being able to run the game were a bit of an over estimation of their ability to make a game that is so detailed and contains so much action run on a machine with those specs. Now i have come to this conclusion due to the events of a story which no one gives a flying about and will be shared below (I really don't have a good story just some dank memes.)Just before anyone doesn't say anything because they never read this at the time i had an I5 3330 with a 3 Ghz clock speed and a 3.2 Ghz Turbo speed and a GTX 640 with i don't even remember.Having some nice little online multiplayer banter with the squad one fateful night. we were doing some missions and what have you generally on that day to day grind now one of my friends was a massive sweat and played a load on the PS3 so when he transfered his save he had a missile launcher we completed a mission and were left on a off great hill in the middle of nowhere i was getting like maybe 25 30FPS at best even though there was barely anything to even try and render.Now my realm 5 mate turns around with this hot little RPG and says something along the lines of Hey watch this and shoots me square in the face with the RPG. After respawning i had a total of 10FPS and could never play the game again.TLDR Those recommended specs are basically the minimum specs. story above because i can't be arsed to write the entire thing.

review: TL DR GTA V is one great game but MP has it's few problems...I have played mostly multiplayer so there will not be that much about singleplayer...Singleplayer is pretty awesome for me as i liked others GTA stories but multiplayer is filled with bunch of s and who just wants to kill you ASAP (even if you have money in bank they still want).After 40 hours of multiplayer (only) i have seen only one cheater but they are not problem problem are low skilled people ( that really bothered me at all heists. I know it's impossible to know heists and their setups detailed but there are youtube tips n tricks for it.Also everytime i had off passive mode and finished heist/setup people always killed me for no reason... This thing and that random killing me solved enabling passive mode.Then there are few negative things like striped bodies (this problem had my friend) &gt PROOF&lt and after fixing it my friend and me (i had it before) have dotted skin &gt PROOF&lt (dotted skin is visible only at multiplayer characters not random pedestriants and story characters like Lester)These things are not harming my gameplay so that's why i am not that mad about them.Anyways this game is good but prepare lots of patience on multiplayer...Updates After 80 hours of multiplayer that stuff above is like nothing and you would just enjoy game BUT you ll start finding a lot of cheaters. I wasn't focusing on them that much but after repeating heists i got kinda bored and started doing CEO missions n stuff about it. Cheaters are just idiots that you can easily vote kick from session (public server).ALSO rockstars logic about reporting cheaters is really (there is no ing option "cheater" or "hacker" ...).After 160 hours of multiplayer you ll start noticing much bigger and worse bugs than before and cheaters will be like casual players to you you see cheater you vote kick him report him and go to another session... Also you'll be doing only Pacific standarts to make money with CEO missions at same time to maximize profit. That's (sadly) the only option of making money in this part of game (level 90).After 360 hoursok O

review: This is for GTA V Online(SP Story was great) If you dont have friends to play this game dont play it. If you dont want to grind for money dont buy this game. If your lobby ends up with more than 10 people in it(which inevitably will happen) there's a 90% chance that a hacker will ruin your game and destroy your cargo. If you dont like extremely dense amounts of toxic players and hackers then dont buy this game. This game is essentially a glorified beta game just being filled with content where grind and real life money is what matters and if you have enough of it you can overwrite even the most skillful players. Like I said BETA game. Its not very buggy but there is an unlimited amount of ways this game can be improved convenience wise and as epecially in actually caring about hackers. Pretty much everyone hates Rockstar at this point not just for gta but for their other games such as bully(im not a bully fanboy fyi). All they want is to make money out of this game so they add new content which costs a ton of ingame money but they make this money hard to get by making even the best ways of grinding money insanely repetitive but cover there tracks by then making little side quests to keep you entertained. This all pressures you to just spend real money on shark and therefore feeding there need for more money. Dont get me started on loading screens I have an exceptional pc and I know im not the only one with this problem. The only reason I could see myself playing this game is because my friends are playing it otherwise im steering extremely clear of it. This review is long overdue for me but I wanted to make sure.

review: Ok so They just gave me a monster truck because I'm OG I guess I'll switch this to recommend lol. They do seem to fight cheating but it's not gone entirely. Do yourself a favor. Get to 1mill don't drop below 1 mill so you can do the VIP misisons and keep stacking chedder. As soon as you can invest in a MC or a CEO HQ so that you can try and develop money making assets. Old review for posterior sake. Listen These updates would be amazing. But R$ does nothing to curb cheating. They do nothing to stop people from spawning money or making water erupt from under you. It's rediculous. Most the time you can just change servers but half the time you just change into another server that has 1 or 4 more cheaters. I really want to love this game because I've always loved GTA. But really. They only reason this exists is to get people to buy shark cards because earning the 10 mil for a boat would take to long with all the effing cheaters. I mean I get it it's GTA. It's edgy to cheat but man. There comes a point in time when you need shore up your game before you release new content. Edit and the newest updates have come at the cost of performance for someone on an older pc. it used to run clean and smooth but since the latest CEO update it's choppy as . Old review ____________________________Raising the price right before the summersale so they can "Lower" the price is bull adding shark cards so they can still charge $60 and not allow people to return the game is bull hackers and no anticheat on online mode is bull. Oh how the mighty have fallen. I never tought it would come to this Rockstar. I think we should break up I'll go pick some small indie dev to be my favorite game maker now. Seriously sad it's come to this.

review: Been playing GTA on console for about 2 years switched to pc as soon as I got one and oh my god it's amazing and if you have a good pc you should install a graphics mod like redux I got it and it looks like real life and with a pc you can get higher fps. I for example have an Radeon rx580 8gb 16gb ram ryzen 7 1700 oc 3.7Ghz and I have redux mod and it honestly looks like real life and I still play at a very solid 60fps. If you don't have a good pc I don't recommend but if you do get this game. The game itself is very fun to play the storyline will make you laugh out loud and it is very well written. Online is a whole 'nother story it is updated like crazy awesome vehicles but it is very much a grind now and it's very boring unless you pay extra cash for in game money or if you mod online but this will result in a ban if rockstar finds out. So it's very hard to have fun online when you are nonstop making little money and not enjoying what's in the freeroam. I personally mod offline which is perfectly gone and it's really fun. All in all it's fun but wait until black Friday or Christmas or any other sale so you can get this game cheaper I know for sure black Friday and Christmas it is 50% off which is a really good deal. Back to the redux mod you should get it if your pc can handle it it causes a 5 15fps drop from the original fps but not only does it make the graphics look insanely real it is a complete overhaul of the game better explosions better ragdoll better water waaaaay better reflections (My favorite) and the weight of the car when turning stopping and going is very realistic. Also the plantlife sways in the wind better and the sky and environment looks real instead of like the vanilla which looks like a filter. I give it a 7/10 regular vanilla version 10/10 with redux and other fun mods you can add to the game. This is just my 2 cents.

review: Honestly the past weeks I got this game have been the worst gaming experience I ever had.I am talking about GTA Online. The loading times are obscene the game takes 2 minutes or more to get into GTA Online after that at any given time it cant kick me back to GTA V single player or show the FAILED to SAVE message.The game does not check if any session you are trying to join is already full and then you have to wait 2 loading screens.There are no messages or progress bars during loading you have no idea of what is going on.You can get kicked from the session YOU ARE HOSTING.The player gets stuck and cannot move at any time you finish a mission or event the game hangs and the only solution is to force close the game. The community is one of the worst and there are no penalties for a**holes someone joins you heist and leaves theres is no ban from heist or cash penalty. During a heist of coop mission players cannot die or else is auto fail dead players should just loose part of the XP and $.Passive Mode protects you from other players but then you cannot attack NPCs or cops.Instead of having a locker at home of safe houses the players can carry all the guns they bought so almost everyone is carrying a rocket launcher and sniper rifle all the time.You cannot sell your guns cars or houses/garaged there are workarounds but some of them are just stupid.Items are level based I can understand that at an MMO but not at an online action game theres always a single player with a fighter jet fu**ing everyone up and them people just leave the game session the same goes for guns and worst of all clothes. There are well documented bugs that never got fixed I cant say how many hours I lost because of the WANTED LEVEL BUG in the PRISON HEIST mission.The game have serious issues and most of them arent hard to fix but by the issues I searched in the Rockstar and Steam foruns and how long they are being discussed I see the DEV simply doesnt care about this product so players have two options Give up an leave Learn to deal with the games issues
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is excellent to say the least. The story is strong the characters are all wonderfully written and the dialogue is voiced by some of the best I have seen. It has a ton of content but the content does not make you feel like you are fulfilling a meaningless checklist. The city is open and beautiful and the remastered version makes it a thousand times better than its last gen predecessor. It doesn't matter what type of gamer you are there is something here for almost everyone. The game manages to include so many elements that it's really hard to limit this to just an open world game. One second you're sneaking into someone's house to steal a car and the next you're fleeing from armed men on a jet ski. My only beef with the game (the only reason it is not perfect) is how unintuitive the controls can sometimes be how stupid the AI has been designed in a few cases and how confusing the story may be to follow at times. Otherwise I give this game a 9.5 out of 10. If you have a next gen system this is a must play.

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples peeled cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double crust pie Directions 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10 inch circle. Cut into 8 (1 inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter sugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is easily on of the best games I have ever played and is my favorite in the GTA series. Pros Extremely well written story Main/side characters feel real and develop thoughout The actions you do actually feel like they matter Los Santos feels alive Smooth driving mechanics Action is great Trevor It looks beautiful Free Updates for multiplayer portion of the game Fun to play with friends Awesome soundtrack that appeals to every taste (Famous artists even host the stations) The different UIs Plenty to do (Even after finishing the main story) Cons The game has infrequent frame drops on more insense scenes on higher settings No Story DLC ( Only a con because Rockstar said it would happen/Rockstar makes good DLCs) There is the occasional hacker onlineThis is one of the only games that I can call a 10/10. Every time I see it in my Library I want to play through it again. I bought this for $60 on PS3 and $60 on PC and I definitely do not regret either purchase. Do yourself a favor and pickup this game.

review: The Grand Theft Auto series has made a remarkable presence on the gaming community as a whole this title is no exception. GTA is one of the (if not most) controversially recognisable gaming series of all time and one of the most successful as well. Overall this title (especially online multiplayer) is fantastic but like anything is not without it's faults. Rockstar has sinned in a variety of ways some which they cannot make up for no matter how prolific their attempt would or could be. Despite these faults in the recent months GTA V has become notorious for a variety of compelling reasons online cheaters being the most significant. This issue needs to be addressed and continually combated in a good professional manor (key word being good). Many people have been banned significant portions of these being cheaters and hackers but although minute still a percentage innocents who are being unfairly maimed in the form of a ban due to other people's venomous behaviour. However although not going in depth in an attempt to keep this concise I've kept detail to a minimum. I highy reccomend if you have a resonable pc of certain specification you buy this game. It's fantastic and has a compelling story (which can become competitive and boring but take it with a pinch of salt the GTA storyline is like no other). However simultaneously the online version of the game continues to flourish despite this cheaters have become a large portion which is a huge drawback to online. Overall Graphics 8/10 Story 8/10 Online 7/10

review: Grand Theft Auto V (SP) GTA 5's singleplayer is one of the if not the best singleplayer experiences I have ever had. Even without the missions there is so much to do in Los Santos. Each character's unique ability also makes it all that little bit more fun. There's also modding which kept the games sales going up and kept the singleplayer fun even after 100% completion. But of course Take Two is trying to shut it down. So you can stop harmless SinglePlayer modding but not cheaters in Online? Disgusting. GTA Online GTA Online is also a really great multiplayer experience or at least it was until the mod menu users / cheaters came along and started blowing everybody up under the name of random people and trapping them in cages. As I said earlier instead of stopping harmless SP modding stop the cheaters griefing every lobby they come across! Now I'll talk a bit about the updates this game has had. I love them all (mostly). I see a lot of people going "omg this military crap isnt gta anymore flying cars wtf". Personally I think these additions are all very cool the only reason people complain about them is the way they get used by tryhards griefers etc. The Doomsday Heist update added a new and amazingly fun heist to the game which also let you experience the new vehicles added to the game (just incase you wanna "test drive" them or something). Sure R* might mess up now and again and add a griefing tool to the game *cough cough orbital cannon cough cough* but it's mostly pretty fun (but expensive) vehicles weapons properties etc. Again to sum it all up I really like all the military stuff they have added into this game keep making these updates R*! TL DR Game itself is great Take Two and cheaters are not.EDIT Recently R* has cracked down on the cheaters step in the right direction also have updated the GTA Online portion for the recent updates added to the game.EDIT 2 This was made in 25th of February 2018 just received news (and confirmed) that R* / Take2 has taken down most or all the most popular paid menus. Nice! Of course there's still other menus but I'm sure they'll crack down on those too.EDIT 3 Game has gotten Mixed reviews because of cheaters making a negative review and crying about how they got banned LMAO.

review: why NOT to buy the game for anywhere the full price (and the reason it has such low ratings now read the other negative reviews)Rockstar decided to poop on all of their big PC fanbase that made all of their money years ago by releasing the game for consoles and never saying they plan to release the game for PC until after a couple of years "thanks for your money losers" so let's get this one out of the way we got the game way too late after they milked the consoles.Online game is designed badly It's ALL about farming the "business"/"making big money" DLCs all take more money from you than they even bring in Hey wanna sell cocaine for 420K? no problem all you need is to invest 3 million. and of course you need to work very hard for those 420k and you can't do it alone (cos of time limit) so you gotta find friends cos general public community is crap. so you never really make the investment back in these money making schemes you end up farming money for tens of hours just trying to make back the lost money by the end of which you're tired of farming the same missions and you just move on. DLC cars millions per car fun vehicles millions You end up trying to make money but you gotta keep putting in more money it doesn't pay up unless you play hundreds of hours just farming (which by that point the game has lost all of its meaning) Full of hackers online expecially chinese ones that don't speak with you long loading times wanna do a nice mission together? don't count on strangers very toxic non communicating people so you can only count on friends you make. game is designed so you farm and group activities are too few and far in between and aren't that fun. eventually you buy a house and have a few nice cars only to realize you had little fun making the money to get them. read the other reviews it's not just my opinion.Offline mode story It's worth playing but not for the full price 20$ is fair. very left wing agenda driven you can see the political views of the game makes creeping in all military man are bloodthirsty killers (you kill a lot of US soldiers in the game) cops are standard (but btw you got only 3 female cops in the entire game you have to search to find their spawn place you kill 99.9999% male cops thanks for the left wing equality rockstar) everything right wing or patriotic is demonized in the game you're pro border? you're a racist that kind of stuff. more anti right wing anti gun in the TV programs they show on TV. one of the characters you play is an insane serial killer but he makes a clear political stand against TORTURE by the US gov that of course after a mission where you tortured a guy yourself. hypocracy (i'm not even american). the only honest thug is a black dude named franklin which plays like carl from San andreas so it's nice. i cringed through half of hte single player cos of the above it's visible and annoying.PROs game is super big beautiful and lots of things to do in the story mode but the lack of a convincing story and characters is annoying the game leaves you feeling empty at ht end of the day both in single player and multiplayer it makes you feel cheated.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It's a love/hate relationshipThe game is not bad but it's not good either....The story is not bad but from the start it feels slow I had difficulties going thru with the story at the beggining because of that but luckily the game got interesting pretty quick.This game has three playable characters (it's the first in the series to have three playable characters) each with their unique style and personality and gives a sense of "there's no main character" but there is a main character Michael. The story is clear from the beggining it's all about him his family present life and ghosts hi's retirement and Franklin and Trevor are there to fill in the gaps even tho they have stories on their own and it's not a bad thing it makes the game more dinamic and gives you a rest from each character I liked that.I'm not playing the online mode I'm not sure if I'll ever play it so I can't say anything about it.

review: A bit late to write a review on a game i've played since launch but i brought the game on console when it was first released and when i heard it was brought out on PC i couldn't wait for the modding community to come in and overall LSPDFR to come into play! )I absolutely love GTA it's been a game i have played over and over again growing up and the game simply never gets old always some new patches or DLC getting thrown into the game which is great to know developers are constantly updating even after full release!And overall it knows how to show you an absolute fun time when you have friends to play with so if you want to see some funny and screw around with some friends then this is the right game.I WILL ONLY RECOMMEND THIS GAME FOR THE SINGLEPLAYER SIDE OF THE GAME! IF YOU EXPECT TO PLAY MULTIPLAYER FORGET IT! Pros Really fun with friends Graphics are absolutely beautiful Story is okay Overall all in all great game Modding Community is flippin awesome Con Rockstar Support is lacking (meaning its and automated) Multiplayer is filled with hackers Innocent people getting banned/accused GTA 5 Multiplayer died when it hit PC Game price increasingSingleplayer experience 9/10Multiplayer experience 4/10 (considering the fun times with friends so this could go lower)Overall vote 6/10
