review: Alright so I've played about 130 hours of this game and I'd say roughly 125 hours of that is dedicated to online. Simply put I love GTA and think extremely well of it I play on a 760 on mostly high settings and have very solid frames online I have no issues whatsoever when it comes to gameplay. Load screens maybe long but that's something that I've learned to work around at this point. This game is currently on sell and I cannot recommend it enough if you are simply looking to pick up a either INCREDIBLE FPS/driving sim/flying sim. Well worth the money and I look forward as to what happens as this game progresses on PC.

review: If you are looking for a game with an amazingly rich detailed and expansive open world with a convincing narrative and a variety of character then this is the game for you especially if you are a fan of messing around in an open world enviorment without consequences. Int his regard the game is close to a 10/10.However if you are looking for an online experience that you can enjoy with friends look elsewhere. The online enviroment is filled with hackers and items like cars and clothes are extremely expensive forcing you to spend real world money to afford anything worth owning. There is also a massive amount of unorganized minigames but very few people populating them therefore it is very difficult and frustrating to actually find a lobby for these games. In the end GTA 5 offers a lot ignoring the online gamemode it would be a crime not to recommend a game that is such a staple in gaming culture.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is single player game review. I have NOT played online at all.In a nutshell GTA V is an amazing open world gaming experience. I've played GTA 1 very very very long time ago I liked that one. I played GTA 4 until it got stuck (was okay game). pros + single player world is inviting with plenty of missions and free roaming+ cool personal characters with each having their unique skills+ graphics look good still+ no "console port" feeling (that was in GTA 4)+ radio channels are great+ all kinds of mini games and activities ranging from dart throwing to stock purchases+ cars!+ cops!+ the heist missions! (man I like them so much first you choose your plan steal equipment go for the mission and espace)+ random encounters (dudes robbing somebody money car coming)+ AI creates create fun situations (cops smashing into something that hits something else that hits you...)+ nice progression with weapons unlocking one after another as game progresses+ so much to explore+ day/night cycle looks amazing+ selfie cam D+ there's just so much awesome stuff in this game I cannot remember it all+ profanities (Trevor has pretty creative words at his disposal)cons profanities (not for everybody if you don't want to hear profanities and characters insulting each other and drivers giving the middle finger to you when you crash their car... then probably not a game for you) I did not like missions where you have to change the character that kills the pace of the mission (it's not that bad there's only few missions like that so far but still) You have to like cars to like this game ) plenty of driving in this game.I played only single player game and if you are after a great open world experience in modern world then there's good chances you're going to like this game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

From that point on I knew they wouldn't give a singlwe **** about what the community wants. Every DLC made it harder to enjoy the Game without buying these f*** sharkcards. The multiplayer went with every Update / DLC more into Pay to Win and that is (in my view) unacceptable for such an expensive game. I see why it is this expensive and I surely am Ok with paying such a price (as you can see I even buyed the PC version later on) but if you make a Game and sell it then you certainly won't need such Pay to Win politics. I really enjoyed playing GTA V in the beginning but know it is one BIG sh**hole. Sorry Rockstar / Take Two but f**k you. You got my money so have fun with your victory wank 'cuz this was the last time I bought something from you or more like wasted my money!And NO not even Red Dead Redemption 2 will make ANY difference.And the BIGGEST MOST DISGRACEFUL EVEN PITIFUL thing is that you practically banned all modding from this game (and I talk about the singleplayer) by shutting down OpenIV. Everyone that worked in order to accomplish it should be proud about the fact that they practically banned the only reason why this game was still useable. You really don't give a single f**king sh*t about your clients do you?And I won't even start on how you are able to ban innocent players on a massive scale but there are still unaccaptable high amounts of hackers online. GOOD WORK YOU F**KERS be proud!tl dr Game was good at launch Multiplayer went since Bankrobbery more and more to Pay to Win Rockstar / Take Two don't give a sh*t about their clients / community DON'T EVER BUY THIS GAME (unless you get it for like 5$ max)

review: I used to like GTA I used to like Rockstar but time and time again they treat us the gamers like Today Rockstar Games and their publisher TakeTwo Interactive sent a cease and desist to the developers of OpenIV a tool made for modding GTA and allowing the games to thrive years after release. So much time and effort put into the tool so that people could make the game their own and it's all gone due to the greed of Rockstar and TakeTwo. I will never buy another Rockstar game after this and it was bad enough as it was with them turning onlline play from something basic and fun in GTA IV into a greed propeled grindfest.Once upon a time I would have recommended this game I would have recommended any Rockstar game but not anymore.Edit I know none of you want to believe your precious Rockstar is at fault here I know you want to put blame solely on Take Two but that isn't the bloody case. Rockstar Games is the publisher of the Grand Theft Auto series Take Two owns Rockstar Games but they infact give a lot of autonomy to Rockstar Games. The people that initiated the C&amp D were Rockstar Games AND Take Two despite what you want to believe that is the way it is. The people you think support mods no longer exist. Management changes in companies and the last time I can recall Rockstar "supporting mods" was back in the GTA IV days which is a long time ago.Stop defending Rockstar. They do not deserve it.TotalBiscuit on the issue https //youtu.be/8hLmM6pK0wg?t 28m33s

review: Grand Theft Auto VA game developed by Rockstar North and published by Rockstar Games.I have been an avid GTA fan for as long as i can remember from the overhead 2D originals that captured our hearts and ran over them for bonus points to the classics of the series now GTA VC and San Andreas and GTA4 So i stepped into this game with mind pre blown ready for a whole new destination (well a rebooted one) And some new characters to get lost in and around.GTA5 did nothing but astound me from the graphical detail to the brilliant story despite its minorly cliche plotpoints. I felt like the whole experience was unique to me. But without further hesitation lets get into this review!I usually break my reviews into 4 categories. Story Gameplay Graphics and Music. Followed by an overall section that details my overall thoughts on the game and a more structured final decision. If you don't like long reviews please feel free to scroll down to the overall section.Story The GTA series has always had a fairly decent and intricate crime story in play Usually just a paid thug sent to do random jobs for someone who is willing to pay. Thats the overall premise so far. But GTA5 took it to a different level This time you have 3 main characters. Franklin Michael and Trevor. Who all have their own stories to follow but along the way become more and more intertwined and friction and friendships are discovered. I thought this was a phenomenal idea because following the adventures of Nico in GTA4 everyone had experienced pretty much every aspect of crime From Liberty City's organised mafia crime to the gang banger crime of the "hood" in SA. They gave you 3 different types of characters all with their own story and personality and it really helped fill out the game in so many ways. The story is diverse taking you basically across the island and back again through its standard playtime With loads of side story missions available along the way. This game has a seriously fleshed out game world with tons of backstory and history to catch up from the start which can seem daunting but once you're in. You're in for a wild ride.Gameplay Grand theft auto has always had a very generic gameplay you play as a hero...or villain as the case usually is really. And you run around a fairly...linear open world and commit mass crimes from small time burglary to mass genocides. But GTA5 has upped the standard again. The game world is huge and the gameplay is smooth as glass. From stealing cars to gunning down police the game has solidly build the world around you (the player). Occasionally you'll discover a bug i guess you'd want to call it where your car would do something stupid or your character will slip down a hill that should have been a clean traverse and annoy you for a while. But the overall gameplay mechanic is fleshed out and been modelled incredibly well. The gunplay is pretty great using a fairly generic cover system as most 3PS games do these days But even still its done extremely well and is well worth the experience. I didn't get a chance to play the online side of the game on PC but i played it vigorously on console to my own detriment i know. This game has alot of content for the MP side of things but not really a whole lot of content if any at all substantial content for the SP campaign which is a terribly large let down seeming the game is so expansive and detailed.Driving can be frustrating especially at the start when you're becoming familiar with the vehicles and the world its incredibly easy to crash and die in this game which i happened to do very frequently but its one of those become accustomed to scenarios once you become familiar the difficulty quickly disappates flying helicopters and planes is very similar in this regard Very rarely did i discover a bug that caused my car to just...launch into the air or make me launch through the windshield. Maybe once or twice in my entire time playing GTA which overall is a pretty astounding effort.Graphics This game is beautiful. To say the least On a fairly mid high end pc this game runs like glass at max settings. 70+ FPS solidly at all times even under what i would consider the games largest strain massive amounts of vehicles and people all gathered together at once or even flying a jet across the skies overlooking the city scape. (My PC specs are in my profile)The game is stunning at all times...Very rarely do i take a step back and look at a horizon or go explore just to see the worlds detail but i did it with this game and i'll happily do it over and over because of how much love and dedication has been put into this game. I have a few screenshots on my profile that help show the worlds detail. Its an experience for sure!Music Probably the weakest point of the game...Not because the music is bad..because its far from bad it has basically music developed by real artists when your in vehicles on the internal radios which helps you feel like its realistic definitely but the actual musical score for the game is very bland...A few high and low drops for dramatic effect but nothing breathtaking and nothing unique to this GTA...which i guess is very common in the GTA series as a whole. But the music while driving is extremely addictive catching myself singing songs i wouldn't normally listen to or just getting lost in some classic rock or country was a great way to pass the time driving across the world.Overall This game is a must buy for anyone who loves the GTA series or any of its clones. It has been masterfully developed and detailed by a loving company who has done very little in terms of games badly. Perhaps its largest let down is that the game is a money sink for online play...Things cost far too much in game money that its almost not worth it and you can buy cash cards from the steam store which i found to be rather stupid and to be honest a bit of a slap in the face for the gamers who love this game. But the singleplayer is near flawless and its GTA through and through. I recommend this game whole heartedly and i hope you love it as much as i do.Drive frantically!

review: I have spent many hours on the 360 version playing GTA V. I loved it but when GTA finally came to P.C. i had to have it. Therefore i will compare the 2 versions quite frequently so be warned.GRAPHICS The game looks fantastic both for the P.C.. and xbox 360 versions. However with the P.C. the frame rate is soooo much better and after playing the P.C and going back to the 360 i don't know how I put up with the frame rate. the interface looks much better for the P.C and the lighting is suberb almost no graphical glitches of any kind.STORYThe story of course is also great. Bassically Its 3 Friends Franklin Michel and Trevor who after robbing a bank go their seperate ways. After finding themselves all in Los Santos they start to plot and scheme to make a ton of money. With plot twists and epic charecters I can say the story was well written and very entertaining to play through. The side quests were fun and the side charecters were hilarious and i am so glad i played through the story before entering online.FREE ROAM. The map of Los Santos and neighboring Blain County is huge. The map is sprawling with detail and even some secrets. A great place to return to after GTA San Andreas. The weapons are simalar in damage and design to be fair however the attachments give the weapons a whole new depth something GTA has never experimented with before. Something else GTA has never experianced before was the 3 charector switching. You can play between the 3 protagonists each with their special power. Michel can slow down time Trevor can become nearly invincible and Franklin can slow down time in his car. Speaking of cars there is a huge variety this time and on P.C. you can now look on the insides of cars wich have great detail inside each of them. For example a super car has a nice radio comfy looking seats etc. A crap car however looks rigid radio torn out and just looks ugly. The speed and handling is different for each and is fun to master each. Overall a great and fun free roam experiance with all the fun you can imagine.ONLINENow this may be the experiance you picked up the game for. The loading screens are always slow but however you have to forgive them for loading such a great online experiance. Once you start You have access to pretty much every car you want and certain missions to help you rank up and make some dough weapons are locked at first which you must rank up to acheve them but DLC weapons which on a side note all dlc is free which is awesome But DLC weapons are unlocked from the get go which is good for newn players would have to contend with everyone else with much better things then them. The customization for players are there but its not really the best. there are tons of clothing options hoever and its fun to dress up in your own unique way. However one major complaint about online is how hard it is to make money. Though heists are there it takes a long time to make just a few hundred grand and with all this expensive DLC items Like yaughts offices and cars many people are resorting to hacking which ruins the overall experiance for everyone when they decide to greif. However Rockstar seems to be on top of hacking for now but Hackers Mainly Jordans menu and Infamous Always seem to be one step ahead. However looking past that missions are fun playing with your friends are better and i still reccomend GTA V for anyone who is looking to have a great time offline or online. My Rating for GTA V is 9/10

review: It is hard to really explain this without the reader being 35+ yrs old but this is probably the game you dreamed of as you played spy hunter pole position or any other game for that matter.GTA V is a triumph in a sea of grey it never floats on the trail of it's own ego or past glory's each of the 3 main player controlled characters could hold the games story on their own but together Franklin Mike and trevor are a trio that will stay with me forever for me GTA IV lost a little something but GTA V brings it back with a H bomb impact..it's chaotic .it has more hidden content easter eggs puzzles and mysteries than most games have in actual main game content.it has my favorite 3 video game characters of all time in one game.it has choices that make differences.it has homour and most politically incorrect type even the trumphster is out done.it also has a solid Multiplayer and player base.it has the Chilliad mystery which rockstar deserve an oscar for the best wind up in game mystery ever.it has so much to do work rest play rob kill yoga extreme sports bank jobs therapy..etc..etc.it has tanks planes boats cars trucks trains helicopters blimps UFO's bikes motorcycles..etc.etcit's good..its very very good if even a fraction of games where made like this i'd be far happier10/10 never done that before

review: Not a lot to say except this game is solid. You play as 3 different characters in a great. The main purpose of the game is to strike it rich by ANY means necessary. Online mode has tons of features and allows you to play almost however you want.The story and characters are full of back story that you have to play the whole game to fully understand. Graphics can be adjusted to allow for insane graphics. You can play in 3rd person or first person mode. Controls by default feel good but you can adjust them if you want. My biggest gripe is flying controls but like I said you can adjust them. You can level up stats and each character has a certain special which comes in handy. What really shines is when you are doing a mission with more than 1 and you when you can switch between each character. I could keep going on but this game is a game that is hard not to like.

review: As someone who has patiently waited for this game since day 1 of release for consoles and never played a single bit untill the 14th of April 2015 i can definetly say that this game is the most fun that ive had out of a game in a long time.If you are on the fence about getting this game by far throw your money at the screen (even if you own a console copy)Grand Theft Auto V is extreamly easy to run and is a relieve that it is so with all the rushed games this generation (hint hint Ubisoft) with the minimum specs of a 9800 GT and Q6600 2.4GHz! Currently i run this game on an average set up with a 560 Ti graphics card and a i3 2105 processor with a smooth 60&lt fps most of the time (on mostly 'normal' settings) but dipping down to about 40 in the city during daytime.The only complaint that i have about this game is a small graphics glitch that i have seem to be experiancing where occasionally bars appear forming out of cars for 1 frame and can get distracting. Although this bug will hopfully be fixed with patches drivers or future Directx.Overall i will give this masterpiece a 10/10

review: Grand Theft Auto 5 is a remastered version of an insanely popular last generation title which has been built from the ground up for current generation consoles and also ground up on a separate build for PC owners. Given the modding community has been enormous for the franchise since the release of open world GTA 3 each release to PC in this franchise really does generate a lot of interest.In this iteration we have Franklin Michael and Trevor who live in the region of Los Santos. Though we don't get to go to Liberty City or Vice City we do get a little bit of time in the state of North Yankton Canada. Two of the three protagonists have a big job together and generate some history prior to the events of GTA 5 and this leads into the story where Michael encounters his new adopted son Franklin.The story is definitely the most interesting in the series and it really does run like a dream for PC owners. The story goes for a considerable amount of time but I played basically all the easily available missions and had it complete in less than 35 hours. There are a few bugs and the steam forums seem flooded by technological noobs and there's a serious issue with SLI but the game really does pay respect to the PC community for the first time from the games developer.The game features an all new angle which allows the player to connect to the protagonist a lot more and because of the new first person mode I found myself less obligated to go on rampages and to drive well. In fact driving is so much easier with this new camera angle. For the first time since GTA3 was released it really does add a lot of value to the game but it's not refined like most first person shooter game development companies release I hope this will be more apparent in the next game in the franchise.We also have a stock market by which if you aren't familiar with what you can earn by investing in which company in which time you'll miss out on much of the post campaign content. The system itself is intriguing educational and fun. I ended up having all three characters have about 170 million dollars thanks to the stock market and one of my characters will be earning half a million for every week that passes so I definitely can't complain.You're able to buy properties visit bars strip clubs play sport buy weapons and of course pick up hookers. The controversy has officially passed for me in that the ability to be able to access the mature content isn't really interesting anymore even though it's really important to the game. If a gamer is playing only for the mature content and violence I'm willing to bet that player isn't legally old enough to play the game.I was hoping we would see smarter AI firetruck missions ambulance missions and vigilante missions and all of those features we saw in San Andreas and Vice City but I was disappointed. The wanted system is easy to evade and presents no real challenge there were no additional missions besides taxi missions and the game is really quite easy. As with my previous points it doesn't pack a lot of interesting content besides the main campaign and a few extras but the game veers towards being an online focused game. I applaud this but I don't at all consider myself a multiplayer player though it's currently one of the most popular online games in the world.I feel all these things along with proper SLI support are the only things this title is missing and it's otherwise a complete version of any GTA game.Perhaps for the next title?Having completed this game on Xbox 360 and PC now I can highly recommend this title to any adult who shares an interested in the franchise nostalgic or not. The story is totally worth it and the AAA PC release is beautiful and scalable to many different computer hardware configurations. It's a title that's worth having in your collection.I'm really looking forward to GTA 6 and the possibilities of playing around in an equally beautiful North Yankton Liberty City or Vice City.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Had A few graphical glitches to start with but they cleared up eventually although I am still having a bug where the terrain will de render around me and I will have to use the traffic and random static meshes to navigate the roads for a few seconds but I can deal with that!Other than that as a first time player of GTA V (never owned it on console) I would whole heartedly reccomend this the system specification are incredible for such a huge game and the controls are fantastic (I use controller to drive and KBM to control my character in first person)Story wise that game is okay it has a lot of side missions and random encounters that are very fun and the central character stories are interesting. Although I absolutely hate Trevor (you all know what I did in that one mission P)

review: A massive game packed with content. Rockstar really took their time developing this game and it shows in the world they gave us. The game is so large and packed with content that it is likely that people will be finding new secrets for a long time to come. Tons of activates and a great online mode that is great to play with friends. The online mode really encourages you to play with friends because some things like heists are nearly impossible to play with random players. All in all a massive game that other triple A developers should try to strive to deliver with their $60 releases. Rockstar really is a Rock Star of the gamming industry.

review: I wrote a positive review before but soon deleted it. Here's why.Singleplayer Cannot complain one bit. Very fun and in depth storyline with insane happenings which suit the usual Grand Theft Auto atmosphere. Lots and lots of cars and things to do outside doing missions e.g flying a plane into the twin tow Maze Bank building. Multiplayer Where do I start. Hackers every fourth session I join usually killing players for fun and not even dropping money (I'll talk about that some more later). The community is toxic people killing other people who are simply driving around (RDM'ing). People with Hydra's demolishing whole lobbies because of their overpoweredness. And now people with flying bikes rocketing the crap out of everyone. But that's what passive mode is for.Now let's talk about MONEYYYY. If you are lucky enough in GTA online you will come across a hacker that drops money for you adn you don't end up getting banned. Rockstar are so anal about how you should get money. Missions or Shark Cards (NOT WORTH IT!!). This takes AGES especially if your heist crew are idiots who blow themselves up (Heists is the main way of getting money). So money dropping hackers in my opinion are genarally welcomed into lobbies and are seen as SAVIOURS to people who are poor (most players). So that about wraps up my review on GTA V. Overall it's kinda good but kinda isn't. Maybe you'll find it more awesome than I did.

review: The campaign is bland and on rails. All the missions will play out the exact same way every time so if you're looking for replay value I see very little.On the multiplayer side of things it doesn't get much better. Between the blaintly rude players and the rampant cheaters I find myself turning off the game in disgust every time. The lobbys are unstable often dropping most of the players or just failing to connect in the first place.If somehow you can look past all that and still want to play the game how it was meant to be played then get ready for a grind. Everything you want will cost an outrageous ammount of in game currency compared to what you make. Of course you could just spend more of your real money to get some in game stuff but after spending the outrageous ammount for this game I see little reason to give them any more. This is the last game from Rockstar I plan to buy. So much for the hype...

review: GTA Korean MMO Edition. The single player campaign is fantastic but avoid online like the plague. Masses of bugs desync issues server issues etc etc. The code is so bad that friends and I cant even ride in the same car because we both see different things due to desync at any decent speed. Often We would see another player get out of the car and start running away under NPC guidence only to snap back into the action a few seconds later Add to that the fact that to get anywhere in the game requires almost superhuman grinding for levels and money and you have a sandbox with very little to do. Upgrades are hidden behind arbitrary walls for race wins (can join a friend and grind) clan level (seperate xp grind) money (dont have to grind this you can use real money!...or grind) or RP (have a guess....yup grind)Rockstar "support" is a joke. I had an issue where my character wouldn't load into the game at all. Searched forums no help. Rockstar are aware of the problem but without a subscription to hold their interest they could give 2 craps. Their "helpful" advice is to wait at least 4 hours and try again. I submitted a ticket and got a reply....a week later...asking if i was still having an issue and that was it. Gee thx muchly.The vast majority of players I see in game have glitched or hacked their way to glory due to the incessent grind and have been subsequently banned. This is after mission rewards have been nerfed into the ground. One fitted out car can cost upwards of $1 million. 1 mission will gain you $20k/20 minutes. Including ammo/ armour costs that would be over 20 hours of grind back to back for a car.In Online you have to make your own fun because R* have no intention of providing any.TL DR single player is brilliant online is one long grind.
